cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: this punch tastes good! i recommend it! there’s no strong alcohol taste at all, it’s enjoyable, and super dangerous. hahaha. be careful! it’s easy to drink a lot of it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good. Added some pimento for more flavor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Reminds me of a cousin to the Mai Tai. I also doubled the coconut rum but still did not detect any of that flavoring.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added a pinch more of grenadine other than that it was delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yumo! Made exactly except subbed regular Bacardi for 151. Real hit for a day on the lake.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not change anything and I would make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: very easy and it was a hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good! Made me feel like I was right back on the beach in Negril. I took the advice of other reviewers and used regular white rum in place of the 151....but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I even made a rum free batch for the kids and they loved it! Perfect paired with jerk marinated chicken and Caribbean rice & beans. Will definitely be making again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best rum punch hands down. Everyone loves it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a great foundation! Made it for a party, tweaked it a bit by adding a can of fruit punch. It was a party favorite! Will definitely be making it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch, and it was a huge hit at my party. I used pretty good rums, which I'm sure helped: Vizcaya Cristal, 7 year Flor de Caña, and Blue Chair Bay coconut rum. I also used fresh lime juice and added a splash of orange bitters. Additionally, I made a smaller batch using club soda in place of the rum for the non-drinkers. It was obviously less exciting, but still a pretty decent fruit punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just whipped up a batch and it was oh so yummy. Only difference is I added 1/2 cup of coconut rum not 1/4 cup. I also used cheaper rum to cut costs but it still tastes great. Husband and I are satisfied with this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: was a hit made one strong version and one normal and they were both yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Jamaican Rum Punch
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made two variations of this, and the one without the Bacardi 151 was considerably better (I used Don Q Cristal in place of it). 151 has a strange, wet towel flavor that dominated the whole drink. I looked this up after having a Rum Punch at a Jamaican restaurant. They used Wray & Nephew overproof rum, which I didn't have but most likely would have worked better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a party and so many asked about it. They loved it. It went so quickly!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great as is - it's tropical, fruity, and refreshing. I like to add Malibu rum too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added southern comfort as well which helped and used orange juice

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used champagne instead of a sparkling beverage. It was a fantastic kick! Made several batches for a small party, ran out within an hour!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! Everyone (even people who don't drink alcohol) loved it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this for several get-togethers, and it is always a hit. So refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe exactly and found that I had to add a bit more vodka for my guests. Still, it was MUCH easier than having to set up a bar with different tequila, bourbon, gin, rum, etc. + the mixers. Also, my punch container has a separate compartment for ice so it didn't get diluted.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty basic, I used club soda instead of 7up and still very sweet

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for new years it was a hit! No one got too tipsy It has the right amount of vodka but I think I'll add a little more the next time I make it lol. If you like a sweet micrd drink then this punch is great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This punch is a very popular treat at a local community event each year. We omit the vodka and all ages enjoy this punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this at my birthday party. Everyone loved it. I can't wait to make it again. Thanks so much for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Couldn't find pineapple juice concentrate so for both cans of frozen juice I substituted a pineapple-orange juice blend concentrate; used Sprite but no fresh fruit; recipe called for 12 oz. vodka but I used approx. 16-20 oz. My friends mostly liked it (although a little on the sweet side) but everyone agreed that it still didn't pack much of a punch. The high rating is for a simple yet decent punch that can be thrown together in a pinch w/a few inexpensive ingredients. Lots of potential for it to be doctored up w/different fun ingredients.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served at Super Bowl party and everyone loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made it for our Christmas party and that was the only cocktail friends wanted to drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made this for a small party! The cherries didn't stay afloat bcz of my punch container but it is tasty! I used pineapple passion flavored vodka and I cudnt find frzn pineapple concentrate so I used Goya nectar n I got 2 cans of pineapple passion fruit nectar. I think it cud have used a bit more vodka! Lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great for summer parties. If you like strong drinks I would suggest using 2.5 cups of vodka. One orange cut into rounds will suffice. If you have left over oranges and cherries after the party, pour a little vodka and let them soak and you have jungle juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this punch for NYE 2014. Everyone loved it, said it tasted like Skittles. I used Smirnoff Vanilla Vodka. Be careful, the teens will sneak and drink it too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Alcohol content not enough, I wanted my crowd to get slightly buzzed, but it did not happen bacause it was diluted so much from the other juices in the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this punch for a Summer BBQ/Birthday party on a very hot day!! Used a large can of Dole Pineapple Juice, a bottle of O.J., doubled the amount of vodka and used one 2 liter of sprite and some grenadine syrup, to give it some color. It was delicious and a major hit with my guests! Will make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!!! Popular choice for ladies' parties.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: All I can say is YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good quick easy punch. I didn't have frozen concentrated pineapple juice and just used a 46oz can of pineapple juice instead. Also I ended up only using 1 1/2 (2 liter bottles) bottles of 7-up instead of 2. (because we like it sweet) Went great with Christmas dinner! Will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this! I used this recipe for my Bunco party. The girls loved it. It was delicious and not too strong so we were able to finish the game...No "Drunko" here! It will be used often!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good punch

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous Punch! I made this for our annual July 4th party and it was a big hit! I doubled it and used a liter of vodka (these people like to party).... I mixed everything in a 5 Liter Igloo beverage dispenser and served it with orange slices and skewered pinapple and maraschino cherries. Very refreshing, but be careful because this stuff goes down way to easy...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This punch is always a huge hit. I add way more vodka because you cannot taste it, and instead of oranges and cherries, I add frozen berries to the punch. Costco sells a bag of mixed frozen berries, or other times I add a couple of bags of frozen raspberries. This punch is so good and you will get many compliments !!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this at bunco and it was a huge hit. The women loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! This is gonna be my favorite go to punch of all time! Compared to other punches this so easy and economical as well for a big crowd. Made it for a party we threw and my husband who drinks mostly beer loved this. You cannot even tast the alcohol. We did get tipsy on this but I think it's cause we were drinking it sooo fast! Thanks so much for this recipe! Will definitely make this for Super bowl for the girls. =0)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very sweet, not very strong. This punch is good for people who may want something different than wine or beer at a gathering

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Punch! Doubled the alcohol and also had to makeshift a second Batch since it disappeared so quick. 2nd Batch I used Mango-Orange Juice Concentrate and Pink Lemonade Concentrate and actually thought it was better because it wasn't so sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a party and this went really fast! I couldn't find frozen pineapple juice so I used bottled and worked just the same. This sneaks up on ya bc it is so good and can't tast the vodka. Oranges and cherries made it great for presentation. Everyone at my luau party loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a "filler" drink at a martini party, just in case anyone didn't like martinis. Well, this entire this was downed and people were turning the punch bowl on it's side trying to get every last drop out. Can't wait to make again!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy! Only draw back is you can't really leave it out for long because the soda goes flat. I made the juice part and added the soda to each glass instead of mixing it all together. I also added at least twice as much alcohol and you still could barely taste it. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: i made this non-alcoholic for my husband's birthday party.everyone loved it.delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this delicious punch for a Baby Shower a few weeks ago, it was gone within 30 mins. Everyone kept asking what exactly I put it in and when will I make another batch. I have added this recipe to my list of MUST HAVE beverages for entertainment parties I host- which are weekly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a party and substituted Malibu Rum in place of the Vodka and everyone loved it...it was a HUGE hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this punch and it does not need any changes. This punch goes really quickly, because it is so good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this simple but delicious punch for every Christmas party I've hosted over the past 6 years since finding it here, and it's always a hit. It's now a standard at my bar set-up, along with other pop & mixers, beer and wine. I split it into two batches -- one spiked and one virgin, and don't bother with the punch bowl, I just use large pitchers. My only warning is to pour the pop in small batches and don't stir it too much, as the carbonation seems to react with the juice concentrate and really fizzes up a lot. I had a sticky mess to clean up the first time -- learned my lesson after that. Great punch - definitely recommend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: A little to sweet for me but it was all gone by the end of my party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at our last party! I will definitely make it again. I made it exactly as the recipe states and it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good. I made a few changes. I used Vanilla flavored vodka and 1 bottle of soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: my husband and I made this punch For a new years eve party I loved it and so did our guests will be making again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made for a cookie decorating party and got rave reviews. Added some cranberry juice for extra tartness and color. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. It was a hit at the party

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have used this recipe many, many times now for parties, and it's always a great hit. If you're a college student or twentysomething like me (or just like to drink), I suggest doubling the amount of vodka. The flavor is still great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty! However, I didn't feel it packed the punch some other reviewers have stated. It went fast, though!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipes was quick, easy and very good! I was able to throw it together in less then five minutes. My friends and I loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party this weekend - turned out wonderfully! I had to keep reminding the ladies at the party that it had alcohol in it - no one could even tell. I received a bunch of compliments on it. I will DEFINITELY be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this punch for my Dad's retirement party and everybody loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: We hosted a murder mystery party and the guests LOVED this. We added some blackberry brandy to give it a little extra kick. We had no punch left over (and we made a double batch) and everyone said that you could not hardly taste the alcohol...which in turn made everyone really tipsy, however that was the intension =)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great summer punch. I cut the sugar in half or more to taste. The full 2 cups makes i too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This punch was the hit of our holiday party. We are social drinkers, though, and felt there wasn't nearly enough Vodka so the bottle was left out with a shot glass near the punch bowl for guests to add their more to their own. Another friend made this a few weeks later, omitting the Vodka completely from the punch bowl but also left out the bottle of Vodka and the shot glass for those who wanted that extra kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was all that and very easy to make. Taste so good. I froze the orange slices before adding to the punch. 5+++

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thought it was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! So easy to make and so delicious!! But be careful...you don't taste the vodka at all!!! We loved it at my New Years party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used only 1 2-liter but was still very good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is such a tasty punch. I made it for my mom's birthday party and everyone loved it. I now keep the ingredients on hand to make a smaller batch whenever company comes over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome punch! I added just a smidget of grenadine for a baby shower. Everyone ranted and raved over this punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was a hit at a party I threw over the weekend. I ommitted the cherries and added a container of Sherbert.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it for an office party - it was a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a small get together and everybody loved that you couldn't taste the alcohol and that it had a zippy flavor. I am making it tonight for a party we are throwing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Made a great jungle juice (a drink where you taste no liquor what so ever)and it was gone before the party was even over! Thanks for a great reciepe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: IT WAS FAST AND EASY TO MAKE. MY FAMILY LOVED DRINKING IT ON NEW YEARS EVE.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Party Punch IV
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this recipe for our reception and it was a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this and because a full blender of ice is so much volume it diluted it to a very weak taste. I made it again and blended the fluid first and kept adding ice cubes until I got the thick consistency without any excess ice. Note I froze the glass blender pitcher first and the glass mug. Keeps it frozen longer

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very sour and sweet. Not enjoyable at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Honestly this was an easy simple, YUMMY recipe for a margarita!! Definitely my new go to! I found it easiest to use the limeade container as my measure, dump limeade in, fill container all the way with tequila- dump, then fill container 1/2 way with triple sec- dump, add ice and I also added 2 scoops of orange concentrate.... big hit at the party and went down smooth!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was great but I used Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge liqueur instead of Triple Sec!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Overall this is very easy and a pitcher of Margaritas is always good, but it is just way too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ok...If you like Margaritas this is the Top & U really should try it.... AMAZING is better than just good... Will be using this from now on at home... I prefer Patron... So I can talk about this tequila....I did as a reviewer suggested putting remaining in ice cube trays for later and wouldn’t change anything....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and delicious! Just need a better blender.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was delicious I added a bit of orange juice as described in other reviews! Best yet

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this and it is delicious and STRONG!! This will be my go to recipe even just over ice!! Though over ice I might add some water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: BEST RECIPE EVER! Triple Batch for 10 Women. Added fresh lime on rim of glasses and dipped in Salt. Delish

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: WILL MAKE IT AGAIN!! So good! Why would anyone buy Margarita Mix??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was perfect and strong. I used Grand Mariner instead of triple sec. I will use this as the base for my margaritas from now on ... but I’ll invest in triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This margarita recipe is awesome! Easy and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't like this as it tasted too bitter. It needed a touch of sweetness added to it, like lemonade or something. I used a reposado and Grand Marnier. I made a better mix myself by crushing lime slices and mint leaves, then adding ice, lime cordial, tequila, lemonade and a touch of soda water. This was just far too bitter and it was missing something that made it nice to drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't like this as it tasted too bitter. It needed a touch of sweetness added to it, like lemonade or something. I used a reposado and Grand Marnier. I made a better mix myself by crushing lime slices and mint leaves, then adding ice, lime cordial, tequila, lemonade and a touch of soda water. This was just far too bitter and it was missing something that made it nice to drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as written - tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: As was mentioned....just as is....perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it just the way the recipe says and I loved it. So did my friend who I shared with.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I took the advice of measuring everything in the limeaide can and the taste was awesome! Fill the empty can three-fourths full of Tequila and then fill the rest of the can up with Triple Sec. You can’t go wrong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We all LOVE this recipe, especially on a hot day. Today I added a handful of frozen (picked up on the mountain last week) huckleberries to the mix and it turned out even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as directed Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I normally don't like frozen margaritas but these are FANTASTIC!! Thank you so much for sharing! These are soooo good and really hit the spot when cooling off from this insanely hot summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Could not be easier and was a crowd pleaser! Absolutely will use this recipe again but for two I may use fresh squeezed limes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so good! We took our blender camping! Camping! That’s how good. Lol! I did notice a difference in taste depending on which brand limeade you use. Definitely pay the price and get the more expensive kind.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfection!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fast easy fun and yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was not good at all!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made with OJ and fresh lime.. Awesome! Husband said, "Dang babe! That's good!" He isn't even a margarita guy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and not too sweet like like the margarita mixes. I’ll be drinking these all summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Basic, simple, tastes fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!! Except I don't like blended margaritas so we just did the recipe as directed but add 1 cup bottled margarita mix( because we had it??!!) Pour into glasses over ice and add salt rims and limes and Viola!!! YUMMMY!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy to make!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I add cherries and grenadine! I love this recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this! Make it regularly. We are light weights so only use half the alcohol. Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple to make, refreshing, and effective. Added a little OJ but otherwise made as written.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best frozen margarita I have ever tasted! Always a hit !

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Loved this version. This is actually a recipe my mother used to make. When I was a kid she made virgin ones for us (frozen limeade!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it using a 12oz can of limeade, a 12 oz can of Wildberry punch concentrate, 12oz tequila, 4oz triple sec, and 12 oz water...mix and serve over rocks...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had a fun afternoon after a couple of these :-) we didn't have triple sec so used OJ instead, still delicious though, thanks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Making it as is is nice, flavorful and not too sweet. I think this one was easier to make than using the Bacardi mix because you have to add stuff to it. This is 3 simple ingredients, with variations available if you want a change of pace. Ain't broke, don't need fixin' my hubby says...just like in Mexico!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Always a crowd-pleaser for guests! I've made these margaritas many times, and follow the recipe closely. If inclined, I'll add the juice of a lime (or two) and if I'm serving my mother-in-law, I'll generally add a few splashes of Sprite or Squirt. I love mine with a salted rim and a couple slices of fresh lime. Nothing better than sittting on your patio on a warm, sunny day with one of these tasty concoctions in hand!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was perfect! I wouldn't make any changes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe I always use - guests love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy and sooo good. Very adaptable to your personal tastes. For us, we used 6oz limeade, 4 oz tequila, 2oz triple sec, splash of OJ and 1tbsp sugar. They were yummy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy to make but something is missing. I think it's juice of lime.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great margarita, will not buy margarita mix ever again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Impossible to beat for simplicity and taste. This is a great party margarita, especially for those that prefer frozen to on-the-rocks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Came out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is pretty much the only way I make margaritas now, it's so easy and tastes so much better than premade mixes. Add in a little squeeze of fresh lime to make it even better! I'm probably made this at least 10 times by now

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these on the rocks instead of frozen. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious. Not a drop was left.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe for years and it is the best ever!!!!!!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! So many compliments every time I make it. I use Grand Marnier in place of triple sec. Excellent!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a big hit when friends come for my patio happy hour! It's delicious as is or add a splash of OJ as suggested by other reviewers, which made it even better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and delicious! Will make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought the original recipe seemed like an awful large batch and I was only making these for two so, I halved the triple sec and limeade and used 4 ounces of tequila and filled the blender ¾ full of ice. I added a couple pinches of fresh lime zest and they were AMAZING! A little boozy, but not too strong, and the flavor was fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was a little bitter for my taste, but I added just a little sugar and they were perfect for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: nobody cared for htis.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe! I double it and make it in my Vitamix and add jalapeño peppers. Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG! Mondays are my new Fridays with this drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious i used 1/2 a can of oj in place of the triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have used this recipe for years but got smart and started making out own Limade Concentrate.` 1 1/2 c splenda 1 1/2 c water(u dont have to heat like simple syrup when you use splenda) 1c lime juice,and bottled lime juice tastes just as good.(actually we harly ever freeze it we keep a pitcher made up in the bar fridge.Large BATCH 6 c splenda,6c water and 4 cups of lime juice

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are amazing!!! Didn't change one thing. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So simple, easy, and absolutely delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good!! Wouldn't change anything

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best recipe ever!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Finally found the perfect mix.... the 2 ounces of triple sec make all the difference! Though a floater of Grand Marnier doesn't hurt either. Thank you for making ME the one that everyone remembers for the fabulous margaritas!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these using the limeade container to measure the tequila and triple sec. 3/4 full with tequila and the rest with triple sec. They came out perfect! Thank you for the easy recipe! My freezer is now stocked with limeade!! =))

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The perfect frozen margarita!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The perfect frozen margarita!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Exactly what I wanted! We did have to add extra Tequila, you really cant go wrong with a little extra tequila . I been looking for a new margarita recipe for years and now this is my go to! Taste so awesome -Gen-ERIC

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm always looking for good "clone" recipes for my favorite things. I'm not a big frozen margarita fan, but love a good margarita on the rocks. I found the frozen limeade mix at Kroger, the Kroger brand, and it was in 12oz. can's. I doubled the recipe with a good blanco tequila and cointreau instead of triple sec. I added about 3 1/2 cans of filtered water in the limeade container. I added a splash of orange juice to finish it. It is OUT OF THIS WORLD!! I would have never imagined! I am totally sharing this recipe with family and friends. SO glad to have found this recipe and tweaked it for my liking ??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: HOLY COW these are dangerously delicious! Used the recipe as is and they were a hit at the Mexican themed dinner party I had. Thank you for sharing this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME! Fresh margaritas. Easy to make. Everyone raved about them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm very picky about my margaritas and I don't usually drink frozen margaritas. But these were Soooo tasty and super easy to make! From now on, I will definitely keep frozen limeade in my freezer for the purposes of making these margaritas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: You also need 6 ounces of beer, and change the triple sec to 6 ounces. That makes it perfect. If you can find the 6 ounce can of limeade, dump the limeade in, then refill the can with the last three ingredients because they are all 6 ounces.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great simple recipe. Thanks!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good recipe for homemade Margaritas!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good and so easy. Can't seem to find 6-oz containers of limeade any more so, darn it, I'm forced to use the 12-oz container and double everything else. Also add a few ounces of fresh orange juice. After blending without ice, pour into a pitcher and keep in the refrigerator. Then when making a drink just add ice to the blender and whatever amount you want of the mix. Great for unexpected guests or just me enjoying the evening garden!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a game night we hosted and I was rather surprised how well it went over... We finished several batches... Definitely will add to cocktail rotation for parties... Easy and no clean up!!! Ps. Holds up well in freezer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made 3 batches of this drink, put them in a covered plastic bucket (Ice cream container) and stuck them in the freezer, thinking they would last all weekend with my relatives around. We scooped them easily into Margarita glasses right out of the freezer. Ha! We ended up making more and everyone wanted the easy recipe for themselves. Very yummy, very simple and better than any bottled Margarita I've tried. A keeper and this summer's go to cool off drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect! Added a smidge of OJ as reviewer suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We love these. It kicks your butt tho! Make sure you don't have to drive.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been looking for a simple margarita recipe and this is the one!! It is absolutely delicious. The change I made, per reviewers suggestions, is I used Grand Marinier instead of triple sec. My daughter is training to be a bartender and she said it was as good as the one they make at the Country Club where she is working for summer. Thank you for posting it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an excellent recipe! My boyfriend made half of a batch last night & it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasted better than the bottled mix versions but packs a punch. :). I bought a strawberry/banana smoothie to add in and it was delicious. I added a full beer (Modelo) to tone down the sweetness. Also bought guava and mango juice so whatever flavor you want goes with this recipe. Will use a little less alcohol next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Been using limeade for many years. Prefer on the rocks - so I make the limeade as directed on the can then add the liquors to a pitcher. Also there is a liqueur called Gran Gala that is much less expensive than Grand Marnier or Cointreau. A slash of OJ or a splash of beer (yes, beer) also tastes yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My first attempt at Margaritas. So yummyo!!! And super easy...I like easy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG..... Are you kidding me? 3 ingredients & ice. This is by far the best margarita I've ever had. I was drinking this out of the blender. Will b making my own from now on...lol.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes great and very easy to make. Dangerous combo! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The honest-to-God BEST margaritas!! Be careful, they are dangerously addictive. So much better than any margarita mix, the limeade and triple sec are the perfect balance to the tequila.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was former pastry chef and I got shorbet or ice cream maker at my workshop,I'd love swap 6 ounce of squeezed lemon juice and sugar + half water.ex 500ml lemon juice 500gr sugar and 250gr water and just put it into those machine)of lime concencrate as same amount with fresh lemon shorbet(mix same amount,you can make it in lot quantity and save it for later.and I also used 7 oz tequila but just 1 oz of triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and delicious. Be sure to crush the ice before blending if you have a cheap-o blender like I do, so you don't get huge chunks of ice. But the flavor was actually really great. Might try some agave nectar next time. Also, a squeeze of fresh lime juice and maybe a splash of OJ really brightens it up and it's so much better than squeezing a million fresh limes for each drink! I've stocked up on a big quality bottle of the tequila I prefer, a big bottle of Cointreau and a few containers of brand name limeade concentrate, for the ease of it. I'm always on the front porch now that the weather's warm and it's always classy to be able to offer a cold drink. If you're not a margarita snob, definitely try this easy, yummy recipe! This is my go-to margarita recipe if I'm feeling lazy. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We love this recipe! This is our go to Margarita. Put everything in our Ninja blender and wa la and a great quick drink. Beats the Barcardi mix and easier on the pocket book.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I worked for Mexican restaurant and I thought they have the best margarita, butt I was in a bind with the neighborhood garage sale, so I run into the house and found this recipe, my jaws dropped and my neighbors where so delightful everyone keep asking for more. I just add and ounce of Grand Marnier and voila!!! that was Cadillac margarita

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Margaritas EVER.... if I could give 10 stars I would!!! Easy and delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy & the tastiest by far!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We used to make these forty years ago, but we always added a juice can of water as well and put it in the freezer so it stayed nice and slushy. We did the same thing with 1 juice can of lemonade, 1 of whiskey, and one of water and called them Whiskey Sours. Way too sweet for me now, though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow this was great. I am not a huge tequila fan but I was pleasantly surprised by the smooth flavor. I will definitely use this again. For myself I might make it a little weaker but for company I am sure this will be a hit!!! Thanx again for a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: love the ease of the recipe, and it taste great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband thinks I'm a genius. Great margurita.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I added the little bit of OJ and tasted even better

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy and my friends raved about them. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Preferred ratios of tequila : orange liquor : lime juice aside, any recipe that doesn't use fresh squeezed lime juice won't taste right. Also, most triple sec is mostly corn syrup or sugar. Use Cointreau, Grand Marnier or any orange liqueur or triple sec that has at least 30% alcohol.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have been making margaritas this way for over 25 years. All of our guests love them, and so do we! Easy to play around with using other fruit----such as watermelon! Use a melon baller, and freeze the watermelon. When you make the margaritas, the frozen watermelon acts as the ice cubes, too. [Will probably need to add some sugar or Splenda if watermelon isn't too sweet.]

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: A+++++ Can't go wrong with this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious. Great for summertime cookouts and with Mexican food.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: PERFECT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: not a "purist" recipe, but perfect for a crowd!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing!!! Everytime I make this drink I get request to make more. Love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: A friend gave me this recipe with one variation: she adds a 1/2 beer bottle into it. It is her family's recipe and it was great at my parties!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have the best margarita recipe EVER! Patron Anejo tequila Grand Marnier liqueur Triple Sec Lime juice (fresh squeezed - you sweeten to you liking) Frozen or on the boulders, baby! Salute mi amigos!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy and super good! I also added a bit of ice to make it a bit more slushie.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easiest and best margaritas ever! I cut back on the tequila and triple sec just for personal preference, and I also add a little agave syrup and the juice of one orange and a couple limes. I add the ice last and blend to a slush. YUMMY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect recipe- I always hated the store bought mixes- glad I found this one! Wouldn't make it any other way!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: All of our guests preferred these when they were made with 4 oz of tequila in lieu of the called for 6 oz. With that modification, these would rate 5 stars from me. These were very good and very easy to make. No more pre-made mix for me! Thanks for sharing this recipe, Katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Surprisingly wonderful! This is so simple but delicious. I used Geand Marnier rather than triple sec nice I had it on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Soooooo tasty! We opted for adding a touch more tequila :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious margaritas, as good as any restaurant. I always get rave reviews from guests.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is THE BEST!!! And so easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. I doubled the tequila and they were perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were wonderful! A little strong for our taste, as written, so when we made a second batch we put 2 oz. less tequila and it was great. Floated a shot of Blue Curacao on top - amazing! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this recipe with a couple changes from other reviews. Delicious. What I also like is that you can calculate for a big crowd. Love this feature.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Super easy and better + less expensive than the premade mixes. Took a suggestion from another review and added a little OJ - perfect! Thanks for this great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these over the weekend, followed recipe exactly and they are deelish. Will be making them again for the 4th of July weekend. Try this, you won't be disappointed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was AMAZING!! I don' think that I will try another recipe ever! I was the right amount of flavor with the right amount of alcohol without being too much. I made it straight, but you could easily add fruit if you choose. Thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent recipe..!! i did not know it was so simple.. i made it for my first wedding anniversary. none of my friends could believe their ears when I told them i made the margaritas.. my mom was taken aback.. thank you for giving this good recipe. i shared each stage of the making with my friend who stays abroad as and when I made it.. both of us made it simultaneously..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used regular ice cubes since I don't have crushed, and it turned out fine. These are the only margaritas I've had so far, so I can't compare them to others or fully judge, but they were pretty good, and soooo easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! Took some advise from the other reviews and added a little bit of orange juice and lime juice. This one's a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great!!! We made these margaritas for our Cinco de Mayo party and everyone enjoyed them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect recipe. Easy and simple and the guests love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect, best margarita I've had, a huge success!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone said they loved this margarita! It had that nice bite that you get from a restaurant drink. I used Simply Lime (not from concentrate/not frozen) Limeade. I also added 2 ounces of orange juice. Blended this in the Margaritaville blender, and garnished with limes and oranges... perfect :-) I also used it as a base for the strawberry margaritas. I used the same proportions, but instead of tequila, I used strawberry rum, and added frozen strawberries (and garnished with a strawberry). Our guests were quite impressed!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! It would be 4 stars as shown, but 5 stars for how we did it. Made as directed but included a couple of additional suggestions from Cooper: added a scoop of frozen pineapple concentrate to the mix and then floated a tiny bit of Grand Marnier on top. As good as - no, better than! - any margarita I've ever had. (Making it as shown was a bit too sour for us - the pineapple was the perfect antidote. OJ would be good too but I didn't have that on hand.) It was a verrrrry good party! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a really good margarita! It is my new favorite. Happy Cinco De Mayo!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you're really intent on using the can for ease of purpose, then do it this way to get it right: fill the can full with tequila, dump that in and then fill it 1/3 full with triple sec. Tada! Instant recipe and the ratio really is good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome signed Boopsie

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow-tastes like it came from a professional bartender! I also tried it "on the rocks" rather than frozen-equally great. Outstanding-a keeper-thank you for sharing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: a keeper, I m not going back to Jose Cuervo. I added OJ . and you can also added some beer it's call bee-rita

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the closest I've ever been able to get to the margaritas that I get at a Mexican restaurant. This recipe is a keeper for me!! I recommend using 3/4 of a container of limeade instead of the whole 6 oz, it was a little too sweet when we used the whole container.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These taste just like the margaritas you get from the Mexican restaurant! We made them blended and on the rocks and we liked them on the rocks better! Added the juice of a lime when making them on the rocks and upped the triple sec by one shot! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO delicious! I served these at a party and everyone loved them. Using frozen limeade is so much tastier than sour mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so freakin easy and good that I'm mad. Mad I've been paying way to much to overpriced bars for margys

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making these for a few years the exact same way except I use simply limeade in the clear plastic jug in the fresh OJ aisle instead of frozen concentrated limeade. The only difference is simply limeade uses sugar instead of high fructose corn sugar used in most frozen limeade. Either way, these are great. Also, you can splurge and use Cointreau instead of Triple Sec for a "Deluxe" version of this cocktail.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great margaritas!!!! Made them for a girls only superbowl party and everyone couldnt get enough of them. Didn't make any changes, terrific as is!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice, very easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never again will I bother squeezing a bunch of (expensive) limes to make margaritas. This was delicious and dead easy. Look no further.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were so easy to make! Just as easy as buying the mix but tasted so much better! I got many compliments on these at my girls' night out.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! you will not regret this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hot summer day. Margarita in hand. Need I say more? Perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mexico in a glass YUM YUM YUM - i sprinkle salt inside with the blender instead of putting it on the rim of the glass (not as messy). I haven't seen a 6 oz can of limeade though :P these just taste sooooo good! I would never attempt to find another recipe anywhere else because this is just perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were really good margaritas. I think they're pretty sweet, but I think margaritas in general isn't something that I can personally drink all night long. I had a party though and my one cousin took care of the pitcher! I will for sure make these again for guests. And maybe do some tweeking next time to see if I can make it a little less sweet. Great & easy recipe though for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Defintely the best way. Been doing it for years and people always comment about mine being the best. I dump out about a fourth of the limeade though so the tartness/sweetness is not overwhelming. 1 cup teq., 1/4 cup trip. sec, as much ice as you can get in blender until it stops moving, then pour a little water in if necessary to get it barely moving again. Salt on rim and lime wedge. As 'Cajun Man' would say, "perfecshone!"

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: too much lime concentrate

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellant! Easy Easy! I made 16 servings and still ran out!!! My advice... by extra limeade because people will come back for seconds and thirds on this one!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought these were good, but my husband and I found them to be too syrupy or sugary with the lime concentrate. I also added some frozen peaches to tone it down. I think I'll try fresh lime juice next time. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy and great tasting. I used another person's suggestion and filled the limeade container 3/4 with tequila and 1/4 of triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: For ease and speed you can’t beat it, but you can tell it wasn’t made with fresh limes which I prefer. It’s still very refreshing, just don’t skimp on the crush ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted something that was better than the traditional margarita mix and this is WAY better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted something that was better than the traditional margarita mix and this is WAY better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I do not like blended margaritas so I'm wondering if I should try adding some water so it's not so syrupy(half and half with the limeade concentrate?). I've tried a version of this with Simply Limeade (bottle of ready to drink limeade) but it was way too watered down.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best I've ever made!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was nervous to try to make margaritas without the ole trusty margarita mix -- but did it (even with company over!) and was so impressed. Were VERY good, and am happy to say i will NOT be buying the mix any more!! Great tasting, very easy....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Truly the best margaritas we've ever made around here! I make it just as directed (only occasionally adding a *bit* more booze, depending on my company!), and it is perfect! The splash of orange juice comment is good, if you like the drink sweeter. I now stock up on limeade when I find it cheap just for this recipe! Everyone loves these!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Da best margaritas eva!! Yeah I've been drinking one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: fabulous! Easy and delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and tasty, a real hit! I also did as one person suggested and filled the limeade container 3/4 with tequila and 1/4 with triple sec. Then filled the blender with crushed ice last and voila, fantasticness!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I do the same exact thing here in this recipe but I also add Patron orange liqueur about 1 oz. I cut up some lime slices and use one to squeeze on the rim before adding sea salt to the rim and then put a lime wedge either on the rim or inside the drink for added lime flavor and it rocks!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Man, this recipe has nailed it. These margaritas are perfect every time. I make it when company comes over, and I've even doubled and tripled the recipe (mixed in separate batches), poured it into my gallon-sized tupperware pitcher, and brought it to pool parties and bbqs. They get rave reviews every time, and people are always amazed by the simplicity of the recipe. This is a definite winner!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree with the addition of orange juice and fresh lime juice! Also, if you reduce the limeade and add a container of fresh raspberries, it makes a delicious raspberry margarita!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an all around great margarita. We use this recipe at the pub I work in for about 12 years now and its foolproof. I add many things like the first poster said to change it up a bit.Very versatile to use. I make it double strength for home and freeze it and make a shush to add to more limeade. I love to add some fresh mint as well, and I zest an orange and add that as well. Skies the limit with this one. You can definately make it your own.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simply perfect. What margaritas should taste like.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! It will be a favorite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this same margarita recipe for more than 25 years, time tested.. most Mexican restaurant Margaritas can't even compare to this one! If you want to kick it up a a few notches, use Gran Marnier instead of triple sec.. amazing!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Holy Moly :) I'm on my second glass now!!! These are so delicious and easy to make. There are no changes that need to be made IMO.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm Addicted to these! Ever since I made these the first time, I can't stop. SOOO good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Instead of triple sec, use Grand Marnier! And always use 100% agave tequila and a squeeze of lime. You'll never go back to any other margarita!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really easy, really good! Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum. Big hit, especially with a floater of raspberry liqueur. Will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and very good. Some reviewers thought they were on the strong side. I thought they were perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe!! I followed the bartenders suggestions adding a couple ounces of fresh squeezed orange juice and grand marnier! FANTASTIC!! From now on this is my EXCLUSIVE margarita recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! I just made this to try it for future parties. I scaled everything back for just one drink. 1 oz limeade, 1 oz tequila and a splash of triple sec. Poured it over crushed ice and I am in heaven! Thank you so much for such a delicious and easy recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Follow the directions, NOT the reviews on this one! I made several batches of this last night, including guava margaritas and pineapple margaritas. So easy and delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: A-MAZE-ING! Yum YUM! I took the bartender's suggestion and added the half oz. oj and some fresh squeezed lemon juice. This is a very refreshing drink. I don't think I can go back to mixes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy, less expensive & pretty good...I just think the Triple Sec kinda overpowers a little & brings out the "limeade" flavor a bit too much...Tastes much better with just 1 ounce Triple sec......

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This margarita was absolutely AMAZING! I dont usually like margaritas but I loved this one. Everyone I served loved it and wanted the recipe. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This margarita was absolutely AMAZING! I dont usually like margaritas but I loved this one. Everyone I served loved it and wanted the recipe. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent margaritas, celebrating Cinco de Mayo a day late and this hit the spot!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: best margarita I've ever had! My husband made this for us. We're celebrating cinco de mayo (just another excuse to drink...lol) and thought we'd festively have these. YUM! Dangerously good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish! Ive never liked bottled mixes but I was really craving a margarita when I found this and Im so glad I did. No more bottled mixes in this house!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe as well. I add to it one bottle of corona beer. Everyone seems to enjoy them. don't forget the salt!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! After years of winging it with other recipes, I finally tried this one over the weekend and it was spectacular!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too funny, Katherine. This is the SAME way I've made mine for years. My friends call these Joanne's margaritas and wow, do they pack a punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe was very good and had a great flavor I think it is one of the best drinks to serve at a party your hosting or just an adult gathering

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always use frozen limeade as every label I've read on Margarita mix is loaded with High Fructose Corn Syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've used this recipe for years; it is great! My son taught me a couple of tricks, which may sound odd, but do try them as they add a little something extra - add some beer to the blender and/or add a couple of spearmint leaves. You will be amazed!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great margaritas. Don't know what I can say that already hasn't been said except I didn't think they were to sweet -matter of fact I added a little more triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! I added water because I made mine on the rocks. Really good and way better than with the bottled mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfection! My huband and I used to go to this chain Tex-Mex place 2 or 3 times a week! Food so-so but the margarita's were to die for! Sadly, restaurant closed and I never could find that fantastic margarita again. Well guess what? This is it! Made it exactly to recipe, loaded the salt on the rim (what can I say, I like salt) and presto! Perfect Margarita! Thank you!! Trying out at party tomorrow night. Can't wait for the reviews!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: these are the best just made some yum yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was an amazing margarita using the tip from Cooper. We added a little shot bottle that was $1.25 at the liquor store (didn't want to buy a whole bottle) to the blender and it made all the difference in the world. Amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: best best BEST margarita recipe EVER!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome. I followed someone else's instructions for measuring. 3/4can tequila and 1/4 can triple sec! YUM-E!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe exactly and they are awesome! I will never buy margarita mix again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So delish, better than any restaurant marg I have had! Quick and easy too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! It was so easy, and everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this recipe for my New Years eve party. Used generic frozen limeade concentrate and 1800 Tequila Reposada. Only made one change - substituted Triple Sec with Grand Gala (Italian version of Grand Marnier). Liquid gold! Wasn't too strong but not weak either. ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making these margaritas for over 20 years! Love them! I do want to throw in here stat I add a TBS of granulated sugar. If I want to make strawberry, I use the frozen sliced strawberries (for smoothies) and cut down on the ice. And if you are wanting to make a "kid" batch, just substitute the tequila and triple sec with orange juice. They love to have a cocktail too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum. Easy. That's all I'm saying.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: i love margarita ,will someone let me know wat is triple sec tq!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Being completely out of my element, this recipe saved the day and was a great success! Thank you to all those who took the time to write reviews and tips...!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: TASTY!!! Perfect! I used 1800 and it was smooth and perfect!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: As written would be too strong for me but is very good. We did the recipe but added 12oz limeade instead of 6. Don't add too much ice or it will be too cold to drink without getting a brain freeze.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were simply amazing. My hubby even drank some with me and he doesn't like margaritas very much

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Most excellent! Most E-Z!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Such a simple recipe for great margaritas! I was skeptical, but they are definetly good! I did reduce the tequila to 5 oz. because I prefer not to fall down after two margaritas. I also used 4 cups of crushed ice. It was the perfect combination.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is awesome! It makes a lot, so when I have leftovers, I just stick it in the freezer. Later, I take it out and eat it with a spoon for dessert. This is a fun and easy recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my...what a find!! These are almost TOO good! Thanks so much for sharing the recipe. I didn't change a thing...didn't see the need to!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I add 1/2 c of powdered sugar (balances the strength of the alcohol) everyone loves them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely Delicious!!! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: awesome- kinda strong but good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I attempted to make this on the rocks, because that is how I prefer my margaritas. Not bad! I doubled the contents of limeade, triple sec, and tequila. In place of ice, I used water (filled the limeade container twice). It turned out well, but seemed to be missing something so I added lemon juice (did not have lime on hand) for more of a sour taste, and then topped with Grand Marnier! Definitely worth it :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I stumbled on this method of making Margarita's because I refused to by the mix with a mile long list on ingredients- Thank you for helping me refine it. Everyone loves them

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: ThAts a recipe that I use but u really need to add a 16oz coronna to all that and a pound of strawberries And ice I'm telling u. You will be amazed my old girl taught me this. Mine a 5. Hers 3

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Finally!!! This is an excellent and easy recipe. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We love this recipe - we make it at least 3-4 times per month. We make a double batch and take it to the pool in a pitcher and keep it in the cooler. Great drink, thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used 1 (12 oz) can of Minutemaid Frozen Limeade with 6 oz Tequila and 3 oz Triples sec. These were the best!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are good but sweet. I add a 1/2 bottle of beer to the blender. It adds some fizz and cuts the sweetness as well. I know it sounds strange but I've gotten nothing but RAVE reviews!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good and quick and easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very simple to make and our friends did like them. Usually have the tequila and triple sec on hand. Next time I will use some O.J. or splenda to see if there is a difference.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making Margaritas very similar to this for some time now. I found myself with no good limes one hot day while I was making Tacos...GASP RIGHT!! ha I always have lime aid in the freezer so....walla...The best frozen Margarita was born. I use about a Tablespoon or less of sugar per-pitcher and prefer just a splash of or no triple sec. I use 4 oz Tequila, 1/3 can frozen lime aid, sugar to taste up to 1 tablespoon, splash of triple sec (or none), 2 cups of ice. Place all in that order in a blender. Puree until smooth...Everyone loves these. Now go get out on the deck on a nice hot day and ENJOY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was visiting my brother and made this for a gathering of our old friends we grew up with. Everyone loved it and begged for another pitcher, which went as quickly as the first. It was awesome and so easy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make mine with 6 oz pineapple juice concentrate, 6 oz limeade concentrate, 1 cup tequila, 1 cup triple sec, ice and a blender. They are the best original margaritas around! The pineapple takes the twang out of the limeade. For strawberry margaritas use 8 oz frozen strawberries in juice, 4 oz frozen limeade concentrate, 6 oz tequila, 2 oz triple sec, ice and a blender is all you need.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: we've been making them this way for a couple years and they taste FABULOUS! Much better than the margarita pre mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: for a lighter calorie version use lemon/lime crystal lite :) I add fresh lemon and lime slices to the jug of mix

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making a version of this recipe for years, and everyone loves it. So much better than the bottled mixes! If you don't have triple sec on hand, fresh orange juice works well. Also, try it with a couple splashes of beer, and rim the glasses with fresh lime before dipping in salt. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I made these margaritas for a girls night in and my friends couldn't get enough of them! Next time I will have to buy more frozen limeade.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great. I will defiantly try mixing some other things in them and play with this recipe. The original recipe is fine all by itself. I would recommend it to anyone and will be making this again real soon.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: EASY! ....and delicious! We rimmed our margarita glasses with salt. I had multiplied this recipe to 20 servings and am glad that I did. My glasses held 2 servings each. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just tried this recipe and it ROCKS !!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are awesome!! I have been looking for a margarita recipe that didn't use those horrible bottled mixes. Finally found the perfect one! Made these this afternoon for an outdoor party and they were the hit of the day! Never, ever will we use the bottled mixes again. So good, and so easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW!!!! Great, easy margarita recipe! I've never been able to make good ones at home until now!!! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: really, really simple and wonderfully delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My margaritas have always been awful, and that's sad, considering I'm from Texas. Never did like the cloying taste of bottled margarita mix. This recipe, however, is wonderful. Also, a bartender made some suggestions on what you could add to make it even better, which I did -- cointreau, OJ, a can of diet 7-up, and oddly? A bit of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: THE BEST!! So simple and easy to make while having a party,I have a margaritaville machine and it made a whole pitcher fast! The don't taste strong but they are strong so beware!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I don't care for the taste of the pre-made mixes, but this tastes just like the margaritas served in restaurants!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Okay but not good. You can definitely tell it is made with limeade instead of fresh limes, it just tastes a little dingy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVED THESE! So easy, even a drunk can do it ;) I took the bartender's advice and added a little orange juice, but that's the only change I made. I will never make another margarita. My husband matched me skeptically, but he loved them as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: great recipe! love this! i also add strawberries when they're in season :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: For the longest time I wouldn't drink tequila until I had a margarita at a friends house. This recipe is great and I really enjoyed it. I know many reviews added OJ to cut the tart/flavor but my friend used 2 frozen strawberries to do the same thing, I did this with this recipe. It does change the color but it was fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. I made it for a family get together and everybody thought it was the best. I will only use this from now on, NO MORE MIXES!! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The basic concept is 5 star, and if you use good liquor you get a truly restaurant quality margarita. As stated, I thought the ratio of limeade to alcohol was a little off and ended up adding more tequila and ice. I got a "Margarator" as a gift last Christmas, and I highly recommend it. The texture is snowy and perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We listened to the 'bartender' and added about 2 oz. (by mistake) of Orange Juice and these margaritas were to die for!! Seems like the OJ took the bitterness away from the limeade. Beat any restaurant margaritas in town by a long shot! Thanks for the tip.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love making these for Cinco De Mayo Parties. I ad a little bit of powdered Sugar to the mix, and rim the glasses with the sugar too, so that they aren't so sour.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Usually I make "original" margaritas with freshly squeezed lime juice, but needed something quicker for a party. I was glad I picked this recipe! It was so easy and the margaritas are wonderful!!! I did not fill the blender with ice all the way to the top with the first batch (was afraid it would overflow), and the margaritas were too strong. The following batches were perfect. Recommend making before the guests arrive (especially if your blender is really loud), put in a plastic jug and put in the ice in your beverage tub. It keeps better than you would expect. Make sure you buy enough limeade! Would recommend to calculate 1 batch per every 4 guests, more if there are no other beverages (we used up 4 batches for 18 people, despite offering also wine, beer, and non-alcoholic drinks)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like the limeade idea as I have used it for years, sans the triple sec. I take 1 small can of limeade, pour over blender full of ice, then fill that same can with tequila pour in the blender, then fill that same can with BEER. Comes out perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These margaritas are delicious!!! I add a little bit of orange juice and squeeze fresh lime into them to make them even better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these all last summer for sipping on our beach. So easy and delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: super yummy....love the flavor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good margarita!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too sweet. Lacks dimension. You could lick the limeade can and not taste the difference. One reviewer added OJ and I think I will try that next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quite tasty! I like to rim my glass with sugar instead of salt.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: this by and far is the best margarita I have ever had! And so easy who would have guessed? I was a bartender for several years and have made every kind imaginable, that everyone said was the best! But this recipe is the best!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe turned me on to Margaritas. I never liked tequila before... This is the PERFECT drink recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a huge hit at parties! A great alternative to using those chemical-tasting margarita mixes! Sometimes this recipe is too sweet for my taste so I add some natural orange juice to thin out the margarita both in consistency and sweetness. Also, if you don't have Triple Sec on hand, Grand Marnier is a great substitute

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very similar to my gpa's recipe that was a family Christmas tradition. He had a great way of measuring, 1 can limeade, 1/2 can tequila, 1/3 can triple sec. Add a splash of orange juice and half a lime, rind and all in the blender, and it brings back all those Christmas celebrations with him!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome margaritas - just like the ones in the restaurants! Since I started making this recipe, I've had way to many happy hours to count! Everyone love it. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: sorry, way too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is about as easy as they come -- with my regular Kitchen Aid blender I don't even crush the ice first. These Margaritas are not too sweet, not too tart, and they will get rave reviews from your friends! What more could you ask for in a drink?!? This recipe is a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so easy to make and tastes oh so good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this for a while now and everyone loves it. However recently we went to an Italian Rest.; and had an Italian Margarita and now have changed it a little. What I now do is use the can of limeade; then use 1/2 can water; 1/2 can - ok - maybe a little more of tequila; almost 1/2 a can of triple sec or a good Orange liquire; then I mix in a blender with no ice. Pour into a salt rimmed glass over ice; and then add 1 shot of Ameratto to the glass. WOW- it sure does knock it up a noch and is super good. Thanks so much for this recipe. - PS - you can use Kosher Salt instead of 'Margarita Salt' its easier to find and cheaper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
