cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I tried this on the rocks and added one cup of water to make up for it not being frozen. Also- added a "Ms. Thang" twist with three squeezed orange wedges and a short splash of orange juice. Wow!! it was sooo good. I cant wait to invite friends over to try.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: perfect recipe! Just what i was looking for

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a margarita and fajita themed birthday party for my son's 3rd birthday party. Tired of the same old pizza and cake routine, I decided to make fajitas and margaritas, so that all the grown-ups could enjoy themselves too! This margarita recipe was fantastic and a hit. I followed the recipe exactly and added some fresh lime juice and an ounce of OJ for those that wanted margaritas on the rocks. I also made several frozen batches with whole fresh mango chunks blended in, finished with a Chambord float on top, like one reviewer mentioned. It was amazing! The margaritas went well with the Avocado, Tomato and Mango Salsa on this site. Thanks for the great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect! This is the first margarita recipe that I've tried, but I don't think I need to look any further! I enjoyed this slushy, slightly tart, and just-sweet-enough concoction with tortillas and salsa. It was better than the restaurant margaritas I've tried. It was tastier than a prepackaged mixer without any extra work. Omit the tequila and triple sec and add a splash of orange juice for an alcohol-free treat that can be enjoyed by everyone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! No better way to make margaritas!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We added 1 oz of orange liquor too! Yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best margarita I have ever made at home. Everybody loved them and I will never use a margarita mix again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is FANTASTIC! My fiance and I decided to mix up a pitcher of margaritas and power lounge in the back yard. This margarita was the perfect thing for a warm summer evening.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: too sweet, I would dilute the limeade first before adding the alcohol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best margaritas ever and boy do they pack a punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: For years now I've been buying the Jose Cuervo mix in the supermarket for almost $7.00 a bottle, and it doesn't come CLOSE to tasting as good as this very simple recipe! The secret is filling the blender with ice, and then the addition of the frozen limeade concentrate makes it the perfect consistency for a blended margarita. This tasted authentic, and exactly like the drinks I have ordered and enjoyed from Mexican restaurants. I am hooked on this recipe now! Great, delicious, easy to make, and much cheaper than a premade mix - I'll never make margaritas any other way again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and better than any I've ever had. Will definitely make again, in fact I'm making it again right now. Can't wait to drink it. Yummy yummy yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Easy and doesn't leave that too sweet tast in your mouth like some premade margarita mixes! This will be my regular margarita recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty. But might I suggest using Sauza blanco or gold tequila. It's the #1 selling tequila in Mexico. (I think that says alot!!!) It's really a great tequila.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! I didn't have any Triple Sec, so I substituted Grand Marnier and they were delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These may not be the most authentic margaritas and a little sweet, but they are very, very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: It has been hot this week in the beautiful Pacific Northwest and I decided to look up a margarita recipe to surprise my hubby and I came across this easy recipe. So I ran to the grocery store first to get ingredients for fish tacos and then off to get the stuff for the margaritas. It was difficult to find the salt for the rims! So while my husband was waiting for dinner I made him one of these margaritas and it sure put a smile on his face! It really cooled things off!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: the description says it all simple and superb!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and Superb!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy and completely fool-proof! I took suggestions and added only 5 shots of tequila and also the juice of one lime. Also used Cointreau instead of triple sec and was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent and easy! I used 1/2 Tequila and 1/2 Triple Sec and added the juice and pulp of one lime (reamed). Made these in my slushy maker and WOW! I need look no further. NOTE - do read the review by Cooper4 for some GREAT ideas how to change this up to a blue 'rita, or a fruit 'rita! My freezer is full of limeade and I'm ready to let summer 2009 begin! Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These margaritas are great, better than most restraunts! Make sure to use Corona for the beer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my "go to" recipe whenever I am in the mood for a Margarita. It's fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ok, I was really craving mexican food last night and I needed the whole thing. First time ever making margaritas, and these are fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this very easy recipe. We made in on vacation. We added just a little more tequilla for a kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I first tried this on New Year's eve at a party we went to. Everyone loved them! I have made them several times since. This has to be the best margarita I have ever made. I did add some orange juice to the mix like previously mentioned in another review. About the same about as you add triple sec. YUMMY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Love being able to make and drink a great Margarita at home. I added 2 fluid ounces of Orange Juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good. I like this, its like going to good restaurant but having it at home!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: too sweet for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: added one full mango in there too. awesome. this is a great recipe on its own or as a base.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a very good base line for a Margarita, I tried it with Watermellon and WOW what a treat on a hot summer day. Just remember to remove the seeds after your had a couple :-}

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous. The only change we made was to reduce the amount of alcohol to 75% of the original amount. Everyone just raved about these!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish classic margaritas. No syrupy pre-made mix here! We like them fairly strong, so this was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great. I keep the ingredients handy for surprise guests or when I've had a hard day at the office. Very good and super easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were good, but I still love my favorite when I'm drinking at home I like the "Master of Mixes" mix we buy in the grocery store! I know... but it's good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are GREAT. Didn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These Margaritas are truly a hit.....I have made them at several parties and they have recieved RAVE reviews from everyone. This recipe is WONDERFUL!! A lot of my friends use the bottled margarita mixers...once I let them in on this recipe..they are through with that stuff. I have branched out to start adding frozen fruit such as strawberries and peaches.....DELISH!! Thank you so much for this recipe...you have made me the Margarita Queen.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too sweet!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty and foolproof! I had never used limeade in a Margarita before, but I loved it. Will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been using this recipe for years. I usually add 3 oz of triple sec. It makes it a little sweeter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I took the suggestion of adding a half ounce of orange juice and fresh lime juice. Also used the suggestion of using the limeaide container for measuring -- a less than 3/4 full of tequilla and 1/4 of the container of triple sec. Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Like a few others said, they were a bit TOO strong. I don't like the tequila to overpower the drink, and this one did. Next time I'll use maybe 4oz. tequila, instead of 6. Love the limeade idea!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These margaritas are the BOMB and SO easy to make. I bought a margaritaville frozen concoction machine recently and wanted to take it down to my sister's for our annual 4th of July party at her house by the beach. I searched for a recipe and found this one. I am so glad I picked this one, because these were a huge hit at the party! I ended up being the bartender for the night and made batch after batch of these delicious drinks. Some people thought the limeade a bit too tangy so I used 1/2 the can of limeade and squeezed a tad of fresh lime in the mix. They were perfect!! This will be the drink now for our 4th of July party from now on!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this once using the exact recipe and it was great, but all the sugar from pre-made mixes sometimes gives me a headache... So, using the idea of limeade from this recipe, I decided to make fresh limeade to replace the frozen concentrate. I used the honey limeade recipe found here, to which I added about 2-3 tbs of fresh-squeezed orange juice. I first poured the liquor and then kinda eyeballed the amount of limeade, serving it on the rocks. It's a great alternative if you're feeling ambitious enough to go homemade once in a while.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed previous reviewer's advice and tweaked the recipe as follows. I used the suggested amount of triple sec, but also added 1 oz Grand Marnier. I also added 1 oz. Orange Juice and 3 oz. Beer. It really takes away the sour taste. I also squeezed a lime into the blender. Everyone at the party raved about these. They went so fast that we had to run to the store to buy more ingredients!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent!!! We had a friend that always made these, and they are my favorite way to make good margaritas at home. Love that the ingredients are cheap and easy to have on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Margaritas - this recipe is a keeper! Had Margaritas at a Mexican restaurant last week - this one's much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: For a twist , I use Blue Curacao instead of Triple Sec (make sure you use clear tequila) and they come out a lovely blue color!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were really good! I added the juice of a fresh squeezed lime, which made them taste authentic. NEVER use the pre-bottled margarita mix...it just doesn't compare!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The perfect summer drink. I prefer Cointreau instead of Triple Sec, add a generous squeeze of fresh lime to the blender, and be sure to use crushed ice. If you have a blood orange on hand, squeeze a 1/2 into the blender as well. This makes the prettiest party drink ever.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: As good as any I've had in a restaurant - and a whole lot more economical. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Tossed half a lime into the blender along with the other ingredients and then strained the contents of the blender into margartia glasses. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was easy and absolutely delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My fiance and I adore this recipe! I make it just as posted, but at grand marnier to make it a cadillac margarita. It's my #1 at home margarita now, and I'll never use the store bought mix again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make mine the same way! Now that it is summer you HAVE to try this! Chunk up and de-seed about 2 to 3 cups of watermelon. Freeze the watermelon and add with the ice when making these margaritas. Freezing is key to keeping the drink a good thick frozen consistancy. Also, you can de-seed then puree and freeze in ice cube trays for later use. Just pop them in a zipper bag to keep fresh tasting. These will be the hit at your BBQ or next party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: THIS WAS REALLY GOOD.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are fabulous! I mix two cans of water with the limeade, a spoon of orange juice concentrate and two fresh squeezed limes. Then pour it all into my ice cream freezer. You have never tasted anything so good! It's like they came out of a margarita machine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Even friends who say they don't like frozen margaritas cannot get enough of these.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Anybody know how this recipe turns out if I dissolve all of the frozen limade and serve it on the rocks?? Plan on making a huge amount for a party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best margarita I've ever had at home. I make mine on the rocks instead of frozen though. And I added a little orange juice and some fresh lime juice as well. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added 2 oz Rose's lime juice - PERFECT!! I've been hunting for the right combination (I don't like the sour mix most places use) and this is it!! A houseful of Mexicans agree!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this yesterday because it sounded so simple and got great reviews. Wow! It was a diffrent take that is for sure. I did the second batch with a bit less teq. and added some fesh lime juice and a little bit of sugar, 1 Tbs. It makes it so they are not as strong. Its flavor is a world of diffrence from the store bought mixer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making margaritas with a very similar recipe for 20 years so I was shocked when I saw this. However, I use a 12 oz can of limeade and mix in the tequila and triple sec on a 2:1 ratio. Depending on how strong your like your tequila I've made them with 1/2 C tequila, 1/4 C triple sec all the way up to a full cup of tequila.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like another reviewer, I added orange juice to make the perfect margarita.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Jose Cuervo Premium Gold and Cointreau and added the orange juice. Best Margarita ever!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe. I love good margaritas, and the mixes they sell just do not cut it. This did not have the awkward taste that some mixes do. Even my husband thought it was good, and he hates mixed drinks. I used Miller Lite Chill, with the lime flavoring in it. Do not know if it helped for sure or not, but it didn't hurt.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Five star Margarita made simple! Like a previous reviewer, I am an ex bartender and have always been in search of a better Margarita. Using the limeade is such a great alternative to the sour mix. I made mine on the rocks and it is oh so perfect! Thanks Katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We make these at every get together and I CRAAAVE them in between. :) This is a wonderful margarita recipe, especially if you like em' a little tangy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was very simple but I thought the margaritas were bland. Maybe I should have tried some additions as suggested by other reviewers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I hate margaritas but these were really good. I had a party and everyone seemed to like them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make sure and check out COOPER4's review for additions!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a must have!!! Instead of using the frozen limeade, I have made them with frozen mexican fruit juices located at the corner mexican market. Parcha/passion fruit is absolutely amazing! Everyone loves them! Also try using Jose Cuervo Citrico..it's a cheap tequila but with the passion fruit, you can't even taste a trace of it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfectly simple, fast and delicious! Made these for Mexican night and Everyone Loved these margaritas, and they are a cinch to make when everyone asks for more! The only recipe I will use from now on! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: i have made my margaritas like this for years and will never change them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's ok. I don't think that concentrated limeade comes anywhere close to the taste of real lime juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good just a little bit too strong, next time i will use less tequila

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy and very yummy!! I added a little bit of Grand Mariner WOW!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I rated this years ago. It was the top rated review but it mysteriously dissappeared so I'll try again. Ever since I found this recipe my search for the perfect Margarita has ended! In my former life I spend many, many years bartending in a popular restaurant know for it's signature drinks. Despite that experience I struggled to duplicate a decent margarita at home. I didn't have the secret spice mix, none of the (expensive) mixes out there even came close, and messing with all of those limes and sugar was, well, a mess! Search no more folks, this is sooo easy and makes the perfect Margarita to boot. Ialways add a splash of O.J. to the blender. To make it "golden" sub Gran Marnier or Cointrau (sp?) or a combo of both for the Triple Sec. In the summer I often replace half of the ice with frozen chunks of watermelon and it is devine! If you prefer your margarita on the rocks, cut the recipe with 1/2 h20, put in a shaker with ice, shake shake shake and pour into your ice filled glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These things are GOOOOOOOd youll never regret making them, I followed the bartender's review and added a half oz of OJ to the original recipe. To top it off I swirled a half oz of Chambord on top! I couldnt find Limeade, so I used a Bacardi Mixer from the freezer isle

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will never go back to the "mixes" again! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Because this recipe was so simple, I was thinking these margaritas would probably be good, but not great. They were fantastic! Thanks to KDA949 for the great advice to measure the tequila and triple sec using the limeade container. These could not have been any easier to make and everyone at my party loved them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! These margaritas were delicious. I'm rather picky about my margaritas, but I really liked this one and so did everyone else. We ended up making 2 batches. Rimmed the glasses with kosher salt - great summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really is the best recipe for marqaritas. Part of the beauty of it is that it's so simple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent flavor with minimum work!!! Great recipe. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is my dads recipe as well, and yet, the best, bar none!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the classic recipe we have used for years, and it is perfect every single time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been using this receipe since the early nineties..the only thing I do differently is add a half can of club soda which seems to cut a tad of the tart taste..try frozen mango chunks..yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! These were really easy to make and tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a recipe I have used forever. I was glad to see someone else uses it as well. It is always a hit at parties! For over the rocks just add a bit of water instead of ice (it ends up tasting a bit stonger).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. Everyone liked them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the reviewer who said 3/4 can of tequila and 1/4 triple sec, but also added a splash of grand marnie. OH boy after two I was feeling so fine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making these since 1984! They have been a huge hit every time I have served them. I like to keep them in the freezer for stress free entertaining!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Out of tequila, so we made with Gold Rum (not spiced), and we liked even better than a traditional margarita. These are very good, and as easy as prepared mixes that taste like fake juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The limeade is a great alternative if you don't have fresh lime juice. I will probably be making these all summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband has been making these same margaritas for years. We love them and so do all of our friends and family.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never cared for margaritas. The few I've tried just tasted kind of nasty, so I had no interest in making them at home. Then, Cinco de Mayo 2007 came along... :) And, Katherine, you've changed my view on this fabulous drink! I made one batch with limeade (I cut the 12-oz can in half lengthwise and stuck the second half in a freezer bag, back in the freezer!) and used 1½ or 2 trays of ice cubes... Well, they were a little strong! The second batch somehow turned out stronger... Nice to drink while watching our daughter playing in her wading pool in 90-degree weather in early May! I also made a batch with pink lemonade instead of limeade and it turned out wonderful as well. Seriously, thanks so much for sharing this recipe, Katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My absolute favorite drink. I make it as written, or sometimes squeeze in the juice of an orange. Yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: SOOOO good! I add frozen strawberries. I served these twice at my house and five of the 15 got pregnant. Coincidence?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are fantastic! After trying several other recipes, I found this one and then my husband declared that I had found my calling as a drink mixer. :) Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: great as is! if you want to lighten the tart, and add some color, throw in a few frozen strawberries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: There was just something funny tasting about these, the limeade flavor was really strong and not at all like what margaritas taste like to me. I made this two nights and just couldn't get the flavor right, even following the directions exactly. Maybe I will try it again using Contrieu instead of Triple Sec, and maybe using a frozen sour mix instead of limeade. I definitely won't make it again as written.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous and easy! We followed the directions exactly for our Cinco de Mayo - doubled the recipe and enjoyed every last drop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous & Strong...Just The Way I Like It!!! The Only Change I Made Was An Addition Of Raspberry & Peaches To Make It Fruit....& It Went Great With The Limeade!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: yummy... try them with Contreau instead of triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband has used this recipe from south Texas for years. He calls it "Border Buttermilk." Everyone loves it and we've given the recipe to many people.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy, and really delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: sweet

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I finally killed my blender making these. They are the best.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these for my fiance after a rough night at work, he loved them! Said we'll definitely have to make these this summer when we're hanging around the pool. I prefer mine fruity, so next time, I'll take his half out, and add some frozen strawberries to my half. Thanks for the great margarita recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: LoVed this recipe for Margaritas!!!!!!!!!!!! It is sooo easy to make and is better than purchasing and squeeIng all those limes! Great recipe..will only use this one from now on!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent margaritas!!! Great blend of all the flavors and I added a few frozen mixed berries for added color and flavor. My guests loved them and I plan on using this recipe for a long time. Thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well, my husband, who fancies himself a "Margarita Master" and has been loyal to his father's famous recipe forever, really liked these MUCH easier frozen margaritas! So did I! The limeade does NOT make them overly sweet or "kiddy"-like. They are just sweet enough. Oh, try using Cointreau in lieu of the Triple Sec for a real "Cadillac" of a margarita. GREAT--either way. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making these for years! I've made the following changes....I always add an ounce of cointreau and an once of chambourg.....I also agree with the guy who adds beer...delicioso!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely perfect! I have been trying to find a comparable recipe for frozen margaritas I found everywhere on the Las Vegas Strip - particularly "Fat Tuesday's" - these are doing the trick! I'm making them in the middle of winter in Toronto - I can't wait to have them in the summer around the pool!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tastey! I am a margarita lover and this is awesome. thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these margaritas for a family get together and they were a huge success and so easy and quick to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We make these quite often, they are wonderful! I like to up the triple sec to 3 and the tequila to 4 or 5, a little less kick to it for me. Adding frozen strawberries makes a tasty strawberry margartia.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so good, you would be surprised they're so easy to make. Tastier and easier than a margarita mix. Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the 2nd time I've made these now and they are awesome! Be sure to use minute maid limeade and for more tartness and color, add a little red wine or sangria on top!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY I have been making these drinks for years and have always gotten loads of compliments. Everyone says they are the best margaritas they have ever had and I have been asked for the recipe many times. For strawberry margaritas add either fresh or frozen strawberries. Mango margaritas can be made by adding a ripe peeled and pitted mango. Your friends will tell you they are better than any bar margarita. They are super easy, less expensive, and soooo much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the recipe I use for my Margaritas, THE ONLY DIFFERENCE IS: I add 1 can/bottle of beer at the very end. Becareful when blending in the beer, use quick little zaps because you do not want this to foam up. When I tell friends what my "secrete ingredient" is, there amazed because they can't taste the beer, but it does add a nice flair to the drinks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: i used skyy instead it was a hit at my party

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummm... These were great. But the Beer Margaritas are still my fav.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! Best margaritas ever!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: STRONG!! All the guys at my party were laughing at how strong these were. I began adding more of the frozen limeaid and they were much better. I also added some frozen stawberries to some and those were a BIG hit! I will definately make these again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The ABSOLUTE best margarita by far! Thank you for sharing! I used Patron & added fresh strawberries to the second batch. This is the one & only recipe you'll ever need!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good!!! I have used this recipe several times with good results.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are excellent margaritas! I make them on the rocks or blended and both are fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: very good will make again for sure

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is so good.......it's sweet, sour and just the right consistency of alcohol..I will definietely be making this again and again....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect margarita recipe, Don't change a thing! This was better than any restaurant margarita I've ever had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I served these at my Party!!!!!!!!!!!!! EXCELLENT 5 STAR MARGARITAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Four stars for flavor. But, duh, these are FROZEN Margaritas! The flavor was probably dulited after micro-waving to turn the slush to liquid, but they were still pretty good. And I will try again to use the recipe for on-the-rocks. (Which is, BTW, the only way to go.)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had these at our Cinco de Mayo party and everyone absolutely loved these margaritas!! Better than restaurants!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Been making these for years. My favorite recipe for margaritas. I usually add 3 ounces of triple sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Catherine, These margaritas were fantastic! I made a surprise welcome home party for my best friend Lori. I decided to have an Island theme, and keeping with the theme, I thought I would try this recipe. Everyone raved about them. Thanks again Catherine for this wonderful recipe!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My mom has used this recipe for years. I love it! Add one tablespoon of powdered sugar to the mixture before blending and it will be perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: GREAT! We used a little less ice and a little bit of lime sherbet for sweetness and to make it a little creamy. So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are really good.. and easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, but a little tart. Next time I'll add some sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are good but I do add a tablespoon of sugar sometimes 2. At least after a few drinks the next batch won't get stronger like they did in the past when I made Margaritas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you like TGI Fridays margaritas, you will LOVE these. TGI Fridays is my favorite margarita place. I've been looking for a recipe that was similar for a long time. The secret is the Limeade (which Fridays uses as well). YUMMY!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes like restaurant margaritas!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: they were OK. I did add some splenda as they were pretty tart. I guess i like mine on the rocks versus blended. if you like blended, then give this recipe a try.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Margarita ever! Once you try it, you will never get another as good anywhere.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Big hit with the ladies. The men thought it was too sour but drank them anyway. I loved them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: What an awesome idea with the limeade. They were so good. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whooo-hoo! Hubby made these last night and they were awesome!!! Great simple recipe. Perfect Margaritas! Wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: EASY to make & SOOOOO good!! One of the best frozen margarita recipes ever! Thanks :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great. They were a little tart for my fiance but I loved them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my new standard. Always get rave reviews and so easy to mix when you have company.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: What an amazingly simple recipe! My friend and I have tweaked the recipe a bit (after lengthy trials :-) and now add the juice from 1 lime to it. We also prefer Cointreau or Grand Mariner over triple sec, but I would use triple sec if it was the only thing I had on hand. It's more important that you have a margarita, right?! We are now known for our great Margaritas! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: so good and easy and great for entertaining.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great margarita recipe! I added frozen berries to the recipe, but liked the original recipe better. Nothing like a cold margarita on a hot day and this recipe hits the spot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a 40th birthday party for my husband and we had a Fiesta Theme -- made these and they were great! Thanks for sharing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is top notch! I was very skeptical at first because the recipe seemed too simple. They were the best magaritas i've ever had. Every homemade margarita i've ever tried to make has turned out bad. You cannot mess this one up. You might want to play around with the ingredients based on how sweet and how strong you want it. I added a little more tequila and some sugar to mine. I will make these from now on when I have parties. Not only are they delicious, but much cheaper than ones you get at restaurants!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Here's a secret... shot of "margaritaville" tequila 4 count of sweet and sour 2 count of lime juice 2 count of triple sec I make these all night and get paid for them:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great great recipe. We made these one night when we had a bunch of people over for mexican food. They were so good a friend of ours who is a bartender asked for the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this! Everyone asked how I made them. They were so great. On on batch I added fresh strawberries and that was also a hit. Thanks for sharing Katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These really are great. Had my margarita-connoisseur friend over and she loved. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum yum yum, nothing beats a good margarita! thanks katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good that my father-in-law (well known for his real-maragitas) asked for the recipe - he was very surprised about how basic it was.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really love margaritas, and this recipe hits the spot! It tastes like other good margaritas I've had out on the town, but much cheaper! It was a cinch to blend up and is now my official margarita recipe! It also refreezes well and is great right out of the freezer. It does get a little more sour and somewhat bitter when it melts, but some type of sugar or oj should help that.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making margaritas like this for years, but add a packet or two of Splenda for just a hair more sweetness! Anotehr tip - dno't strat dirnknig 'em too eraly!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Nice way to start the weekend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are good but I prefer margaritas that are not frozen.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These Margaritas rock so hard...I decided to give them a trial run before a little get together Im having Sat. nite. They were so easy! And so delicious! I can't wait to wow my Margarita lovin' friends. Im drinking one right now!!!! These will definitely be a regular around this camp!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are by far, the easiest and best tasting margaritas I've ever made at home. My limeade never goes bad, like my limes used to. I'm always ready to serve these whenever I have guests over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy and very good! Next time I'll add a bit more tequila & triple sec...and blend it a little longer. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the same recipe I've made for years. I don't care much for frozen drinks so I double the recipe and add as much ice as the blender will hold. A little goes a long ways!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent and easy to make. Will use often.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Better than any store-bought Margarita Mix!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am rating this ONE for the sole purpose of we made these to a T and they didn't taste good at all. We even threw it all out and started over and it was still not good, very bitter in fact. Maybe it was the kind of Tequila we used. Any suggestions of what we could have done wrong? My hubby LOVES margaritas!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good and easy. We added some fresh strawberries for a sweet touch

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great and they couldn't be any easier to make. I used a little less than the 6 ounces of tequila and used my smoothie machine to blend. I will definitely be making these again and again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These margaritas are the best I've ever made, and I've tried many recipes. Make sure you put ice right to the top of the blender or else the limeade will make it taste too bitter. Also make sure you blend it long enough so that it's more of a slushy constistency than snow cone consistency. And to serve, use a margarita glass, cut a lime in half and run the cut part over the edge of the glass, then dip the rim in salt and garnish with half a lime slice. Perfection.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was using the "Barefoot Contessa" recipe for these. These are much easier to make and taste soooo delicious, although I added 8 oz of tequila instead of 6 oz. I only filled the blender 3/4 with crused ice. Really hit the spot!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes! Finally I can make a good margarita! I wouldn't let myself get my hopes up because I've followed recipes before but have always been disappointed. Not this time. I added a mango and they came out great. I can't wait to have company over to impress them with my great margaritas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: My family has been using this recipe for over three decades and it's always been a hit. Only difference, we've always used a teaspoon of sugar or two instead of triple sec - not a big difference. Also, we usually call them "drunk margaritas," because you can make them well, even when you're drunk. Since we use the 6 oz. can of limeade, you just dump that over the ice in the blender, then fill the limeade can with tequila then add the sugar. Trust me, these are fool-proof, and you really can make them perfectly even when you're drunk. (Though maybe you wouldn't really notice.)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and so good!! Thanks for the quick and easy recipe!! My husband and I could drink these all night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY!!! Have turned out perfect everytime I make them! Thank you for a "fool proof" recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good, but we did the following to make it easy: Put crushed ice in blender, poured in can of limeade, filled can with tequila and poured in, then filled can 1/2 way with triple sec (a little more than what it called for), and poured that it then hit the blender! Tasted GREAT! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY good recipe. I served them for a gourmet club "Cinco de Mayo" party, and they were a hit! I didn't tell them it was a limeade concentrate until they had polished off every drop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: yummy.........i don't think i'll go back to the expensive pre-mixes again. looks like i'll have to stock up on limeade for the summer! :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used this recipe the first time I made margaritas without a pre-made mix. It is easy and foolproof! I received rave reviews from my guests. Try it out!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This totally kicked butt! I used Cointreau instead of Triple Sec, though, and my container of limeade concentrate was bigger than 6 oz - it was more like 10 oz. The drink is pretty powerful - if I were making it for a party, I'd scale back a bit further on the booze so that my guests wouldn't be snockered within a drink or two! We had this along with enchiladas and mexican baked red rice for a delicious cinco de mayo dinner.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'll never use a mix again. This recipe was so easy and everyone loved them!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these for my husband and brother-in-law. They loved them! I will definitely use this for my next party

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is so easy to make, and we always run out! By far the best margarita's I have ever made. Thank you for this great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy! I should have chopped the ice first. When I put the cubes in the blender, the bottom was slush and the top was still hard cubes. Otherwise, the whole drink was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and GOOD! For the person who said they prefer margaritas on the rocks, so do I, no need to blend, just mix together and pour over ice, excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a good recipe but if you want to make it better try using Grand Marnier in place of the triple sec, this makes it a "TOP SHELVE" Margarita!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were easy, inexpensive, and very good. I like to add a little cranberry juice. Had them like that in AZ in a resturant. Great!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think this is the ONLY way to make blended margaritas! They taste SO MUCH better then those made with mix from the bottle!! One quick tip for easy measuring that I use- I dump the can of frozen limeade in the blender, fill the limeade can 3/4 full with tequilla and the remainder full (1/4) with the triple sec, pour that in then fill the blender with ice. Turn on the blender and let the party begin! Much easier then using a measuring cup. If this is too strong then simply fill the can half way with tequilla and add triple sec to make the can 3/4 full.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and tasty. I prefer my margies on the rocks, but for a blended drink these were great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These margaritas are fantastic! I am so glad I had a chance to try this recipe because I love the mexican people and their traditional drink is so flavorful and so good and I think I'm drunk right now but the taste was wonderful and so wonderful.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very simple to make and they taste delicious! They also pack a powerful punch! This margarita recipe is a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect margarita! No more expensive mixers for us! Rim the glass with salt, and you are ready to go....Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a simple great tasting drink recipe. Thanks OP! This was a hit at my party and very easy to modify!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a tasty and easy recipe that rivals the margaritas at the Mexican restaurants. Do use a good quality tequila. If you don't it will taste too "boozy". Pay a little more and you won't be disappointed. Can't wait to try these out on my friends at our next girls night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe! It only took a minute to make a batch, and they taste just as good as the ones served in mexican restaurants. I used Grand Marnier in place of the Triple Sec. The limeade mix is cheaper and better than those Bacardi mixers. I plan to keep the freezer stocked with a few limeades so anytime we have guests we can quickly whip up these yummy drinks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these on Father's Day and the women LOVED them (the men were mostly hard core beer drinkers). These margaritas got rave reviews. I wasn't too sure about filling the blender with ice but if you don't you won't get the right consistency (slushy). I also measured the tequila and Triple Sec with a measuring cup to get it just right. Not too tart and not too sweet, they are very smooth, easy to make, and they kept well in the refrigerator as well. EVERYONE asked for the recipe. Perfect for a warm afternoon outside.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Very easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow hard to believe that it is this easy to make, and taste so wonderful!! I had several people not believing that this was my very first time ever making a margarita! I won't search any further! Thanks so much for this great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked the flavor of these but my husband thought they were a little stong. I have made them several times and will keep this recipe. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: YEOWZA! These are strong! Next time I'll tone em' down a little, Thanks Katherine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are very easy, delicious margaritas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are the best margaritas! They are so much better than those made with the mixes, and much cheaper too. These are so good my friends and I now have margarita Thursday at my house. Goes great with chips and salsa!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these at my 4th of July picnic and they were a big hit! Everybody loved them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are great and a tastier alternative to buying the expensive margarita mixers. I'm scolded every time I show up at a party without the fixins to this fabulous drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for Cinco de Mayo and it was such a hit! It was so easy and simple and tasted better than the ones at most resturants.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are the best margaritas I have ever tasted!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Note to author: This is the identical recipe I use for Margaritas! Couple suggestions: In addition, try pouring 6 oz. of any old beer (lager style preferred) in there. It mellows the tartness of the limeade and smooths the whole mix out nicely. Also, try replacing triple sec with Grand Marnier. Mmm Mmmm Mmmmm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a little pineapple juice but overall it was excellent and easy...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are the best homemade margaritas I've ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very good. I added alittle bit more tequila. You only need one ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my first attempt at making a cosmo. The entire recipe is less than 2 oz. of a drink, so it is on the small side but enlarging is easy. I did add a little more cranberry, but I think it tastes great (a good vodka that doesn’t taste and smell like isopropyl alcohol helps ). Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: We typically make 'Big Cosmos' - 4 oz. vodka, 2 oz. Grand Marnier, Triple Sec (or similar orange liqueur) 2 oz. lime juice, 6 -8 oz. cranberry cocktail - to taste. Pour everything over 4-6 ice cubes in a large tall glass and garnish with lime wedges/slices.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious. I slightly increase each of the ingredients other than the vodka.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really good but a bit too strong for me. Next time, I’ll add a little more Triple Sec and cranberry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just added about twice the amount of cranberry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a little more triple sec, and I used Cran/Cherry juice. Try it with the flavored vodkas, and mixed juices until you hit upon your new signature drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very strong; maybe less vodka?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Absolut Citron and a full ounce of cranberry juice which makes a perfect balance for me!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was perfect. The only thing I would change is the amount, I would double it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: My(wife's) tastes tend to gravitate towards more sweet and less alcohol. She's essentially a non-drinker. I add about 1/4 oz simple syrup (equal parts water and sugar) and beef up cranberry juice a bit. 1.5 oz vodka, 1/2 oz Triple Sec, 1 oz cranberry juice, 1/2 oz fresh lime juice, 1/4 oz simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too heavy on the vodka for me and needed more cranberry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used vanilla vodka and it was wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these Christmas Eve. They turned out really good. I actually made a pitcher of them and dipped the rim of the glass in sugar. Everybody wanted more??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I Love this "modern" classic cocktail, and I agree with Rainbow Jewels that it's perfect to share with My Girlfriends. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: A classic drink to enjoy with your girlfriends. Perfect as written, wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic cocktail well worth making with top quality ingredients

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This should be named the "classic cosmo" or "original" I had made another recipe before I found this one and it had a lot of unnecessary extra ingredients. This recipe is PERFECT and it's the one I'm using from now on. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: A tad stronger than I would have liked, but easily rectified by additional cranberry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Really good, im only 21 but its good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm w/Sarah Jo in that this makes a small "drink". It barely filled a highball glass 3/4's of the way full, w/additional cranberry juice. No biggie, just be prepared to adjust (or feel like your doing a cosmo shot) per your own personal preference. No Triple Sec, so I subbed a little lemon juice instead. I also used a sparkling cranberry juice as I prefer bubbles in my drinks. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used fresh lime juice and "diet" cranberry juice. This is delicious. I tripled it only because I wanted a bigger drink. My husband keeps sneaking sips.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as written except I could not find Hiram Walker pumpkin flavored liquor, but I found something that was pumpkin spice that looked like Bailey's (creamy) and used that. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous 👌

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great fall cocktail. Rich and delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this martini! I found Bailey’s Pumpkin Spice which just made it even better. I did add (2) 1.5 oz. jiggers of the Pumpkin Spice Bailey’s which helped keep it from being overly strong. Aldi’s has a Pumpkin Spice version of Bailey’s - o’Donnell’s. I haven’t tried it yet, but the lady that works at our local ABC store said it was really good..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it exactly according to the recipe. Delicious. Could add more pumpkins if you want more of a stronger pumpkin taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this recipe, like having dessert in a glass

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is just delicious. I wet the rims of a martini glass with lemon and dip the glass in sugar with pumpkin spice mixed in. I am making this for my husbands birthday party in a punch bowl.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great combination of flavors, although the proportions were a little off for me. With equal parts of all three, it's far too pumpkin-spicy. I changed the ratio to two parts vanilla vodka and irish cream to one part pumpkin liqueur. Perfection!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious as is, but for the 2nd batch we added all ingredients to the blender with ice. Even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious as-is, and always a huge hit at gatherings! Our friends and family beg us to throw Autumn/Halloween parties because these are a staple. As some other reviewers mentioned, preference dictates strength: if you like it stronger, stick with the recipe or even add a bit more vodka; if it's too much, add some half-and-half or milk before shaking. Fantastic either way!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a huge hit, every time I make it! My wife talks about it throughout the year and as soon as October rolls around, she starts hounding me to make these. Don't ask me why she waits until October, and drinks them until January, I stopped trying to follow her logic-train years ago. Its easy to make and just sweet enough to be a pleaser for any crowd. Chill the martini glass ahead if time. It's worth it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooo good. I serve this at my Halloween parties. I have made it without the spices and it is still yummy! Always a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: A nice fall and holiday drink. I never had pumpkin spice liquor before, and it was very good here. It only came in a large bottle, so I'm sure I'll make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I could only find Bailey's Pumpkin Pie Spice liquor, so I mixed equal parts of the vodka with it and added some 1/2 and 1/2 to mellow it out. Was told it was delicious. Did try this Bailey's on the rocks - not a fan. Gave it a 4 star because it wasn't the original recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh Yea!!!! I made these having the girls over for brunch while we watched the veterans parade! It was a hit!! Everyone raved over it! I rimmed the glasses with cinnamon sugar!!! Mmmm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was a bit strong for me, and I like strong drinks. Still amazing. It is a holiday tradition for us! I might try another reviewer's suggestion to cut it with some kind of milk.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are delicious! Thanks for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use the Pumpkin flavored Vodka instead of the vanilla. And instead of the creme de cacao, I use Rumchata.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: i switched the Bailey's out and used RumChata. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very yummy! I tried it as written, but then also tried it with whipped cream-flavored vodka instead of the vanilla flavor. Both were yummy. I couldn't decide which one to use, so when I mixed up the batch I used half of both vodkas. Because it's such a simple recipe, it can be made ahead of time. Use a mason jar with measurement lines, and just fill to each line for however many servings you need. Make it the night before and store in the fridge. When you're ready to serve it, it's nice and cold. Just shake and stir. This is really convenient if you are bringing some drinks to a get-together.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: My boyfriend called this a "Pumpkin Pie-sicle." He used pumpkin vodka, whipped cream vodka, and Bailey's Irish cream (because that's what we had in our liquor cabinet). The he added a little 1/2 and 1/2, shook it up with ice and topped it off with a pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg. I prefer my drinks on the rocks so he poured everything into my glass. Delish!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made my own pumpkin liquor with rum, pumpkin, vanilla bean, spices (recipe from the net). It makes for a strong pumpkin martini! Very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed recipe, but it was bland and disappointing. Made another batch of six servings with half cup Kahlua to half cup Baileys, two cup pumpkin liqueur, 6 pinches cinnamon, 1 cup vodka plus one extra shot vodka....much better this way. Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wayyyyyyy too strong, talk about your chest burning & I like my creamy martinis! That's the problem, it wasn't creamy. Definitely needs some cream/half & half & I would probably cut down the vanilla vodka. I only had Pinnacle Whipped on hand, not Stoli Vanilla.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy, but the true pumpkin spirits were shockingly expensive. I used a cream pumpkin version that less, but seemed more authentic than the Hiram Walker flavored liqueur.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice fall cocktail

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a drink for those that love sweet creamy drinks. Pumpkin? Well, not that I could detect. The pumpkin liqueur that I used lost any and all pumpkin flavor once the Irish cream was added. Still a good drink, but if you want a pumpkin flavor, I would omit the Irish cream.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: for an added delight...dip the glass rim in caramel and then into graham cracker crumbs, very nice

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing... I followed recipe with a few slight edits 1) 1 jigger each of the following: Bailey's Caramel Irish Cream, Stoli's Vanilla Vodka, Hiram Walker Pumpkin Spice Liquor, 2) shake with 1 cup of ice, strain into martini glass 3) then shake some cream in carton till frothy, spooned over top 4) add a little milk (so it's not too strong) 5) sprinkle top with a little cinnamon and nutmeg. And Enjoy! Just be careful, they taste so good, you may drink too many without knowing it. I think this will be a new Thanksgiving tradition!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great drink. Not too heavy at all. We used inexpensive brand liquors and the drink was very nice. My friend and I are wine enthusiast and seldom drink anything else. We will make this again and no changes needed. Happy belated Thanksgiving!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good! I added a shot of skim milk to thin it out a bit (and to save on calories/alcohol)...it was still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these for a Halloween party-they turned out great but I ended up eliminating the spices. My guests decided they did not want the cinnamon or nutmeg. I also found a pumpkin cream liquor at the liquor store.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: So much better than the other pumpkin drink I tried. This one was yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is delicious and was a big hit at our party! I decreased the amount of vodka a little, which let the creamy pumpkin flavor come through more. Yum!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh wow! This is a perfect combination of flavors...so tempting to over-indulge ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked the idea, but I ended up adding a bit of vanilla soy milk, to make it more creamy and not so strong...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit at a party I had with one slight change. At first it was thought to be too sweet so I reduced the amount of Bailey's by 1/2 and it was a huge hit! The nutmeg and cinnamon were a great addition!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Keep the pinch of nutmeg, but as an alternative to the pinch of cinnamon, I like to drop in a whole cinnamon stick, which allows for a stirred, not shaken, martini.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not care for this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mmmmm good! My son & I enjoyed these on Thanksgiving Eve. Just the right amount of sweetness without being cloying. Made exactly as stated. We have a new tradition!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Couldn't find pumpkin liquer, but I found gingerbread liquer from Hiram Walker at my local store. WOW - it is an awesome substitute! Love these and WILL still try to find the pumpkin. Looks great garnished with a cinnamon stick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely need pumpkin liquor. I didn't have any so just added pumpkin spice along with other spices. Just tasted like a chocolate martini with cinnamon.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really enjoy this martini in the fall and around the holidays. I usually add a little more vodka. I can't wait to try caramel Irish creme with this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: A friend brought this recipe, to a holiday gathering this past December! Outrageously delicious! We doubled the vodka, and used pumkin spice (which I'm guessing is sold mostly around Thanksgiving). Creamy goodness...yyuummmm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: I found the pumpkin spice liquor at my local liquor store a couple months back. I've tried a couple things, but none quite as good as this. I like my drinks stronger, so I upped the vodka just a bit. This is SO creamy and good. I love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Rum Runner
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a good recipe, although I did tweak it a bit. I cut the pineapple and orange juices down to 3/4 oz and added 3/4 oz pomegranate juice. I also added 1/2 oz fresh lime juice. This cocktail really benefits from it's addition. I was going to add a dash of grenadine, bit forgot. It was fine without it; the pomegranate juice added the right flavor, without too much sweetness, although the color of the drink probably would have been more attractive with it. I also didn't bother with the 151 rum, the other rums were enough for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Rum Runner
cocktail_reviews.Review: I absolutely love it. It was a challenge finding the blackberry liquor/brandy. Fantastic drink to share with your friends on a summer day. ❤️🍹

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Rum Runner
cocktail_reviews.Review: This, this is a faithful recipe. I'd take out some ice unless you wanna be drinking just water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Rum Runner
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, simple recipe for rum runners. I find that the banana liquor easily overpowers some of the other components, but it's easily corrected by adjusting amounts. Find what works for you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was good, but really sweet. We could each only drink one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: By itself this is an excellent drink.. but try adding coconut rum and you'll be blown away!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Soooo good! I could not taste the alcohol. It looks awesome with the blue curacao!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes, I would definitely make it again. There is no picture this time, because we drank it all up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used citron flavored vodka , lime and tonic water . Squeezed the kumquat garnish to enlighten the flavor before drink. Yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty sweet but very tasty! Satisfied my need for sunshine in the cold December weather!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: very pretty and VERY yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a big batch of this for our July 4th party and everybody loved it. Used homemade sour mix and half 7-up and half club soda. Not too strong, not too sweet!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is sooooo good!!! We made it for our Super Bowl party and it was a huge hit. I have a glass drink dispenser so we made a lot at one time. This is the measurements that we used: 1 1/2 cups citron vodka, 1 cup Blue Curacao, 3 cups Sour mix (which Sweet and Sour is the same thing) and about 3/4 of a 2 litter bottle of 7up, then we floated Lemon slices on the top (which is so cute because they turned blue as the night when on). We ended up filling the glass dispenser about three times cause everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow What a drink. Had it for the first time at TGIF. In fact I had three of them. Plan on buying the alcohol to make them at home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! FYI, if you don't have Blue Curacao you can use Triple Sec. I used food coloring to make it blue and used other colors as well. Fun!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had this at my daughter's and was a HUGE hit with everyone....delish!! She made it in a clear glass container with a spicket and everyone got to pour a glass over ice.....so good. Making it this Labor Day and will have it on the bar along with a lot of other good drinks......

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Triple sec instead of sour mix. Soda water instead of soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Addicting! I used half the amount of lemon-lime soda and added in half lemonade as well. This way, it actually is lemonade! I also garnished all of these with a lemon wedge and a cherry. The contrast in the colors is also electrifying!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: A tasty and pretty drink! I didn't put 12 ounces of lemon-lime soda in when I made these though - I just "topped off" each glass (with probably more like 4-5 ounces in each). I garnished with a slice of lemon and a raspberry. Made for an awesome-looking presentation!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Didnt have sour mix or citrus vodka.. So I used sweet and sour mix and passion fruit flavored vodka and it was still super yummy and not too sweet at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! This was SO good! It was dangerous too- soooo tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had this when my husband went out one night and this recipe tastes just like it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a very tasty drink, we use a 2 liter so that we can make multiple drinks and make it cheaper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum!!!! Everyone enjoyed on the 4th of July.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: eletric lemonade is a good drink for ppl who dont like the taste of alcohol. we like to use the small cans of 7up when making a drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink. Not too sweet and goes down smooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE THIS! This is a perfect drink for a hot summer eve, on the patio with friends!! Not to strong an alcohol taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Electric Lemonade
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! My wife who doesn't like the taste of alcohol loved this drink. We used Mrs T's Sour mix and Absolut Citron

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I gave this 5 stars because it had all the ingredients I already had on hand. I did cut back the tequila (Jose Cuervo Tradicional) to 1 1/4 cup. I used the slightly higher end orange liquor by DeKuyper 3/4 cup, Rose lime syrup because I wanted to get rid of it (will probably use agave nectar or simple syrup next time) and a three part mixture of freshly squeezed lime, lemon and orange juices 3/4 cup. Very, very good! For myself I could probably handle the full booze amount, but this is for a family gathering and double recipe with lesser booze amounts made two 750 ml bottles so perfect. Glad I found this recipe. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was the best margarita I have made at home. However, it tasted delicious, like not too much alcohol but the effects of one 16 oz glass with ice was pretty strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: More like juice is def needed, and I also added a 1/4 cup of simple syrup. Definitely sweetens it a bit more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Strong but delicious! A good blend and the fresh limes make a difference in drink quality. Will make again soon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best recipe ever!!!! 👍😁

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: It’s likely those that are complaining it tastes too strong of tequila are probably using cheap tequila (like Jose Cuervo) which will burn your throat and taste like lighter fluid going down. Good tequila should be 100% agave so if you see that on the bottle then you are good to go. Tequila only needs to be 51% agave to be called tequila so the cheap still will fill the rest of tequila with a “mixto” aka cheap alcohol, which is why you feel like garbage the next day after taking shots of Cuervo. You should be able to get a decent bottle for around $25-$30. The only thing I did different to this recipe was use Cointreau instead of Triple Sec and it tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make but very strong and good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I hear people say its strong. But I just made it for later to put in the fridge. I tasted a sample and its tastes perfect. I like mine just like this. And is all for me. Cant wait till later HAPPY CINCO DE MAYO

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this just as the recipe calls for and have since made several times. Super easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I had made my own simple syrup before finding this recipe, so replaced the sweetened lime juice with it. I had to adjust the lime juice amount a bit because of this. Next time I want to follow this recipe exactly!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: All five women that shared this pitcher of margaritas were very pleased. I course it's important to get good tequila! I hope to have an occasion to make these again soon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: The guests kept asking for refills, so that says it all! We split using Triple Sec and Cointreau - only change.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree with many of the reviewers about using only one cup of tequila (I made the half used bottle of tequila available for anyone who wanted to add a bit more tequila to their drink -- only one person did). With one cup tequila the drink was ...... perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Taste just like at the bar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was the hit of the party!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!! For those who didn't know, the sweetened lime juice is by Rose's Find it in the liquor aisle with tonic and club soda. This margarita was tart and tasty. I made a half batch and used the full cup of tequila. Perfect!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe to make several margaritas for a Taste of Mexico fod event for over 100 people. The pitchers were empty within 1 hour and people praised them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good for margaritas on the rocks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So strong but so good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great for parties, but a bit on the strong side! Use good quality tequila or you're gonna be in for a headache... After cutting back on the tequila and using crushed ice this was pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I did tweak it a little bit and used 2 cups of sweet and sour and one squeezed lime instead of the lime juice. They were a huge hit :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
