cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a basic margarita recipe and is very good. Using high quality triple sec (such as cointreau) will make it alot better. Anyone who says it is too strong is likely using cheap tequila! (Such as Jose Cuervo)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Use only 1 cup of tequila! Yikes, I can't imagine them with 2! So good and easy to make! I am always an advocate for fresh squeezed limes, but I couldn't bring myself to pay $.89 a lime when I would need 20! So I used lime juice in a bottle and they still tasted SO much better than the bottled margarita mix! I will definitely use this recipe again and make sure to use fresh lime juice!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit too strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Besides making Pina Coladas last night/this morning for my GF's b-day party, I made margaritas using this recipe..... The first batch I made, I did use the 2 cups of tequila and it was strong!!!! Too strong!!! From there on out, I only used one cup and it was still pretty strong using that. All in all, they were good. My guest called it top restaurant quality strength margaritas. I had to give only 4 stars because I have no idea why the recipe calls for 2 cups of tequila when it only needs one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and everybody loved them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quite good, but fairly strong margarita. I put the mix in the blender & added a quart of frozen strawberries and a cup of ice & it was a great addition and calmed it down a bit. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well named. They make a pitcher, and they're perfect. This is a great way to serve margaritas without manning the blender all night. The fresh lime juice gives them the right balance of flavors to taste authentic and fresh. I will use this recipe a lot! UPDATE: I make simple syrup (1 part water to one part sugar, heated until combined, then cooled) instead of "sweetened lime juice", because I don't really know what that is!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum. I may add some cointreau next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really needed an idea of where to start with the measuring proration for a pitcher. This is a good base, but was a little strong for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good I've made these a few times. everyone loves them

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nursing a serious hangover the following morning, my wife made me promise to never make this again. Needless to say, she thoroughly enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe, and always a hit for parties. I sub Cointreau for Triple Sec and raspberries for cherries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as is written was great. I loved the club soda addition.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes. Yep. This is it. Forever in my recipe box. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’ve been using this recipe for years. So long it’s become my recipe I’m known for. It’s delicious. I make it just like the recipe less carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The bomb!!! Made 1:1 simple syrup instead of sugar & doubled recipe. Used spanish red wine & brandy, plus triple sec. Letting sit overnight but already incredible.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this sangria. Not sure how some say it’s the worst they ever had when everyone else gives it 5 stars. Highly recommended.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this recipe for years. Everyone loves it and it is heavily requested by family and friends. I make it as stated except I leave out the Maraschinos and use a $10-$12 bottle of Spanish Riojo wine and cut with lime La croix before serving for those that want less alcohol. I always make a double batch and it is easily gone. As others have mentioned it is very important to give it time to marinate. If you try to serve it right away you will be disappointed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec and apple brandy for the brandy only because those are what I had on hand. I also threw in mango, strawberries, blueberries, and pineapple in addition to the citrus. Excellent recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: ***I added ginger ale in place of carbonated water*** Very good red sangria. Not too sweet, not too dry. It was a big hit at a party I had, everyone complimented it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. I find myself making this for every holiday get together and people love it. I use goslings ginger beer and it is the perfect addition of a spicy kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a party favorite!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria hands down

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time making sangria and it was amazing! I didn’t add sugar or carbonated water! It was PERFECT!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: fantastic just the way it is. Added strawberries and blueberries in addition to the apples and oranges. make sure you give this recipe time to sit in the fridge, makes all the difference in the world in taste

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I lived in Spain for a while and this brings me back to those sunny evenings when the sun sets at 10pm with the first sip. My girlfriend, from Cadiz, swears the recipe was stolen from her familia.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I substituted fresh cherries for maraschinos and blood oranges for naval oranges. I also added fresh blackberries. I omitted white sugar, delicious without extra sugar!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe a hundred times over the past decade!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great Sangria. I did use 7-UP instead of the carbonated water. Everyone at the party really enjoyed. Will definitely make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: BEST Sangria EVER!!! I made this for Easter, and everyone raved about it! Many glasses were served (I made a double batch). One thing... Definitely serve on the rocks bc it packs a punch!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG! This recipe is IT! Even my friends from Spain and Portugal loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wish I was better at making cocktails. Honestly, I'm pretty terrible. This recipe makes it look like I have a little bit of skill. I used carbonated lime water. It was pretty good. Glad to say I can make at least one good drink. I will definitely serve this when I can have people over again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best sangria I’ve ever had. After finishing the first round, my guests all requested more. I will have to double the recipe next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make this at least a day before. This was just okay since I made it the morning of for a brunch day with my friends. There was about half leftover which I left in the fridge overnight and busted it out the next morning. It tasted much better after sitting in the fridge overnight. My husband didn’t like the brandy but it wouldn’t be sangria without that.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved the recipe! Did not use the optional carbonated water, and used only 1/8 cup of sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec and served some with a diet peach soda and some without for those who don’t like it as sweet. It’s smooth and goes does easy. A hit with all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go to recipe for sangria for many years. I add the sugar and skip the carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We're having a Derby party this weekend and Sangrias are requested. We wanted to do a trial run of this recipe and OMG it was delicious. We used ginger ale in place of carbonated water and peach mango v8 splash instead of orange juice because thats what we had. Sliced oranges, lemons, and fresh pineapples. The wine we used was Oliver Sweet Red. Can't wait for the weekend to make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is an enjoyable Sangria. I did feel there was a bit too much lemon for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this twice. The first time I made it exactly as the recipe reads. It was great but I felt like it wasn’t sweet enough. Perhaps my oranges weren’t ripe enough? The second time I made a double batch and added apples. It was AMAZING. And, it’s potent. It definitely sneaks up on you as you’re drinking it! You were warned.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have prepared thus sangria recipe multiple times and it is a hit every time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used blackberry brandy and lots of fruit. I don’t like it super sweet so I didn’t add sugar. Absolutely delicious. Will make over and over!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mom loved it in mother’s day

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely will make again. Only changes I made: omitted simple syrup and used Cointreau instead of Triple Sec.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My favorite recipe! This pic if before I added fruit. I love that you can add and remove to your own liking!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: we love sangria and this recipe easy and possibly the best we've made at home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love the flavor of this! I've served this at many parties and always get compliments!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don’t like wine. Made merely palatable by most sangrias I have had. It all tastes like rotten grapes. But my sister in-law gave me this bottle of red wine that sat unused for over a year. But during the social isolation period of 2020, I figured what the $&@? I will make some sangria. So I had to use what I had in the house. Bourbon in place of brandy, lemonade mix (in a cup of water, used 1/3 c in recipe) in place of frozen concentrate, and no soda water which I always thought watered it down anyway. Results.... amazing! A use of wine I can get behind. I added a tablespoon of sugar dissolved in a cup of the mix the next day, to break up the tartness from the lemon. If you prefer a sweeter sangria you will want to add some sweeter elements, this is bold, reminiscent of port.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: wonderful, made a few tweaks, now I make this all the time by request

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe as-is! I used Riunite Lambrusco wine and it was a hit! The second time I added half of a Fuji apple and a half cup or so of blackberries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty and worth the time

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have been making this recipe for years now and every time I serve it - I get requests for the recipe! THE GREATEST SANGRIA RECIPE!!!! Make sure to let it sit overnight for the flavors to meld and save some fruit slices for a garnish. SO GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Every time I make this I get requests for the recipe! It is so easy to make and so delicious to drink! Be sure the give the fruit 24 hours to marinate. The flavors need that much time to meld.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tripled the recipe and served it over New Year's Eve. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this sangria several times now but keep forgetting to review it. It is AMAZING!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is always a hit! I omit the sugar and use ginger ale instead of water. I also add cherry juice from the maraschino cherries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this so many times! It is always the best at any party! I am always asked for this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The frozen lemonade concentrate makes it. I didn’t use the lemon juice or carbonated water. I got so many compliments. Will make a gain.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was a hit at our holiday party! I made it 24 hours in advance, substituted cranberries for the pomegranates and used club soda instead of the ginger ale to lessen the sweetness. A triple recipe filled my 1 1/2 gal. dispenser and it disappeared quickly. This recipe is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this yesterday. Was soooo good. Used blackberry brandy and Fresca soda. All I had. Thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i have been making this Sangria for my family holiday gatherings for more than 10 years. i like to make it a day or 2 ahead of time to give the flavors time to settle. I use Grand Manier instead of plain triple sec, and use a frozen berry mix instead of the citrus slices. I find the orange juice and the frozen lemonade is enough citrus for me. I hope you love this as much as my family does!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was so good - one of the best Sangrias I have had. I didn’t use orange juice, but just orange juice concentrate, and I didn’t add extra sugar. Would recommend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good sangria....terrible hangovers tho

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great! I love this app! Only used 2 tbs of sugar and plain seltzer at serving. Also added a big peach. It sat over night. Delicious! The peach was amazing after soaking it all up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is deadly good. made as is, everyone raved about it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed this recipe exactly and it came out perfectly. My friends and I like a good sangria and this one got rave reviews! It's a keeper and I will make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don’t drink but I made it for a dinner with friends. It was a hit! I followed the recipe as stated but I did add 7-up instead of water. Very easy to make. I would certainly make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome work. Better than any sangria I've tried from restaurants. I made it with fresca, instead of club soda and It's a super hit. Also that overnight portion of the instructions is very very important.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe never seems to disappoint, even though I tend to change it up each time. I always leave out the sugar, find the freshest berries and citrus , sometimes change out or halve the lemonade with strawberry lemonade or mango lemonade and a floater of gingerale, ginger beer or splash of sparking wine. Absolute crowd fave at every party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the best sangria I have ever made (or had)! I made a double recipe for a day on the boat, and it was a hit with everyone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We cut amount of sugar to half and used Maker's Mark

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe - and tweak it to my own personal tastes - using peach brandy and peach schnapps (instead of triple sec). It has never failed me and my guests love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! I adjusted the recipe only to fit what I had on hand but this was so great I'm keeping my edits. Frozen lime juice instead of frozen lemonade Gingerale instead of carbonated Omit sugar entirely

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, Better without added sugar IMHO.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made it without the sugar and carbonated water and we loved it. The triple sec made it sweet enough.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We both agreed it was too acidic. I think it was too much OJ. We did not add sugar, but that would have made it too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amaaaaazing!!! I cut the sugar in half and used a Cab for the win. Filled glasses half with the sangria and half with Lemon flavored seltzer. Everyone who tastes this raves about it! Definitely a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! Will definitely be my “go to” recipe for sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love that this recipe isn't too sweet! We left out about half of the sugar, and each person added soda (or not) to taste. Even mis-reading the proportions and adding a little too much lemon juice didn't kill it - we just adjusted the other ingredients until it tasted good to us. YUM! This will definitely become a motorhoming staple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this on 5 or 6 occasions and I've been told every time that it's the best sangria they've ever had... I LOVE it and yes, it is that good... I follow the recipe exactly... I use inexpensive red blend wines, doesn't matter what kind, they all come out great... I don't add the white sugar, you don't need to... and I use a single serve bottle of 7UP (instead of carbonated water) for the carbonation and sweetness and I add it right before serving... I also cut up all kinds of fruits to add, not just the orange, lemon, & lime as the recipe lists... I use apples, strawberries, peaches, etc... Again, it doesn't really matter... this recipe allows you the freedom to play around without screwing it up AT ALL... I will say making it the night before does seem to make a difference to the complexity of the flavors... But I've also made it and served it 15 minutes later because someone asked me to make 'that awesome sangria' and it's still fantastic!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely making again! Though I may use less rinds from the citrus, that flavour almost overpowered mine when I left it over night. Everyone loved it though! And it sure packed a punch from just one glass we were all feeling it quick. Deliciously dangerous haha!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent sangria recipe! I made it as listed, and chose the option to not use the sugar, and used ginger ale instead of club soda. The brandy I chose was black cherry brandy. Threw some frozen strawberries in too. Made it the day before (added the ginger ale just before serving). It was delicious... and dangerous! LOL! This stuff tastes like punch but packs quite a punch! I'll definitely make this again. Next time, I'll cut the lemons, limes, and oranges into smaller pieces... while they looked pretty in rounds, they made it difficult to put some fruit in to each person's glass, and the smaller fruit was stuck at the bottom of the pitcher. By cutting them smaller it will be easier to use a slotted spoon to put some fruit in each person's glass before/after pouring.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We did not add any sugar, and used seltzer and ginger ale for fizz!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Been making this for a couple of years after finding the recipe on this site. It is really a great recipe and friends and family always seem to enjoy it. I always warn those that don't drink very often to be careful, because it can pack a wallop! We mix it with club soda, ginger ale or Sprite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this sangria recipe on three separate occasions. Most recently, I made FIVE liters for a yacht party. The ladies smashed the first two liters before the boat pulled anchor and headed out to sea! I was stunned! Next time, I will double the batch. This is a very flavorful sangria. Do not skip any ingredients. It will not disappoint.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times and have recommended it to others to make (even some random guy at Aldi this morning). Always a hit! Came back to the recipe today to try a white wine version!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used pomegranate juice instead of red wine, an extra lemon instead of frozen lemonade, I froze Some raspberries and blackberries to add at the end and used sprite instead of club soda. Everyone loved it! Some folks added Prosecco to their drinks too, so I guess that means I could Have made it more fizzy? I used Rum instead of brandy because that is all I had At home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hands down, the BEST Sangria EVERRRRR. It has become a staple at my office parties!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and very strong! I didn't have frozen lemonade concentrate and left that out. I added fresh apple and blackberries. I used 2 bottles of semi-sweet red and 1 bottle sweet red wine (nothing fancy!) and halved the sugar. I let this sit overnight and added 2 cups of carbonated water (used my Soda Stream) in the morning. I tripled the recipe for approx. 15 people and this was a huge HIT. It was gone only halfway through the party and people were asking me to make more! The flavors and fruit come together beautifully in a rich, deep red color. I was not expecting this to be so strong though, you can't really taste how strong it is. Definitely a creeper! I think I could easily make this using half the triple sec and brandy and still have it taste delicious. I plan on adding more fresh fruit next time around. Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious combinations! Made it for a party and it was a hit. Definitely recommend making it a day or two earlier so fruit can absorb the juice. The club soda makes it a spritzer lighter version so some folks didn’t use it. After cutting the fruit I sprinkled it with sugar and let it soak a few hours then I made the sangria and poured it all in a large pitcher. Yummm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I left out the sugar and used the optional club soda. It was still plenty sweet enough, very fruity and delicious. I gave the citrus slices a little squeeze to extract some of the juice into the sangria before dropping them in. So good, this is my go-to sangria recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't drink, but have made this 4-5 times over the last year. There is never a drop left and people request it every single time we have a party. I don't use carbonated water and I add the fruit a few hours ahead (not overnight). It is a hostess' delight to see people enjoying this drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I skipped the frozen lemonade, added more lemon juice & swapped the cherries out for blueberries. It was a big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't know what it is about this recipe that I am not comprehending but every time I try to make this recipe I do not like it at all. I turn out disappointed each time I try to replicate this recipe. The ingredients sound about right but flavor wise, it's not working for me. If you really enjoy your sangrias, or are a bartender like me, you might want to pass on this one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too much citrus for my taste! I suppose I could've added the optional sugar and ginger ale, but I'd much rather use naturally sweeter fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is delicious!. Every bit as good as what we had in Spain. I cut the fruit rings in quarters and made the mix the night before as suggested. The ginger ale added a subtle taste and a little fiz when added just before serving. The fruits were sweetened over night and we ate them, even the lemons slices, too, after we tossed back the drinks. Easy to make and impressive when served in fancy glasses. This is a fun drink to serve with tapas or your favorite appetizers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the first time a couple of years ago for a family Thanksgiving. Now my sisters and friends ask me to bring it to every holiday and gathering. Huge hit. It does have to sit overnight to meld properly....and I add sparkling water or ginger ale before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! I made it without the sugar or club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and easy to make. A real crowd pleaser! I skip the carbonated add-ins and use non-citrus fruits. These get eaten with gusto!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Deeeelish! It was a party favorite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: 2 c soupe de sucre et ginger ale au lieu

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this Sangria! I didn't have lemonade so I used pineapple juice instead and it was delicious! Will definitely make this again. Only reason this is getting 4 out of five is that the recipe did not say to make a simple syrup with the sugar, which I did and it blended perfectly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: But you have to add the club soda. That’s not optional, as the recipe says. With the club soda, it’s good. Without the club soda, it’s extremely tart.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was asked to make Sangria for a friend's party. I used this recipe. Being a non-drinker, I didn't know what to expect, but it was really good! The party guests and the host enjoyed it as well. I'll be making it again over the holiday season, and passing this recipe along.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Party Favorite!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this many times....a definite favorite. IF you have any leftover, remove the citrus or it gets too tart, it'll keep just fine. DELICIOUS!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I loved it. Guests loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: People are still raving about this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic! (One minor change, I doubled the OJ. )My husband, who isn't a big wine drinker, completely enjoyed this. I've forwarded the recipe to family and friends and they enjoy it too. Thanks for posting!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this several times. No additions or substitutions. I just don’t add the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria recipe. I do not put sugar in mine. Big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe to alter to your liking

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first time making sangria, although I've had it many times before. It was delicious! I made it for our Labor Day cookout, and it was a huge hit. In reading through the reviews before making it, I noticed a lot of people mentioned to omit the sugar and to use fresh-squeezed lemon juice if possible. I did both, and also added blackberries in addition to the citrus fruit and cherries. This will definitely be my new go-to for get-togethers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my sangria go to recipe I have made this several times with great success, EVERYONE LOVES IT!!! I use minute-maid frozen lemonade and gingerale instead of the carbonated water I make simple syrup instead of adding pure sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times now and it is fantastic! The first time I made exactly as written. I've since varied a few things for my taste. I use a fruit brandy -- raspberry or blackberry -- and use 3/4 cup of it. I put all of the liquids in over the fruit then use a wooden spoon to crush the fruit a bit. I mix by the glass with about 50% ginger ale in each glass. So delicious and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: No cherries, heavier on the brandy, ginger ale instead of carbonated water...this is a very tasty recipe. Oh, and I always use Trader Joe's 2 Buck Chuck Cab Sauv, works great for this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made it with no sugar no soda. It was not my favourite option to make because of all the very specific liquor to buy but it didn’t not disappoint!!!! It was amazing and we will make it and surely use up all our ingredients! Highly recommend. And so easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: All my quest loved it. I will surely make it again! The best sangria ever!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy! Everyone at the party loved it and i had to sneak into the kitchen to make more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My large glass serving pitcher was the perfect size for the single recipe, including the carbonated water (which is essential for authenticity,) fruit, and a top-off with ice. For the carbonated water, I used Topo Chico, a locally popular sparkling mineral water of Mexican origin. Since I was making enough for a big party, using a 3 gallon glass vessel, I made the "base" for this sangria, multiplying the recipe x3, to generously serve 25 guests. The "base" includes ALL ingredients EXCEPT the carbonated water, i.e. Topo Chico. To maximally maintain carbonation for each refill of the pitcher, I ladled one-third of the liquid "base" mixture (approximately 5 cups) into the pitcher, adding the slices of lime/lemon/orange, and 2 cups Topo Chico. To serve or refill each guest, a beverage wineglass was half-filled with ice. I did not garnish with maraschino cherries as I do NOT use these food aberrations. This beverage was a party hit, with many compliments and no left-overs.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: we drink it all the time in BAJA very tasty

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at the wedding shower I recently had! I made two double batches and people were so desperate for more that I added another bottle of wine toward the end of the night just to extend it. I used peach flavored brandy and added a lot of different fruit: apples, pears, fresh cherries (I do not like maraschino cherries). I also provided Buffalo Rock Southern Spice ginger ale as the topper, which was a huge success!! I will definitely be making this again for any party I have!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Big hit at the summer 4th of July BBQ. Be careful it sneaks up on you. Lol. Perfect recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I used a bottled sparkling lemonaide instead of the club soda....great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Always a hit...my go-to sangria. Perfect as it but it's versatile as a base too. I often use a 1/2 or 2/3 can of frozen lemonade mix instead of adding the lemon juice. I have also added canned or jarred fruit with the juice, instead of the sliced fruit...depends what I have on hand. I've tossed in peaches, apples, pears....it all tastes good. My favorite brandy for this is blackberry brandy. I don't like carbonated sangria so I always leave it out. I think it tastes better the next day so make it in advance if you can.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! I used Pinot Noir and I did not add the sugar, it was perfect. Freshly squeezed lemon juice is the way to go and make sure to make it the day before.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My new favorite summer drink! I made the recipe as written and it is divine!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So great for a block party! Def let it sit overnight. I added diet white soda to lighten it up because I don’t like club soda and didn’t want the ginger ale. Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this delious recipe for at least 8 years and everyone loves it. Instead of adding carbonated water I add champagne.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Substituted gran mariner for triple sec, substituted lemon juice for the lemonade concentrate, cut the sugar in half. The result was a smooth, fruit forward, refreshing blend — will be making all summer long

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't just the sugar. It was perfectly refreshing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Everyone wanted the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Everyone wanted the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummmmm!!!I made this for a party and everybody loved it!! It doesn't need all of the ingredients. I didn't add the sugar, orange juice, lemon juice, or club soda. I did add some fresh berries instead of the cherries also. I made 5 batches and there wasn't a drop left!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved the finished product but as with my favorite recipes on this site, I relied on constructure feedback from other reviewers! I skipped the sugar and lemonade concentrate. I replaced the club soda with ginger ale. It was absolutely delicious! I will definitely revisit this recipe in the future.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this a few times and made various substitutions. The most important thing is to make it ahead so the flavors have time to blend together! Otherwise you really can't go wrong with this - its delicious. But be careful with it - everyone always wants more but they might be cursing you the next morning! :D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a delicious recipe! I’m usually a dry wine drinker, but I love an occasional Sangria on a hot day. My husband is not a wine drinker, but I made this for our cook out and it was a major hit! I omitted the sugar because I don’t need it very sweet - the triple sec is sweet enough - and I used regular brandy. Be careful, it’s a stronger concoction than you think!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Used Sprite and no sugar. Had to make a second batch the next day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I will definitely make again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's not even in the fridge to sit overnight and it's delicious. I agree with another reviewer that I think the booze u choose is key. Can't wait to drink it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's not even in the fridge to sit overnight and it's delicious. I agree with another reviewer that I think the booze u choose is key. Can't wait to drink it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really is an excellent traditional sangria recipe! Easy and absolutely delicious! Thanks for sharing your recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing and was a total hit at the party! I did not use any sugar and added cut up apple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Triple sec sold out so used Disarono instead & Yum Yum Yum! Absolute HIT of the party & will b made again & again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this twice and its awesome. Prepared it exactly but used zinfandel and extra brandy which turned out good. Definitely let it set all night in fridge but also definitely take out the fruit because their flavor overpowers the drink if left in more than one night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a couple adjustments I peeled the limes in efforts of preventing the bitter oils from infusing since I was making it the day before- and I think it did the trick, several compliments were made about how it didn’t have a bitter taste like their recipe has. (YAY!) 2) we didn’t have a regular brandy so I used Tuaca instead since it is made with Brandy, 3) I used a cheap red blend wine ($4.97/bottle), 4) totally forgot to get the cherries, but it didn’t affect the taste apparently! I made a gallon and took it down to the docks for our Cinco de Mayo potluck and it was a hit! I should have made 3 Gallons! This is my go-to recipe now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made six batches of this for a party and it was a hit! Had about 15 guests and it was gone by midnight! Could have made even more! Followed the recipe almost to a t except I added a frozen tropical fruit mix and used 1 cylinder of frozen pineapple juice. I did not and would not recommend adding the optional cups of white sugar unless you want to give your guests an even more excruciating headache in the morning. Trust me it’s sweet enough. I also used pretty much the cheapest wine and liquor I could find and it was still great so don’t worry if you’re on a budget. Overall fantastic recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We loved this! Absolutely wonderful flavour. I let it sit overnight as other reviewers recommended, and added a bit less sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this during the Holidays and it was a complete hit. I did have to make some modifications as I did not want to run to the story but basically I just subbed rum for the brandy and ginger ale for the sparkling water. It was amazing and everyone loved it. I plan to make it for an upcoming summer event (and will at least double the batch!). Thank you for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A.Mazeing!!! Excellent recipe! I used cherry brandy and a Cabernet Savignon. I also used club soda and added it with the rest of the ingredients. For sure my favorite sangria recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria. EVERYONE loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had some serious sangria drinkers over for the eagles super bowl win, and they all loved it. Made a double batch, stayed true to the recipe. Easy and basic don't add the club soda it doesn't need it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this recipe for about 2 years. Everyone loves it and insists that I bring it to every gathering. I attempted a version with rum and was quickly told to stick to the brandy version. I cheat a bit and add the Costco brand sangria with sweet red wine since I prefer a sweeter version. I started with the original recipe and have tweaked it over the years with different flavored brandy i.e. peach, apricot, cherry, blackberry, you get the point. It’s much better when you let it sit overnight. It’s absolutely delicious and will sneak up on you if you’re not careful.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Like the other reviews, I added a splash of ginger ale right before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria recipe ever. It's almost impossible to mess up. I get requests for this all the time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I use ginger ale instead and skip the sugar. Love this recipe. It's just like I remember it tasting in Spain.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i drink a lot of sangria and this recipe is great!! if you want a stronger wine tasting sangria, don't use Ginger ale or 7 up or any carbonated drinks. it's fine in its own. i made a huge batch for a party. ONE RECOMMENDATION.. before letting this sit overnight, take out the lime and lemons after a couple of hours of making this because the rinds will eventually make it have a not so pleasant bitter taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'd been using a Bobbie Flay sangria recipe for years which was usually a hit, but I wanted to try something new for my cousin's 18th annual Oktoberfest party this past weekend in PA. I checked out this recipe and decided to make it... I quadrupled the recipe to make 24 servings (2 (12-serving) batches). I followed the recipe closely MINUS the sugar and cherries. I also omitted the club soda/ginger ale. I used Trader Joe's fresh-squeezed OJ. I also hand-squeezed 2 lemons and 2 limes per 12-serving batch; I do this because I find when you add lemons and limes sliced up, the rinds make the sangria bitter. I added fresh apples and oranges but I removed the orange rinds (same reason as mentioned above), as well as blueberries. Used Spanish table wine, triple sec and brandy, let the whole thing refrigerate for 2 days. Needless to say, every time I walked passed the bar, I watched the sangria container go down, down, down. People RAVED and said, "Next year, you need to make more!" A huge hit! I loved the addition of the lemonade concentrate. I used 1 can per 12-serving batch. There's enough sugar in that - you don't need to add more. YUM! I WILL be making this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it. It is very good as is, but I prefer to sub half the triple sec for a higher end orange brandy (Patron Citronge) and use fresh or frozen cherries imstead of maraschino. I use a $12 red blend or a spanish red.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit strong

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it for a family party and people really enjoyed it. I recommend to leave the sangría overnight without the limes, oranges and lemons. An hour or two before serving, the citrus fruit can be added.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Please don't use Two Buck Chuck. True, you don't need to break the bank with the choice of wine but it is the star of the recipe and needs to be decent. Try a Garnacha from Spain. Tres Picos is inexpensive and a good choice. Excellent sangria that we all enjoyed drinking.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled this recipe for a party and I'm glad I did because everyone loved it! Not everyone wanted the club soda so I let people who wanted it add a little to their own glass. Would definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING sangria! I skip the cherries and use Cran-Raspberry LaCroix instead of carbonated water. Definitely let it sit for a good 24 hours prior to serving and add the bubbly water right before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make this for every event we have and get request ALL THE TIME to make a batch..people, men, that dont care much for wine, love it! Changes.. no sugar, no cherries, no ginger ale or carbonated water, no lemonade or limeade, just a dash of lemon juice, i mix regular brandy and apricot brandy, extra brandy! Use any kind of fruit i have available. Put in the freezer at least 24 hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Always the hit of the party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just downright yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made with limeade concentrate and no sugar and it was delicious and plenty sweet. Served over ice in a large stemmed glass with a float of lemon. Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Huge hit. Made this for a get together and every last bit gone. I made 2 small alterations. No sugar, but used 7up instead of plain soda water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it with oranges, lemons, limes, apples, peaches and used an orange and pineapple juice instead. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Used Perrier sparkling water (lime flavor) to add the fizz at serving. Also did not have lemonade concentrate, so I added about 1/4 cup more lemon juice. Dry and not too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I live in McAllen, and this recipe has been a hit with guests this summer...to the point I make a batch almost every weekend, (guest or no). I stick to the exact recipe, yet, I've added small chunks of apple and I use an inexpensive pinot for my wine that pairs extremely with the fruit. Next day, I take the dregs, pop them in the Bullitt and I got a fruit smoothy with a bang.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time making sangria. It was very time consuming to make. Made it for a backyard wedding reception and nobody would drink it. Was way too strong. Followed the directions and even tried to add ginger ale as others here suggested. Also, I ended up extremely ill. I'm not sure if it was the food at the reception or maybe the fruit wasn't washed good enough. But, I definitely had food poisoning. I personally do not recommend this recipe. I was a bit surprised after all the good reviews.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this dozens of times, and it is terrific. A lot of ingredients make it a little complicated, but it is always well received. Don't use cheap red wine though....use the good stuff. I use Meomi.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Forgot the triple sec and it still tasted good. It was still strong enough for me. Took it to an event and everyone raved about it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I put 3/4 of recommended brandy in, and didn't add any sparkling water (I didn't want it diluted). Cutting the rinds off the circles seemed good, and if the circles are cut into bite size pieces then you can serve by ladelling (ladeling?) out the sangria + fruit. Definitely recommend making the day before, for taste and then it gets cold in icebox. But fine with ice cubes also. Probably not as many circles as recipe calls for, are needed. I used 1/2 as much sugar; adding the cherry juice may be good, too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: No changes. Will make it over and over again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed this recipe exactly as follows minus the cherries. After adding all the liquor I found that the brandy over powered it. Not sure if it would've been different if I let it sit overnight but I needed it for a party I was attending the same afternoon. My solution was simple, I added another bottle of red wine and it tasted perfect! I llove the full bodied taste of it and it's not sweet like other sangria you might order at a pub. I'm making it again for my bbq this weekend and I'll be adding two bottles of wine again. So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used a nice dry red wine - no sugar - and club soda. Was a huge hit. This is one you can count on!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing, and my guests loves it! Success...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome sangria!!! I used fresh pineapple and 1/4 cup of sugar instead of orange juice.... chopped up all my fruit and poured the brandy over it.. let it soak overnight in a big bowl.. then mixed everything together the next day! Fabulous! Definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy to make! Per other user reviews, omitted sugar and used ginger ale instead of carbonated water. Key ingredient is brandy, and must make it the night before! It was all gone super fast! Party pleaser for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria ever. My company begs me to make it. You cannot go wrong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good albeit on the sweeter side like, and at that I was quite stingy on the sugar. I think I will skip the sugar completely next time I make it. And Yes! The guests finished the generous batch I had prepared!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was ok but nothing spectacular... I don't like anything too sweet so I did not add the sugar and used club soda. I think it's better after sitting 24 hours and not just overnight to give the flavours of the fruit time to blend in with the alcohol, I'd say it's actually a **** star recipe if you give it the 24 hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted to right a real review; like actually following the recipe in its totality but I altered very minor things. For starters, I used peach brandy; I omitted the cherries: I added peaches and apples; as we speak the sangria is in the fridge so I haven't added the ginger ale (instead of the carbonated water like the recipe suggest) but it taste great without it! I think this recipe is a hit! I'm taking it to the beach today and I can't wait to share it with my friends! I think if you followed the recipe exactly it would be great as well. I really didn't alter much. I will be making this again(but not to often bc sangria is not cheap to make! Lol)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Unlike others who changed just about everything, I kept it the same. I did not add the optional sugar or add any carbonated beverages. I like sangria for what it is. No need to alter it. I used Campo Viejo Rioja. I bought El Presidente Brandy per the top review. I had little choice at my wine and spirits store for Triple Sec. But I doubled this, and I could see myself drinking all of it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is our signature "welcome to summer " recipe. I omit the sugar, no club soda or ginger ale, and use an inexpensive Spanish Tempranillo. Let it rest in the fridge at least one day before drinking. Yum, yum yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was excellent; don't add the sugar in. You definitely don't need it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this many times and it is wonderful. Easy to make and deliciously refreshing. It certainly helps blend the flavors if you can let it sit 24 to 48 hours. Have tried a couple variations such as adding a bit of St. Germaine, Grand Marnier, fresh rasberries, blackberries, strawberries, etc. Use the base and just play around with flavors you find enjoyable. It is the best sangria recipe I have found!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my staple summer boat drink. I always double the recipe and made a few changes... I use Apothtic red wine from Wal Mart. $9 a bottle. I have also used an inexpensive tempranillo that is really good as well. I omit the water and sugar and just add a can of regular sprite per making, so two cans when I double it. Do NOT leave out the brandy, it makes the recipe, and sometimes i add a little extra just for good measure. I also add a little splash of grenadine and some of the cherry juice from the marichino cherries. I don't always have time to let it chill overnight and usually just make it in the morning and chill for a couple of hours before serving. This is by far my favorite sangria recipe, and it's requested everywhere we go.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this drink recently for a birthday celebration and it was a BIG hit! I'm not a brandy fan so used rum instead and used ginger ale instead of club soda. Everyone loved it and can't wait for an opportunity to make it again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not have brandy so used my grey goose vodka. I used Gnarly Vine Red zinfandel for the dry red wine and I did add the 1/4 cup sugar. I loved it!! This will definitely be my go to recipe for sangria. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My absolute favorite Sangria recipe I love love love this and make it exactly directed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is so deliciously refreshing and it'll get you tipsy!! It received so many compliments and it's perfect on a nice sunny day. I used ginger ale rather than club soda and I didn't add the sugar to my second batch, which was okay because the ginger ale still made it sweet. This is my new fab summer drink. Even thru non-wine drinkers loved it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Multiplied this recipe by five for a party we had. Used a cheaper Spanish Rioja wine and were a little heavy handed on the brandy. We used fresh squeezed juices and dialed back the sugar to about half what was called for. Next time we make it, we may try it without any sugar. Absolutely let this recipe sit in your fridge overnight and stir it every few hours to submerge the fruit that is on top. We tried it after making it and again the next day, and it was significantly better the next day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe can easily be adapted to the ingredients you have on hand. The first time I made this on the spur of the moment, and didn't have any of the citrus fruits, or the lemonade concentrate, or the orange juice. So I substituted Margarita mix for the lemonade, and fresh strawberries for the citrus fruit, and it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super tasty sangria...the few modifications I made was that I used limeade concentrate vice frozen lemonade, 1 cup of light lemonade instead of orange juice, and 1/2 ounce of cherry juice. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was great for my moms wedding. Forgot frozen lemonade nobody knew. Lol.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely better the next day! It was a hit with everyone. I don't typically like sangria but this one is great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party with lots of international people from Spain and all over the world - I made 3 batches and it was all gone in about 1hr. I left out the cherries, used less sugar and used the juice from fruit instead of concentrate and let it soak overnight. Just before serving, I added lemon-lime and blood orange Italian soda to it to give it a light fizz. The trick is adding cinnamon sticks to it (learned that in Spain). Awesome!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria - I make it with 7-up and everyone raves about it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Huge hit with my family. I will definitely make this again. Rather than add sugar I added the jar of maraschino cherries, juice and all. The sugar in the cherries was just perfect and no additional sugar was needed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastica!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A hit every single time. I use cheap Cabernet, cheap brandy, orange liqueur sometimes instead of triple sec. I like to mix up the fruits. I have found that I don't like to add the sugar until after it's sat for a day because sometimes it gets too sweet. Whatever I use, this sangria always disappears at parties.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria was delicious! I elected not to use a sweetener.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super delicious! Tripled the recipe for dinner party. I chose not to put the sugar in and added a small amount of 7up to each class when serving (although it was also good without it)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is wonderful! I love sangria but never made it before. My fiancé and I loved it. He even said it was the best sangria he'd ever had. We added strawberries and an apple so it wasn't too citrusy. A hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was very good as per the recipe. We could have used a sweeter version so next time I will eliminate the club soda and use ginger ale instead. IMPORTANT ~ letting it set overnight or about 8 hours really makes a difference! Mix ingredients the night before except for club soda/ginger ale. Add club soda or ginger ale just before serving. YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe with two minor revisions. I don't eat high fructose corn syrup so I swapped out the lemonade concentrate for Newman's All natural lemonade. I doubled the recipe and used about one quart of lemonade. I also reduced the regular sugar to two tablespoons. It got many compliments.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is now our go to beverage for get togethers. We add the optional sugar and Sprite but skip the cherry. Have made it four or five times and each time our guests plow through it quickly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a nice recipe. I made a double batch and it was all gone. Without sugar was plenty sweet with the fruit juices. I used 7up to top because that's what I had but anything would do - champagne, ginger ale... Ahead of time I prepared all the fixings for an extra half batch except for the wine so I could pack it and bring it with me so I could easily create the second batch during our family gathering and that was a good idea since the first batch disappeared so quickly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A winner EVERY TIME

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go to drink to make for gatherings. It's delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really is great sangria! Due to the addition of brandy and triple sec it is super strong in flavor and alcohol, be warned. Adding ginger ale makes it taste more like a traditional restaurant sangria. Great recipe and I will make this my go to for sangria in the future!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it for a Halloween bday party. I tripled the recipe and it was gone before the party ended. Big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this at least half a dozen times and every time it's hit, I always get asked for the recipe. I opt for ginger-ale instead of club soda per the author's suggestion for a sweeter sangria. Yum Yum for Sangria Sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a double batch to take to a pitch in. It was gone in no time. One of my personal favorites.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Brilliant recipe. Doubled it and it worked out fine. It can be a little strong for some people so I added Soda Water to their drink and they seemed quiet happy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this for every party and block party I have been to. I always get rave reviews on it. I leave out the lemonade concentrate (as I usually don't have access to that, and Sangria from Spain or Mexico wouldn't have it in anyway). We lived in Mexico and EVERYONE loved this. The key is making it in advance so that the flavors really meld. I always make it at least the morning of the day before I intend to serve it. You can make it earlier than that, just don't add the fruit pieces until 24-36 hours before. When we lived in Mexico, I used Rioja wine to make it (a cheapish one as you don't need high quality wine in this mixed drink). In the U.S., I have used Cabernet as I was unable to find Rioja. I usually have Sprite and club soda on hand for people to add to it themselves. Some people don't want it watered down at all and some people prefer sweeter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will definitely make this one again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whoa! This is great, much better than any sangria I've ordered in a restaurant. This is not a terribly sweet cocktail, which is what I prefer. I never use very expensive wines in this recipe (~$8 bottle), but I think the end result will depend on how sweet of a red wine you choose. This drink is STRONG. Definitely dilute with sparkling water as suggested. I'm a heavy wine drinker and I cannot handle more than 1-2 glasses of this at most. GREAT for summer dinner parties by the pool!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I tripled the recipe and used half ginger ale and half club soda. I used Spanish red wine Tempranillo. I don't think it needs all the sugar listed maybe half. I used a 3 gallon drink container and it was about 2/3's full. Perfect! Very forgiving and huge hit! Update: made as stated except but doubled it, used frozen pink lemonade (as that's what I had), didn't add the sugar or carbonated water. Let it sit overnight and then in morning added one can of sprite. It was perfect and everyone raved!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I forgot to get the frozen lemonade so I added ginger ale instead of the club soda to add some sweetness. No sugar. Used bag of frozen mixed fruits. I also used apple brandy. Definitely by far, the best sangria I have made this far. I still added the fruit the recipe suggests and went by all the recipe measurements.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used pear brandy., Did't use Triple Sec. Did use carbonated lime water. Sweet enough so didn't use sugar. Our guests loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a family cookout and thankfully made a double batch starting with a 1.5 liter of Merlot wine, and there was not a drop left! I did the exact recipe with 2 exceptions- I used two different brandies, one part regular brandy and one part cherry brandy (only because I thought I was going to be short on the regular brandy) and I didn't have Triple Sec, I had to use Cointreau (just another orange liqueur). It all fit in a really large pitcher that I have even doubling the fruit slices and the cherries you put in and I definitely made it the day before. Right before serving, I did add 1 can of cold diet ginger ale just to cut it a little bit (although it was great without it too because I had to try it!!) and also added frozen cherries as ice cubes in the glasses before pouring! A true winner! And was asked for the recipe over and over!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the first time I made Sangria and it turned out great! I added ginger ale and also added the sugar -- it was not too sweet; just perfect. Made a double batch using 2 bottles of red wine and doubled everything else. Put in mixed fresh fruit and it was so refreshing! Guests at my party all enjoyed it. Thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Made a couple of changes: Deleted the added sugar. Deleted the carbonated water. Made the recipe the night before, as instructed. Added 1 can of ginger ale right before serving!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous!!! Always a favorite!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Every time I make this I get requests for the recipe. I omit the sugar since it doesn't need it. I also use Ginger Ale instead of Club Soda. Last weekend I subbed white wine for red and think it's just as good. Best if you let it sit a day before you drink. Salud!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this recipe!!!! But not as is - made the following changes. I omitted the sugar and used Ginger Ale instead of the carbonated water. If you're going to let this sit overnight I suggest not using the citrus fruit. I had some leftover from a party in the fridge for a couple of days and it turned bitter. I'm making it again for a part and this time I'm going to try frozen mixed fruit/berries to add a little sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've had much better Sangria. Pretty much an Cactus Club (for example) has a Sangria way bettter than this. They also made significant mistake in the instructions, that is, they tell you add the club soda THEN they tell to to let it sit overnight to allow the Sangria to absorb the fruit. That's pretty dumb (for obvious reasons). NOTE: I did skip the sugar, now that I think of it, it would taste better if it was sweeter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this as a large batch for 20, and just changed a few things. I left out the maraschino cherries, added 3/4 cup of lemon vodka for an extra kick and used lemon lime soda instead of club soda. We let it sit over night and it was wonderful. We will definitely do thIs again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Other than omitting the club soda, I made it exactly as written. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! Everyone including my husband love it!! I have taken it for a girls weekend, Mothers Day party and this weekend a Retirement party. My husband and I actually make it just to relax on the back porch and watch the world go by in the evening!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this sangria. I make it in a large punch bowl and add frozen raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries, and sliced oranges. Freeze any left in a ziplock for the next day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I omitted the brandy and the extra sugar and it's pretty darn good without club soda or any extra fizzy drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time we added the specified sugar amount and it was way too sweet. Second time we left out the sugar and it was much better. It was a big hit at a friends pool party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good sangria! Not the best I've ever had, but certainly not the worst. I usually add blackberry or peach brandy to my sangria which gives it a great flavor. NOTE: Adding the orange, lime and/or lemon overnight will impart a bitter sour taste to your Sangria. Add the fruit right before serving! Enjoy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this for the 4th of July the last 5 years. I make 12 times the normal recipe and use white wine instead of red. People remember the sangria year after year.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Didn't have lemonade concentrate, so used fresh lemonade instead. Added 1 diced red delicious apple. Did not add sugar, but added 2/3 can diet Canada dry. Used blackberry brandy. Fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy, amazing, fantastic, absolutely fabulous magnanimous tasting drink!!! *Also added: Apple's, blood oranges, blueberries, peaches and lemons sliced in rounds.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Our favorite sangria. Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Leaving it for 12 to 24 hours is the key. Everything has to 'steep'. This is an excellent recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party today, and oh my gosh it was too sweet! The sangria I've had overseas wasn't liquid candy. Possibly a good recipe but it's going to need some major tinkering not to make me cringe next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Found this a bit tart even though I did put in the sugar as well as used the ginger ale. I made it first thing in the morning for the evening and I found that I tasted a bit of the rind flavor from the fruit which I do not like. I also prefer using fruit that can then be eaten (oranges and cherries being the only fruit you will eat from this). I like apples, berries etc.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made for a wedding shower. I thought making triple the recipe would last - it was gone very quickly, even though we offered several other drink options. Reading through the reviews, I opted for using 7-Up and left out the sugar and water. I added sliced strawberries. Definitely let it sit overnight, it really makes all the flavors come together.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I upped the serving size to 40 for a Memorial Day BBQ, and at that size, I realized it is almost *exactly* ONE of everything! There was no leftover alcohol to store for weeks in my cupboard or measuring cups to wash. Could not have been simpler! - ONE bottle of brandy (750mL) - ONE bottle of lemon juice (443mL, standard 15 oz.) - ONE can frozen lemonade concentrate (12oz.) [The exact adjustment would have been about 1.5 cans, but since I don't drink lemonade and didn't know what I would do with that last half can, I decided to just use one.] - ONE box of Merlot (5 L, 169oz.) [The exact adjustment called for 6.75 750mL bottles. I used a $14 box of Franzia, which comes out to just under 6.66 standard bottles of wine. Close enough.] - ONE bottle of triple sec (750ML) - ONE med. jar maraschino cherries (16oz.) - 2.25 cups OJ (18oz.) - 6 limes, 6 lemons, 6 oranges - Sugar to taste Except for the OJ, I didn't have to measure anything! Sorry for the mixing of metric and imperial measurements. I used whatever measure was most common for the item. **Also, since I made it the day of in a last minute rush, I heated up a bit of wine to help dissolve the sugar faster.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazingly good and worth the effort. Make up a double batch for your next summer party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm not a wine drinker but my friends are. I went with this recipe because of the positive reviews and this was a HUGE hit!! I followed the recipe to a T with 2 additions fresh cherries along with the marichino and I added New York black cherry seltzer with ginger ale and no sugar. I multiplied the recipe *4 and it was amazing. I tasted it when I put it together and the over night marinade is a must. The taste difference is night and day!! Follow the directions and you won't go wrong!! Thank you so much for the recipe! This is definite a recipe I'll keep doing. It would make my Spanish Grandma so happy if she was still here to enjoy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our monthly ladies night, and it was a hit. I doubled the recipe because I knew it wasn't going to be enough. I added strawberries,apples, and instead of club soda I used ginger ale. I used about 2 scoops of sugar and no lime. One of the ladies requested that I make it for the next ladies night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go-to sangria recipe. I love it. Not too sweet, not too citrusy. I have also made it with a dry white wine and it's just as good. A great summer drink - but potent!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Be prepared with extra batches, because you're going to need them. This is a GREAT recipe and a tasty drink that everyone loves

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would not make this again..needs more sugar, too many lemon stuff. It has lemon juice, lemonade concentrate, 2 lemons and lime, that was way too much. I let it sit over night and it was very tarty. I put club soda into it to see if it made a difference, it did not. I wasted a bottle of red wine. I would not be making this again. I will look somewhere for best sangria recipes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Made it for Mother's Day and it was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was awesome. I made it per directions. I did use cherry brandy because that is what I had on hand. We served it at a family dinner and everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made it for a party tomorrow. I tasted it and it's already delicious. I can't wait to try it! :-) I have a question: Does the recipe call for freshly squeezed lemon juice and freshly squeezed orange juice (or for already made orange juice like Tropicana?) THANKS FOR SHARING!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO good!! Best sangria I've made. I used half triple sec, half peach liqueur because I didn't check the cupboard before I started and didn't have enough triple sec Didn't matter...pitcher was empty in a flash and got the party off to a great start! Will definitely be a staple and all my summer gatherings.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Changes? I should have made two batches. I added the water later to sprizz it since we had two options: lemonade or water, for a sweeter or sourer taste. It was delicious! Definitely wait 24hrs before serving!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like it better without the sparkling water. And I didn't have triple sec so I used something called aromatic bitter that I found at the supermarket. Love sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was excellent. It was just the thing for our girls night! For seven of us I tripled the recipe and had plenty. For the most part I followed the recipe as is except I used spiced rum and peach schnapps instead of brandy and triple sec. It wasn't as potent to me. Just had a nice relaxed feeling all evening. I used ginger ale instead of club soda and sugar, used apples and oranges for the fruit. I served it over ice. My one regret is that i didn't let it set overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was absolutely delicious. I made this for the professional championship football game and all the guests, even the guys, loved it! I decided to make two separate batches. With the first (red sangria), I used merlot (you need a medium-bodied red wine), Christian Brothers brandy (cheap), and a Patron Orange Liqueur (you can find a cheaper one). For the second, I wanted to make a white sangria. With that, I used Reisling (instead of the red wine), Captain Morgan Spiced Rum (substitute for the brandy), and Peach Schapps (vs the orange liqueur). Per the recommendation of other reviewers, I omitted (or you can use half of) the sugar. I chilled in the refrigerator overnight BEFORE adding the fruit. I added the fruit a few hours before the guests would arrive (I added oranges, lemons, limes, grapes, strawberries, and apples). Again, absolutely delicious. I can't wait to have another event so I can try this one again. Don't hesitate to try this recipe (with my suggestions). Enjoy!!! P.S. If your containers are plastic and aren't stain-resistant, fruit will damage it if left in overnight (specifically oranges, lemons, and limes as they are acidic). Some plastic containers even discourage adding liquor above 7.5% for that same reason. I purchased glass, 2.5 gallon pitchers for this. Worth it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So delicious! I followed the recipe exactly, but replaced club soda with Ginger Ale and added strawberries and pears in addition to the fruits listed. It was a huge hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this 10 years ago for my husband's 40th birthday party, and the whole party loved it. My only problem was that it tasted so good, and I had too much of it, without realizing it packs a punch. I'm making it again for his 50th.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this all the time. I've been using this particular recipe for about 10 years. I'm guessing I've made it over 20 times in total. I only make a few changes and it always turns out amazing and gets the whole family real drunk. What I do: 1. I don't care if the wine is dry or sweet, I just buy the cheapest stuff I can find that isn't boxed. I taste it. If its really sweet, I cut pack a bit on the orange juice.
