If it isn't so sweet I keep the OJ the same. 2. Since the first batch, I NEVER add cherries (just kinda tasted weird and added their syrup to the recipe) or lemons/limes (too sour---I like to eat my fruit as I'm drinking the sangria)... 3. So I add more oranges and if I know it's all gonna be gone soon, I add apple slices (DO NOT add them if you aren't gonna be drinking it all the next day...cos the longer they are in there the slimier they get). 4.I also never add the sugar (it's sweet enough) or carbonated water (detracts from the taste/my sweet buzz). Always, no mater how much you want to drink it now, wait til the next day to drink it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe several times for different crowds and everyone has absolutely loved it! I use Rioja wine as no other works as good. I also omitted the sugar and the cherries and used ginger ale instead of carbonated water. Highly recommend to let it sit for 48 hours minimum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic recipe! I use ginger ale instead of club soda and then eliminate the sugar... That gives it just enough sweetness. I also add 1-2 apples and pears cut up, which add a tasty finish to your drink. You must make it the night before, otherwise it won't taste the same!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Altered this recipe slightly. Used cherry brandy. Limeade concentrate (instead of lemonade), didn't add any sugar, and added ginger ale 30 mins prior to serving. Oh and mixed in some blackberries. It was a huge hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe several times and it's always a hit! It's very flavorful. It is also pretty strong so be sure to keep an eye on consumption if anyone is driving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you are used to Sangrias from Mexico or any other country than Spain, it is not going to be the same. I love traveling to Spain, and Sangria is one of my favorite drinks. I make this quite often, here are my changes: No lemonade concentrate (ew), I squeeze a lemon and a lime instead. Instead of carbonated water (I just don't like it), I will use a splash of Sprite. I will juice oranges if I have them on hand, if not, then orange juice will do. No sugar, that's what the fresh fruit is for. I agree with the other reviewer from Madrid, it should be fruity, not too sweet, and strong (Brandy is a must). Enjoy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at Thanksgiving. I used Cabernet Sauvignon, doubled the batch but did not double the sugar. Used pink lemonade concentrate and ginger ale instead of soda water. Outstanding!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing!! This is a go to recipe, and when I make it, I'm always asked about the recipe. Def make this, don't change a thing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria was the hit of the party! I used a sweeter wine (Lambrusco) and cut the sugar in half. I also added blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries in addition to the oranges, lemons and lime. I didn't use any carbonated water, didn't want to water it down! I definitely will make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this sangria for get togethers and parties, and it is ALWAYS a huge hit! There is not a thing that I would change about it, and my guests can't get enough of this fabulous drink! Thank You for sharing this great (and essential) party recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous recipe! I used blackberry brandy, omitted the sugar. Cut the strength with ginger ale. Removed fruit after several hours so it stayed fresh, and still delicious after 3 days!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: To make 24 servings I ommited the lemon juice in liue of using the entire can of frozen lemonade. Was a HIT at Thanksgiving this year. 5 stars!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe to make my first sangria for my mother-in-law's 60th bday party. It turned out awesome!!! I read the reviews and made some changes considering the crowd at the party. I had rum at home so I used that instead of brandy. Since my mother in law likes sweet drinks I didn't cut the sugar completely but used half of what the recipe called for. I used ginger ale instead of soda water and waited until the party to add that so that it wouldn't be flat (You can always add more if you think it's still dry and taste more like wine) I made it a night before and let it sit overnight. I took some of the oranges and lemons out in the morning so it wouldn't be too citrusy. I added apples and strawberries in the morning as well. Make sure to at least double the recipe since it's gonna be the most popular drink at the party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this soooooo many times and get rave reviews every time. I've shared the recipe over and over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy recipe that is great for a crowd. Everybody loved it. We didn't add the sugar and used ginger ale. It was soooo good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! Have had requests to make this over and over. Used no sugar and Ginger Ale

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE this recipe. Very easy to make and every bit as good as the restaurants serve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this every Christmas and just for fun on occasion! Love it!!!! I use 1 bottle of Pinot Grigio for a white sangria. You can also switch out brandy for rum (spice rum too) and it's just as tasty. I don't add sugar, but instead do what other posters have suggested and just add in 7-Up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! Crowd pleaser. Sweet but not too sweet. lots of different udnertones that make it fun to drink. Definitely use better grade alcohols and let it sit for 24 hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So I came across this recipe and thought it was going to be a hit. Everyone at the BBQ was upset. Upset because it wasn't enough. I made 3 times the recipe but accidentally added a little too much brandy(1/2 cup to be exact). Again its for 3 times the recipe. Everyone loved it. I didn't add any sugar nor the mineral water. I found it sweet enough and don't really like fizz. I made my recipe with spanish brandy and spanish wine(rioja) and added small slices of cantaloupe. It goes great with fruit. Thank you so much for the recipe. It is very authentic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Double the recipe!! It's good!! I used Mountain Dew because that's what I had on hand. Excellent!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a 12 serving recipe of this for a dinner party without ever having tried it before. I made it EXACTLY to the specifications provided, including the optional white sugar !!! It was a HIT and we ended up drinking the whole thing and making more before the evening was over !!! What a DELICIOUS drink (and so pretty, too !!) I had requests to know what the recipe included !!! Thank you for this great recipe !!! I will be making this MANY more times in the future !!!! : )

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is good sangria and the brandy is a must. I added sliced plums as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is definitely the best sangria I've ever had. And I've tried LOTS of recipes! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Most delicious Sangria I have ever made! Prepared it for my friend's wedding but used 7-Up instead of carbonated water and everyone loved it so much – we had to make more! Received so many compliments! Thank you H.Jacoby!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!! I was distracted, and without thinking, just dumped the entire can of frozen lemonade concentrate into the pitcher, so I just skipped the lemon juice. I added 1-2 tablespoons of sugar. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly as written, and this sangria was SO fantastic! Really delicious, everyone loved it. I will definitely be making a lot of this in the future.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe. We drank the whole pitcher!!!! And I don't even drink!!!! Famous last words right....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! I used blackberry brandy. And 1/3 cup lemonade concentrate plus 1/3 cup orange juice concentrate. No juice and No sugar. For the fruit: pineapple chunks, mini manadarin orange slices, and dark cherries soak up the wine and make a wonderful drunken fruit. Marinate overnight in the fridge, then add 1 liter club soda just before serving. Give your guests a long teaspoon to scoop out the fruit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first Sangria and it came out beautifully. Perfect cottage drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria for a July 4h party and it was a huge hit! I quadrupled the recipe to make sure I had enough and I still ran out! I made it the evening before so the flavors would have a chance to blend. Fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quick and easy! It is best if it can sit for a day or two ahead I always get compliments on this Sangria

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used a can of gingerale and club soda in a half recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Toured Spain a few years ago and drank plenty of Sangria. For making it myself, thought it was a great version. Also made a white wine version. Made both for a dinner party and it was a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best sangria recipe ever. I have been asked to make this for countless gatherings including my friends wedding. Everybody races about it and there is never a drop left. Be carful though it is delicious and sneaks up on you. I usually use a box of red wine and a just the liquid ingredients to a serving of 30 makes enough for a large party. I also omitt the triple sec because my mom and I are both allergic to it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Took a jug of Carlo Rossi wine (merlot) 1 bottle each of blackberry brandy an triple sec (750ml) sliced up 1 blood orange,1 lemon and 1 lime, then juiced 1 blood orange ( could use 1-2 cups of oj instead) a jar of drained maraschino cherries and then mix and let it sit overnight, added 1 2 liter of diet ginger ale before serving and bang! It was a hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party I went to. I was little scared I wasn't going to like it after I first tasted it since there was so much alcohol in it. I didn't add any sugar and added sprite just before I served it. It was a hit! Everybody loved my sangria! Would definitely make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe - star of my BBQ party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing amazing amazing! after reading all the review I thought I would have to play with the recipe a few times to find the right one for me but I'm sold on the first try! I followed the recipe except I didn't add sugar. Definitely need to let it sit 24 hours to allow the fruit to naturally sweeten it. I did add a splash of ginger ale (small splash like maybe a tablespoon to my large glass lol )to my glass just to see what it taste like and it was amazing. I did try it before adding the ginger ale and it was also amazing! Definitely my new to go to drink! so refreshing on these warm summer days. ENJOY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time I ever made Sangria and it was a HIT in my home! I even took it to my neighbors and they loved it and asked me to make a large batch for a jewlrey party their having. The first time I had Sangria was in Chicago on St. Paddy's day and I could never find a place to compare too. Now, a Sommilier in training, I gotta say, this is a Party FAV!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome sangria! I like wine but have never cared much for sangria. This was an unbelievably good mix of wines. I will make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is awesome! I've made it for 3 parties and it is a hit every time! The frozen lemonade concentrate and sugar makes it sweet enough. It does NOT need ginger ale. I use the carbonated water instead, just before serving. The recommended amount of brandy is good, but taste it to see if it's "strong" enough for you and your guests...know your audience though...this stuff can sneak up on you ;-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipes. I have made is several times.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had a Sangria taste-off. I used this recipe and my "authentic" friend from Panama used his grandfather's recipe. I won. I use blackberry brandy and the cheapest bottles of wine. I also let it sit in the fridge THEN freeze. Why? I have large parties and never know how much of this to make. So I make six batches and freeze. I put a frozen section into my punch bowl and pour Sierra Mist over the top and it gets slushy. (Alcohol doesn't really freeze solid.). I then add fresh oranges and raspberries. (I have also added fruit at stage one and frozen it. That allows the berries to soak up the alcohol; I prefer fresh berry taste vs. laden with brandy.) Making it ahead allows me to focus on other things the week of the party, knowing my Sangria is done. Everyone asks me for this recipe. I claim it as my own. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been using this recipe for several years and it's always a hit. I usually double the recipe for parties and we never have leftovers. It's fruity and delicious but not too sweet. I don't use soda or carbonated water, I like it better without. So yummy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've used this recipe as printed and I've played around with it based on the ingredients I have on-hand and it's always been delicious! I don't usually use the maraschino cherries. I've used peach schnapps and/or triple sec. Brandy is a must. I've added plums, peaches, strawberry, pineapple, etc. I always add some cranberry/raspberry juice (about a 1/2 cup) and I use a can of ginger ale that I add right before serving as suggested. And I don't ever add sugar. You really can't go wrong using the basics of this recipe and tweaking it to make it your own. You will want to double the recipe if you are having company. It goes so fast! Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this twice and everyone always loves it! I make it exactly according to the recipe but don't use the optional carbonated water. I usually have to at least quadruple the recipe and found that you can get away with using inexpensive, boxed red wine. I had the same experience as another reviewer - that the men who started out with beer and chose to stick with it when offered the sangria changed their minds after they tasted it and abandoned their beers and drank the sangria for the rest of the evening. Definitely make it the night before for best taste. If you have leftovers after your event I suggest removing the fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm not one to write reviews, but I've used this recipe over 20 times and since I rely on others' reviews I'll do my part and share my experience. This is the best Sangria recipe I've found. Everyone i make it for raves about it, usually giving me credit. I find that if you let it marinate it's actually best the 2nd day. Also, I don't use the club soda, just my preference I like mine stronger! This is by far better than any Sangria you've ordered in a restaurant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the first time I've ever made sangria but I had to make another batch the very next day to accommodate demand!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this for my wedding! I made it the night before and used ginger ale. Everyone loved it- but especially the ladies in attendance. I think my sister had +4 drinks! Which is probably why it was gone 30% of the way through. Should have made two pitchers! I am making it again for my housewarming party in a few weeks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow this is phenomenal! Had a lot of tipsy people because they loved tne flavor! Lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe exactly as written with the exception of not adding the cherries, since I didn't have any on hand. It was out of this world! I used blackberry brandy and it was even better than the $14 a glass, blackberry sangria at our favorite restaurant. Thank you for sharing this recipe. It' absolutely delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this because of the review that said, "I was a nobody; and now I am famous for my sangria." Now I am famous for my sangria also. I am in Mexico for the winter, so we don't have the limeade concentrate anywhere. Otherwise, I followed the recipe almost exactly. I only put in four tablespoons of sugar and it was better without the sparkling water I added to the top of the glasses on the first round. The first time I made it, I used a Pinot Noir and it was perfect. The second time I made it, I used a Malbec. A little dryer and darker in color. I will stick with the Pinot for this recipe. I did not use cherries, but added a plum, a peach and strawberries to the citrus. I doubled the recipe for 8 people and everyone loved it. I didn't realize there were so many recipes for Sangria. This one was fine and you really can't make a mistake, unless you make it too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's soooo yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is the best ever!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best recipe ever. I did everything the way it said insted I used Brandi flavoring. Let it sit for 4 days without the lemons and limes. Add lemons and limes day of because it will turn sour. Still the bomb recipe. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: 12/14: sangria from costco, half cup brandy half cup triple sec, 1/3 cup oj and sprite. very good. didn't have frozen lemonade and lemon juice sounded too tart. cranberries, apples only.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yumminess. Made it for a Christmas party and turned around and made it the next weekend for thanksgiving! Definitely a keeper??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have made this several times and it is delicious. My girlfriends ask me to bring it to our Girl's Nite Out. To be honest, it tastes better than the sangria that I've had in Spain (too diluted). This recipe is stronger, and we like it that way!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my! This was my first attempt at making sangria and it so good! I made 2 pitchers, one with blackberry brandy, the other with white rum. I didn't add the sugar and it was just fine. Both were good, but I preferred the one with the rum. Try this recipe. You will not be disappointed! In fact, I am making a double batch for a Christmas Eve gathering and I can't wait to drink it again. Yum!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wanted to make this Sangria for Christmas Eve so we did a "trial batch" first. We love it!! Hubby hunted for a recipe that would be a keeper and this is it!!! We used half the sugar recommended and it really was sweet enough. For those wanting a little fizz and a tad more sweetness we topped each glass individually with 7Up. This is now our official Sangria recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this the first time for a huge 50th birthday party and it was such a big hit that everywhere I am invited, I am asked to bring it again! I can't just double the recipe anymore, I have to make it x4 or more, LOL. We are partial to the 7-up also and sometimes add other fruits like pineapple and apple, etc. and omit the sugar. Leaving it to sit overnight, it turns out delicious every time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this recipe for my daughter's wedding shower and she liked it so much that she asked me to make it for her wedding reception. I used Trader Joe's Morello Cherries and their juice instead of maraschino cherries. Everyone loved it and I have never had as many requests for a recipe as I did with this one! I love that allrecipes gives you an automatic system for adjusting the number of servings. Thanks so much!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tried it. Excellent. I made a recipe and a half to fully fill the pitcher I was using, and it turned out perfectly. The key is letting it sit overnight to let all the flavors blend and mature together. Used blackberry brandy and also nectarines, which we ended up digging out of the pitcher to eat. Delish!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the 2nd time making this recipe and I made a double batch and used 1/2 c of spiced rum and 1/2 cup of Brandy. I also used Italian sparkling lemonade instead of club soda and added frozen pineapple to this batch and must say it turned out fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! Stick to the ingredients and instructions and you can't go wrong

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it for the 1st time & followed it except I added peaches & an Apple. Great!!! With either club soda or ginger ale. Very good!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! everyone loved it, I cant get away with serving pre-made stuff anymore

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too sweet

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious sangria. We used a little more brandy and a little less sugar. No club soda for us. We will make again soon for our friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Left me and everyone else wanting more!!! I bought this to a party and it was a huge hit with a the ladies !!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this hundreds of times now because it is a party favourite! It packs a punch, but every time I serve it, I'm asked for the recipe. Highly recommend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious! First time to make sangria and it was a hit. Made exactly as is except for used an orange liqueur instead of triple sec. So yummy! Used a cheap brandy and $3 bottle of wine. Definitely making for future parties!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too much citrus as-is. Added more cherries and less citrus the second time around and was much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A staple for anytime of the year. I'm always asked to bring it. I use diet 7up for the fizz and merlot. Deeeelish!!! Drink fast... this will be gone before you get a second glass

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed this recipe exactly and it is perfect. I squeezed fresh oranges for the orange juice and added club soda just before serving. I mixed the liquid ingredients two days before serving and added the fruit one day before. Please, no fooling around with this one!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Use Spanish wine for excellent flavor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was amazing!! Brought it to a friends birthday party! It was a huge hit! I made a double batch of it. I used Rum instead of the brandy. Did not add sugar-already sweet enough. Also used ginger ale instead of carbonated water. And also let it set for 24 hours in the fridge. Thanks to some of the reviews for the tips on adjusting the recipe a bit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So tasty everyone always asks for the recipe! Only changes I make are that I don't use any sugar or cherries and, so that the batch goes further, I add a litre of flavored soda water (lime and wild cherry are my favourites :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been using this recipe for a few years now and it has definitely spoiled me!! It's the ONLY sangria I'll drink--better than anything I've ever had in a restaurant and better than any other recipe I've tried. I'm always disappointed when I try other sangrias because they just pale in comparison since this one has so much flavor and complexity. I typically use blackberry brandy and a merlot and I don't like it sweet, so I skip the sugar. It's definitely better the second day, so if I'm doing it for a party or something I make sure to make it ahead. Thank you so much for this HJACOBY :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this recipe for years and it is always a crowd favorite!! I also add a sprinkle of cinnamon and nutmeg.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my new go to Sangria! Be aware - it is very strong, which is maybe not a bad thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has been a summer staple for five years now. How convenient that Costco sells cheap bottles of red wine, huge bags of lemons, limes, and boxes of oranges. It's like it was meant to be!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add more brandy and add different kinds of fruit! Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the 4th of July and it was a smashing hit. Everyone loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Packs a powerful punch and is fantastic. We forgot to add the soda/ginger ale and still loved them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is fairly forgiving. I made a triple batch for a barbecue on the 4th of July. I didn't have limes to slice up, so I substituted a third of the OJ with lime juice. I added sliced apples, frozen strawberries and frozen blueberries to this the first night. The second night, I pulled all of the citrus and apples out and added a cinnamon stick and two mixed fruit cups to slightly alter the flavor. I used cheap Christian Brothers VS brandy and BOTA box Shiraz (which I love anyway), plus triple sec. It tasted FANTASTIC, but I wasn't feeling more than a little buzzed after several glasses. Maybe I'll skip the ginger ale next time. ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Soooo good! Will be making this again! The only change was diet 7up instead of carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The most amazing and easy recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria recipe! My father in law from Spain says this is very authentic tasting :). I make the recipe as is. I always make it the night before to let the flavors meld. I make it for parties, so I end up 6x the recipe. I used to use bottled wine- however tried it with the boxed wine and it is still delicious! Thanks for the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have never made sangria before but wanted to serve some at a party. This stuff was a HIT!! Made me look like I knew what I was doing. Will be making this again just for myself.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm hooked!!!! Whenever I have guests coming over, they beg me to make this for them the night before. But don't let the taste fool you, though sweet, it does have a "kick" that sneaks up on you rather quickly :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow, Wow, Wow!! So delicious and strong but not too strong. the changes I made: 1/4 cup sugar; gingerale added just before serving; chilled w/out fruit for 24 hrs. prior (added the fruit 9 hrs, prior to serving); added the cherry juice from the cherry jar; only 1/2 cup lemon juice. LOVED it! thank you for sharing and thank you to all the other reviewers for helping me pick his recipe :) oh, I used a nice orange liqueur instead of triple-sec...taste better

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a triple batch for my graduation party, it was gone within the first few hours. Everyone loved it and was asking how i made it. I followed the recipe but with a few minor changes: I added an apple, a pear, and a pineapple (with the juice). I used a blackberry brandy and triple sec. I left out the sugar (it's sweet enough without it. If some prefer a sweeter sangria, add a shot of triple sec to the glass before serving). I let it sit in the fridge for over 24 hours and added seven-up just before serving. I did add ice to it, and it didnt seem to water it down at all. When I ran out, I just poured in more wine, brandy and triple sec and it was almost as good as the original batch. If you're looking for a knock-your-socks off Sangria recipe, THIS IS IT.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe and so do my friends who help me drink it! I've never actually used the lemon juice as it's not something I have handy. I use the gingerale instead of sugar and carbonated water. I use orange juice and cran-raspberry in the quantities for the juice and concentrate. I use triple sec and blackberry brandy. And...so far... rave reviews and requests for the recipe every time I make it. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed previous suggestions and used spiced rum instead of brandy. This was the perfect cocktail for my deck party. I'm glad I discovered this drink in time! Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time making a sangria. Really, really, really good. Used a big red as the base and used limeade concentrate instead of lemonade. Served it to about 20 people for a family party. All loved it equally! Didn't use the club soda but will try that next time just for fun.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the best Sangria recipe I have found and it was so easy. I substituted strawberry lemonade concentrate for the regular and it was delicious!!! This will be an all occasion drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is STELLAR! I fixed this for the first time at my Memorial Day Cookout and my friends and family were scraping the bottom of the barrel to get more! A few suggestions...I doubled the recipe to make a nice, large container of sangria! I also, used frozen, sweetened cherries, lots of oranges, limes and lemons. Substitute orange juice for orange concentrate and it's a hit! At the very end, add 1/2 bottle of sweet champagne to give that extra kick! Soo good! Will make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made many sangria's and this is the best by far. I don't like mine too tart, so I don't add lemon juice, lemons or limes. I use the oranges and also some apples too, depends on what I have on hand. I use a sweeter red wine and no sugar. I am asked to make this for every holiday and get together. I always make a double batch and that usually isn't enough. It goes down like juice but really packs a punch! Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AhhhhhhMazing! My friend made this for her Memorial Day party and it was so delish! Can't wait to make it for a party of my own. She used the ginger ale in place of the soda. Yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good sangria recipe. I had no lemonade concentrate so I just added extra lemon juice and sugar. I also used fresh orange juice. Very refreshing and very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe, but tweeted it a little for our tastes. I doubled the recipe, (used a Tempranillo for the red wine) added tequila, about a cup, also added fresh pineapple & a firm apple, cut into small pieces, a handful of grapes & a sliced kiwi to the fruit. I substituted a jar of natural bing cherries for the maraschino cherries (no artificial coloring or sugar additives) and used the cherry syrup in place of the sugar in the recipe. Then I used sparkling water rather than the lemon-lime soda. It came out great, everyone raved about it & wanted the recipe, which I posted the original on Facebook. Thanks, HJacoby, for submitting!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I replaced the triple sec with peach Schnapps. Nothing against the orange liqueur...I just wanted a different fruit liqueur that would complement the orange juice that's already a prominent flavor in this recipe. I also added a sliced peach along with the other fresh fruits. So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always make a double batch, use real lemon juice, merlot wine, sugar, cherry brandy, and ginger ale instead of carbonated soda. Also, let it marinate for at least 24 hours; that way the flavors marry and the wine has time to mellow out. A good trick to keeping it cold without ice, use frozen cherries! Yummy! It was gone in no time the first time I made it so I learned to make extra!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it for the second time last night. I add a little bit of the maraschino juice and use gingerly. I like the added zing from the ginger. I'll try using a flavored brandy next time for added flavor. This definitely is a keeper! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this recipe for a bridal shower and the ladies LOVED it! A keeper for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe so many times...and get loads of compliments each time. When the next person needs to make sangria, they always come to me for "my" recipe. I try to stick with the fruit listed in this recipe, but you can definitely make it with other fruits. Add the sugar to the cut up fruit, while you mix the other ingredients. Let it sit overnight and it's much better. I use tempranillo wine and have huge success.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was excellent. Used 2 cups of gingerale, but don't add until ready to serve. Also, remove limes and lemons within 4 hours or so as others suggested or else taste is too sour. Can add other fruit. Next time, make double the batch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't have enough triple sec and was out of orange juice. Mixed up what I had which was everything else. I only had 1/3rd the required amount of triple sec. I gave it a sample before going to get orange juice and more triple sec. It tasted great! Like all other good sangria's I've had. Got oj and ts, added, tasted again. Not as good. Left if fridge overnight. Again, not as good. The triple sec is just way to strong. Adds that synthetic orange type of flavor triple sec has and is just overbearing. I think using about 1/3 the recommended sugar is also a good idea. I didn't use carbonated water or ginger ale. Next time I make this I'm going to do it exactly to the recipe, but with only 1/4 of the oj, 1/4 the triple sec, and 1/3rd the sugar. I'm betting that will nail it. I'd advise you to taste as you add though, and add these 3 ingredients last. Dial it in how just how you like it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best sangria recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wish more people had mentioned if they used the optional ingredients. I added the sugar and probably didn't need to. So, because of that, we definitely ended up cutting the sweetness with some seltzer. I'd recommend no sugar and then hopefully you wouldn't need the seltzer. Overall it was good, but people definitely said it was a sweeter kind of Sangria. I used the Roijo that someone recommended. Maybe I'd try a different kind next time. Also, I would cut the rounds in half. The orange rounds were too big for the cups.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit at Tapas party I hosted. I followed it to the letter, using Trader Joe's Velvet Moon cabernet sauvignon and including the optional 1/4 cup sugar and club soda. It only macerated for about 3 hours and had plenty of flavor. Personally, I found it a bit too sweet but not in an objectionable way. Next time I'll try it without the sugar. This recipe is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Get recipe. Super delicious. I recommend using a Spanish tempranillo red wine to make it more authentically Spaniard. Very goo recipe non-theless.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe made it for Bunco!! Doubled it and it was gone after the first round.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked the way this came out. I used Merlot for the red wine. I did leave out the suggested cup of sugar. I'm really glad I did because it's overly sweet without it. I didn't wait to let it sit overnight to try it and it was still good. I let it sit in the refrigerator for about 2 hours. Although, the leftover Sangria was better the next day after having sat in the fridge overnight. It would be nice to dial back the sugar even more-maybe less of the lemon frozen concentrate and replace with fresh lemon juice. The carbonated water was a nice addition and even helped dilute the sweetness of it. I added about 2 teaspoons of cinnamon, and it made it even more delicious! -Cheers! :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good! I didn't have frozen lemonade OR enough lemons to get 1/4c of lemon juice so I just juiced 1/2c or so of lime juice and added 2 Tablespoons sugar to make it sweet like frozen limeade. I opted out of adding the extra sugar to sweeten at the end and used a sprite before serving. I let it sit 4 hrs and had to taste. Delicious!! Will be making this again;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT!!! Used 7-Up instead of the sugar/carbonated water and no cherries. Definitely a keeper...Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this last night for our neighborhood LNO and everyone loved it! I tripled the batch and ran out. Next time I will make more. Will have to get a bigger punch bowl! I also put a whole bottle of champagne in just before I served it. It was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been sadly drinking this Sangria daily. As others have mentioned, the sprite/club soda should only go in individual glasses as you're serving the drink, not over night. It is indeed delicious!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Holy cow this was good! I took the reviewer suggestion of using a plum merlo and think it made the drink spectacular. I had several people ask for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I first prepared this for a Christmas get together 2 years ago, quadrupling the recipe so I would have plenty. Everyone loved it, and there was some leftovers I used a week later for another party. It was still delicious. The secret is to let the flavors develop, and depending on how bitter the peel is on your citrus fruit, will last a couple of weeks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first time making sangria and it was a hit at out holiday gathering! The only difference I made to the recipe was leaving out the cherries & ginger ale, but I added the sugar and 1/8 cup more brandy. Next time, I will add a full 1/4 cup more brandy and the ginger ale/club soda. Great recipe!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a fabulous recipe! All of my friends loved it and begged for the recipe. I kept everything the same except made a simple syrup instead of straight up sugar...definitely give this recipe a try, tastes just like sangria at an upscale restaurant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious. Made it for a party, I tripled the recipe and it was all gone by the end of the night. I served it with carbonated water (about 50/50 ratio) and it was still very strong and tasty. Guests raved about it. We even ate the liquor soaked cherries at the end!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria ever! Served it at my bday party...which turned out to be a bad choice cause I spent most the of the night making more and more batches to replenish.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tripled this recipe and made it for an office party. Everyone wanted the recipe. I used the sugar and a mix of club soda and Sprite to get to the right sweetness. This is a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I HUGE hit at my summer BBQ!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG this is an awesome recipe!! I have made it several times ,most recently at my Halloween party. It is ALWAYS a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this- just perfect as written!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Needed something for a ladies get-together and this was easy to make. Love, love, love.....now I have something for all my occasions.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy. We made for our house warming party. Used 7 up instead and no cherries. Tasted great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh yeah, baby. Good stuff. Be sure to eat the fruit at the bottom! It's got a kick all its own!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SUPER delicious. We always double this recipe at minimum, and there's never any leftovers. Definitely a hit at parties! Our only change is to skip the sugar (it's plenty sweet on its own), and substitute seltzer for ginger ale at time of serving (optional). 5 HUGE STARS!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG. This is so good it's ridiculous. The only thing I did differently than the recipe was to add frozen peach slices and frozen pineapple chunks. I did let it refrigerate overnight and then added 2 cups of Sprite Zero right before serving. The entire pitcher was gone in no time and everyone wanted the recipe! Fabulous!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: great! leave out the cherries and the sugar and the soda water. a double batch in necessary for any gathering (fits in the smaller pasta pot). For a party at our house, 3 or 4 batches are necessary.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mr. Yum Yum says YUM! This Sangria is so good and a close match to my favorite restaurant, El Burro in Campbell, CA. I've made this many times. I do not use the carbonated soda because Sangria is better without it IMO. Nor do i bother with the cherries as they do nothing to enhance the flavor. Mr. Yum Yum gives this 5 Oles!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!! Amazing. Used a ginger ale floater on top of each glass. Going to try ginger beer next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made 5 times the recipe for a pool party and everyone loved it! I did not use as many fruits as the recipe called for and I thought it was perfect. Definitely a keeper. Many of the guests said it was the best sangria they ever had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent sangria! Everytime I have made it; has a favorite drink by everyone and requested time and time again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added the optional sugar and carbonated water. I only had time for the Sangria to sit for 5 hours and it still tasted great! I will definitely make this again when I have time for the Sangria to sit overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Brought it to a neighborhood block party and it got lots of compliments. Used an inexpensive bottle of rioja, apples, plums, peaches and raspberries, added an orange the day of to avoid any bitterness. I also tried an inexpensive bottle of blackberry brandy, since that was one of the flavors in the wine. I also used orange juice so I wouldn't have to go out and buy triple sec just for the recipe. Turned out really yummy and perfect with something fizzy - ginger ale or club soda. Make the night before and definitely taste test it to get the right amount of sweetness and tartness. Great recipe and will continue to use!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy, quick and tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a good start. Add a sliced peach and macerate with citrus. Omit lemon juice, OJ and frozen concentrate. Cut triple sec in half, add ¼C of peach schnapps. Add the wine, omit the sugar and refrigerate for minimum of 3 hrs., preferably, overnight. Before serving, add 1L. of 7Up, reg. or diet. Gotta watch those calories!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my sister's baby shower and it was a HIT! I took "MAMASPICE" review and went with her suggestion of using EL Presidente brandy and spanish Riojo wine. (I passed on using the carbonated water and white sugar) Since we had approximately 65 guests coming I wasn't sure how to gauge it so I made 2 gallons. I prepared it 24 hours ahead of time and stored 1 gallon in a glass beverage container with a spigot, and the other gallon in a reserve pitcher. The next day, I unveiled it and you could get drunk off the fumes, which wasn't a bad thing, but I didn't want my guests hammered after one drink. So, needless to say, I poured half of it out into a reserve pitcher to use for later and what I just poured out of the serving container I filled to the top with ginger ale. Thankfully, it sweetened it up perfectly, yet you could still taste all the flavors of the brandy, the wine and fresh fruit. I would say 90% percent was all gone by the end of the party. So if you want to keep it on the sweeter side fill half of whatever container you use with Sangria and the other half with ginger ale and only add the ginger ale right before serving. CHeers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A perfect Sangria recipe for all those outdoor Summer parties. No Brandy, so I substituted Cognac. I'm pouring this Friday night when our block starts the weekend round of "cocktail" get togethers. Pour over ice, add a splash of seltzer. What could be easier? Get fancy and add some Chambord instead of Triple Sec & add additional summer fruits to the pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just mixed up a batch and, of course, had to do a taste test. Only change made was the addition of 1/2 cup of spiced rum and used Pellegrino instead of soda water. Fabulous flavour. This pitcher probably won't make it through the overnight resting period!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this recipe was absolutely terrific. Whoever kelcampbell is, they are way out in space. This was great. Joshua

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served this for my husband's birthday party. Fruity and intense. We did not dilute with carbonated anything and served over ice. WOW! Folks are still talking about the Sangria served and it's been 2 years since.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was a party hit! I used Malbec wine and the ginger ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is wonderful!!! I leave out the triple sec, add extra oj and brandy to taste, and it comes out AMAZING!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Followed suggestions to omit sugar and add ginger ale (I added diet ginger ale). Everything else was per the recipe. If you ladle the sangria into a glass and then add the ginger ale to the glass, you can customize the strength to your guest's taste and each glass will be as "fizzy" as the first.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria recipe was the best that I have tasted and made.I made this during Christmas and New Year's and everyone loved it.I will be making it again and again.Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous Recipe! I've always wanted to make Sangria and this is the first recipe that I've tried. Definitely a keeper! I think it was a bit strong. We added more ginger ale and made this much more drinkable and refreshing. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this recipe this weekend for a barbecue and it was a definite hit! This was my first time making Sangria so I was a little worried that it might not turn out. Followed the recipe exactly and it was great! I plan to change things up next time with different fruits and try with a white wine. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We just had housewarming party and everyone loved this sangria. We did not put any club soda, and guests were super happy at the end of the night:-) Great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! I added a green apple, used a Cabernet and used half the sugar and it was super good. The apples really made it great. I also made it early in the morning so the fruit had plenty of time to soak up the alcohol and flavor the wine. Make sure to get fruit into your glass because it was the best part. I used 1/4 sparkling water to 3/4 sangria in each cup. YUM.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I believe the key to this recipe is letting it sit for several hours prior to serving. I've made sangria recipes before that were not very successful, but I made this pretty close to what was written (I took the 7-up suggestion from other comments, left out the sugar, used frozen black cherries because that's what I had on hand) and it was beyond amazing. I will be making this again...and as I'm taking it to a party this evening I'm regretting not making a bigger batch because this is going to be a big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Changed it slightly.. It was very tasty (YUMMY)!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: too tart for me, but not bad.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great tool for converting people who say "I don't like Sangria".

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked this recipe. I wasn't blown away, but it was easy and tasty. I might just like it sweeter though, because I made a non-alcoholic version for the kids substituting sparkling wine and it was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our christmas gathering. It was a huge hit. My only regret was that I did not make more. It really tastes better when it sits for at least an hour.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use this recipe alot to make Sangria. I agree that the brandy is very important. The one thing I do different is take 3/4 c light rum and soak the fruit and 1/4 c sugar over night. Use the rum in the Sangria! Yum Yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: it is very, very good ---- but add about 1/2 cup of Southern Comfort, and 2 sliced bananas, and 1 mango (sliced) for a really special taste !!!! Also -- consider (i have done it both ways) using 7Up instead of Ginger Ale -- both work equally well

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe, always a hit at parties. I've noticed when I bring a batch to a party at which others have also brought sangria, mine always goes first.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used Brandy soaked cherries because I had them and left out the lemonade, used more OJ and Ginger ale instead of water. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so easy to make and absolutely delicious! The only change I made was that I added about a 1/4 cup of Amaretto, but that was only because I mistook it for the brandy bottle on accident. I will probably keep that in the recipe the next time I make it though because it was so good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always get compliments when I make this. I usually use blackberry Brandy and use whole blackberries and granny smith apples as garnish.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. Strong, sweet and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A few neighbors got together to do a Progressive Dinner. The concept is you start at one house for appetizers and cocktails, proceed to another house for the main meal then finish at another house for dessert. I had the privilege of providing appetizers and cocktails. I wasn't sure what to serve because I have a few neighbors that do not indulge in alcoholic beverages. I also didn't want to spend the evening blending drinks and playing bartender and was concerned about a drink for the men so I decided to try this Sangria. OMG...this was the HIT of the evening!!! Even those who had a preference of not indulging had MORE THAN ONE GLASS! I followed the recipe but used Duplin Black River Red wine (it's a little sweeter) and I used Vernors Ginger Ale instead of carbonated water. I also pre filled the wine glasses with diced strawberries, peaches and maraschino cherries. I agree with everyone the key is to let it sit over night. The neighbors were in no rush to proceed to the next house for dinner and everyone wanted me to write down the recipe. :0)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I 3X this recipe for Superbowl Sunday. And it was just about all gone. I would say it was a definite hit. I have had peach sangria that I personally like better but this one was delish. My advice... definitely don't skimp on the fruit. I 3X'd all ingredients but the fruit and I was sorry, I ended up adding more the day of the party. it will look like A LOT of fruit but it's much better!! To me Lime was the key, added that extra zing in contrast to the sweetness of the orange juice and lemonade. OH and I did what others suggested and used Ginger ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this the first time for a house warming party and it was gone before I knew it! The next time I made a double batch and still ran out early in the evening. I did not use the sugar or the cherries either time, but felt nothing was missing without them. All my guests raved that this was the best sangria they had ever tasted. I will use this as my go-to party drink from now on!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It really helps if you don't forget the ginger ale! This was delicious, and was a perfect complement to a "girls only" baking day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow!! I made this for my girlfriends for Spanish Dinner night - they loved it! Instaed of TripleSec (I didn't have any) my firend said to add Cointreau - wow, it was great! Definite recipe for Sangria. And a must to make 24 hours ahead of time!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A good sangria recipe is so hard to find. Now I've got mine :).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful and easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I traded sugar for splenda and used diet gingerale and it tasted awesome!!!.. better than when i was in Mexico!!!!.. thanks a bunch!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic recipe. Has a few different ingredients, but worth it. Also it lasts for up to a week.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I used a Cabernet Sauvignon and provided ginger ale to mix with it before serving. I thought it could use a little more sweetness, so will add some more sugar next time. It was a hit at our Christmas get together.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out great! I used a large bottle of cab to double the recipie. My only change was I used about 1/2 cup of simple syrup to help it mix better. Simple syrup - boil 1 cup sugar in 1 cup water, cool, and use

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best ever! I removed the peels from the oranges, lemoms and lime, based on several comments that the peel made it bitter after a bit, used half apricot and half cherry brandy. The fruit I had on on hand were dark cherries and strawberries. This was heavenly. I need more wine so I can make it again. Lovely!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made with ginger ale and 1/2 the sugar...good doubled for party

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best!! Dont change a thing! Our bacyard BBQ/party area is never without a pitcher or two all summer!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Over and over, I am asked to bring this one to parties. Just perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like it, but I tweaked it to reduce the bitter/sour flavor. I halved the limes and halved the number of lemon rounds. I omitted the frozen lemonade concentrate. I used the sugar. Prior to serving, I added a bit of orange soda, to taste. I kept a six pack of orange soda on hand all night. I used smoking loon cabernet sauvignon for the first batch. People really liked it and it was finished quickly. I refilled with trader joe's $2 charles shaw cab and the correct proportions of brandy and triple sec. I kept orange soda on hand and kept refilling. Watch out for the bitterness!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not sweet enough. I added more soda and OJ.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Sangria Recipe! I added some raspberries and Pisco Brandy instead. Definitely recommended.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The mix turned very sour overnight and was evident of the citrus rinds. I ended up using the sugar as well as adding 2 tsp of the maraschino cherry juice to sweeten and mask the overwhelming citrus aftertaste. I made a 20 serving batch so 3/4 cup of cherry juice was used to salvage my expensive concoction. In other words, there is quite a bit of sugar in this batch. I would suggest removing the rinds of the citrus in lieu of adding so much sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We make this recipe (tripled, at least) every Christmas Eve. We mix it in a huge stock pot, cover it with plastic wrap, and keep it in a cooler in the back hall for the family to sip on, over Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The wine we use is often a Cabernet Sauvignon, or a Shiraz. The Brandy is a must. We have used both a cheaper "triple sec" and the patron orange liqueur. Since it is mixed, I recommend the triple sec. We generally leave out the sugar and leave the ginger-ale separate for individual servings. Everyone LOVES it. It certainly helps the holiday spirit as well, wink wink. This will be our third year making it. A family favorite, for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ive made this twice now, first time I doubled it and people complained I didn't make enough so second time I quadrupled it and it worked perfectly. I add every fruit I can put my hands on around the house, apples, pears, frozen berries, you name it. I also use peach schnapps instead of the triple sec. LOVE the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! this was great. Served it on Thanksgiving and followed recipe exactly. I did not use the optional sugar but did use the ginger ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit! I used ginger ale instead of sugar and sparkling water and it was perfect! 1 batch does a 2 quart pitcher - I made 2 batches to be safe and they are both gone.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The BEST sangria! I have made this for parties and everyone has always loved it, even then men who typically drink beer! I agree that it has to sit overnight, and the different modifications/substitutions mentioned in the reviews work, but it's good just as the recipe calls for. I typically leave out the soda and have used all different kinds of fruits...apples, pears, grapes, limes, lemons, oranges, etc. I've also used peach schnapps along with the brandy and triple sec. Very, very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I take the drink with me to all parties. Love it! It's a real hit! The only thing I do different is I add Sprite right before serving instead of the sugar and carbonated water. I also don't add cherries. Delish!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always make double or triple the recipe. I have made it a few times and it is a hit! I do not add the sugar or bubbly soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this probably a dozen times now and always get rave reviews. It's my go to recipe for fun party cocktails. Watch out - the rum will kick you in the pants!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this twice for parties and this is always a hit. I used blackberry brandy and it was terrific.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria I have ever made! The only changes I made were to eliminate the cherries (I don't like them) and added a cinnamon stick. As far as the fruit goes, I cleaned out the fruit bowl, any kind of fruit works. The key to this Sangria is the Brandy and letting it sit overnight. Makes for a great party punch. Enjoy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe as written and allowed to sit overnight. Love, love this and it was a hit at the party. Will definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is amazing!!!! I cant get enough of it!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really great sangria!! I didn't have all of the brandy, but it still came out perfectly. You definitely need to add a touch of ginger ale on the top. I will definitely make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria for an autumn bonfire party recently and it was such a hit! I made a double batch and we could have used more - it's THAT good. I used a 1.5L bottle of Barefoot "sweet red" wine as the base for this sangria and it worked really well. You don't need an expensive wine to make great sangria, after all. Since I made a double, I used a whole can of thawed lemonade concentrate. For the fruit, I used two cans of (drained) pineapple chunks, a jar of maraschino cherries, 2 oranges, 2 lemons, 2 limes and a quart of fresh strawberries. I omitted the sugar and add a 2 liter of ginger ale prior to serving. Also, I let the fruit sit overnight and pulled out most of the citrus in the morning. I froze the citrus (and a few other fruit pieces) throughout the day and then added the frozen pieces back in prior to serving. You definitely want to make it at least 24 hours in advance to let it sit and soak up all the goodness before serving. I will definitely make this again. Fantastic!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love it. In fact everyone that has tried it loves it. I use champagne instead of carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this recipe! I followed the recipe exactly, and it was terrific. Word of caution, though - it's so good but it's powerful...it sneaks up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just a brilliant recipe! Felt like I returned to Spain again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: don't bother with the extras like the sugar and carbonated water. i don't even use the maraschino cherries. the drink stands well enough alone with the mixed ingredients and fresh fruit slices. simply delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great tasting drink! I loved it and so did everyone at the party. I followed the recipe but I added more cherries, and half the cherry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this Sangria for a dinner party tonight. Doubled the recipe and followed directions as they are here, but added a bit more brandy and also used Sprite instead of the carbonated water. Everyone said they loved it! I will use this recipe again. Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved this

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: sooo perfect for parties!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made this receipe for the Labour Day weekend. I had to make a second pitcher of it, as it was a great success. We had purchased beer for the guys, and thought this would be a fantastic drink for the ladies...well, all the men loved it too!!! I substitued lemon juice for lemonchella, and triple sec for peach schnapps. I will definitely be making this sangria again and again! Best receipe....I have to admit, my best Sangria was in Barcelona, but now, this actually may have beaten that!!! Enjoy all!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awsome! I used a sweet wine, peach tree and ginger ale. I made this for Labor Day and the ladies loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely wonderful! The only modification was that I added some fresh berries. This is my go to drink when we have company coming over. Very refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! A wonderful recipe-I've skipped sugar and used apricot brandy. I've also topped off with either ginger ale or club soda, depending on how sweet I am in the mood for.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Def. the best Sangria around! Was a hit at my dinner party. I tripled the batch and it all went. I, too, omitted the sugar and club soda and used gingerale. Def. a keeper recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an awesome Sangria recipe! It takes a bit of time because its best if you can let it sit for awhile, but it is SO worth it! I've made it multiple times and people always want the recipe! Thanks! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So Good! Added 1/2c. peach schnapps and added gingerale before serving...it's sweet & very strong, but that's just the way we like it. Worth trying for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummy - used Blackberry Brandy - 1/2 the sugar and a Rasberry Seltzer! A huge hit - only let it sit for 6 hours and it was fabulous. I just say this so people won't skip by it if they want to make it last minute! Will make again and let sit over night to see if it improves. Oh - and don't bother making a single batch - you will need more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I receive nothing but rave reviews for this sangria.. EVERY time I make it.. funny thing, when I made it.. I had no frozen lemonade concentrate. However, I found a frozen lime ice pop (real fruit) in the freezer.. broke it up, and put it in.. worked like a charm! I am sure other 'substitutions' would work as well!~

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last weekend and it was FABULOUS! As suggested in another review, I replaced the brandy for rum, the triple sec for peach schnapps and completely left out the sugar. It was fabulous, not too sweet and very refreshing!!!! I just made it again today for another BBQ tonight and am looking forward to sharing it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We currently live in Spain... and this is goooood and similar to what you can find here. Very close to the real deal. We followed everything pretty closely. We did not have triple sec, so we omitted that. We DID add the carbonated water (1 full can) and white sugar to taste. Probably 1/4 cup??? Lastly... it needed a little extra something so we added a guzzle of tom collins mix (since it was in the fridge) BUT it would have been good without it! YUMMO

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a great drink for a summer LUAU! Good thing I bought extra ingredients. The first double batch that sat overnight in the fridge was the best sangria I've ever made or had. I used gingerale instead of club soda. I made several additional batches on the fly (total 9 gallons!) that were just as good. I scrubbed bottles of water, froze them and they worked great to keep the sangria cold without diluting it. Sangria and frozen water bottles were placed in a large beverage server with a spout/spiget. It was perfect and it looked amazing on the Tiki Bar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We doubled the recipe and made it without the sugar or the carbonated water and it was DELICIOUS !! We followed the recipe exactly as written and will definitely be making it again, at the cottage for afternoons on the dock :) Yummm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Before I was a nobody. Now I'm famous for my sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so easy and delicious. After reading reviews I swapped the brandy and triple sec for peach schnapps and rum. Used 7up instead of the carbonated water. I tripled the recipe and there was not a drop left!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I finally found the best sangria recipe. I did read the comment and instead of putting triple sec, I used peach schnaps. I also added cinnamon. Can't wait for the pool party to begin. They will LOVE it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummmy this recipe was amazing! I didn't add the sugar but put in extra fruit and it was delicious! Winner Winner chicken dinner on this one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at my reccent BBQ. I could't even fill the bowl before people were coming back for seconds. I agree with some of the other reviews that it is best to let it sit for 24 hours before serving. All the flavors marinate then. I will definitely be making this for the girls trip later this year!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the only red sangria recipe I use! The flavors are spot on. I don't add the sugar or cherries, but I do top off the drink with a little lemon/lime soda! Delicioso!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: If I ever make this again, I'll follow some of the other reviewers suggestion and use rum instead of brandy. I thought the brandy was overwhelming and there was a faint bitterness to the total taste. Maybe I'm just not a sangria person!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! I tripled the recipe as I made this for a big party and it was a huge hit. It is by far the best sangria I have ever had. The only change I made was to omit the sugar and use 7-up instead of carbonated water. I also took the hint from other reviewers and added just 1/2 cup of peach schnapps to the tripled recipe. I think 1/2 cup per one recipe would have been too overpowering. The only complaint was why didn't I make more! There was not a drop left by the end of the night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria ever!! This is a keeper I will definitely make again. I made a double batch and it disappeared. The only changes I made to the recipe was I didn't have any lemon juice so I substituted pineapple juice from canned pineapple chunks and I used Ginger Ale instead of Club Soda. I also added additional fruit I had on hand which included apples, pineapple chunks, and oranges.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Skipped the sugar and used gingerale in place of the carb water. I added a little cherry juice and chunks of pineapple. Used cheap merlot for the wine. I am basing the 5 stars off of what hubs and my father in law had to say- they both love red wine and they both loved this. They were skeptical b/c Sangria is usually too sweet. Leaving the sugar out worked for them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG....this is the BEST sangria ever!! I made it for a party, everyone loved it and constantly being asked to bring it to the next party or people asking for the receipe. The only thing I did differently was omitted the sugar completely and used gingerale instead of carbonated water. If you prefer an even less sweet drink then go with the carbonated water. Perfect everytime.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SOOOO good! I wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ding ding ding ding ... we have a winner! My wife, daughter, and daughter-in-law are big sangria fans - especially in the summer. I made this over the weekend, and it was a huge hit. I didn't have limes or cherries so I substituted a frozen margarita mix for the lemonade concentrate. That gave it the lime flavor, and I don't think we missed the cherries. Other than that I followed the recipe exactly using the club soda instead of ginger ale. Great recipe! We'll be doing it again. Thanks HJACOBY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked it ok but no one else at my party did. I've got it coming out my ears. Oh well. Guess I don't have Sangria lovers around.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i made this for a graduation party. i doubled the recipe and it was gone before i knew it. truly the best i've had in a while and easy to make. i should have quadrupled it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy,delicious,will make again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh this goes down so smoothly! Too smoothly??? :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is excellent. However, if you don't use up all the Sangria the first day, be sure to remove the citrus. The peels make it bitter the second day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with a friend for the 4th. What a hit! Our guys loved it also. We didn't change a thing except to add more fruit and left out the sugar. We also couldn't wait it to drink it over night, but it was still delicious! Maybe the good wine was the trick to that?? Anyway, thanks for the recipe. It will get good use and make many people happy :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this with different fruit but stayed very close to the original recipe. Everyone loved it and it was soon gone. Great summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nothing not to to like about this recipe...it's sangria at its best. Do let the fruit steep in the wine mixture as long as possible (I did overnight), as it really enhances the overall flavor of the sangria. Thanks HJOCBY for submitting this recipe; it's a winner!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was a big hit at a recent grad party. I used *cheap* red wine and tossed in whatever random frozen fruit I had in the freezer (a berry blend, plus strawberries), in addition to the lemons, limes, and oranges. I left out the maraschino cherries and ran out of lemon juice on my second batch, so I just added more OJ. Instead of carbonated water, I used Sierra Mist. Yummy, and made a ton, too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the easiest, delicious drink recipe I've ever made. I made it as the recipe states the first time and it was delicious. Then I started playing around, this is the beauty of this recipe: you can swap out things and get a completely different flavor. I now use frozen limeade instead of lemonade, I add the full bottles of liquor instead of half, and a lot of fruit.
