It's great after it's chilled a bit in the fridge, but it's FANTASTIC after it's "cured" for 24 hours... it's hard though :) I usually fill a glass 3/4 full then top off with either Mountain Dew, Sierra Mist, or a fruity pop for a little fizz. Just watch it, it sneaks up on you :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful. Easy to take basic recipe and adapt to whatever you have on hand. I used 2 bottles of Mikes "Lite" hard lemonade instead of the lemonade. My favorite version is with fresh peaches and schnapps. For the fall, I like to use finely minced apples.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe just ommitted carb water and sugar and used ginger ale before serving. I also used Lambrusco instead of a dry red wine. I also put apples in mine. A huge hit though, loved it!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted a sangria recipe for a special picnic I made for my husband, who LOVES sangria. Me, not so much...until now! It was just delicious, not too sweet or too tangy, just perfect. He wants me to make it every weekend. This is the first sangria I've ever had that I like. I made according to directions except I used raspberries instead of cherries, eliminated the sugar and used Sprite instead of carbonated water per other reviewers' suggestions. I also quartered my fruit and let everything but the sprite sit in a pitcher overnight in the fridge. Will be making a double batch next time! Thanks so much for this great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh gosh! I was so nervous to make this recipe because I wanted it to be perfect for my friends that were coming over. I followed the recipe exactly, leaving out the sugar and using ginger ale. I put it together yesterday morning. We just did the sampling and it is amazing. Not too sweet and doesn't taste like nasty alcohol. My disappointment? I don't think I made enough batches. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious. Was very difficult not the drink the entire pitcher myself.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I used Rioja wine, added peach schnapps substituted fresh strawberries in place of the fresh orange, skipped the added sugar and used ginger ale instead of carbonated water. Next time, I would skip the peach schnapps and lemonade concentrate, too - just didn't need that much sweetness for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served this at a party and it was a hit. I left out the cherries and carbonated water, it was just right the way it was. We used Lambrusco, it's a great, soft red wine with a hint of fizz. Delicious! As some others stated, be careful! It sneaks up on you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: People who snub this recipe as inauthentic are right ...real sangria is the cheapest booze, mixed with half-rotten fruit, intended to get you drunk cheap. Add a bunch of sugar to hide awfulness, and serve cold and fast to get the party started! American sangria recipies are much better, and far more refined. This one is a great starter! Everyone should try different add-ons. I hate brandy, so I used spiced rum instead. I've also sloshed a little Cointreau in before. I've added pomegranate juice, pomegranate seeds, blood orange slices, blackberries, cherries and even ginger ale (reduce the sugar if you try that.) Sangria is a great chance to try some unusual fruits to jazz up the look if nothing else; just stay away from overbearing flavors.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I had several "partial bottles" of light rum, dark rum, triple sec and added them all. I also added some pomegranate schnapps...yummy! An easy recipe to tweak!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome Sangria! So drinkable!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made this for our Memorial Day party and I couldn't resist sampling early :). Never had Sangria so I'm not sure what this is supposed to taste like...but it's pretty darn good!! Hubby and I are sure enjoying it! Maybe there won't be any left for our guests hehe. Made the recipe as written using Cabernet and a sweet red wine, no sugar but dumped in the entire jar of cherries, and ginger ale (I prefer my drinks a little sweeter). I did as one of the other reviewers suggested and removed the citrus fruits the next day but left the cherries in-yum! Nice recipe that I see could be easily tweaked for personal preferences. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Incredible! We loved this recipe! Used Trentare 33 red wine ($6/bottle @ Trader Joe's), which was perfectly dry for this recipe. Left out the sugar, cherries, and carbonated water. I didn't have frozen lemonade concentrate, so I used an extra 1/4 cup of fresh lemon juice. Served over ice. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO YUMMY!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was truly awesome stuff! Read through the reviews and made only one or two tweaks...left out the sugar, allowed guests to add ginger ale as opposed to carbonated water to their own glasses per their own taste, and sliced up some strawberries, blackberries and apples to add to the citrus. Tossed in some frozen grapes to each glass to act as ice cubes and there you have it. I was having a paella party (try the Paella I recipe incidentally, you won't be disappointed in that one either) and even the men drank this as opposed to beer. Only mistake was not quadrupling the batch, made only as double and it was gone in no time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a sangria taste test at my house one weekend (I made 3 different ones) and this recipe got first place. Here's what I did: 1. I did't measure the brandy, I poured enough to cover the fruit and let it sit for 36 hours. 2. I used merlot 3. I did NOT use sugar or cherries 4. I used Diet 7-up instead of carbonated water/ginger ale. I will make this again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm personally not a sangria fan, but this was very well liked by friends & family. Put it in a big beverage dispenser and made a frozen ice ring of OJ, wine and club soda w/ fresh fruit in it to keep it cold while in dispenser - looked very nice!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made exactly as written with the exception that we added a sliced apple. It was delicious! Very refreshing! A definite keeper for us.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy to make and oh so yummy!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our super bowl party last year. I doubled the recipe and still ended up having to make 4 more (double) batches. It is now the most requested think I make for parties. I used much more fruit and dumped in the entire jar of maraschino cherries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not care for this recipe. Followed the receipe to the letter. It is much to dry and mich too strong. I made this for a dinner party and my guests couldnt finish their drinks. Embarrassing and very dissapoining.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy. So delicious. I do recommend waiting to add citrus fruit until 3-4 hours before serving. If you leave the fruit in overnight, the Sangria can take on an acidic taste from the fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome awesome recipe....let a bucketful sit in the fridge all night...was a HIT...and when the bucket was emptied, refilled it with brandy and orange juice and fruits..brandy that tastes good is dangerous :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A-MAZ-ING Sangria! Easy to make and tasty to drink. I do recommend leaving the carbonated water on the side for people to add as they please. I will definitely be making this again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very forgiving recipe if you don't have everything on hand. Changed it up a bit to make it similar to the sangria I drink at my favorite tapas place. Used apples and oranges as the only fruits, no sugar, ginger ale for bubbles and I used one bottle of Merlot and one bottle of bottled Sangria wine (I doubled the recipe). I just made some for tomorrow night and I'm "sampling" it. It's really good but I can tell it's strong!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not bad...but I will not make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome. I used ginger ale instead on club soda and everyone LOVED it!!!!! SOOOOOO Good!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a girls only dinner party and it was a huge hit! I used peach schnapps and rum. I cut up all the fruit and let it sit overnight in all the liquids (except the wine). An hour before serving I added the wine (I used a cheap Merlot) and since there was no room left in the serving bowl, I left out the ginger ale and let people add it to their cups along with some ice if they wanted. Refrigerate everything the night before, including the wine, and it will stay nice and cold. Will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fresh squeezed lemon juice 1 bottle of Rioja wine (Spanish) 1/4 cup Grand Marnier instead of 1/2 cup triple sec No cherries 2 cups Ginger ale instead of water. Let sit for min. 6hr

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria! I was able to make this using bourbon because that's what I had on hand. It didn't take away from it at all. Delicious drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hands down one of the best Sangrias I have ever had in my life. Tip, be sure to make the night before so it has a chance to ferment and add the carbonated water before serving it (to the jug), I used Ginger Ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish!!! And potent! I used pineapple juice instead of orange juice and added a 1/3 cup of Cointreau and it was just right for me!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Jungle juice for grown-ups!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria for a party with co-workers. They LOVED it (a couple even overindulged!) and I'm now required to bring it to every party. I don't use any sugar, but I do add fresh sliced ginger. I would say the longer it sits, the better it gets. Mine sits for a minimum of 12 hrs. I leave seltzer and Gosling's ginger beer to the side of the sangria pitcher, but many prefer it straight. When its not 25-50% diluted with seltzer or the like, take care-its pretty strong!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish! Followed recipe, though I omitted the sugar, and used ginger ale instead of carbonated water. Everyone loved it! Thank you for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Instead of the sugar (simple sugar) and carbonated water I like the diet ginger ale. I also add some of the maraschino cherry juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this Sangria and loved it! Made it for Christmas and it was a big item that went fast! I posted the photo of it in a pitcher!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Seemed a bit bland, even after refrigerating overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A 5-star recipe! Most sangria is too sweet for me, but this one, made with club soda and no white sugar, is perfect. Even my wine-snob guests loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: best recipe that ever happened to cheap red wine, excellent mix, doesn't need sugar added, other fruits like apples are good in it, careful - kicks your a--

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really was great! It was my first time making Sangria, and I chose this based on the many rave reviews. I tripled it to fit in my beverage server nicely, and I ran out of triple sec the third go round, so I added more OJ and let it sit overnight. I will say that it tasted great immediately, so I"m not sure if it sitting overnight is really that crucial to this recipe. I took the fruits out in the morning, and added fresh fruit prior to serving with some ginger ale. Next time I will try Blackberry brandy, as I had some last weekend and it was amazing in the Sangria. ** Be warned: this is very strong if you do not dilute with ginger ale or club soda. The way I made it was wonderful! I will make this again and again. It's the best recipe I"ve found.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing and easy. If you want a really sweet sangria, use Stella Rosa wine. Yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for the first time during the Christmas holidays. I followed the recipe strictly. At the end of the evening guests were asking for more although I had doubled it. Great! Everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria ever. Original is too sweet for my liking, so I don't use the sugar at all. Other than that it's perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: instead of the cherries and lemon I cut up peaches, strawberries, and oranges soaked them in rum over night and added them to the drink. turned out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made for a party, and it was a hit. I used Appleton rum instead of brandy. I bought a very very large bottle of cheap burgundy wine. It gets better with age. We had the leftovers 5 days latter, and it was better! I also mixed with ginger ale instead of club soda and omitted the sugar. Why ginger ale, because it's Christmas. I already made three more pitchers for Christmas eve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was a huge hit at my BBQ! Used 7Up for the bubbles! YUMMMMM

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sneaky sneaky. This has a wonderful fruity flavor, but it will kick back. Beware - it's pretty addictive. I've made this recipe "by the book" and it's amazing. However, I was in a jam and had everything except the lemon & orange. I left them out. It wasn't nearly as pretty, but it was still quite tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have not even let this sit overnight yet, and it is DARN GOOD! I can't wait to see what it tastes like after 'mellowing' overnight. I have a bottle of pinot grigio in the fridge, so I'll be making a white sangria with this recipe next. I did not have the frozen lemonade, I forgot to pick it up when I was at the store, so I doubled the Orange juice and so far, so GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Refreshing, easy and yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING. Ok so I was worried at first about the amount of alcohol in here but this sangria disappeared on us. I tripled the recipe for our party so I added 3 cans of gingerale to it. That put the cherry on the cake. Make sure to mix it from time to time because the brandy tends to go down the bowl which makes the last cups very strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This a very tasting drink and looks so pretty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I experimented a little with mine and added 1 cup of frozen mixed berries, it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't follow this recipe exactly, more like I used it as a guideline, with great results! I used the lemonade concentrate, orange juice, and triple sec as a base. For everything else I just used what I had, lambrusco (not a dry red), chardonnay (to make up for the sweet red), and Yukon Jack instead of brandy (that's just what I had). I didn't add any additional sugar, but it didn't need it! I added a splash of seltzer water to each glass when served. It was a big hit!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was an excellent Sangria. Word of caution: goes down a little too smoothly!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is always go to recipe for parties! I can never seem to make enough. I never add the sugar and I use Ginger Ale instead of carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very very tasty! I did one for Thanksgiving and it was a hit. I'm gunna do one for this coming Superbowl.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely a party pleaser! Made this for a bridal shower and everyone kept asking for more! Great recipe although I didn't use the sugar or club soda. Must sit for at least 12hrs

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: my first time making sangria, EVERYONE loved it! Thank You! I did skip on the white sugar and the carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A big hit with all! I didn't add carbonated water. Used strawberries, peaches, blackberries, tangerines in addition to other ingredients

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is AMAZING!! We doubled the recipe and made it almost exactly as listed, except we added gingerale instead of club soda right before serving. It was incredible and will definitely use it for all our parties. Thank you!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and very very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a halloween party and it was super popular! I used cherry brandy and ginger ale instead of carbonated water. For the fruit I just used sliced up oranges and apples. Made it 24 hrs in advance and added ginger ale just before serving. I also heated up orange juice and lemonade concentrate on the stove with the sugar, just to get it to dissolve fully. Will definitely save this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The key is soaking the fruit overnight. Wow, was this good! I added 7-up instead of carbonated water and had rave reviews from all that tried it. Everyone came back for seconds and the 2 pitchers I made for girls night was completely gone. I quickly tried to whip up another batch, but obviously didn't have time to soak the fruit and it wasn't the same. Fantastic recipe...Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty, but darn these are STRONG!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added 2 cups diet ginger ale in lieu of optional carbonated water; added 4 cinnamon sticks. These changes made it 5*. Tried it without the ginger ale, and it was too tart for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic Sangria - made 24 cups according to recipe minus lemon juice - it was the hit of the party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: After having tasted and made about a thousand different Sangria's over the years, I have settled on this one as the best of the bunch. I typically add additional fruits like strawberries and pineapple, or whatever I have on hand. I like to make a double batch so we have enough for the weekend. Always a huge hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Sangria recipe I have used!! It really does help to refrigerate the sangria the night before. Also, adding gingerale instead of club soda intensifies the flavor! Great recipe to have!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for bbq party we had for my husband's birthday made a double batch.. with everything but the cherries everyone loved it best sangria recipe yet thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've tried many sangria recipes and this is the best - and most potent. Before we knew it all us ladies were giggling up a storm! Make a day ahead and it's even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! Will be my go to sangria recipe. Quadrupled the recipe - it all went.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! Was extremely popular at our open house. We used: burgundy wine, triple sec, fresca.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i made 5 gallons of this today for my bbq. i used a fifth of brandy and 2 gallon jugs of wine. i didnt use the triple sec i forgot it so i upped the orange juice because triple sec tastes like oranges. i used 7up since i already had it for the party. this was beautiful and all that was left was a 2 qt pitcher and everyone was very smiley.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and very pretty! I used gingerale and thought the taste was perfect for a BBQ on a hot summer day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this sangria at my wedding last month and it was a HUGE hit! Everyone loved it. I omitted the sugar and cherries, and used ginger ale instead of club soda. We made it the night before and let it sit overnight (a full 24 hours) before adding the ginger ale, it was absolutely perfect! We made 15 batches of both this red and another white sangria, and this one was gone before the end of the night! I will definitely be making it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never made sangria before. AWESOME recipe! Didn't have triple sec (so just substituted in more brandy) and didn't have lemonade concentrate (so just added in more lemon juice). Read the recipes that said it should really rest 24 hours and so I was a little concerned because I made it in the morning for an evening dinner party. Even with all those changes and letting it rest abour 8 hours, it turned out delicious! The whole pitcher was gone. Didn't add the carbonated water or the cherries- didn't care for them and the sangria still tasted great. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was excellent! I added sierra mist at the end, and not the water. I also added random fruits that I had in the house, so not everything in the list. It was great. Everyone enjoyed it and it was so easy to make!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a fantastic recipe! I subed the brandy for rum, triple sec for peach schnapps, used only 2/3 the sugar, and no carbonated water. Sweet enough, and potent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great. I modified it slightly by adding chopped asian pears and substituting Canada Dry Ginger Ale for the carbonated water. It was such a huge hit at the last party that we ran out so this time we're doubling up!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this one night for the pickiest of picky people and I was told it was "The Bomb". I had to make another batch while everyone was still here! Made exactly as written.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my birthday and all my guests were super happy with this drink. I made three times the amount!!! Yay!! Thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a favorite for summer BBQs and people always ask me to bring it. I don't have a specific wine I use - though I prefer a dry red and use less sugar, testing to taste. I use the citrus fruit as recommended by the recipe, but it would probably be great with green apples instead, as suggested by another reviewer. Because I like to keep it "dry" rather than sweet, I add carbonation with lemon-lime flavored seltzer water instead of 7up. This one is definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delish! I used Chianti for the red wine. Skipped the sugar, cherries and carbonated water. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is GREAT! I only had about 6 hrs for this to sit in the fridge and it was really good. I did not use cherries. When I served it I filled the glass with plenty of ice, put fresh lemon and lime slices in each glass added a few raspberries, blueberries and blackberries and topped it off with a splash of soda water. It looked as good as it tasted!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe! I made a white version using a moscato. This is a sweet wine so be careful, you may not need the added sugar and use club soda. I chopped the apples in cubes and soaked in the brandy overnight prior to making the sangria. What an added surprise for those who bit into them. I received many many compliments.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really IS the best Sangria I've ever had. I've made it 3 times in the last 3 weekends for friends and everyone (even white wine drinkers) really enjoyed it!! 1st time I made it pretty much to recipe - the 2nd time I didn't have any orange juice so fresh squeezed some and it was delicious. Never had the cherries - but it was great. And twice I didn't have the time for it to sit more than about 5 hours and it was still delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria recipe ever!! I have had authentic Sangria in Spain, and this is just like it, but it has a little something more and I love it! You can't go wrong with this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: very tasty!thanks a bunch! I used sliced oranges as well.I used a cab and it worked well

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty! So, I hate when people talk about how they changed everything in a recipe because then it's not really the recipe! I didn't have everything the recipe called for, so I did my best to replace with simliar items. I didn't have regular brandy, so I used cherry brandy. I didn't have triple sec, so I used Grand Mariner. I didn't have maraschino cherries, but I did have some sour cherries from Trader Joe's that I added. I let it sit about 30 hours. YUM! It was a hit! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it. Also omitted cherries and sugar and used diet sprite, added apples, which were very yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit. I made it exactly from the direction but added ginger ale instead of club soda. It was gone fast and I have already had two requests for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ohhh Yeahh, THIS is the ONE! Incredible! Bartended for over 20 years, yet THIS recipe just blew me away. Make it, LOVE it! No sugar used and also chilled all ingredients, added only some of the citrus fruit to sit then removed it and added more fruit just prior to serving. Added frozen grapes, as well as frozen berries just prior to party to keep cool, per another reviewer (GREAT IDEA, btw!) Also diced fresh peaches, apple, whatever ya got prior to serving. Ah-MAZ-ING! Thanks for this oh so yummy recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe. I also tweaked it a bit for a lighter sangria as an alternative. I use White Zin instead of Red wine, use apple, canned pinapple (with juice), and mango for the fruit. I use no sugar, and use ginger ale instead of soda water. It is great either way. Dark or light.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING!!! This recipe is a definite keeper! Was missing some ingredients so had to tweak it a little but it turned out delicious. I omitted the Brandy and instead of using the lemonade concentrate I added extra fresh squeezed lemon juice and a little extra orange juice. Yummy. Thanks for sharing this fabulous recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I live in Spain and the one thing missing from this is a bit of cinnamon. add a few sticks in the pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic - very similar to the Sangria we had in Barcelona! Modifications I made: used blackberry brandy and omitted the lemon juice - thought that would make it too tart, saved the club soda and added it by the glass instead of mixing it in. This is my new favorite drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the BEST Sangria ever... highly recommended!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my future sister in laws bridal shower. At first seemed a little strong, but the longer it sits the better it is. I let the fruit soak for about 24 hrs, then took the fruit out that morning of the shower. At the shower I added fresh oranges, cherries, strawberries and ginger ale. I also skipped the sugar and instead of carbonated water I used ginger ale. IT WAS EXCELLENT! I was asked to make this for the bachelorette party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was skeptical about some of the ingredients (frozen lemonade!) but this was great!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was better than the so-called 4* restaurant we went to. Didn't add the cherries or carbonated water and it didn't need it! Wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: it's become a tradition with our friends. I can't have them over without making it or they think something is wrong. Very good! I just use boxed wine and it's very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummy. Made a huge batch so I multiplied by 3. I didn't use the lemon juice or the sugar. I let the fruit marinate in the mixture over night but removed all the citrus rinds the next morning. I then added fresh citrus fruit a few hours before serving. The drink received rave reviews. The next day I removed the citrus rinds and added blackberries, strawberries, apples, and a few peaches (just what I had in kitchen) I served it with a few pieces of fruit in the glass, some ice, and a splash of ginger ale. (Subbed Sierra Mist when we ran out of ginger ale) We ended up finishing it off that second night. Not bad for 6 mommies!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch for my book club, 4 girls. It was gone very quickly! I made it exactly as the recipe states, just left out the sugar. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO DELISH!!! I followed the recipe ALMOST exactly (will get to that in a bit). I doubled this recipe and it was SUCH A HIT at my 'Fiesta' themed party! Now, for the adjustments/additions I made. In reading other reviews, I adjusted as follows: I used an entire frozen lemonade container (tube). I did not add any fruits (no sliced lemon, no sliced lime, etc) until it had been marinating in the fridge for about 12 hours. Then 4 hours before serving, I added diced apple (1 red, 1 green), diced strawberries, diced lemon, diced lime, and blackberries. Instead of carbonated water, as I poured each drink I topped it off with a little Ginger Ale (in some cases I used Fresca, which was my personal favorite) and put a few extra blackberries and diced apples as a garnish. It was light, refreshing, and DELICIOUS!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this recipe!!! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch of this recipe and it was gone in a half an hour. They LOVED it! I added a few strawberries and omitted the sugar and it was amazing. Just made a double batch for dinner (it is WAY better when it sits for at least 24 hours)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe ... but I would not recommend putting the fruit in over night as I found that the fruit soaked up a lot of the sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Ginger Ale instead of triple sec and Arbor Mist Pomegranate Berry Pinot Noir for the wine...everyone loved it! I also didn't bother with the maraschino cherries or the carbonated water. This was a great recipe =D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just to add a little kick I added another 1/2 cup of brandy and instead of sparkling water add 1 bottle of champagne. That mixture will make everyone forget it's summer. Try it, you'll like it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: u can also use champagne, here in spain is fantastic and expensiver than the red wine sangria. but of course the color change a bit, and add some peach in cubes is wonderful eat them with all this flavour

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I skipped the cherries, used a whole can of frozen lemonaide and substituted gingerale for the club soda. I did not add sugar - I added other sweet things :) Most Excellent!! I will freeze any leftovers, if any...., and make slushes :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I skipped the cherries, used a whole can of frozen lemonaide and substituted gingerale for the club soda. I did not add sugar - I added other sweet things :) Most Excellent!! I will freeze any leftovers, if any...., and make slushes :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: no sugar and used ginger ale

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious Sangria. I loved it all throughout. One small change I had to make was to deduct the triple sec (didn't have any), and adding Ginger Ale. I had a BBQ for Canada Day, and this Sangria flew like nothing else. I had to prepare a second batch. A total keeper, thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a graduation party and tripled the recipe. There were no leftovers and lots of smiles. Delicious Sangria, thanks :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! We used diet ginger ale in place of the water/sugar and added apple slices and peach schnapps (per NANAWAG's suggestion). Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: How refreshing! I omitted the lemon juice and triple sec and subsituted peach schnapps. I did quadruple the recipe and used only 1/2 cup sugar and a whole container of frozen lemon concentrate. I used more brandy and peach schnapps than listed. I will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious...I doubled the recipe and served it at a summer party, and it was a huge hit. Other than doubling it, I didn't change the recipe, other than leaving out the cherries. It is strong, but you won't realize how strong at first. It is so good, you may be tempted to drink it too quickly. Very, very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really great recipe. My wine obsessed daughters really enjoyed it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used 7up instead of sugar and carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sangria! Sangria! is the Best of the Best!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent drink! We made a double batch and it was so delicious! We added more fruit than called for, adding pineapple, grapes and orange slices. We also used ginger ale instead of the carbonated water and only used 1/4 cup of sugar for the whole batch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tripled this recipe for a big bbq party. I used half blackberry brandy and 1/2 regular brandy. I used a red zin and had to end up adding some sugar to the recipe. Next time I won't add the extra lemon juice or lemon slices. I think it might have helped to make it a little too sour. I wasn't sure if I should let this sit out all night without being in the refrigerator but my container was too big to sit in the fridge so I took the advice of another review and stuck it in a ice chest with some ice overnight. Next time I might try apricot brandy because I like my sangria a little more fruity tasting and I don't think blackberry brandy is that much different than regular brandy. I forgot to add the sparkling water. I agree with other post. It doesn't need it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent flavor, easy recipe. We used Carlo Rossi Burgundy and Cointreau instead of Triple Sec. Delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made exactly as directed. Used a Spanish Cabernet and because it was pretty dry, I added the optional sugar. Made about 16 hours in advance and it was perfect by the pool the next day. I don't usually drink sangria but my friend is a fan and she said this was the best she has ever had. And I enjoyed it too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The sangria was a hit at our barbecue. I didn't have any brandy, but used rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We liked this sangria as is, but LOVED it with the tweaks we made the second time we made it. We used orange mango juice, and that gave it a great flavor. We used blackberry flavored brandy and cut the amount in half since the original recipe was too strong for us. We substituted limeade and lime juice for the lemon juice and lemonade and thought it was so much better this way. We used cheap Spanish Rioja wine and did not use the sugar. Definite thumbs up from us, and we'll be making this all summer long!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: can't wait to try this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had my girlfriends over and EVERYONE requested the recipe! I used a lemon/lime soda instead of carbonated water! Delicious!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: just served this last night at my husband's 40th birthday last night and everyone loved it! tripled the recipe, added apple instead of lime, and cubed it...would chop the orange and lemon next time so its easier to eat. substituted limoncello for the triple sec, and a mixture of southern comfort and slivovitz (plum brandy) for the brandy. served it in 1 gallon mason jars with ladles which looked beautiful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I received rave reviews when I brought this to a sangria party recently. The only modification I did was used Sprite and I did add about a cup of sugar...I just prefer wine more sweet. Highly recommend this recipe, as everyone who tasted it thought I bought it somewhere instead of making it:).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A great sangria! We followed the recipe, but omitted the sugar and used ginger ale instead of club soda and it was a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE!! I halved the sugar, used diet ginger ale instead of club soda, & added strawberries then let it all soak together overnight. It was amazing! Next time I will omit the strawberries or add them right before serving because they didn't hold up well over time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic left out the optional items and added fresh apples, strawberries and grapes. Will be making this all summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE LOVE LOVE! I use the Gallo pinot noir (the 1.5L) and double all the ingredients except for the sugar, which I only use 1/4 cup. I omit the cherries and the carbonated water and its heavenly. Let is sit overnight.... VERY important. I have made it for the last three get togethers and with all that Sangria its gone by two hours in. If I had a bigger pitcher I would make even more! Delicious :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never made sangria before but, as other reviewers noted, this is an excellent recipe! It is strong but you won't notice by the flavor. I used a $10 (on sale for $7) shiraz. I would't recommend using the least expensive wine becuase there is a lot of wine flavor through the fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this sangria for several bbqs now and it is always hit. I usually bulk up the recipe by adding some carlo rossi sangria after i already multiply the recipe by 5. Usually add some strawberries too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: As collectors of fine wines we generally sneer at wine "cocktails" or anything that alters the wine. But I wanted to try something a little different, and convinced my wine snob husband to do the same. I made this exactly as directed, the only difference being that I didn't see the need to add soda to the drink. I can see that if one is not accustomed, adding a little soda could make it go down easier. I made it a day ahead, and we had it as a weekend cocktail--very tasty! I reminded my husband that I would order something similar at a bar, served in a tall glass with crushed ice, a straw, & garnished with a cherry or to, and happily pay 8 bucks. In fact, I think that's how I'll serve it in the future. Great summertime cocktail!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria I have ever had. Make it ahead of time so all the flavors can blend. Addicting.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times and shared the recipe with others. Everyone LOVES it as do I!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. I used Merlot because that is the bottle of red wine I don't like and ginger ale. Loved it and my guests did too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely the best Sangria I've had. However, be forewarned.. this stuff is potent. One glass will have you tipsy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I usually skip the sugar and use diet sprite or 7up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: KILLER!!! Left out the sugar and used gingerale. OMG after one glass I was feeling fine. Great flavour....the brandy gives it a great kick. Making this for a party on Saturday and I do not anticipate any leftovers! Thanks for sharing! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for girls night out and it was a hit. I doubled the recipe. A few people thought it was REALLY potent and decided to switch to my Tropical Martini's. Those who were REAL drinkers enjoyed the robust taste. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I added chopped apples and lime juice instead of a lime. I also used less brandy than it called for. I did not add sugar. I doesn't need any sugar! So good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was easy,fast and wonderful!! Thanks for the recipe - it worked great with Easter dinner and spring time on the way I will be making it more & more!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was a little skeptical that this recipe could really be that good, but it is! Very easy and so tasty. You don't need to try anything else.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good but still wish it were stronger. :) I used: 1.) 2 buck chuck - merlot 2.) Peach Shnapps instead of triple sec 3.) Cut the sugar out completely 4.) Added pears, apples, strawberries 5.) Had some 7-up on hand for guests 6.) Let the juice and fruit sit overnight Next time I'll add more brandy and peach schnapps. yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: strong but yummy, will use some apples nxt time also

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: You've got to double or even triple this recipe if having a party. I spent all weekend making Sangria. It was THAT good! Also, I left out the sugar completely.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: There's only one problem with this, if you follow the recipe exactly it goes very quickly. Don't bother making it unless you double it! I add the sugar and just add the club soda when I pour it into a glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everybody loved this! I am going to make it again this weekend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best sangria I have ever drank! I was sad when it was all gone. I mixed it with the ginger ale and it made it nice and smooth going down. I used fresh squeezed orange and lemon juice and also added a little bit of lime juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: BEST SANGRIA EVER!!! LOVE IT! I do make alittle change, I use a can of sliced pineapple and use the juice with/in place of the orange juice. I also throw in a ton of fruit. Strawberries, pomegranite, pineapple plus the oranges, lemon, and lime. And I used the advice of others and top it off with a splash of Gingerale. Thank you for such a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I consider myself a Sangria "Critic" and I can say this recipe is wonderful-perhaps the best I've ever had (move over Olive Garden)! I cut back the lemons and limes by half and removed them after a few hours vs overnight (otherwise it gets very sour tasting). I have used limeaid (instead of lemonaid-can use either), always use gingerale (vs sugar and tonic water) and **blackberry brandy** (my favorite ingredient so I add about 1/2 C more). This is fabulous anytime of yr and great "on the rocks". My family & friends beg me to make for ALL gatherings now....so I always double the recipe. You will love this recipe even if you don't modify anything...enjoy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Da bomb!! Didn't leave anything out. This stuff is strong - the club soda helps and I like it better a little fizzy. Have made this 3 times - always a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it with club soda and no sugar and a cheap bottle of dry wine. Still a hit at the party. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this regularly for parties and it never lasts!!! I usually only use about half of the sugar though, sometimes less, depending on my wine. All in all, this is an absolutely delicious recipe, and an oh so beautiful color! Don't forget to eat the fruit out of it the next morning. Mm mm good! Sangria is traditionally a recipe from Spain (yumm...) and, this recipe is pretty accurate. The only real difference between this and a legitimate Spanish sangria is the sweetness, which probably comes from the addition of the lemonade concentrate (and also the sugar, which I've already mentioned, but nobody said it was illegal to like your booze sweetened!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last weekend for a birthday bbq. I made mine in an iced tea jug the night before adding everything but the optional carbonated portion. Then I took 6 ice cube trays and dispensed half of the mixture into the trays. The following morning, I popped the frozen cubes back into the tea jug, added a can of sprite and gave it a stir! It was very yummy but I do have one complaint. While I was inside getting all the food ready to serve, it disappeared! I only got to have one glass :( Will be making often this summer! Thank you

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best sangria ever! The only I've ever had that compares was in Madrid at Zaharas. I did away with the club soda and used whatever fruit was handy (mostly apples, pears, and oranges). If you can let this sit overnight you'll be in for an even tastier treat the next day. I scoop out the old fruit and dice up fresh for the wine glasses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fair. It was expensive and took a long time to make, for a fair result.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really good and definitely best done a day ahead. I skip the sugar and use ginger ale or sprite instead of carbonated water (less chance of the sugar just falling to the bottom). I also skip the maraschino cherries as I don't care for them and they aren't very authentic. Cheap wine is fine here (in fact it's encouraged!). I often use the jugs of burgundy that you can get for around $10.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this out Friday night for a game night at a friends house. They like wine but have never had Sangria before, my friends loved this. I will definitely be making this in the future especially considering a glass at a bar is about $12 here and most of these ingredients I keep on hand anyway!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum. These are great! The only thing better would be fresh squeezed but this makes so quick and also goes so quick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made enough for 75! Omitted the sugar and used 7up... it was so DELICIOUS! Every drop.....gone....was a huge hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Careful on the frozen lemonade - measure 1/3 cup separately.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: very tasty. one batch is enough.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a definite 5 star recipe!!! However, my husband and I made a few changes/substitutions. We used Pinot Noir instead of dry red wine, Appleton Rum VX instead of brandy, pink frozen lemonade concentrate instead of regular and ginger ale instead of the carbonated water. Oh and Grand Marnier (triple sec). Like some of the other reviews….it is very…very important to let rest a minimum of a day. The only issue we had was that we could only make one pitcher. Therefore we are on our way to replenish our ingredients and buy a bigger container.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made several sangria recipes and this is my favorite. I made it for a party and it was a hit. I also continued to have it for the next two days (I made a bit too much), and it still tasted good. I love this recipe. I don't use brandy because I don't like the taste of brandy. Sometimes I throw in the ingredients without measuring, and it tastes good regardless because all of the ingredients work well. I usually leave the cherries out too. I just thought it was a lot of fruit and they weren't necessary for me. Instead of carbonated water, I add ginger ale sometimes. Be sure to add it at the last minute though if you want bubbles.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is fantastic! We tripled this for a party of about 12 people and had to make another batch when it ran out. DEFINITELY use the sugar, but we didn't change a thing and it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served this at a recent dinner party, and it was a huge hit, everyone asked for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times and always use the cheapest dry red wine I can find. It always turns our great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for mom's night out and had to make another pitcher everyone loved it so much. It is definitely tastier if you let it soak overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made mine without Brandy simply because I did not have any handy. It was still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: made a huge amount for our new years eve bash. Very popular drink, but wish I would have picked a different wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Sangria! We've tried several Sangrias around town to great disappointment, but this recipe was a huge success. Saving it in my Recipe Box for another batch soon :-).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best! What a hit at our Christmas party! It was exactly like what we had in New York in Little Italy. Be prepared to have ingredients for a second batch on hand!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe, but a little on the sweet side, even without the sugar. I put in only 1/6 of a cup of lemonade concentrate and eliminated he maraschino cherries as well as the sugar. I found the fruit slices overwhelmed my pitcher, but I like them in the glasses. I fished the majority of the fruit of the pitcher before serving. I then sliced fresh lemon and orange slices and placed them in each glass and placed one on the rim of each glass as a beautiful garnish. Sadly, they made it very difficult to drink and all fruit ended up in the glass. With these changes I was asked to make this cocktail for every family function. Only after a double batch can put up with my in-laws. : )

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would remove rinds on fruit because it will leave a bitter taste. I minus the sugar and lemon and used grenadine instead of the sugar.... Delish!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Yummy! This was a big hit at our New Year's party. We ran out and had to piece together another batch (I'm sure it wasn't as good, but at that point no one seemed to notice). As other reviewers suggested, I left out the sugar and cherries and added 7 UP at the last minute. I also added an apple and pear and let it sit overnight in the fridge so the flavors all mingled together.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: very tasty and good - it really packs a punch! Tell your guests to sip slowly and savor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this for New Years and it was great. I added mixed berries. also instead of carbonated water.I had different flavored sparkling waters(key lime, lemon, etc )so everyone could customize their own glass. It was a big hit!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have been going to spain or the past 15 years and this tastes as good as the sangria in spain. Great recipe thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a double batch of this on Christmas Eve (2010). I should have made more because it was gone very quickly! Made just a few small changes: used rum instead of brandy because that's what we had on hand, left out the sugar, and added diet lemon lime soda instead of the carbonated water right before serving. It did need to be a little sweeter in my opinion, so I added a couple tablespoons of splenda. Might just have to make this again for New Year's!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: If I could give this 10 stars I would! This makes the best sangria ever. I made this almost exactly true to the recipe the first time, and then made a few changes the next time to suit our tastes. I used limeade instead of lemonade as we found it a bit too lemony the first time. I added club soda instead of carbonated water right before serving and did not add sugar or cherries as it was plenty sweet enough. Another change I made was to add frozen grapes before serving to keep it cool and added 2 more oranges for more fruit to munch on. This is so good and refreshing on a hot summer day you will want to keeping drinking it but it hits you harder than you realize. We were already feeling it after the first glass, so be warned! :) Thank you so much for this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: FANTASTIC!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: big *h*i*t* with the familia! have to make a lot more next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've used this recipe several times over the past few years, but I realized this last time I've never rated it! It's so good I never have enough! For our wedding reception/housewarming, I made 4 batches and filled our pretty glass bev dispenser... it was gone in an hour flat!! Make WAYYY more than you think you'll need, I'm planning on 8 batches for our next party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Left out the cherries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit at party I made this for yesterday. I left it the fridge overnight. I didn't use sugar or club soda. I left it up to the guests if they wanted ice in their drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is good recipe. Made it for the first time and it was very good. My sweety liked it too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is no wonder why this has 5 stars it is amazing! If you have a big enough punch bowl, I recommend tripling the batch for larger groups. A single batch would be good for a group of 4 anymore and you want to double or triple it. I tripled it for a party of 15 and it was gone in about 2 hours. So if your party-goers enjoy sangria make a lot. The key is letting it sit over night in the fridge. Also one other tip to save on wine is Traders Joes – 2 Buck Chuck works great- I have used the Merlot, Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon and the Shriaz and got great result. (I do not recommend Chianti that other Sangria recipies call for, I think it always comes out too sweet.) I never have any leftovers of this when I have a party. I never use the sugar I think it would be too sweet and I always have two litters of club soda for people to add to it if they like, but I don’t mix it in the bowl. Also if you can take some of the lemon aid, maybe a little bit of water, some OJ and fruit and make an ice ring the night before to float in it so you don’t have to dilute it was ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I used ginger ale and no sugar, like others suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious, but quite strong, so watch out... it'll sneak up on you! i like adding extra oranges because i enjoy eating the fruit - they absorb alcohol and become quite potent in themselves, yet still taste great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never really liked Sangria before this recipe. It is wonderful! Thanks to Hjacoby!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it, Love it, Love it. My dad used to make this during the holidays and I have missed it since he has been gone!!! Thank you for bringing back such good memories for me and my family!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome and easy to make! I absolutely HATE red wine and had some left over from a party I hosted. BUT this recipe made it delicious! I used sugar and gingerale to counteract the dry bitterness of red wine. Def recommend this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: great recipe! no need to use expensive wine-- i used $3 wine from trader joe's. if you are a lightweight like me, you don't need to put in the brandy nor triple sec. tasted fine without it. experiment by putting in different fruit juices, such as cranberry, apple, grape, etc. sprite, or carbonated fruit sodas are a great addition, too (don't use diet). i skipped the cherries & didn't miss them. i recommend making a block of ice in a tupperware & put sliced fruit in there, and put it in the punch bowl. very pretty. i also recommend using organic fruits since you will be drinking the juices & oils from the skins. don't wanna risk any pesticide getting in your drink, as the fruits will be soaking for hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. I made mine the night before, and didn't add as much sugar. I think the key is leaving it overnight though since I quickly whipped up a second batch (by popular demand!) and it was good- but not AS good. Every time someone tried it they got a look of amazement. lol It was such a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I LOVED this sangria! I made it for our house warming party, and scaled it to 50 servings. I used a sweeter red wine, and cut out some of the sugar. I also added some apple pieces. Everyone LOVED it, even my sister and mother who don't drink. Great Recipe! Cant wait to make it again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My first time making sangria, but certainly won't be my last! I made this for a birthday party that I was hosting, and I made 4x the recipe but didn't have much left over! I'll definitely make this for our next party. Set it out in a punch bowl...it makes a beautiful presentation! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the ONLY Sangria recipe I use!!! FANTASTIC!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made using white wine because that was all I had on hand never the less it was great...turned out to be a hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This stuff was awesome! I omitted the sugar and cherries. Didn't need it at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is FABULOUS! I made a double batch for a party and even the "non drinkers" were drinking this! I omitted the sugar and filled 1/2 of the glass with sangria and topped it off with ginger-ale! It was a hit at my party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends from Spain love when I make this Sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is AMAZING!!! I made this over the summer when my mother in law came up from FL. The only change that I made was adding different fruits. I added blueberries, mango, pineapple, and strawberries. I used brandy, Ed Hardy Sangria red wine and peachtree schnapps!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I registered just to rate how great this recipe is! Omited the lemoade, sugar and carbonated water. It was delicious!! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Haha! Just won a Columbus day sangria contest! Was sure to give u the props:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe or some version of it, as it is a very flexible and forgiving recipe, tons of times. And it's always a huge it! The only thing I have never done was add the sugar. If you use a splash of sprite or gingerale it has plenty of sweetness. This has been dubbed by friends as "the hold sangria." Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I madee thisw recipe for a party of around 22 adults and we blew through 4 gallons in no time Was so awesome I received calls the next day for the recipe. May have another party just so I can make some more HUGE hit!! This is the recipe I have always been searching for and didn't have to go to the ends of the earth for ingredients! Used the gingerale instead of carbonated water. Great tip!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Gets no better than this. The perfect beverage to top off a Sunday afternoon. I've made it before and I'll make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow was a hit very citrus and colorful.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used what I had on hand. Used blackberry brandy, along with peach schnapps. Added in lemon, lime, apple, and pears. Let it sit for a good 24hr. I then used ginger ale instead of a lemon soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was incredible! I have a huge sweet tooth but didn't need any sugar at all. I did accidently dump in too much lemonaid concentrate but I think this is a very flexible recipe that you can have fun with. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definately some of the best sangria I've had. I made this for a family gathering and everyone loved it. Next time I'm going to let it sit for two nights instead of one because I had some leftover and drank it the next day and it was even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is very similar to my mother's. Love it!!! Highly recommend this as a good base recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolute best recipie EVER! I made this for a party hosted by my latino friend. I was so nervous as I was the only non-latino at this party. OMG, it was a success. I am asked to bring this to every party she host now. Thank you, thank you! I made it once and let it only soak a couple of hours. It was good, but the key is to let it sit overnight!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: all I can say is yumm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this recipe for my BBQ that I had today. It was GREAT! I read all the reviews before making it and these are the changes I made. Im not a cherry person so did not include cherries. I used fresh squeezed orange and lemon juices when it called for that. i also used clementines instead of oranges, the flavor is so much better I think. I only used 3 rounded tbsp sugar as Im not a sweet drink person. I added 2 fresh nectarines and 2 cups fresh pineapple. I used sprite instead of club soda or gingerale as I had omitted some of the sugar. This was truly an excellent Sangria and several people insisted on the recipe before they left. It was a serious hit. You wont be dissappointed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome.... I was making this for a large group and had a hard time figguring out how much alcohol to buy. Here is what I bought to make enough to make 5 times the recipe (30 servings). 4L jug of Carlo Rossi Sangria wine, 750 ml bottel of Blackberry Brandy, 750 ml bottel of triple sec, and a couple of 2 liter bottles ginger ale. I used all the wine and most of the brandy and triple sec. I added the ginger ale before serving and only used about a 1/2 a bottle (wanted to add more so that it would serve more people but the taste testers said it was great and not to add any more). I did not use sugar and made it the night before. I should have made the serving for 60 or even more because it went fast. Will absolutly make again, and I dont even like wine!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is awesome....very potent tho!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great. I used less sugar than it called for and added some other frozen fruits (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We have made this countless times and everyone always loves it! I don't always use all of the fruit that it calls for, and I tend to skip the sugar but instead add Sprite - though I have followed the recipe to the letter, and it is great either way - just personal preference on taste. Definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE this recipe! I made the recipe as is & it's fabulous.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe. The second and third time I made it I made some modifications: I eliminated the optional sugar and poured 1/8 cup of the maraschino cherry juice into the mixture. I used 3 cans of 7-Up instead of carbonated water, and floated 1 quart of rainbow sherbert on the top. I colored some water in oleo tubs and froze it for ice. Very pretty; very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this sangria twice now for summer cookouts and it is gone in literally minutes. Definitely make it the night before...just be carefu because it does sneak up on you ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OK. It wasn't as sweet and light as I would've liked it to be.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Maybe it was just us, because this recipe got so many rave reviews, but we found it to be way too strong for our liking. I think I'll make it again and cut back a little on the brandy and triple sec. *FOLLOW UP* - I made this recipe again, this time using rum instead of the brandy. I cut back just a tad on the rum and triple sec, and used the ginger ale in place of the carbonated water. HUGE improvement. I would say this is now a 4 star recipe. Also, do not like maraschino cherries so I used strawberries instead.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is really good- i make white zinfandel/rose sangria with this recipe- u can also put less brandy to make it less stronger and play around with the lemon juice and sprite/ginger ail instead of carbonated water

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was excellent!! I tripled the recipe for a cookout, but did not add any sugar, cherries or carbonated beverage. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: GREAT sangria recipe! I have adapted the fruits some and use nectarines, apples, and oranges in the mix and add a slice of lemon to the edge of the glass so that the citrus rides with every sip. I have used this recipe to make sangria for a lot of summer parties and everyone just loves it. Allowing to sit overnight/over 12 hours is definitely key. I have adapted the recipe slightly, and this is what I've found really brings out all the flavors. I mix the fruit with the brandy, sugar, and triple sec 2 days beforehand. Then the next day I add the orange juice, lemon juice, lemonade concentrate, and red wine. Then I mix the carbonated water individually for each drink the next day. Makes for a wonderfully refreshing summer drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple, easy, delicious. The hardest part was deciding on a good dry red wine. I would suggest making a double batch if you're having friends over because it goes really FAST!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Sangria I've ever had. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: grat i add 1/2 cup of coconut rum....yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a party favorite. Perfect blend of flavors and adds sweetness to the dry wine. Make a double recipe b/c it will disappear fast!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy, tasty, sneaky! Love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: oh my! this is the best sangria ever! better make 2 batches because you're gonna want extra! i used homeade peach brandy in mine and it was wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was ok, but I felt it had the flavor of the orange & lemon rinds which made it bitter. It was better with served with ginerale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe exactly, turned out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a dinner party and everyone loved it! I used orange curacao instead of triple sec and used only one can of ginger ale without sugar. We had everyone asking for seconds and more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe is a real hit!!! I followed some reviewers recommendations - use cherry brandy and add raspberries... I also skewered fruit and garnished each drink before serving. everyone love it!! I trippled the recipe for 6 people and it was just enough

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Used peach schnapps instead of the triple sec, ginger ale instead of carbonated water, and left out the cherries. Made the recipe for approximately 20 guests. Super-easy preparation the night before. It was a huge hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! Brilliant! I tweaked it slightly, made double the amount in the recipe but added to the mix: 4 chopped oranges, 2 chopped apples, half a litre strawberries and a little gingerale (prior to serving) Let all the ingredients soak overnight in the fridge. Everyone loved it! :-D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe! Peach schnapps instead of triple sec is good. It can also make a great take along to a potluck. Make in a ziploc bag the night before, put in a cooler, then pour into a pitcher with a little ice and club soda at your destination.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Like most people, I dropped the sugar and carbonated water in favor of ginger ale, and let it sit for a day. I made a double batch, and it was gone long, long before the wine, beer, and margaritas were.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe twice, and it turned out great both times. The first time I followed the recipe but used rum instead of brandy (because I had it on hand). I also added a pear to the fruit mix and left out the sugar. Turned out great! The second time my fiance added the whole can of lemonade concentrate instead of 1/3 a cup so we didn't add any ginger ale or carbonated water and it was still good! It got great reviews from all who tried it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: comparing this to some wine drink from Mexico ... Sangria is Spanish NOT Mexican. Spain has European influences and Mexico has S.A. Indian influences - in both food and drink. Different cultures entirely. Be careful of rating apples to oranges ... Oh, floating sliced apples in this is nice too. Remember to eat the fruit ... Yummo!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria you will ever have hands down!! But beware, it does come up and bite you!! I substitute Orange Crush for the orange juice, use the sugar, and NO carbonated water. Better with a dry oak and spice red wine, then its not too fruity. All my friends LOVE this recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So over the many times that I have made this recipe my aunt and I have made it to our liking: use blackberry brandy use frozen raspberry lemonade concentrate leave out the sugar (way too sweet with it) mix everything together and pour into the glasses then add a little of the cherry juice and the carbonated water to each glass instead of the whole pitcher. We usually omit the lemons and limes because we dont have them around as often.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great recipe! I made a few changes - no sugar, cherries or water. But I did add Malibu coconut rum and fresh lemonade instead of frozen. I think it would taste equally as good with spiced rum or peach schnapps as someone else suggested. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic! I love the way the fruit mellows the wine and the wine mellows the fruit - such great compliments to each other. I made pretty much exactly as is except i omitted the cherries and the triple sec. i also omitted the sugar as the lemonade concentrate is sweet enough for my tastes. W/out the sugar and triple sec, its the perfect amount of semi-sweetness...not too much as to not be refreshing but just enough to make it a treat. I took the suggestion of adding the soda as i was serving it for a little bit of fizz. I made with Carnitas for a going away dinner - guests were very impressed as this is a very "fancy" yet easy beverage to serve - very fun! Can't wait to make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never made sangria before, and I've had a few good ones and more bad ones at restaurants. I followed the reviewers' advice and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec, 7UP instead of soda water/sugar, and included raspberries. I made two batches and it was really really good! Even my friends who don't like wine or sweeter drinks enjoyed this...even my non-drinking mother had some and loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had a World Cup Cuisine party and people are still raving about this amazing sangria. Warning !! it is potent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made 3 other Sangria recipes and this is by far the best. For the triple sec I use Cointreau but I think any triple sec would be just as good. I just happen to keep Cointreau in stock. For the brandy I use Wild Cherry brandy. I omit the sugar completely. I mix it all up, then let it sit for about 18 - 24 hours. Then I take a glass, fill it with ice cubes, fill about 1/3 to 1/2 of the glass with Club Soda, then top it with the Sangria. Oh My Goodness...it is the best! I would have never thought that using club soda would be my preference, but it most definitely IS. I made a triple batch for the Fourth of July (only 4 of us total) and I had to make another triple batch the morning of the second day, or we would have run out. Try this recipe exactly as it is written, and then you can easily make any adjustments you prefer. However be forewarned, you need to plan ahead a wee bit, because if you let it sit over night, or even 4-6 hours, it is much much better.
