Everything seeps and melds together and mixes just wonderfully.I think that is the secret to this particular Sangria recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe! I made a mistake and added a little extra sugar, but it still turned out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is one of the best I have tried ~ I was taught to add the fruit and sugar first. I take my wooden spoon and break up some of the fruit to release their flavors ~ other than that I use ginger ale (about 1 can per bottle) ~ delicious! thank you for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe for Sangria. Do refrigate it overnight because that makes it sooo much better. Very smooth. Good the first day but GREAT the second. I did subsititure Grenadine for the sugar - adds the sweetness and enhances the color. Definitely add the club soda right before serving - gives it a sizzle!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So tasty! Best homemade sangria I've ever had - and my guests adored it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best sangria I've ever had! I can't believe I made it! I made 2 batches for a small party and ran out. Next time I will make more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times and it is always a hit at my get togethers...people beg for me to make. I don't use ginger ale or club soda, just with some sugar depending on how sweet I want it. It does better if it sits in the fridge for a few hours before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you want a WOW sangria try this receipe. I made 2 pitchers. Everyone was complimenting it was the best sangria they ever drinked. Thank you for sharing the receipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a delicious recipe! If you are using a sweeter red wine, you may want to adjust to less sugar added (taste it first!) otherwise it ends up being sugar overload. You don't need to use an expensive wine either- all the ingredients meld together really well to make this a really enjoyable drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to use a frozen berry mixture as the fruit in addition to the orange and lime slices. Never lasts very long at parties!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had high hopes for this sangria for our July 4th party, but unfortunately it was a dud. :-( Maybe it was the rain...but no one really raved about it or came back for more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.User: Noemi - No way is she a
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this and it was supposed to be for our 4th of july celebration, but it never made it! It was so good we drank it up the day before.."taste testing" it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good and very potent...so be careful. Also Sangria is a very forgiving recipes with lots of different variations. I used a sparkling wine and skipped the sprite/soda. Didn't have orange juice, so added lemonade. Perfect summer concoction!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this every year for our pool party, and everyone loves it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! It was a huge success at my son's graduation party! I used a low cost merlot and cherry brandy, skipped the sugar and offered seltzer on the side for anyone who wanted to add it. I quadrupled the recipe so I would have enough to last the entire gathering...which I didn't! Many asked for the recipe before departing the event. I have made it since using apricot brandy, which was also wonderful. I will caution you that if you have left-overs, remove the fruit. If it sits more than a day, the skin's give it a bitter aftertaste. An excellent summer-time offering! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a fantastic recipe! I tripled the recipe but cut the sugar by half and left a bottle of ginger ale and a bottle of club soda next to the dispenser (a 3-gallon clear container with a spigot at the bottom and an opening at the top for the ladle) in case anyone wanted to lighten it up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was a perfect sangria for the my "girls day at the pool"" party. i didn't use the sugar or the carbonated water, i used ginger ale before serving. yummy! i will make this over and over for all the parties.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG, this is SO GOOD! I made a quadruple batch for my 40th birthday party and it was a huge hit! I used frozen berries in addition to the fruits mentioned in the recipe. I also used an inexpensive Shiraz for the wine and let the mixture sit in the fridge for about 36 hrs. (After doing some online research regarding which type of wine to use, I found out that Sangria was originally made with inexpensive table wines to enhance their flavor, which makes complete sense and did the job! I can't see using an expensive wine just to doctor it up?!) I added Ginger Ale right before serving. Myself and my guests highly recommend this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I never use the brandy and it is still gets rave reviews with my friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this with a giant foccacia bread sandwich, and pepperoni salad to friends and they loved it. I did not use the cherries, but followed the recipe exactly. I served it straight without the seltzer water. I will be sure to double it next time. WONDEFUL!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was SO good!! I did add the sugar and 2 cups of gingerale. I think it would be fine without the sugar, too. The men didn't want any, thank goodness because my mother and I polished off the whole thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was terrific! I used Ginger Ale instead of the club soda, and Orange Liquer instead of Triple Sec. I left out the sugar but added 3/4 cup of Peach Schnapps I let everything sit overnight and this was SOOOO good the next day! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: perfect recipe (used sprite instead of carbonated water)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious Sangria. We used the Seven-Up variation without the added sugar and it was a crowd pleaser. It was sweet enough and full of flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time making Sangria. Was a hit at dinner. Doubled the recipe for 6 people and ran out halfway through. Should at least triple if you have some sangria lovers / heavy drinkers. Used half the brandy, and 3/4 of ginger ale (instead of carbonated water) called for. No lemon juice, used more frozen lemonade instead. No sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this!! I made it exactly as is EXCEPT that I omitted the sugar. I don't like super sweet drinks and I found that omitting the sugar made it taste perfect for me. I used merlot for the wine. I made it for a party and it was a huge hit- however it was very potent! But in a good way. I will definitely be making this again- this weekend in fact!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe to serve runners in the South Okanagan Winery Association Half Corked Marathon (May 30). I made a batch that used 24 bottles of wine. Rave reviews from all the runners, and requests for the recipe. Kudos to HJACOBY.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: pretty fruity prefered squirt instead of gingerale and used blackberry brandy and peach schnapps

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was GREAT, just like I remember from Spain. I left out the cherries, sugar & club soda. However, next time I will only let the fruit stay in for about 8 hours. I noticed that it tasted fabulous then, but after I let it sit overnight, the rind gave the sangria a bitter taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO YUMMY!!!! You need to definately at least double the recipe. One batch is not enough! I didn't try it with the soda. I like it non-carbonated. Can't wait to make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is AWESOME!!! The Sangria is a huge hit! It is so easy to perpare. For a better taste let it sit overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this sangria was fantastic. i made it for a playdate luncheon and the other mamas swooned. i did substitute gin and cointreau for the brandy and triple sec; it was a wonderful crisp drink. i skipped the sugar and marischino cherries, and added about 1/2 the ginger ale. warning, this drink packs a POWERFUL punch, and it is easy to drink a lot without realizing it. needless to say, everyone was at my house for a good long time. but even the non-sangria fans were true devotees before the day ended. last word of advice: make a double recipe at LEAST!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice and refreshing. Very easy to make too! I used sprite, and i like how i could play with the flavor by adding more or less sprite in my cup... also yes it keeps tatsing better the longer the flavors have a chance to blend :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of the best Sangria recipes I have ever had. We used sprite instead of soda water to add a little sweetness and used frozen mixed fruit. It is great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit hit. I also added other fruit like apples and pears. Had to sub brandy with rum but was still awesome!! Will def make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy! Got rave review from all of our guests. We like our sangria sweeter, so we used ginger ale and added the optional sugar. We left out the marashino cherries, but followed the rest of the recipe to a T. This was a perfect drink for a beautiful, sunny, warm evening. We'll be making this a bunch this summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone was raving about this. Made it on Mother's Day for a bapstism/combined with Mother's Day lunch reception. It was the only thing most people drank! I skipped the cherries and carbonated water/ginger ale but did use the sugar. Used a relatively cheap Cabarnet Sauvignon for the wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! Made this for a party, it was a huge hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! Definitely a crowd pleaser at any family gathering, cook-out, etc. Everyone loves this and I always find that I cannot make enough.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a party and they drank 3 full bowls of it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a sweet red wine and this was really good!! My family LOVED it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is soo good and it's stronger than it tastes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!! I followed the suggestion of others here and left out the sugar, opting instead for gingerale. Also added in fresh raspberries. It definetly needs to hang out over night which is so hard to do but it so worth it! Everyone loved it but most importantly I LOVED IT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fab! Add 12-16 oz of frozen blueberries and or strawberries!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my pig roast..I had increased it to serve 100 ppl and eveyone loved it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: You can add also orange soda and some diced apples a very good recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: yikes! I doubled this recipe for a party of 8 and it turned out only 3 of us were drinking. Delicious and what a fun night! We finished it...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mmmmm.......Easy to tweek to your own liking!!!! I added extra brandy and a bit more orange juice!!-----Oh and cheap wine works wonderfully!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this sangria every single summer. Nothing beats lounging on the back deck with a glass of this delicious drink in hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe! I use sprite in place of club soda and frozen orange juice ice cubes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WONDERFUL. I made this for a party of 23, it's sweet but not too sweet and as several other reviewers have mentioned... the brandy IS key. I used a dry Barefoot wine and went ahead and threw a few more fruits in just to add more color to the drink since this was a honeymoon-themed bridal party (threw in some kiwi and strawberries). You really can't go wrong with the fruit combos. Made this the day before the party (a must in order to allow all flavors to blend and fruit to marinate) but come day of the party totally forgot to add ginger ale and carbonated water (I was going to make two batches to see which was more popular among the guests), but the drink was a huge hit even without the fizz!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: the. best. sangria. EVER!! Wow! Thanks for such a rockin' recipe!! I've substituted sunny D for the OJ and drank it without letting the fruit soak (just squeezed the fruit so the juices came out) and it was STILL fantastic! Doesn't last for very long around my house!! If I could give this 10 stars, I would!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is really good. I have made it several times and depending on time & what I have on hand, I add or omit ingredients. Any way you make it, it's really tasty! As other reviewers have stated..go slow! it's so good it sneaks up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good!! I don't like wine so I was nervous but it was great. I made this for my birhday party and everyone loved it, my only advice is make lots of it because it goes fast. I made the recipe as is and added the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted to make a drink for my housewarming party and my husband sugested a Sangria. I am not a wine drinker so I did a little research and ended up using 2 large bottles of Shiraz Cabernet and quadrupled the recipe. The only thing I left out was the lemon juice, I had only bought one lemon to slice up and since I used the frozen lemonaid I figured it would be ok. I also took note of some of other comments and added some cherry juice. I made this the night before and added the ginger ale before serving. The Sangria got raving complments, it was the hit of the party and there was not a drop left! Definitley a keeper, I can't wait to make this on a warm summer night!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent sangria recipe! Made it for a shower today and it got great reviews. Didn't change a thing, but we didn't add any fizz because I prefer sangria that way.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a large party and it was a huge hit! I've just been asked to make it for the next party since everyone loved it so much. The balance of taste was perfect, very smooth. I couldn't find the cherries so I just used oranges, lemons and limes, delicious! Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Outstanding!!! I will be serving this all summer!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great. Great. Great. Made it a day ahead of time to have the flavors blend, but me and my husband couldn't wait so we drank half of it the night before our party. I had to put together another batch before and during the party. i also added apples b/c i made it in the winter. I would most likely make this again in the summer and add peaches and grapes. I also used Seltzer water cut down on the sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very good. I made it the night before as recommended. I substituted limeade concentrate because I had it on hand. I omitted the cherries and added green apple. I did use a little bit of sugar, maybe 2 tablespoons, to add just the right amount of sweetness. It was a big hit at our party- I only wish I'd made more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is the best. I have made it many times with different types of wine (I think Merlot is my favorite), and it always disappears right away. I do add the sugar, but I omit the carbonated water. I think it is best about 2 hours after you make it. Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is fantastic as written.. YUM! I made a second bacth and added bacardi limon, and a can of pineapples, and Oh so good. Basically you can throw in whatever you want on top of this recipe and It will be good! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! will use it over and over again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SIMPLY THE BEST.... love love love this recipe! Thanks so much!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this and have made lots of different variations with the same basic ratios. It is my favorite Sangria I've found!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Sangria! Left out the frozen lemonade (didn't have any) so I increased the sugar and lemon juice. It was delicious. Double batch was gone within an hour. Be ready...this is so tasty its easy to forget how potent it is!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome Sangria! Drink slowly, though, this one sneaks up you. Best Sangria I've ever had - better than restaurant versions!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! Every year I make this for New Years and it is gone in a matter of minutes!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: yuuuum!! I can't wait to try with different kinds of fruit juice!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria for my family party and I double the recipe to make a hugh punch bowl full of it. I was worried it was going to go to waste but instead it was gone half way through my party!!! We ended up using all the fruit left on the bottom to make other mixed drinks because it tasted so good. I commited this recipe to memory and will use it many more times. I did use the white sugar and I also used the maraschinl cherry juice as well and it tasted spectacular.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: sssooo fab!! didn't have time to let it sit overnight the first time and still loved it1!! am going to make it again for mlk day and goign to let it sit, can't wait!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was such a hit! Follow the recipe exactly and you will not be disapointed!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. I made it New Year's Eve for some friends and they all raved about it. I did cut back on the sugar a little. I am a little bit of a light weight so I added some Sprite to mine and it was fantastic! Can't wait to make this during the summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best! I've made this several times since Thanksgiving (when I first made it). It's now frequently requested by my friends. :o) ***UPDATE*** I've since doubled the wine and I use a table red or a red rose wine; bump up the lemon juice to 1/3 c.; double the triple sec, orange juice, frozen lemonade, and sugar; and leave the brandy at 1/2 c. Delish! I finally have it right.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love love love it! I have made this 3 times and have always doubled it! I only add a sprinkle of the sugar. And, it's true, even the guys love this! Thank you for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: best sangria i've ever tasted! super easy to make and has a kick that's perfect. i've tried a lot of sangria and this one is by far the best ever! enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great stuff! made exactly as is and served ginger ale on the side for those that wanted it! Stout and goes down waaay to easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a Mexican themed dinner I was invited to. Was in a rush and didn't fully read directions, and made it a few hours before the party. It was still delicious, but my neighbor said the left over drink was even better the next day...so make the day before for best results!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit. Instead of dry red wine I used the Boones Sangria. I used 8 bottles so this was a much cheaper alternative, and this still tasted GREAT!! I also soaked my fruit in the triple sec and stuck it in the frezzer overnight. This was a huge hit at our Holiday Party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used ginger ale. It seemed a little strong, but that may have been the wine I used. We added ice to our glasses to "water down" a bit. All in all, it was good and enjoyed by everyone. UPDATE: Since my original review, I have made this several times. It has become a holiday tradition. I make two double batches the night before, and add ginger ale when it's time to serve. I've even added an extra bottle of wine when the quantity starts getting low to make it through the party! ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very potent as well. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Seriously! The best Sangria I've ever had. No need to tweak anything!Thanks for the recipie:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit at a party I had; just be careful, because it packs a punch! I doubled the recipe but found it to be too citrusy, so on my next try I didn't double the fruit slices, and it was perfect. I also used ginger ale in place of club soda, but I'm sure it would be good without. Don't forget the cherries - I love the flavor they add!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best I've ever had!! Like candy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't have lemonade concentrate or the carbonated water but had everything else. This had very good flavor, but wasn't as thick as I get in Mexican Town so only 4 stars

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria is AWESOME! I do NOT add the sugar or cherries (ew) or carbonated water...you don't need any of those! But I follow the rest exactly! I make this almost every week now! Soooo good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great. Every time I make this drink I run out so the last time I multiplied the amount by 5 ((I used a huge stockpot to chill overnight). Here is a tip should you have leftovers, if you use fresh citrus with the rinds, remove them as they will cause the drink to become bitter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Tastes like punch ... and packs one too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!! I made exactly as written and added the carbonated water just before serving. I will definitely make this again, thanks for sharing!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME, everyone at my party loved it, quick and easy to make too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I omitted the sugar because it was sweet enough. For one batch I used Menage a Trois, and the second batch I used Blackstone Merlot. Both were delicious, and the fruits are great to nibble on too. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very very dangerous drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have never made nor tasted a better Sangria in my life. Every time I have made this my guests drink it like water. I cannot make enough of it. I usually make it exactly as written, minus the club soda, but I have used different fruit combinations, changed the amounts of sugar and/or juice based on what I have, and it still comes out perfect. I think the key is the balance between the brandy and the triple sec...mess with that and it doesn't taste quite the same. One thing is for sure is that you and your guests wil be loaded and happy. One reviewer said "dangerous" and "excellent" in reference to this recipe. Agreed and agreed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO FREAKING GOOD!! I added chopped up granny smith apples and some peach schnapps. I skipped the lemon juice and added extra frozen lemonade. I didn't need to add anything to sweeten it up. I just used the soda water and it was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh so delicious :) I left out the sugar also as I didn't want this to be like punch. I added the club soda and glad I did because it lightened it a bit. The punch bowl was empty by the time we finished our appetizers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was so hoping to love this recipe as there were lots of 5-star reviews, but honestly, I didn't like it. I tried making it twice. Once with Shiraz and once with Merlot. Not sure if it's because I used fresh-squeezed orange juice -- the oranges weren't the sweetest or tastiest, so maybe that's why. I'm going to try the white peach sangria. Maybe that one would suit me better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word: Dangerous!! Excellent! Oops...that's two words.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe. I have another recipe with much less ingredients and I think it tastes better! I will use this when I want to make sangria completly from scratch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had with the girls. Increase OJ and sugar. very tasety!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria is delicious! I made it for my sister's bridal shower and received rave reviews. I used barcardi instead of brandy, omitted the frozen lemonade concentrate, and did not add the sugar. I've made it since and everytime I have, people are in love with it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed recipe using fresh juices and did not include club soda. Allowed to "marinate" for 24 hours. Used cheap spanish red wine and cheap brandy. Slightly sweet and very fruity. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's difficult to find a balance between the alcohol and fruit juice flavors, but this recipe does that very well. The last time I used this recipe, I substituted the frozen lemonade concentrate with a limeade concentrate (it's what was on hand) and the finished product was slightly more tangy, which I enjoyed more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Brandy is a must, as well as letting it sit for 24 hours. I didnt use triple sec, limeade, lemon juice or ginger ale. I added papaya, mango and strawberry chunks and let them sit for the 24 hours, then i served over frozen pineapple chunks. I tripled the recipe and it went quick. I used Carlos Rossi Sangria... will definately make again. oh, and its super strong when its freshly made, so letting it sit as long as possible is key in blending the flavors and toning it down.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This is a great recipe. The brandy really gives it a kick, along with all those juices and fruit. I put mine in a decorative glass iced tea jar, and it looked fabulous (plus was easy for guests to help themselves). Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! I also added apples..followed entire recipe but no carbonated water..it was perfect, sweet but not too sweet. I had another recipe last wk and it was awful! this is the right combo..I used Lambrussco for the wine, I know you can pretty much use whatever but I like specifics and this wine worked perfectly and was recommended.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I cut the sugar in half- other than that it's great! i make this lal the time now! I double the recipe and use a bottle of zinfandel and a bottle of shiraz. turns out perfect every time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a baby shower and had many requests for the recipe. One guest told me that she tried 6 or 7 recipes and this was the best she has had. I agree.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch of this for a big gathering and everyone loved it!! I used white wine (as there were going to be kids running around and didn't want red wine drinks getting knocked over onto the carpet!) and ginger ale and it was excellent. Will definitely try with the red wine next time...when there are only grown ups around!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Took this to the same dinner party as the Basque Cake (yum); it was very well received and we'll make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Stuff is Fantastic! I followed the recipe. Put in lots of fruit, let it set over night, added ginger ale right before I served it. It was a huge hit. Even my mom, who doesn't drink much liked it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was trying to find an intersting drink to serve at my wedding. Adapted a bit and made berry sangria instead. Added frozen strawberry and raspberry juice. Then, put in some berry arbor mist with rose wine. Diluted it with strawberry sparkling water. Put some frozen strawberries and raspberries for an added touch. Anyone that gets married requests my berry sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic! We all "felt no pain" when we finished this punch bowl! It was delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Sprite instead of carbonated water. Put in lime, orange, mar cherries, and grapes. We doubled the recipe and a party of 6 had approx 2 drinks a piece. The fruit was the best part! Chills for 24 hours before it was served. It was a hit and will make again~

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great base recipe. A little too much citrus for me though. On my second batch I followed the directions exactly, except I omitted the lemon juice, limes and lemons. Also, omitted the club soda/ginger ale. I added mangos and pears (plus the oranges) instead and it was fabulous!! I served it at a neighborhood party and it was a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and STRONG! I was going to a potluck lunch at a friend's house where I didn't know the other guests. The sangria was a hit the second I walked through the door - who doesn't like sangria? After a glass of this stuff, forget about being shy! Be particularly careful measuring out the frozen lemonade as it changes the sweetness of the recipe dramatically. Think about making two batches and letting them marinate with the sliced fruit overnight. My first batch was gone really fast! Definitely worth purchasing the hard liquor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a double batch and was glad I did...I forgot the OJ, I let it sit overnight, but tried a glass before bedtime and I rested well. ;-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use 7-Up instead of sugar and carbonated water, and I make sure to slice the fruits thickly, otherwise I find it's a little too much citrus for my taste. I've also been adding red raspberries and pineapples recently - super good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well it may not have been the very best I ever had but it certainly was good, refreshing and wonderful on a hot Texas day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! This is best Sangria recipe I have found. It definitely needs to sit overnight for best flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is unbeatable! I made 6 gallons of this the night before as one of the cocktails for my daughter's wedding. It was all gone during the appetizers!!! (and we had an open bar - guests could have anything) Everyone LOVED IT!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is always a hit. I eliminate the cherries, can't stand them, and add whatever fruit/berries I have laying around. Sliced pears, limes, oranges and whole blackberries is my favorite combination. If there's time, I like to make it the night before, and add cold ginger ale just before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it exactly as written. Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a big 5gal cooler of this and everyone loved it....works great for a taco tuesday fiesta!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I made a big batch then let it sit over night. It was the hit of my Mexican Fiesta Party! I had to give thi recipe out to everyone at party Thanks for a winner

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The sangria turned out great. My boyfriend, who is a sangria lover, said that this was the best he ever had and that he would pay for a drink like this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: everyone loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch (12 cups). For reference; all the ingredients came to 1 gallon. I did not add the sugar and opted for the Ginger Ale instead. I also left all the fruit in the pitcher and instead of floating slices I put a pineapple spear in with each 8 oz. glass (juice glass). It was a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made 3 batches of this for bunko last night and it got very good reviews. A nice change from the usual Margaritas. I tried Club Soda and also Sprite Zero---I definitely preferred the Sprite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I completely agree with everyone on how great this Sangria is!! My only recommendation is that you don't just use one batch. The one and only batch I made went in about 5 minutes. It can serve about 5-6 servings. If you have a big crowd or you think that your guests will want more than one glass, double or triple this recipe! (Also, I omitted the sugar and water and added Sprite instead). It was Incredible!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is heaven on a hot summer day!!!! Omit the sugar and swap sprite for the carbonated water. For the wine I recommend Carlo Rossi Cabernet - this giant jug so you can make a couple batches!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends and I have recently starting trying the Sangria at our favorite restaurants. So, I made this for a group of women at a jewelry party. I used Ginger Ale instead of the club soda. It was a HUGE hit and several people asked for the recipe! I will definitely make this time and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very good and strong!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Trader Joe's has a peach-mango-orange juice that is amazing in this sangria (instead of plain oj).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummy - Easy recipe! Has a serious kick!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic and will be regularly made in my house now!! I used ginger ale as a topper, really tasty. Only problem is it ran out too fast :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a real nice treat, will make this on a regular basis

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! This has become my favorite summer drink. My guests love it and never fail to ask for the recipe. I don't alter the recipe at all because it's perfect as is. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this Sangria! After visiting Tapas restaurant in NYC, I tried hard to find a similar recipe to make my own, and this one is the closest by far.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is the best one yet. I quadrupled the recipe and it went in about an hour! I added some more fruit than what is in the recipe and it does not need the carbonated water. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: doubled sugar and added 1 cup of prepared minute maid lemonade or us ginger ale to sweeten

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i served this at my backyard wedding, and everyone raved over it and wanted the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh dear... this stuff knocked everyone off their feet (both in taste and in alcohol content...) GREAT recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last summer for a big outdoor birthday party. Everyone drank this instead of the beer, and I had an entire keg left over. It was the best sangria I have ever made or drank! I did cut up apples, so there would be more edible pieces. I did make it the night before, and it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The crowd pleaser! It vanishes everytime I make it! Only added about a tablespoon of sugar. This time I let people take it how they wanted it...over gingerale, stright up or over Asti Spumante champaigne. SOOO GOOD! Make sure you double or triple the recipe and make a day ahead.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Finally found a keeper Sangria recipe!!! Almost gave up making it because it came out too tart. No leftovers with this recipe. I didn't use the sugar but the maraschino cherry juice (to taste) 1/2 jar juice to start with. Also I used ginger ale (instead of c. water) but let everyone add it themselves to their own taste! Everyone liked it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: made this recipe twice now, first time followed recipe exactly, little to tart for my liking, second time left out the lemon juice. and i had let it steep for 24 hours(hard thing to do, but well worth it!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! I also added rum, strawberries, pineapple and a peach to the mix and it was delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe and everyone LOVED it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was a huge hit last night. I made a double batch, but ran out.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for my sisters bridal shower. I was very excited since the reviews were so great. I was pretty disappointed. It was very tart. I added ginger ale and some extra sugar and used a Merlot. I'm going to try another batch tonight and use less lemon. Hopefully that will work out better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my husband's family reunion and it was a huge hit! Guys who said they didn't care for Sangria were coming back for more and the beer was hardly touched. I used carbonated water - otherwise it might be too concentrated. I cut up the fruit into smaller pieces as other suggested. Also, know that while the taste is smooth, this stuff is potent. I'll definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, and easy. I threw some strawberries in too..yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! After the first batch finished people asked for more. It is a quick fix and very tasty. I substituted Lemon/Lime soda for the carbonated water and it was great if you like a sweet drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a neighborhood pool party and everyone loved it. A very forgiving recipe, followed the recipe until I found I had another bottle of opened red wine so threw it in along with a some of the other ingredients, let it sit all day and served it up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, and DO make it a day ahead! I substituted 7-up for the sugar and sparkling water, and grand marnier for the triple sec, also used grapes instead of cherries. again, delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO SO good. I added apples. I poured in a glass with frozen grapes (no ice needed that way) about 3/4 wine to 1/4 sprite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is the BOMB! We have made for numerous parties and it's always a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had never made Sangria before...but always wanted to. I stumbled upon this recipe in the Summer of 2008. I make it with my sister (it's our new backyard BBQ ritual) and we vary it each time. Our guest feel that our Summer gatherings are just not complete without this EXCELLENT beverage.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my Bunco group and the ladies were tipping up the punch bowl I served it in to get the last drop. Several of the ladies attending swore upon entering the house they weren't big Sangria fans---this recipe made several converts!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome Awesome, Sangria Sangria!! The best, bar none!!! Make sure to do the day before (except add soda just before serving). Way better than any mexican restaurant recipe that I have had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a couple changes based on what I had around the house...still came out great/my husband said I have to make a big batch for when we have our 4th of July party next weekend. I left out the triple sec (did not have nay on hand/had plenty of booze without it/never noticed it was missing) and we had powdered lemonade mix around for the kids but not lemonade concentrate...so I subsituted the powdered lemonade mix. For the soda I used Sprite.Big hit!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is awesome! I only let it sit for 5 or 6 hours before drinking and still thought it was brilliant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My favorite Sangria recipe. I always leave the cherries and lemonade concentrate out. I am just not a big fan of cherries and I think the lemonade makes it too sweet. I do add a little sugar, about 1/8 of a cup. I also add club soda to each glass for fizz. Love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this according to the directions with the exception of making a simple syrup for the sugar, it was heavenly... A must have for any future event!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my goodness! This was soooo good! My family has been making Sangria for years...holidays and pool parties wouldn't be complete without it but THIS recipe is our favorite! Thanks for the post Hjacoby!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We loved it! We wanted to be able to eat more of the fruit so we peeled the oranges and cut them up and added additional cherries. Next time, I'll follow other reviews and add more fruits, like pineapples, etc.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good base recipe. Brandy and triple sec are a must.... skipped the lemonade concentrate and just added more lemon juice...Can vary the fruit- do NOT use marachino cherries (uck!). I used lemon, orange, lime and kiwi....the kiwis were delish soaked in the sangria. I also cut the sugar in half and will likely skip next time. Used an Australian Shiraz.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing...coming from a long line of strong Spanish family this sangria passed the test. Made it for my Spanish family and the still talk about it. Kudos!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a HUGE party hit!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm a sangria snob and loved loved loved this! I added sliced apples and I also took another reviewers suggestion and omitted the sugar and soda and added gingerale instead...but just before serving. LOVE IT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had some work friends over and it was a HIT! Didn't use cherries or sugar and used ginger ale instead of club soda. I had sliced the fruit into really small pieces like at my favorite sangria place but I think next time I will use larger slices.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great sangria. Everyone loved it! Used 7up instead of sugar and carbonated water. Added it individually to each glass as I was serving. About half and half. For some reason all of my fruit tasted very bitter after it had set for 24 hours even though it was not bitter when I added it at the begining. No problem, just didn't eat the fruit. Although I am curious as to why it was bitter. Will definitley make this again and am sharing the recipe already.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Upped this recipe for 30 servings and still wasn't enough. Used 5 bottle of Jacobs Creek Shiraz. Didn't add the sugar and didn't miss it. Put it all together the night before (except for the soda, which I used Sprite and added as we drank it) and let it marinate. Used suggested fruits and added red grapes. So good! Packs a punch. Will be the standard I use from now on!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a BBQ, quadrupling the original recipe, and it was all gone before the end of the night. My guests raved about it and they all wanted the recipe. I also used ginger ale in place of the club soda and only added half the sugar. It was the best sangria I have ever had and will be making this over and over again. Thanks for sharing it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful recipe! The entire batch was gone almost immediately. I cut down on the amount of sugar used and opted to add all of the cherry juice from the maraschino cherries for extra sweetness...yummy! I also decided to add apples as well but found that it is best to add them right before serving so that they do not soak up all of the alcohol (they were pretty potent the first time I made this recipe and allowed the apples to soak overnight). By far the BEST Sangria recipe I have come across. Thanks for sharing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe is GOOD...but...after making it once, we altered it to include 2 more bottles of red wine, changed the triple sec to Gran Marnier and left out the sugar, opting instead for the cherry juice as the sweetner along with the Ginger Ale instead of the Soda. Awesome! Made 5 gallons and it was even better the next day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM YUM YUM. Had for a birthday bbq last night and guests drank it up! (Even Grandma enjoyed!! ha!) Will keep this recipe on hand for sure! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I second the person's opinion that this is a very forgiving recipe. I used a red zinfandel wine that I had on hand, with everything as directed except triple sec because I didn't have any. Went over well for a tapas party and complimented my theme perfectly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: CRAZY good! I've made this many times over the past year or two and anytime I bring it to a party, bbq, whatever there is never any left and I always get requests for the recipe. I use cheap red wine (usually Trader Joe's 2-buck-chuck merlot) and usually use a peach or apricot brandy, and in a pinch I've used peach schnapps in lieu of the triple sec (hey, whatever works, right?!), and aside from the listed fruit I'll also throw in oranges, frozen or fresh strawberries, basically just whatever I have on hand. It's worth the ingredients and the time it takes for the flavors to blend. Yummy-yum-yum!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whoa!!! This is my new summer drink... absolutely delicious! Thanks for an amazing recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I didn't have triple sec so I added some Grand Marnier instead, I also omitted the cherries, and added a bottle of sparkling white wine instead of carbonated water or club soda, as other reviewers had suggested. Packs a strong punch, but tastes great (do be sure to let it sit before serving, though).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was delish--and super strong! The fruit does an awesome job of hiding exactly how intense this sangria is! I added extra cherries. we also used ginger ale instead of club soda. Definitely let it all marinate over night . . . it tastes completely different (better) that way! I used cheap box red wine (which is why I made sangria in the first place). We didn't like the box wine, but it would've been alcohol abuse to throw it away, so I found this recipe to save it. It worked!!! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was ok. I used a port wine instead of brandy which may have caused the really strong taste. And I didn't use sugar and added sprite before serving. Everything else I did the same but it was too potent for me. Once I added the sprite it was much better but still disappointing after all the great reviews.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was FABULOUS! I left out the sugar and added strawberries,skipped the cherries...this is going to be a regular at my house. I can't wait to make this again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! I followed recipe to the T except for the sugar. I dont like Too sweet drinks, and let it sit 24 hrs. After it was done marinating I tasted it and was like oh no. Citrus without enough sweet so i added some sugar and 7 Up. FABULOUS!!!! I made it for my daughters 21st birthday party and everyone loved it. I put out wine too and nobody touched it. I put a bowl of extra fruit out, strawberries, blueberries, lemons, limes and oranges for people to add as they like. My new favorite drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the first recipe that I have ever rated on AllRecipes, although I have been using the site for years! Love, LOVE this recipe. Always gets rave reviews. I did decide not to add sugar or carbonated water, but instead used lemon-lime soda. I use a 1:1 ratio. Very refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Deeeelicious! Served it to a group that included some former bartenders who have very high standards for beverages like this, and they agreed this was among the best sangria they've ever had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing. Simply the best sangria recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe - only change made was to use Grand Mariner instead of the Triple Sec, as I am not a fan of triple sec. My boyfriend made this for a party and everyone loved it. The leftover fruit is addictive!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my weekend bbq and it was a huge hit. Used apples, pears, cherries and mangoes. My only grip is I didn't double the recipe. Next time I know better. Can't wait to make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria! Made it with Merlot, however any dry red wine will do. The brandy gives it a "kick" so it is a bit strong at first so do let it sit if you can. Have served it immedately after making it with no complaints :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very sweet and delicious. Made it with a cheap red wine and served it to my in-laws the last time they were over. They kept asking for more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing!!!! I made it for a BBQ we had and the adults loved it. I even doubled the brandy, orange, juice, triple sec and lemonade mix. IT was great. This is definatley a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe! I don't use ginger ale OR the club soda, nor the frozen lemonade, but add some of the cherry juice. I add a little extra lemon juice and half the triple sec and make a simple syrup with the sugar, as it mixes together much better. I also marinate the fruit int he punch 12-18 hours, then "muddle" to get the extra pulp and juice - discarding the rinds before they add bitterness to the sangria. I buy the Taylor Lake County red in the BIG bottle (less than $12 at Walmart) - and it is great. Be sure to drink on a full stomache, as this has quite a kick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome, if dangerous recipe. Have made it successfully many many times. 1) I recommend using orange curacao - I settle on this after experimenting with triple sec and others but invariably this provides the smoothest, richest flavor. 2) A raw cane sugar * lemon juice combo can easily be substituted for the lemonade concentrate (which is afterall just a shortcut). 3) I find a merlot is the best choice for a deeper flavor. 4) Make sure it is well chilled and all the fruit nice and alcoholic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I made this with some of the hints by other reviewers - no sugar or carbonated water but used gingerale instead; also, I added peaches and apples with the other fruit and left out the cherries. This was a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made five batches of this recipe. I use good brandy (VSOP), good OJ (not from concentrate) and good wine (the kind you would enjoy by itself). I have never added the sugar or carbonated water. This was the most popular drink at my last party (thus the five batches!) This is a keeper! P.S. This is NOT the Sangria I had in college.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like the sangria in Spain. I follow the recipe exactly and it's always the hit of the party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome sangria recipe!!!! I used diet gingerale instead of club soda, everyone loved it!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We loved it! Definitely will make it again. Thank you for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great! I didn't add any soda. Maybe someday I might try it that way. But this way is great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was some of the best sangria I have ever had. Served it at a Cinco de Mayo birthday celebration and everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I didn't want to purchase any additional liquor for the recipe, so I went with what I happened to have on hand (mango rum and Grand Marnier instead of the brandy and triple sec - though Grand Marnier is actually a variety of triple sec liquour that is made with cognac brandy). I did not add the sugar, and used 7up instead of soda water (again, I was trying to work with what I had on had). I tasted it when I first put it together and I questioned the recipe, but after having a day to mellow out it was outstanding. I made a double batch and everyone went back for seconds (at least). This will be my go to recipe for sangria from now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe and really enjoyed this. It was in the refrigerator overnight before serving and I used a Spanish red wine-- really very nice and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG-What a Fantastic Sangria. I haven't had Sangria in 10 years, but I remember loving it. I was afraid to make it for my Cinco de Mayo party (also my b-day) in such a large quantity, but it was a hit!. Made 48 servings-(ie; 4 cups brandy/triplesec equal 1/5. Cut sugar down to 1 cup; added pineapple and a can of peaches. Stored in frig overnight and bought 2 bottles of 7Up, which people could chose to add (and most did). Used a decent 5 gallon box of cab (= to 6.5 bottles) and a 1.5 liter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!!!! This came out so awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: good base recipe, but it left a very bitter after taste. Had to fix w/ more OJ and simple sugar. Next time will steer clear of the citrus and opt for apples and pears.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awsome!! Make sure you double or triple this, otherwise it will be gone in an instant! Beware however, because it packs a punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Used Pinot Grigio and it turned out awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Finally got the chance to make this recipe over the weekend.. I used a Merlot, added the sugar and the 2 cups of GingerAle. The taste was fantastic... I will be making this again for sure..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this today. SO good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Let it sit overnight is the key! AMAZING

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, next time I would use less citrus & add some other fruits to it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Honed to perfection is right! I have been drinking Sangria for at least 35 years and this is the absolute BEST I've ever had. Made it exactly according to your directions, took it to a party last night, and everyone LOVED it. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for Easter and it was a hit every with those who do not usually like wine but they loved this recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did not like. Used top quality ingredients and it wasn't good. Not a good balance of ingredients, way too tart. Probably won't make again. If I do, I'll make adjustments.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party, tripled the recipe and used the gingerale.... Everyone raved about it and several people have asked for the recipe. It was so delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I absolutely love this Sangria. I don't use the triple sec or the cherry juice but it still comes out great everytime. I have even made it without the brandy and it was still very good. Everyone raves about how great this Sangria is. I make it for almost every party I throw.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe last summer for my boyfriend parents who are big wine drinkers. I used just a cheap bottle of red wine, peach schnapps instead of triple sec, and used mangos, oranges, and peaches.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was wonderful! I served it for a party tonight and it was definitely a hit! EVERYONE loved it and went back for seconds-and thirds! Fantastic and tasted just like the sangria that I tried in Spain!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party and everyone raved about it, even the ones who don't like wine. I used the sugar and ginger ale instead of soda, and it was perfectly sweet for all of us who like 'girly drinks'. Next time I will cut the orange rounds in half though, to make it easier to eat the boozed up fruit (which everyone was doing when the pitcher was gone). Definitely a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled the recipe, using: Berringer's cabernet sauvignon, a total of 1/2 of sugar and no carbonated water. It was delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the potluck dinner I had. It was really good. Next time I won't use as much lime and will put in other fruit like pineapple and cantaloupe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this for a couple of years after having it at a friend's party...you can't beat this recipe! But I make mine with white wine (it's so good I haven't tried the red yet!), usually a cheap pinot grigio--Barefoot is great! I don't add the sugar, but do use ginger-ale instead of club soda. Like so many others have said, DEFINITELY make the night before...it needs time for the flavors to marinate. I'd give this more than 5 stars if I could!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE IT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great base recipe, you can add any fruit you like and it still tatest great! I would agree with other reviews that throwing this together and letting it "marinate" overnight is key to the outcome.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and really good. I made this for a party and everyone was asking me for the recipe. One thing I would do differntly next time... I would add about a cup more of wine and maybe a little less orange juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would give this more starts if I could. Took it to a party and EVERYONE LOVED IT!!! Just be careful. It really is potent!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is delicious! I used half of a sliced orange and half the amount of club soda. Added this and let the whole thing sit overnight. It was the best I have ever had, and friends said the same thing too. Very satisfying and refreshing. Thank you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hit of the neighborhood!!!! It is a perfect drink for people who love wine and people who don't...it's good for all!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great recipe. Did not need any sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a favorite in our household to serve at parties. We just recently had a Poker Party and all of our guests loved it! We made several gallons of this stuff and all of our guests were pleasantly tipsy and throwing their money out the window by the end of the night:)We also used ginger ale. I got to say that it's not your traditional Sangria so if that's what you're looking for then maybe this recipe isn't the one for you. But I'm not a huge fan of red wine to begin with, so adding all the other liquors and gingerale made it a bit sweeter for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best ever! Every time I have made it, everyone asks for the recipe! And when I make it it never last long! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a staple at our parties (which my husband and I throw quite often)!! Even if it's technically 'out of season' or not really relevant to the current holiday celebration, our friends INSIST that we make this recipe! It's the best; I cannot say enough good things. The only alterations we made are to use limeade instead of lemonade and cherry brandy instead of regular...You won't be disappointed!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this!!! I took this to a party and it was a huge hit! I would change anything to this recipe! Tasted very close to the one I get when we go to our favorite Italian place in Little Italy in NYC.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: loved it! its a great summer day drink to sip on outside in the sun. i didnt change a thing on the recipe and it was great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for our Christmas party and it was a HUGE hit. This was the best Sangria I've ever tasted.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We omitted the lemonade concentrate, and made sure to add all the sugar called for. Wonderful!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is indeed the very best sangria recipe ever !!! If you prefer your wine sweet and fruity, this is a must try !! I make it at Christmas and Valentine's Day .. amazing.. thank you !! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a dinner party. Every one of my guests loved it - even people who normally don't drink. I omit the lime, lemon concentrate, and sugar; instead of using triple sec I used Peach Schnapps; I added a little more Brandy; added apple and pear; I also did not add carbonated water. I let it sit over night in the fridge. This is a fantastic Sangria recipe - my version is a bit strong but not too sweet. Next time I would try without adding the additional Brandy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic sangria recipe! Made this for a Superbowl party and my guests went crazy over it. I used diet 7up as a topper instead of seltzer and it made it that much better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is such a great recipe! Not too sweet, and makes a great presentation in a clear pitcher. Definitely a keeper on my entertaining list.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this for a housewarming party to serve with margaritas and chicken fajitas. Went over very well. We made it the night before so the fruit could release all of its flavor into the liquid. I think we ended up tripling the recipe and had to make it in empty milk jugs for storage. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this recipe. I used peach brandy and I used the triple sec. I also added 2 1/2 cups ginger ale so it wouldn't be as strong.For me it is a little to strong and the triple sec gives it a taste I don't care for to much. It is a little bitter tasting to me. But,I do need to add I have never had Sangria before, so I am not saying it is not a good recipe. I was hoping for something with a smooth fruity taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: When you use a really good spanish wine, it can make you very tipsy! I had a cook out and made Anne's fruit salsa from this website. My friends added the fruit salsa in this sangria recipe. Very very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Added apples and ginger ale instead of club soda, kept everything else the same. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome at Xmas time!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last night for my book club ladies...7 outta 8 loved this drink! I used apricot brandy and peach schnapps and added strawberries…no sugar. I had club soda and ginerale on hand as mixers per the other reviews. Most went with club soda. The one gal who didn’t care for it said it was just to sweet for her…even mixing with the club soda. I can tell you I am not feeling my best today because I kept going back for more. I tripled this recipe and ran out…this is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Left out the cherries and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. Great recipe, but it makes a lot! If you are going to save it for a few days I suggest taking the citrus out after 24 hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had to try this after reading all of the reviews and yes, it was totally 5 Star!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was not what I expected, in all my years of drinking Sangria from different countries this was the worst.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of my all-time favorite drink recipes -- have made for various occasions now and everyone has always been pleased. Never had sangria before this, but I'm sure nothing else will compare. I've tried this by the recipe, and also using the peach schnapps / rum swap - both are delicious, though I don't prefer triple sec quite as much. The first couple times I made it with Red Cat, bc that's the only type of red wine I know I like... however, after reading many reviews, I tried the cheaper red wine and it tastes just as delicious !!! No need to use the more expensive wine -- I'd save that for drinking it by itself. This sangria is fantastic.. thanks for the awesome recipe. PS -- guests love eating the cherries after they've been soaked for a day !

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe was soooo good. I have been searching for a sangria recipe that wasn't too tart. This was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe! I made it for a new years party and it was gone. I followed the recipe exactly, but I opted not to add the soda. Thanks for the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. I like mine a little sweeter so used 7Up instead of carbonated water. Otherwise, followed the recipe exactly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've tried a lot of Sangria's and this one has to many citrus ingredients. The white sugar is definately needed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so tasty! Make according to recipe except add sprite and leave out the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I octupled this recipe for a birthday party and added 8 chopped granny smith apples, which I thought were pretty clutch. Mmmm...I omitted the sugar and served with ginger ale and seltzer water optional. It was a hit! Not a drop left. I also sliced half of the oranges in rounds but put in the rest in edible chunks and they were delicious. I was a little short on brandy (used a 750 mL bottle, which was a little less than a cup short of what was called for) and I doubt that it made too much of a difference. Would definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone I serve this Sangria to asks for the recipe. Absolutely fantastic! I tend to skip the concentrate since it's too sweet for my liking. Better make extras -- even the men love this one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME! After reading reviews, I used Capt Morgan instead of Brandy and Peach Schnapps instead of triple sec, for fruit I used peaches, pears, cherries, apples & the sliced oranges and made it the day before. make a quadruple batch for our Xmas party, it was GONE! will make again and again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is fantastic! Made 2 changes.. .left out the limes (afraid it would make it too bitter) and instead of the white sugar made a simple syrup which mixes MUCH better - and no one even knows they're drinking an alcoholic beverage!! GREAT recipe! I'll use it again & again! This from someone who HATES wine!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The BOMB! I served this at a party and people kept asking for more... It was sooo good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria! I tried two batches one with brandy and the other with rum. Preferred the brandy, but both were still great!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Kelcampell- I had to laugh at your review- Sangria originated in Spain- NOT Mexico! No wonder this didn't taste right to you! LOL!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make sure you have a designated driver!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great sangria recipe. I made it for a family dinner last night to serve with paella and we all loved it. We didn't have club soda so I substituted a bottle of Fresca. Worked fne.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe a few times now and it's ALWAYS a huge hit. I love it too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: just need to add my accolades. this is wonderful and i'm asked for the recipe EVERY TIME I make it. delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a quadruple batch for my 40th birthday party and it was a huge hit. Every drop was consumed and I should have made more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good sangria. Not sure if it's similar to the real thing or not but it was pretty good and I would make it again. I liked it better with some ginger ale added to it also.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a Halloween party and all my girlfriends loved it! Even the husbands enjoyed it. I made my "Witch's Brew Sangria" even more dramatic by putting my punch bowl into a bigger Halloween bucket surrounded by dry ice and water. The eerie foggy effect was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria recipe. Period. I serve this at least once a month at my Yappy Hours (I own a little doggie daycare) and everyone raves about it and want the recipe! I do some modifications however. I HATE the bitterness that most sangrias have so instead of sliced citrus I use mango, pineapple, watermelon, strawberries, etc - anything but fresh sliced citrus so you don't get the bitterness of the rind.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made alot of Sangria. By far this has been the best recipe. I served it at a Bunko party, and everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: oh my god this was good. it was a lot of prepwork but for a party or shower its perfect. it was a hit at my sisters bridal shower. i did make some substitutions as recommended by some of the other reviewers and i was glad i did. first of all i used cherry brandy instead of regular brandy, i wanted a little sweeter recipe. i was afraid it would be too strong. i used frozen cherries because my supermarket didnt have fresh and delish and easy! the fruit soaked up a lot of alcohol so we were sucking on the pieces long after the sangria was gone and they were heavenly. i would recommend this recipe anyday and will definitely make it again!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria I have ever tasted. I only added one bottle of soda water because there was no room in the large container I used - it was a multiple recipe for a big party. Every bit of it was gone at the end of the evening. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Worth the wait! I forgot to make this the night before and started early in the morning, but this recipe definitely gets better with time! It's a lot of ingredients and could break the bank if you don't have alot of things on hand, but it well worth it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I also didn't make enough and both the men and women at our BBQ enjoyed this! I also substituted the carbonated water with 7up and didn't add the sugar. Pay no mind to the reader who didn't like this because they tried "the real thing" in Mexico - someone should tell them that this is a Spanish drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party. Even those who "don't like Sangria" loved it. Some preferred to add club soda instead of lemon-lime soda (which they found too sweet).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is gooooooood....and strong! I made this for my daughters 1st birthday party. I had several people comment on how good it was and they aren't even drinkers. Definitely let it sit at least overnight! I didn't add the 7-up or club soda, but I might try that next time cause I think that would be really good too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect recipe - wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious and easy to make. It even gets better as it sits. i didn't have regular brandy on hand, so i substituted apricot brandy.
