After 24 hours I removed the fruit so it wouldn't ferment or turn bitter. One week later, I had some leftover and it was even more delicious. I used Cabernet Saugvignon for the wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! Made these for a Southern Living party and although I think I drank the majority everyone like them. First time making anything with pomegranite but it was easier than i thought.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: HOLY MOTHER OF SILENUS! What a concoction. Fruity, flavorful and very very strong. Not that this needs any more alcohol added to it but it is also fantastic with champagne substituted for the club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ahh... sangria as it should be. I did not add the sugar, but did add about 1 cup of club soda. I also threw in an apple. Perfection in a pitcher. Yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great! I think I am still hungover from this wonderful sangria we made 2 nights ago! It was perfect with the Tortilla Espanola & Paella I made. We taste tested it without Gingerale first - it was terrific, then with Gingerale and it was terrific. Fun to make, fun to drink and looks so pretty! Thanks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! My neighbor and I are scared that we are going to develop a drinking problem with this stuff!! hahaha Thanks for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this and was only able to let it set for 5 hours before serving, everyone loved it. I was glad I made a double batch. I also only had cherry flavored brandy and it worked out great. I did omit the sugar. Perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved it. Didn't add the sugar and used wild turkey instead of brandy as that is all we had...still tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: everyone loved it no one tasted the alcohol at all. Used blush wine to make it sweeter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this over the weekend ... it was wonderful ! Ended up drinking the whole thing with a girlfriend! I added limeade instead of lemonade just because I didn't have any. Left out the cherries too. I'm going to try and make a white sangria next.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We jazzed it up with a little more of everything, due to individual taste and then brought it to a BBQ. Everyone really enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is by far the best sangria recipe I have ever tried! Everyone loves it. Great party drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I took a 1.5 L bottle of Inglenook Merlot-- (cheap-- about $6.00) and I doubled the ingredients. It was wonderful. My company loved it. I didn't add limes. I let it sit in the fridge about 4 - 5 hours. Will DEFINETLEY make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! My husband and I made this for our family this summer and it was an instant vacation favorite. We used apricot brandy instead of regular and it turned out really well. We had to make it a second night because everyone loved it so much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!! I used a Peter Vella burgundy (my favorite mexican restaurant uses it in their Sangria). Also used Peach Schapps instead of triple sec. I definitely like the addition of carbonated water for a 'summer' feel. We used one with citrus flavor. Absolutely wonderful. It's almost impossible to ruin this recipe. Next time I'll try a few variation and make a 'white' Sangria. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for the first time back in March for my sisters surprise b-day party. I made a double batch & it was gone before the party was over. I followed the recipe exactly as written. You can definetly add your favorite fruits for your own personal liking. I have made it several times since the party & every time its a party favorite!! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I used a package of frozen berries (strawberries, raspberries and blueberries) in addition to the citrus and cherries. I did not use any sugar. I added soda water to the glasses as it was served. It was delicious and a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made sangria before, but this was the best. My husband absolutley loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is YUMMY!!! Be careful - it's more potent than it tastes!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this. So yummy! I always add raspberry club soda and never ad the sugar, instead I add 2T of grenadine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was hands down, the best concoction I've ever brought to an event. I say this for two reasons; one, everyone at the brunch I was at commented on how great it tasted (I eased dropped of course); two, everyone was hammered but giddy! The only thing that I really did somewhat different...add strawberries with the other fruit. Also, most important of all is be sure to let the fruit marinate overnight (8hrs) and don't add any soda to it, yet). I waited until I arrived at the brunch and then added 7-up to it. This way, it had a little bubble flavor to it and the soda wasn’t flat sitting in the fridge overnight! The apricot brandy was good additive! 7 gallons of this stuff makes for some really good stories out of people you’ve never met!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I looked at a number of sangria recipes on this site before deciding on this one for serving at my niece's first birthday party. I took another reviewer's suggestion and added a bit more brandy. This was a great success! It was refreshing and the flavors of the fruit blended perfectly. I will definitely make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I got the recipe from my s-i-l. Made "30 servings" for a picnic at my house. It was FANTASTIC!! Be careful, it packs quite a wallop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria I have had and everyone at my last party is insisting that I make it again for my son's rehearsal dinner this weekend. So I'm preparing to make a quad-duple batch! I followed the original recipe to the "t" but I did use another's suggestion of ginger ale instead of the sugar. Fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is amazing! Honestly, I've never had any other sangria before, but everyone I served it to (3 different times) said it was fantastic. I took the advice of another reviewer and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. I didn't use any cherries, but instead added blueberries, kiwis, and pineapples. However, the pineapples were a bit iffy. I guess they have some kind of special digestive enzyme in them and so they will do weird things to the sangria if you use a lot or if you add the juice as well. I did both of these things once but it still tasted fine, just smelled a little ripe. I made sure it was consumed the very next day. Also, I think the cabonated water or 7-up really ruins this drink. Try it without or let people choose if they want to add it or not.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria recipe received rave reviews at my last party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: So very, very, very Fab!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this Sangria for our July Sangria & Summer Wine Party. Friends helped me taste test the week before!I made several batches to the T but without the sodas. I used different reds (Malbec, Merlot, & a Cabernet) did use the cherries & some juice along with a partially ripened peach. OMG we let it sit in Fridge for 48 hrs. and what a difference 1 more day can make. We did really like the Malbec Sangria it had a different flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: best recipe ever! ive tried different resaurant sangria and now i wont drink anything but this!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree with everyone else! This is a great idiot proof recipe. I made it with cheap red wine and it was delicious. As many others did before me, I omitted the sugar and used ginger ale. I made a double batch. It looked great in my punch bowl. This recipe is a keeper for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a dinner party and it was a huge hit. I did not add the sugar...I think it would have been too sweet. Very easy and very worthwhile.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made with fresh speamint and it was awefull. Make sure you use Peppermint.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Sangria!!! Have made this several times and everyone likes it. I usually use one bottle of "Sangria" wine and another bottle of whatever red/apple I have on hand. Doesn't really matter. It's the other ingredients that make this Sangria special!! Great in the frig for a few days.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great item to keep in the fridge during the summer in case company comes by or just when the mood strikes. It is good to make in the morning for a dinner cook out. Also, I do not bother with the fruit since it takes up room in the glass. Just pour it over ice and yum, yum. Be careful! It has a punch and goes down really easy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great sangria! I took some of the other members advice and used sprite, but I loved it and plan on serving it often!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out perfect. I will definitely continue to make this. I make it with the sugar and I leave a bottle of tonic water nearby for anyone that wants to lighten up their drink a bit or create a more fizzy drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I actually only used half a can of pink lemonade and just the fruit, with one more orange in it. Turned out very very sweet and citrus-y and kept for days.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best! Love It! Followed recipe to the tee!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic as it is! You can't just have one glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!!!! Made this for a summer luncheon and my friends loved it! It is so easy to make. You must let it sit over night for it to bring out all of the flavors.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an excellent drink. I had never made Sangria before but was suprised how easy it was to make. I have made this several times now because I keep getting asked to bring it to parties. I omitted the sugar and just used key lime flavored carbonated water to each glass I served and I omitted the cherries and added some sliced apples. Thanks for a great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is truly the best...I have made and tried several, and this is the one I always come back to...to the person who said this was the nastiest recipe they have ever had...I too have been to Mexico, and you have no idea what you are talking about...Kudos! this IS the best!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a VERY tasty Sangria. I am NOT a red wine fan, but I really enjoyed this mixture very much. I left out the marachino cherries (don't like cherries), but followed the rest of the recipe verbatim. My company raved about it and I enjoyed it, too! Definitely a keeper recipe and will make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is delicious. The market did not have lemonade concentrate, so I went with limeade concentrate instead. I also used Burgandy wine in those big jugs. Oh and I added a splash of Rose's Lime Juice, too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic. I did make the night before. I did not add the sugar as it was sweet enough. I also did not add the club soda or Sprite to the entire batch. Rather, I mixed in individual glasses. Therefore, if people wanted it sweeter I mixed w/Sprite...if not I mixed with club soda. This was a big hit at my 4th of July party...doubling the recipe makes a gallon...I made 3!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed one of the readers suggestion to substitute Captain Morgans and Peach Schnapps for the triple sec and brandy and have handed this recipe out countless times. You can add gingerale before serving if you don't want it so strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this for cookouts for the last year, and it is by far the best Sangria! I don't change a thing except quadruple the recipe, and it's gone in no time. Definitely needs to sit overnight. I serve mine over crushed ice. Also, I use the big jug 'o wine, even though I would never drink that stuff alone, it doesn't matter in this recipe because there are so many other ingredients. Wonderful recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great mix! Pretty and tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added sliced green apple and used 1/2 cup simple syrup instead of the sugar. Wonderful! Everyone loves the recipe so be sure to double it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I doubled the brandy & this was a huge hit among my girlfriends -- 2 of whom had lived in Spain for a year+. They said it was the best!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed this almost exactly, but I changed the fruit up a bit. I used some fresh peaches and I cut down a bit on the limes and lemon. I also cut the sugar in half...not as necessary with the sweeter fruit. I served this party and it was gone in a flash...DELICIOUS!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria recipe yet! It is comparable to the one at my favorite Portuguese restaurant. As other reviewers suggested, I used Sprite (instead of sugar and carbonated water) to sweeten. I also used some of the maraschino cherry juice to sweeten it, as well. I didn't have oranges, but I cut up some strawberries to add. You can easily drink a lot of this because it does not have a strong alcohol taste. Be careful not to drink too much; the next day is a bit rough. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this twice recently for parties. Everyone loved it. Thanks for a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Sangria recipe! I used ginger ale instead of sugar and carbonated water as suggested. It was better after sitting overnight. We did serve some right when we made our double batch and it was still good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed all the directions and ended up with Sangria with a kick. I made a double batch, everyone enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe exactly, except for the optional items. Did not need the sugar or carbonated water. Let the mix(without the wine) sit in the fridge over night, it was fantastic. My new summer drink. I will make this over and over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had to try this recipe with all of the rave reviews, and wow were they right. I have since made this Sangria with both red and white wines(with white I use apples to soak up the flavors). Both types have been devoured. I never use the optional sugar or club soda, but sometimes I use pink lemonade instead of regular and it tastes just as good (It dilutes the color of the white wine though). YUMMMY!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this in a double batch, using a liter of Montepulciano D'Abruzzo, which I know is Italian,not Spainish, but what the heck. I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec, and instead of the traditional citrus, which makes it bitter if you leave it in too long, I drained a can of Dole tropical fruit, pureed it, then added it to the sangria, I also added about half of the juice. I sweetened with about 2 T sugar, and 1/4 c maraschino cherry juice, since the cherries just sink to the bottom anyway. I added the club soda to the glasses as we drank it...AWESOME!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word....deliciuos!!!!!!!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Spanish wine, like another reviewer did, spiced rum and 7-up. It was the best! My mom and sister loved it too. Thanks to the reviews I was able to put my own twist on this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this sangria! It was my first time & I thought it tasted as good as any restaurant's. I followed the recipe closely except for the following: I used a sweet red wine & so I didn't use any additional sugar, I added pears to the fruits & I didn't use the cherries. Delicious! Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! Made it last weekend as an adult alternative beverage at my son's 14th b-day party and it was delicious! Used Cap't Morgan's pineapple rum, cheap grocery store merlot and pineapple/orange juice instead of plain OJ. For fruit used: oranges, limes, lemons, strawberries and cherries. Soaked fruit overnight in the rum and sugar and added the wine and OJ a couple of hours prior to serving. Definitely a keeper. I started another batch of fruit soaking but didn't need it so I put it in a large ziploc bag and tossed it in the freezer to thaw and make another day. I plan on using it this weekend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Didn't change a thing and this will be my forever Sangria recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and Strong!! I used a wine "cube" of Cabernet/Shiraz. A friend of mine said a restaurant she used to work for used cabernet and it worked out great! I followed the recipe fairly accurately except I didn't have any o.j. so I left it out and I only added a teaspoon of sugar per batch. I didn't want it too sweet... Also as the carbonated water was optional, I had sprite out as a mixer and people could add however much they wanted for the desired strength. Everyone loved it. I suggest making a double batch:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this for a party over the weekend. It was very easy to make, and everyone loved it. I started with a double batch and ended up having to make another batch during the party because it went so quickly. I followed the suggestion of others and omitted the sugar and used diet Sprite instead of club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good! My guests really liked it and it was easy to put together. I made it only hours before my party and it was still good. Definitely would be better the next day though. I'll keep this one on hand for our next "happy hour". Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW!!!! This was the best sangria I have ever made. I cut the rum down and added ginger ale to the glasses befor I pured the punch in. Wonderful summertime drink. This is a keeper!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it for a party, everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made both this recipe and "Conchi's Sangria" and did a blind taste-test with all my sangria-loving pals at our cottage. This one WON by a 8-1 vote! Skipped the cherries and added some granny smith apples which were fun to eat after soaking in the wine (and added to the buzz!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummmmy!!! Wow, what can I say! The best sangria I have ever had. I made one batch for a bbq, which disappeared in no time... (should have doubled it) I didn't add the cherries or the sugar, used diet sprite instead of the carb water and it was perfect. This one is a keeper. Thank you for sharing this awesome recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made three batches of this sangria for our Memorial Day party, and it was the favorite drink. The only change we made was to use diet Sprite instead of carbonated water. Otherwise, everything was the same - to the measurement in the recipe. This is a perfect summer drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I believe I may have developed a bit of a drinking problem because of this recipe...lol! You can use inexpensive wine, make sure it's dry. I tried using a cheap box of wine so that I could prepare it for the masses, and it was gross. Something about box wine being sweet, yuck. Do not change a thing and you will have the best Sangria ever!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked this sangria, but I like the recipe that I normally use better. There was a lot of this left over at my party which is NOT normal for sangria! LOL

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Lieke other reviewers, I used Taylor Lake Country Red, econo-jug-inexpensive wine. I used rum instead of brandy, because I didn't have any brandy. Otherwise, followed the ingredients. Didn't water down with anything carbonated. The Bunco-babes and I loved it, especially after three glasses each. It will definitely creep up on you. Warning to peri-menopausal women: may lead to hot flashes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with Louis Jadot Beaujolais Red Burgundy...it was outstanding. One of the best Sangrias I ever tasted! My guests agreed!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for a hot day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sorry folks, guess you haven't had my friend Helen's Sangria! She won't share her recipe and I thought this might be it. I followed the suggestions of eliminating the sugar and using Ginger Ale as a carbonator, added gingerale to the glass at the end, didn't work. Added the 1/4 c. of sugar and it didn't help much so when the brige group arrived, I dumped the 2 cups of Ginger Ale in the pitcher with the mix. There were no 2nds asked. Didn't expect any to be leftover but it is 'marinating' in the refrigerator and I will probably throw it out. Oh, I did use a good wine that I would drink. Too sour, even with sugar, and too lemony and fruit didn't look pretty, like Helen's.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Woweee! This is a tasty drink. And it was fun to make. I did cut back on the sugar a bit, but otherwise made exactly as the recipe states. I will have a pitcher of this on hand whenever friends visit. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow...what a great summer treat. I used apricot brandy and sprite instead of sugar. Yummy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I drank the entire pitcher & now I don't remember if it was good or not. Maybe I should try it again? Just kidding. It was excellent. I wish I had omitted the sugar like others suggested though. The first glass was a little too sweet for my liking - after the first glass though, I didn't notice it as much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW - this is AWESOME!!! The only thing I did differently was to marinate everything but the red wine and sparkling water first - for about 2 hours, then I added the red wine (a Spanish Rioja) and let it chill for another 2 hours. I can't even imagine how much better it could be if I'd started the night before!! I didn't add the sparkling water - it would be a good way to stretch it and tame it down, but I didn't need to do either. Thanks for this recipe!! I was a very happy mother on mothers day (grin)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very good, rave reviews from party goers. Added ginger ale with every glass. A great way to use some inexpensive merlot!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! My husband and I had another couple over for a Mexican dinner. We served this Sangria. (The first Sangria I've ever made.) The guys had beer because "Sangria is girl's stuff." However, after one sample sip, both of them switched from their beer to our girly Sangria! :) Unfortunately, after that, I wish we had made more than one batch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink would cost a small fortune if I had to buy brandy, triple sec, etc. I have had Sangria in Spain and I can tell you it was absolutely delish without all the added liqeurs. Liquor may be quicker but simpler is better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my "go-to" sangria recipe. I don't add sugar or seltzer water. Caution: this is a strong drink. Sip it slowly over ice and enjoy eating the alcohol-infused fruit. You won't be disappointed!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for an anniversary party and everybody loved it. The only changes I made were I didn't have any brandy so I used rum and I threw in the juice from the cherries. Very good recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made a double batch for our party and wished we had made even more. It went in a flash! We added pineapple chunks, pineapple juice, a splash of cherry juice, and some cherry brandy. An awesome drink! Thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party and everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This is absolutely the best drink that I have had in a long time!!! The taste, the presentation, EVERYTHING!!! I thought it would be a little sweet for my taste because I'm more of a dry red kinda girl....but wow....I love it!!! Kudos!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A very forgiving recipe! We made this last night for a party, and everyone enjoyed it. (We made it last for an Easter gathering, with boisterous reviews.) Last night, one person switched from white wine to the Sangria and never went back! We made three changes because we think we are "Sangria Aficianados." We omitted the cherries and carbonated water, and added 1/2 cup Peach Schnapps, and substituted diet 7-Up for the water. Aside from the basic bones of this recipe (the wine, oranges, lemons, limes and specified liqours), many variation work. Apples and Pears work. We always add Brandy and Triple Sec and use 7-Up, but if something is not around or we run out, we find substitutes. I have friends who add dry fruit to their Sangria. (I think it is sweeter, but tasty. They used dried mango and pineapple.) This is really a great ice breaker at a party of friends or acquaintances.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! I made this for a barbeque two days ago and its already known as the "infamous sangria." I can see this getting made for years to come. I left out the sugar and used all the juice from the jar of maraschino cherries. Be warned: this will sneak up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our open house it was a complete hit! I ended up having to make more and everyone kept asking for the recipe. I served it with a creme cheese with the pepper onion relish from Harry and David which was a hit too :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I, luckily, added the carbonated water to a glass instead of the pitcher. I really didn't like it, so I would recommend trying that first. I also found this to be very strong (maybe because I left out the water? so adding more juice or something to compensate might be a good idea).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best! I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. I made 4 batches of it for a party and it was gone at the end of the night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Being clueless about red wine (I drink white) I bought the cheapest I could find (Gallo Cabernet Savignon). I also had to improvise because I realized I didn't have the brandy OR the triple sec I though I had. SO, instead I used burbon and orange flavored tequila that I had on hand. Instead of the sugar I used sweet & low and added extra as I like my sangria just a little bit sweeter. I marinated overnight (including the cherries) and it was the single best sangria I'd ever had. I did NOT add the carbonated soda as it was perfect without. I took the rest over to my dad, the sangria affectionado and he also proclaimed it the best ever....and we fought over the 'marinated' cherries. If I can make it with tequila and burbon and still have it be phenomenal, how would it be if I followed with brandy and triple sec???? I need to find out! I removed the fruit on my second batch--after leaving the citrus slices in for 48 hours my first batch started turning bitter. This is definitely the new party drink at our house!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is DELICIOUS! I have made it twice more since I introduced my friends to this recipe. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was great! I combined some other ingredients from another recipe & everyone loved it. It's definitely on my menu for the summer barbeque.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: very good! I only gave it 4 stars because it's a little too sweet for me, so I just cut back on lemonade concentrate and sugar. Much like the restaurants!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: took this to a party, it was a huge hit. Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe is fantastic! I used a sweet red wine, peach brandy, peach slices, pineapple slices, pear slices, and I added a cup of lemon-lime club soda just before serving. Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I used Robert Mondavi Merlot for the dry red and everyone loved it. If you want a party hit - definitely make this one - best sangria I've had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this at my New Year's Eve Eve party and the guests loved it. Used 7-up instead of carbonated water and let it rest in the refrigerator overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this! Made it for a get together and even one of my fiance's buds snuck one in between his beers. Topped it off with a little 7Up instead of the sugar. Also used fresh cherries since I had them. Would definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my, this was good. I had some leftover and did not want to pour it down the drain. So I got out my trusty freezer containers and froze it. Talk about a yummy icee.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made 4 pitchers of this for christmas and it was a hit. I omitted the sugar. I added juices from pineapple chunks, cherry juice, I added oranges, limes and lemons. I used the triple sec and added ginger ale. It was great 2 and 3 days later. Made it again for New Years. the liquor store recommended Taylor Lake Country Red in a giant Jug and cheap. It worked really really well. will make this again and again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a party in a pinch, with only 3 1/2 hours for it to sit, and it was still delicious. Was a better flavor the next day, but for all those who don't have enough time, I say go for it. Left out the sugar and just used ginger ale like others here, found it to be easier and it was just the right sweetness. Also, swapped frozen berries and pineapple for the cherries (which I don't care for) and thought that was a good change.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING! I love sangria, so there was no doubt I would enjoy this. I was so excited when my guests adored it too. The men were too "manly" to try it, but 3 girls (including myself) downed 2 batches. I will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good, but kind of strong. I used 7up with it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this on two separate occassions over the summer and everyone loved it. I omitted the soft drink, it's a lot stronger without it. I also added apples to the mix. Update: I made this with Gallo Hearty Burgundy wine and because it's naturally sweet, sugar isn't necessary.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am used to making Sangria with a Monin mix, which is hard to find other than ordering it online. So, i thought I'd give this a try last night for New Year's Eve. I made a triple batch, it was all gone. I have a new favorite! And without the pricey Monin mix! I, too, use Charles Shaw (Two Buck Chuck) wines. They're our favorite and you can't beat the price!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty and a hit at the party! I substituted Citron Rum for the brandy, used triple sec, eliminated the sugar and used 7-Up instead of club soda. I do recommend having some of the soda available for your drinkers to mellow the sangria if needed. For reference, I used "2 buck Chuck" Merlot from Trader Joe's. I made a double batch and used 2 oranges, 2 limes and 2 lemons per the recipe. Next time, I'll use one of each for a double batch just to save space in the pitcher and glasses. Also, I recommend halving the orange slices so they fit in the glass better. Will definitely make again! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe, just a few modifications. Used spiced dark rum instead of brandy, a little sugar, no triple sec, more cherries and fruit, and no carbonated beverages. A nice smooth sangria everyone loved!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow, really good. Very easy, never made it before, did use suggestions re: light rum, used Trader Joe's 2.99 Shiraz etc. added sprite zero just before serving. Made a double batch and it was gone quick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my flippin' heck! This is awesome. I never thought I liked Sangria...but then a friend made some that changed my mind. I don't have her recipe so I tried this one. My hubby doesn't like red wine and loves this too! I didn't have lemonade when I first made it - used lemon juice. Also, I had orange and grapefruit juice to use up - yum. Could really play with the fruit juice. And I like this sagria both with and without the soda water (or ginger ale). Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love sangria and this recipe works!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Exquisite recipe! I skipped on sugar, triple sec, but added a pear, apple, mango/peach margarita mix, and gingerale. “Cooked” in the fridge over for about 18 hrs. Will be making it again for the next gathering.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT RECIPE! I get sooo many kudos everytime I make this Sangria. I only wish it was my creation!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria I have ever had. I did not use the carbonated water but did add 2 cans of gingerale and most definitely needs to sit at least overnight. Thanks for this definite keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: FABULOUS!!! Served it at my daughter's wedding and it disappeared in a flash and everyone raved about it. I made some substitutions/changes: NO maraschino cherries or sugar water. I used lime flavored tonic water instead of 7-up or gingerale. The key to this is the wine...the Rioja was fabulous. I think marinating it with the fruit 24 hrs. in advance is also key. I only used oranges, lemons and limes. Can't wait to make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made about 30 servings of this recipe for a tapas party and it was long gone early in the night. Definitely a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! My guests were thanking me while drinking up the two batches I made. I used rum instead of brandy and sprite (omitted the sugar) instead of carbonated water. Also, I bought Trader Joe's Merlot wine ($1.99 a bottle!) I made the evening before my gathering and placed in a punch bowl. It made a very nice centerpiece with the fruit (apples/pears/orange slices) in it. I will definitely make again for the Holidays.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an OUTSTANDING Sangria! It has a major kick so make sure when you make it, your guests have plenty of time to sober up! I like a little sweeter sangria so I ommited the cherries and put in sliced nectarines and served with ginger ale. A do listen to the other reviews about making double batches...one isn't enough!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria ever! I've made this several times already. The only changes I make are to leave out the sugar and cherries (don't like 'em), then serve mixed with ginger ale. Beware - make 2x what you THINK you need because this goes fast!! Thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I left out the lemonade, sugar and cherries and substituted lemon/lime soda for carbonated water and it was fantastic- I needed to change the quantity to serve 50 people. I bought several gallons (4 liters each)el cheapo red wine and adjusted the remaining ingredients to make several batches. I don't even like red wine by itself but this was muey fantastico!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have never made a Sangria before. This was the first time having one and it was lovely. I did add some ginger ale to my glass just to calm the strong taste a little. I used Rosemount Shiraz wine. I also used apricot brandy and a little rum added as well. It marinated in the fridge for a day. My boyfriend didnt care for it so I had to drink it all by myself. It would be a great summer drink to take to cookouts!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: great sangria recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WONDERFUL!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe to make sangria for the first time. It was sooooooo good. As some reviewers suggested, I omitted the sugar and used ginger ale in place of the carbonated water. I also added apples, peaches and plums. I made a pretty big batch and am happy to say it disappeared. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my boyfriend's birthday party, and it was fantastic!!! I used four bottles of wine to make two 1-gallon pitchers. I used rum instead of brandy and peach schnapps instead of triple sec. In addition to the lemons, limes, oranges, and cherries, I also added pineapple chunks. I omitted the lemonade concentrate and sugar, but added some of the cherry juice. I let it sit overnight. Also, I did not add carbonated water or soda to the Sangria, but had it on hand. When serving, I mixed half gingerale with half Sangria in the glass for most people, but some of our more seasoned drinkers preferred it by itself or mixed with Red Bull. The pineapple did NOT taste good when eaten, so I won't add it next time, but the oranges and cherries were to die for! Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a summer party and it was a huge hit. I will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria recipe ever.I won't be using any other recipe from now on. I omitted sugar and water. Refrigerate it over night for best results. I used a inexpensive red spanish wine called El Paseo. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an excellent recipe. I used sprite instead because that's what I had on hand, everything else is as indicated in the original recipe. This will be my entertaining beverage from now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this to serve 50 at my housewarming pool party. Instead of the recommended amt of brandy, I did half brandy and half peach schnapps. Also, instead of sugar, I added a big jar of maraschinos with the juice, plus the recommended amt of soda (I used Sprite Zero.) If I did it again I would only slice up one each of the citrus fruits-- I sliced about 4 of each and even that was too much perhaps because I served it in a beverage jar with a spigot at the bottom, instead of a punch bowl or pitcher, so people didn't have access to the fruit. I had about 40 people at the party and the sangria was a big hit. Thanks for the recipe and for all the suggestions! Will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous. I only let it sit in the fridge for 5 hours and it was still wonderful. I added 1 cup ginger ale 1 cup club soda right before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sept 15 2007 - I Tried this for the first time for a birthday party cook-out..Im not a drinker but this is so good i had 3 small cups of it.Sub barcardi lite rum for brandy & used peach snapps for triple sec.Instead of dry red wine used Arbor Mist Sangria Zinfandel.Forgot to add 7-up,still tasted great.Everybody loved it including the guys.Mother-in law not a drinker & she like it too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of the most requested recipes I have ever made--I made it last spring for a luncheon and am still getting requests for the recipe. Bravo!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this the other night and my guests loved it! I put Gran Marnier in it and it was the best.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is awesome! I didn't have any lemonaide concentrate so I used that same amount of lemon concentrate and added some sugar. It's a huge hit everytime I serve it. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really enjoy making this recipe and my friends love drinking it. It seems like I never make enough. It is easy to improvise and add your own touches with this recipe. I make it a little differently every time and it always comes out great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: FANTABULOSO!! I did make a few changes, mostly because I didn't have a few exact ingredients. Instead of 1/2 cup brandy I used 1/4 spiced rum with 1/4 brandy. I used Cointreau for the triple sec because I'm a snob and prefer it. Didn't have frozen lemonade, but did have pineapple sherbet, used two scoops. No cherries, so I splashed in some grenadine. My only mistake was that I didn't DOUBLE it for four people. Oh and I added an extra peach. The fruit was yummy over frozen custard later. burp

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it for a party and everyone loved it (atleast that's what they said). I didn't like the carbonation... thus 4 stars. I didn't add the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A must for any BBQ! This is the best Sangria! I substituted the brandy for rum and used gingerale instead of the sugar and club soda. I used a very inexpensive bottle of burgandy wine (as suggested by the liquor store employee).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a triple batch for a picnic and all was gone in an hour!!!!!!! Great recipe!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this to serve as a pre drink for my daughters 21 birthday. I excluded the brandy, and used gingerale .. for triple sec we used grand marniar. everything else was accurate.. it was awesome. everyone loved it and it went well with the fish tacos. I will definately make this again. Cheers!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! This reminded me of grapefruit juice which I found shocking considering the amount of alcohol it contained! This is the only recipe I've ever attempted...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic Recipe. Best Sangria I have had in the states... Party guests raved about it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good! Will definately make it again for another party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum - lots of ingredients though

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I took this to a party. It wasn't a big hit with the women, but one guy drank a ton of it because he wasn't getting buzzed off his wine coolers. I thought it was okay, but wouldn't spend the money to make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This packs a punch!! I will make it again, but add less brandy, or maybe use a flavored brandy, like peach. Adding the ginger ale is absolutely necessary to dilute it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria is DELICIOUS! I made it without the extra sugar and used some canned peaches/nectarines and their juice. I only let it sit for about an hour and it was still fantastic. Topped off with ginger ale, it's marvelous! It certainly does sneak up on you...but very pleasantly :) Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome.....knock you off your feet....but really yummy too!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delecious!!! Instead of buying triple sec, the liquor store sold brandy and orange together, it was very yummy! Also, instead of adding sugar I bought a sweeter wine that was recommended by the sales rep. Otherwise followed the recipe the same and everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yowza! Very very strong if you don't dilute it, and my guests didn't realize that! Next time, will add the lemonade (or ginger ale or whatever) prior to serving for the sake of my guests!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have never made Sangria and with all of the recipes out there I had a hard time choosing which one to make. My best friend suggested this one. I did not ad any sugar, but did add fresh nectarines in with the fruit. All I can say is watch out...this stuff has one heck of kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I left out the cherries and sugar and added a peach. I used 2-Buck-Chuck cabernet sauvignon, which worked just fine. I made 4 batches and let them sit overnight -- this was a HUGE hit at my housewarming party. We ran out in about an hour, and everyone was digging the fruit out of the pitchers. Next time I will add pineapple and maybe other fruits.... great recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my goodness! This is to die for! I made it for a backyard BBQ. My only mistake was making only a double batch! I was shocked to discover that the men would pass on beer for some sangria! Just a tip, it must sit overnight or longer! Also, don't mix the sprite or soda water. It doesn't need it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT!!! I did not have any Frozen lemonade, so I substituted My kids' lemonade mix for that and the sugar, it turned out perfect! Keeps for days and everyone loved it!Try mixing half and half with a white sangria recipe, very refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these for a small gathering of friends and it was a huge hit.Everyone was looking for more when it was all gone.Definitely a permanent recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a delicious sangria. We used Sprite to make it a little sweeter. 2.5 gallons of this were gone in a couple hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have used this recipe several times now. Everyone raves about it! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really like sangria and this was an awesome recipe. My only advice is make A LOT becuase it goes quick! I took another reviewer's advice and used giner ale instead of club soda and it was very good! I tripled the recipe and still needed to make more!!! I will definately be making this recipe again! Thanks for sharing it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty! A big hit at a casual party at home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whoa! This was delicious - I used spiced rum vs. brandy, blackberry merlot and omitted the sugar. Even my beer drinking husband enjoyed this cocktail! The secret is definitely letting it sit overnight. Very tasty with a great kick :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a girlie party and I made this drink and it was a hit. All the ladies loved it and wanted the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a dinner party last night w/ a cuban menu...it was WONDERFUL sangria!! I doubled the recipe. The only thing I did a little different was to use Splenda & pineapple juice in place of the sugar. I will definitely be making this again & again! Enjoy:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW - Superb! Served this tonight for a Cuban-themed dinner for six friends and the two batches weren't quite enough, so we hit a bottle of red wine after we ran out of the Sangria! I loved the brandy and triple sec and don't think I'd substitute those. I omitted the sugar and added Diet 7-UP instead of carbonated water. Even the red-wine hater asked for more!! The best new recipe I've gotten in awhile - thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this Sangria recipe for three years now. I make it ahead of time and share it with friends on our summer camping trips. I've tried other Sangria recipes, and ordered Sangria in restaurants and this is BY FAR the best ever! For my taste, the fruit & juice add enough sweetness, so I omit the sugar altogether.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this for friends last weekend and it was a HUGE hit. The only issue is that we didn't make enough! We really don't know much about sangria so we were flying blind here, but boy will this become a staple for us from now on. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I substituted rum for the brandy and added diced apples. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Recipe!!! Everyone loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this for summer parties for the last two years and it is always a hit. EVERYONE loves it. The 1st time they drink they always try to figure out all the wonderful tastes. I use inexpensive red wine by the gallon and it is just as great. Hint, dont put the fruit in a skinny neck bottle!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This IS the best Sangria recipe! I typically can "take-or-leave" Sangria, but decided to try it out on company this week. I wouldn't change a thing on the recipe - I did add club soda to the mix, otherwise it may have been too sweet. Very YUMMMMMMY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just one word.....delicious!!!! The best sangria I've ever had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very delicious! Used good brandy & Cointreau to dress it up. I'll definitely make this again to accompany my favorite Mexican dishes - especially the spicy ones!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The only ingriendent that was different was the brandy, mine was apricot brandy. I doubled the recipe an it was gone for the Father's Day BBQ! This recipe is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was good, but not as amazing as the other reviews. Oh well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Double batch was all gone! Left out the sugar and used ginger ale. Big hit. Only refrigerated for about 5 hours, and was still really good. Will definitely plan ahead next time, as I am sure that it's even better after sitting overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Incredible! I followed another reviewers lead and substituted Rum and Peach Schnapps. Absolutely love this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm thrilled to have found this recipe. We have about 50 bottles of yucky homemade red wine that no one will drink. I used it with this recipe and it's fantastic! Definitely try to make ahead. I also skipped the carbonated water and sugar, and just gave my guests the options to add some sprite to their glass if they wish. A huge hit, will make a lot this summer..thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A fantastic recipe - it was gone at no time in my party. I originally tripled the recipe, but still had to make another triple batch in the middle of the party because it was gone in under 30 minutes. I didn't use the carbonated water, and let it sit overnight - delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious--I can't stop making it! This is also a fun recipe to play with. I tend to overbuy when it comes to fruit, so I throw in whatever I need to use up--sliced strawberries and kiwi are my favorite additions. However tempting it is to start pouring early, you're cheating yourself if you don't wait at least 24 hours. If you can hold out for 36, even better. This stuff gets better the longer it sits in the fridge.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! Made this last night for a cookout at our house and it was a hit - not a drop left! I doubled the recipe and omitted the sugar. I had cans of sprite zero sitting next to the pitcher sangria for guests to add if they desired. Without the sprite it was very strong . I added sprite to mine and it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Incredibly good! I went to 2 stores and couldn't find triple sec so I just left it out. The only other thing I changed was another reviewers suggestion to add gingerale instead of carbonated water. I served this at a ladies' night and it was a big hit! There are already requests for upcoming summer parties! Just be careful because it definitely packs a punch!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe for sangria was excellent! I used champagne instead of club soda to add fizz and a little extra kick! Got rave reviews from my guests!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I will admit that when I first made this recipe and took a sip I wasn't sure I would like it, but letting it sit for approximately 24 hours made all the difference in the world. The flavors from the sliced fruits really come out after the Sangria sits overnight. I doubled the recipe and it nearly made two quarts. I am not a maraschino cherry fan so I left those out. If you would like, you could add a little club soda to your glass to tone it down for those who cannot handle the stronger flavors of the alcohol. My husband liked this and thinks I should make it again. I concur! Great drink for warmer weather!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really great! I left off adding the sugar and used 7-up to add to the mix before serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made two batches - one with club soda and one without. I think that I liked it better with the club soda. I think it could have used more brandy, and I was glad that I didn't add the sugar! It was really good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this. It definitely had a lot of brandy and packed a punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is PERFECT. I've made this sangria several times and given the recipe away each time. The alcohol content is just right for a relaxing evening on the deck or your celebration of choice. I've also served the soaked fruit separately and that was a hit too. I definitely recommend this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: i agree that there is no reason to try another recipe after you've had THIS one! requested every year for cinco de mayo!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing sangria! The BEST I've ever had, let alone made myself. I made twice as much but substituted brandy with rum and used gingerale. I took it to a BBQ and we couldn't stop talking about it! I've passed this recipe on to everyone who was there.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria for a fiesta party and within 30 minutes it was nearly gone (and I even doubled the recipe!) It was a hit and I'll make it again! I used peach scnapps and rum rather than brandy and triple sec. I also used a liter of ginger ale and fresh peach slices just moments before serving. Fantastico!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was pretty darn good, I let it sit in the fridge for 2 days and added a can of sprite right before drinking. I'm adding apples to it this time. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was just ok for me. My friends enjoyed it. I will make it again. Next time I will put less alcohol in it. Was too strong for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious. I used peaches instead of cherries. Also, I used a pineapple Mexican soda that I found in individual bottles in the Mexican aisle of the grocery store in lieu of the optional carbonated beverage. It really came out fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great sangria recipe. I have made it several times, following the recipe exactly. Friends love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this in the summer for a gathering, and I have been getting requests for it ever since! It's so good, it is smooth, you don't taste much alcohol but it can knock you on your but easily! I used 7-up instead of ginger ale, I mean lemons and limes are added so why not a soda with a lemon lime flavor? It is a must try, and save recipe, cause once you make it, people just won't let you stop.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was easy and delicious. my first time making it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was easy and delicious. my first time making it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Big hit at New Years! Dont change a thing! perfect as it is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I omitted the lime slices and added peaches which was super yummy. Instead of sugar I used honey and sweetened lime juice instead which gave it a nice flavor. Next time I think I'm going to try using Oporto instead of Cabernet and then it will have the natural sweetness of the wine. This was a huge success, I would recomment it to anyone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe twice and both times it was a hit!! Once at my housewarming and it was the first thing gone!! Again for a friendly dinner and my friend absolutely loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think this is a five-star sangria, but I would recommend using a good wine. My not-so-good wine made it more like a 3-4 star sangria. Oops!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit at our thanksgiving dinner. We made a double double batch, used red table wine in a box and added a bit more liquor. Everyone loved it and knew which drink was theirs by which combo of fruit was in their glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this when ever my gal pals come over for a night of fun.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great and oh so easy! I made mine with Razz Rum instead of Brandy, used Merlot wine and rasp lemonade concentrate. People were looking for more after it was gone! I cannot wait to make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I never liked Sangria in the past, but when I tried this, it was unbelievable! I made a double batch and added 2 c of ginger ale. I forgot the cherries, though. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled this for a party and at the end of the evening not only was it all gone, but my friends were fishing out the fruit to eat. This recipe was so good I shared it with the clerk at the liquor store.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone LOVES this sangria!! I omit the cherries and sugar, lighten up on the lemon juice, add peaches and top off with ginger ale. Absolutely perfect!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We soaked the fruit in brandy and some wine overnight and they added a real kick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends always request this for book club! I don't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good! Everyone loved this. I doubled the recipe and used it two days in a row adding diet sprite just before serving. I will definately make again. 2010 Update: I have been making this for several years now and everyone I serve it to loves it. I use a 3 Liter bottle of Chianti & quadruple the recipe for a big crowd. I always make it the day before and leave out the sugar, and add clear american black cherry carbonated water from walmart at the last minute. If there is any leftover it last several weeks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Crisp and refreshing. It went down a little TOO well....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this recently for a pool party and it was a hit. Everyone enjoyed it. We didn't wait the 2 hours before drinking it and it was still very good. We used Merlot wine and rum (had it on hand). We will make this again and again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious...everyone wanted the recipe. I omitted the sugar and cherries and didn't dilute with seltzer or club soda. To a batch made with chardonnay, I added the lemonade concentrate, and to a merlot batch I used the limeade concentrate. Yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastico !! This was great, and so simple ! I used Merlot, and doubled the batch for a dinner party. Thanks for the GREAT recipe ! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: A wonderful base recipe for improvisation. I used a cabernet for the wine, used lime juice instead of the lemonade concentrate and added 5 cloves before refrigerating overnight. - Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fruity and refreshing, this Sangria is a wonderful drink. I followed the recipe exactly except I left the cherries out.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria was great! I used the sugar and ginger ale and it was perect - got rave reviews at my party. I threw in some green apple chuncks too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was FANTASTIC! I made it for a tapas dinner party and it went over famously. I followed the advice of others and used gingerale in place of the club soda. Very addictive! Makes for a good party! Thank you!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am not a Sangria drinker, but I loved this recipe! I mixed with diet sprite and thought it was a great refreshing summer drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used merlot, limeade and a couple packets of splenda. Just a splash of diet sprite when serving. Excellent. Best sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is definitely the best sangria I have ever had (and I have tried many)! I made two batches, one with a cabernet and one with a chardonnay, both were fabulous! I didn't use the sliced fruit suggested or the cherries, instead I cut up oranges and granny smith apples into bite size pieces. I added the sugar as suggested, but left out the carbonated water. This drink was the hit of the party, everyone wanted the recipe! Thanks HJacoby!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was SO good! The best sangria I've had. We made o.j. cubes so it wouldn't dilute the flavour and it was perfect! I also used Sprite rather than club soda. Will definitely make it again this summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Limeade instead of the Lemonade and Splenda instead of sugar. For the soda water, I used Diet Sprite. Everyone loved it! I will definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Recipe. I made it for a 4th of July party and it was a great Hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! This was my first attempt at making Sangria and it was excellent. My neighbor, who makes her own, said this was even better than hers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The very best Sangria!! I double the recipe and used Grand Marnier instead of triple sec, mmmmmm. Didn't need any suger. Thank you my new favorite drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was excellent. I omitted the sugar, the cherries, added peach schnapps and gingerale instead of carbonated water. A summer keeper! Thanks HJ!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: SCRAP THE CHERRIES AND ADD AN APPLE... EXCELLENT RECIPE

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this drink, but I substitute the orange juice for cranberry juice. it cuts the citrus tastle a little and makes the drink oh so close to those served at the Olive Garden.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simply Amazing. Was a complete hit! Even my friends that were not big fans of sangria loved it. I dreamed about it for days after trying to make excuses to make it again...hehehe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great if you have everything, if you don't and need to make some compromises it's still flavorful. I did not have lemonade concentrate but a can of tropicana lemonade did well. Ginger ale was also a welcome addition in lieu of carbonated water. You can really make this recipe work if you taste as you add. We loved the result!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: The brandy and triple sec add a flavorful twist (and some kick!) to this recipe. I used a cabernet and omited the sugar and cherries for a tangy, dry sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent! i nixed the cherries and added sliced fruit to the individual glasses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome... had a girl's movie & sangria night... everybody loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is very similar to one that I use for holiday parties and other events...Its great and always a big hit. The only thing I do different is substitute white rum for the brandy, double the oj and omit the leamonade concentrate, and add pineapple slices instead of cherries!!! The great thing about sangria is that you can really make it your own by adding a variety of different ingredients!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: FABULOUS! Makes drinking large quantities way too easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Outstanding! I prepared this to go along side Thanksgiving dinner. It was a big hit - which is especially noteworthy because about half my guests were of Spanish heritage. I doubled the recipe and added a lot more fruit than is mentioned above, inlcuding peaches, pineapple, grapes, 4 different frozen berries and Mandarin oranges. I skipped the carbonated water and used Ginger Ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is excellent, It's the best Sangria I ever had, and it's so refreshing. I made it for a party once and Everyone said it's SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They Wanted the Recipe, thanks HJacoby!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the first time for a office/holiday lunch. I originally doubled the recipe and it went so fast I had to make another triple recipe. Everyone loved it. It was the hit of the luncheon. I used gingel ale instead of club soda. I also added apples and included the optional sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Served it at our supper club's Mexican night and everyone seemed to like it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really nice. Not a five star for me, but clearly 4 star. Now....as we had more and more sangria, the rating certainly went up and up! Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: We really liked this, it was served at a mom's night out party. I used rum instead of brandy because I had rum in the cupboard!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sagria recipe is great! We wanted something to go with the beer at our wedding reception and I found this recipe. It was a huge success!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oustanding- be sure to habe some munchies available because this stuff was potent! We found ourselves digging for the cherries out of the pitcher... thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it. Next time I would chop up the fruit more. Also I omited the frozen lemonade and added more lemon juice and sugar. I also added a little bit of lemon zest.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely the best! I used chianti, ginger ale, and apricot brandy because we like a sweeter Sangria. Hardly a 'far cry from the real thing'- Sangria originated in Spain, not Mexico! I made 2 recipes, and every drop of it was gone at the end of the party. I'd call that a success :-), Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served this at Easter dinner. Was a big hit. Finished quickly. As per another reveiw, I used Rum in place of Brandy and Peach Schnapps in place of triple sec and 7-up in place water.No added sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: Makes the best Sangria I've ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this recipe was the most awful thing I have ever tasted. I go to Mexico every year and this was a far cry from the 'real thing'; absolutely nasty, I definitely do not recommend this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at my last summer party. I made two pitchers and it disappeared in no time. I did refrigerate it overnight as others have suggested which helped make the flavors mix. Will be making again soon. Great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe for sangria. I used spiced rum in place of the brandy, but other than that followed the recipe exactly. I would recommend making more than one pitcher though. We ran out fast!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Sangria! Sangria!
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an amazing recipe. I've never had sangria before and decided that this recipe most appealed to me. I used everything the recipe called for and am I ever glad I did. I let it sit overnight in the fridge and it turned out beautifully. Thanks HJacoby!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’m from Wisconsin and we make it with brandy and 7up or if we want a little sweeter we’ll us southern comfort, I’ve also seen it made with fireball.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like using simple syrup much better than sugar. It is smoother and easier. I used really good quality Italian maraschino cherries (2) and that made a big difference over the cheap cherries. They made the cocktail better. I used Breckinridge Bourbon and it is really smooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: As a simple syrup I used 1 1/2 of white Karo syrup instead of sugar. I also used club soda instead of water, the zest of orange peel instead of the meat of the orange and a little juice from the Marichino cherries. My daughter and I had one as a nightcap last night and it was perfect!!♥️

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: Muddle the cherry and twist that orange to get oils from the zest in there. Always muddle the cherry. SMH

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best OF recipe. I prefer the simple syrup to sugar cube.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty simple and good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Old Fashioned
