cocktail_reviews.Review: An excellent base for hot buttered rum! Keeps very well in the freezer (don't try to freeze it in "cubes" or anything else, it's far too sugary to freeze). I have been known to add ground cloves, ground allspice, or any manner of other delicious spices to this recipe. Also, if you're not using salted butter, do add a pinch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: my sister gave me some of this for Christmas what a warm fuzzy feeling tastes so good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent... much better than my old recipe. So good on a cold winter's night, especially around the holidays!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my first time making Hot Buttered Rum...I had it in November at a party and searched for a recipe. This was such a hit! I doubled the recipe (after reading reviews of giving as a gift) I gave small containers to 4 friends, and had enough to bring to two family Christmases and New Years Eve party. Everyone LOVED it! Each person that had a cup asked for the recipe. I hate to share it...I feel special having such a fun treat for everyone. I used Spiced Rum for each drink, and the kids loved it with cider. I wasn't as big of a fan with the cider. I used Vanilla bean ice cream. I will make every year! Thank you for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This batter is fantastic! I made it the other day and then had friends over for hot buttered rums and cheesecake. To say it was a hit is an understatement, it was a smash hit! It’s very easy to put together and the fact that it keep in the freezer means you can enjoy them all winter long. That is if the batter would last that long, ha! Thanks so much for sharing, I can’t wait to get home and have one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Like everyone, i agree the flavor of this is great--you could eat it with a spoon or drink it with a straw. But this is butter-based and really doesn't mix well with hot water. I have tried it in coffee but I think i will try it with hot milk and/or simply use it as an ice cream topping.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a hit!! Everyone enjoyed this and it was so easy to make. I made a pot of tea and served it that way with spiced rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very creamy and buttery. I think that one tablespoon isn't enough for a cup, so I add a little more. Good with or without the rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is even great with just plain hot water and a dash of nutmeg!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had never tried this drink before but it sounded so yummy that I decided to try it and I made the whole batch. And it is amazing! My husband and I both love it and I can't wait to serve it on Christmas. I did mix two table spoons in though instead of one. I think I will try it in my coffee in the morning!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: very good...very rich I put 2 tbsp of batter in a large mug, with a shot of spiced rum, and topped it off with boiling water...the perfect beverage for our tree trimming evening. I also recommend stirring 1 tsp into a mug of hot milk...really yummy...even without the booze! Another option : mix a spoonful in with coffee -mmmm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum, yum!!! I am giving this for Christmas gifts this year, so good! Although, I did use 2 tablespoons per cup. And maybe just a little extra rum... :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Hot Butter Run Ever, would not change one thing, ive had many other rum recipes but this one made with ice cream is so creamy and last a long time in freezer.... luv it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Christmas drink EVER!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfection! Just what I was looking for @ the Holidays! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made some of this Hot Buttered Rum Batter tonight. It is delicious, however, I had to use a little more batter than a tablespoon for my taste. It could have something to do with the standard coffee mugs these days being much larger than they used to be. Once I added two tablespoons of batter, I was in heaven.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been searching and searching for a Hot Buttered Rum recipe ever since I had it years ago and all the ones I have tried have let me down - except this one! This is absolutely delicious! I don't like a bunch of spices and all of the others were too flavored with nutmeg or cinnamon. This one is so creamy and yummy! All of my friends have asked for the recipe and I find neighbors knocking on my door for a cup when the weather is nasty! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy to make! This was the first time I had ever made hot buttered rum batter. Make the whole recipe, it doesnt make as much as it sounds like it will! Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe exactly as written...it's a definite 5 stars! The batter will never freeze completely solid--don't be alarmed when it keeps a thick gelato texture after hours or days in the freezer. Also, the sprinkled nutmeg at the end makes all the difference. I will be remaking this batter/hot drink every holiday season.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not something I could drink often, but tasted really good. Made way too much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Hot Buttered Rum Batter I've ever made or tasted!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am the most popular woman at work after giving individual batches of the batter as Christmas gifts. Everyone enjoyed the toddy's. A very comforting, delicious drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: So disappointing. I followed the instructions to the letter, but it just doesn't taste that great. It's too sweet and not buttery enough for my liking. If I were to make this again, I'd cut the confectioner's sugar completely. Overall, it's just not that good for the calories you're consuming while drinking it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I remember drinking this (sans rum) when I was a child, it was a Christmas favorite of my grandma. One taste and it was 1979 again, snowing outside, and Grandma was still with us. Isn't that what traditions do? Keep us in touch with our loved ones through those shared memories. Thanks for sharing this recipe. =)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely wonderful. I was afraid it would create a watery drink, but not at all - the result is creamy perfection. I made two batches to give out as presents, and it was easy and fun. A keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been leary of buttered rum recipes because I have had weak tasting buttered rum before, and there is nothing worse!! This recipe is DELISH with just the hot water and rum! I am going to try it with hot apple cider for Christmas. I made a full batch, and it will last a while. Excited to have it again. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: A Christmas party hit! I doubled the spice requirements and added a pinch of clove. Adults loved it and the kids loved the virgin version of it (hot cider used instead of water and rum).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is AMAZING!! You can change it up simply by using a different type of vanilla ice cream (french, vanilla bean etc...) or adding a bit of pure vanilla to give it a richer flavor. The recipe is very versatile. Use it in coffee, with hot water or in cider for starters. I've used rum (spiced IS best) Baileys Irish Cream, coffee and whiskey and yes, even plain ;) This recipe is simply.....NUUUUMMMMY! I made a triple batch and am giving it away in jars for Christmas. THANK YOU SHERIMA1!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last night to test it before giving it as a gift for Christmas. It was REALLY good. I followed the recipe exactly, but cut it in half. After being in the freezer overnight it's still not completely frozen..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious. This is really good as my creamer in my coffee in the morning, without the buttered rum :) This will now be my recipe. I also used Spiced Rum like some other reviewers. Just a splash for me. Used French Vanilla Breyer's.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!! Drinking one right now. Our first Christmas toast, Christmas 2010.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been really sick with a horrible cold that I can't seem to shake. While purusing allrecipes the other night I really wanted to find a hot drink to warm my insides and help me sleep. I love hot buttered rum and when I saw this recipe it sounded really yummy. My husband made it for me last night and I will tell you it made me sleep like a baby! I felt so warmed up and helped loosen my sinuses enough that I could get some decent sleep. Not saying it's a cure all for what ails you, but it sure can't hurt! Plus it tastes sooooo good! I plan on making more of these on xmas! thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe! I started making this in 1965 when I found it in a newspaper in Ohio. Kept it for years but then forgot about it. It makes wonderful Christmas gifts. I love it with apple cider or even in my coffee. Warms your from the inside out.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! I made this and shared with my family and it hit the spot. Warm, sweet, and merry.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this! I actually add 1 teaspoon of pure vanilla extract as well and use 2 T. of batter to a cup. It keeps very well in the freezer and is so much better than store bought.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fabulous! It made a ton, I was able to give it out to my guests as well as keep some for myself! Everyone loved it! I did put 2 tbsp of mixture to 1 oz of rum....PERFECT!!!! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you love creamy, warm, holiday goodness, this is your drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm in love with this recipe! I thought that making my own buttered rum batter was a lot of work but my hubby finally convinced me to try it. This recipe is so easy and tastes way better than the grocery store kind which I used to swear by. I had no problems with the sugar clumping like other reviewers said. I mixed the batter with Captain Morgan's spiced Rum and it taste so much better than using regular rum. I don't think I can keep this to myself and plan on making it as holiday gifts for family and friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I halved the recipe and am now wondering why in the world I didn't make the whole thing!?!? This stuff is DELICIOUS. We don't drink, so as a non-alcoholic alternative, I used apple cider. 8 oz apple cider to 2 Tablespoons batter. If anyone has ever had the Sbux Spiced Apple Cider/Caramel apple spice (what ever its called) - this is almost a dead ringer for it. Every fall and winter I always order these at Sbux - it's my absolute favorite and I'm so so so happy I can now make these at home when ever I please. Thank you for this wonderful recipe :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy! Great for the holidays!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like my sister-in-law made a couple Christmas' ago. This was the hit of my bunco party. A great holiday drink!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG! This is amazing! I just had to try it so I made a glass before I tossed it in the freezer and its soooo good. I made it exactly the way the directions say wouldn’t change a thing. I added a spiced rum to it (don’t even care that’s its 11:30am) but I can’t wait to serve it over a bon fire this weekend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: A friend introduced me to this recipe a couple years ago and it's been a holiday favorite of mine ever since! Great on a cold winter evening!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: okay, i made this for the first time last winter. given the harsh winter we had in maryland, i enjoyed it thoroughly....all by myself. :) i just made a batch today which i'm sure will last me through the holidays. it is becoming a tradition and i'm thinking about giving it as gifts this year. i make it with spiced rum and it's so delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this batter for two Fall/Winters now and I LOVE it! I use about 2 Tbsp. of batter in a mug, because I can't really taste it with just one tablespoon. But other than that, the batter is perfect as is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am so very late with my review of this recipe. It should be ten stars because it was as uber delicious hit at our cookie exchange party last year. This year my plan, because there was so much left over last year I will be putting this in small containers and giving this away to guests for their later enjoyment.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am so very late with my review of this recipe. It should be ten stars because it was as uber delicious hit at our cookie exchange party last year. This year my plan, because there was so much left over last year I will be putting this in small containers and giving this away to guests for their later enjoyment.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have already had requests for this as holiday gifts this year. Guess that means they liked it last year. I up the spices and add ginger because it makes me happy. All in all it's a winner.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good and simple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a yearly drink at our Christmas gathering.I like the way it keeps in the freezer for those nights you want to cozy up with a delicious hot drink. SOOOO GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good, but made a lot - I would only make 1/4 batch at a time, if that. Also, it was hard to mix in the sugars - I ended up with a lot of lumps. Also good served with coffee or apple cider instead of water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this batter recipe for years during the Christmas holidays, and this is just holiday heaven in a mug (and it will sneak up on you with a good buzz!). For a non-alcoholic version I make for the kids, use hot apple juice in place of hot water and rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe exactly as stated. It's tasty enough but it is not freezing. It remains a pourable consistancy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: My mom always had this in the freezer during the winter!!! We would have without the rum as kids. Thanks for bringing the memory back.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is amazing! We love to light a fire, make a hot buttered rum and put on It's a Wonderful Life. Children and teetotalers love it in hot apple cider and hot chocolate. The only danger is eating spoonfuls of it when I am making it! I add a little extra cinnamon, but that is because I love cinnamon so much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Move over coffee!! This is so warm and wonderful on this freezing MN evening. I did as others suggested...and added 2 TBSP of the batter to hot water & rum. Also, tried a non-alcoholic version......2 TBSP batter and 8 oz hot Apple Cider. Very yummy!**UPDATE: Substituted Rum with ButterShots (butterscotch schnapps)...WOW, its hard to decide which is my favorite. This has become our favorite eve drink while wrapping gifts.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: As other reviewers stated, this recipe makes A LOT! That's okay with me, because it's so good! Children and non-drinkers can enjoy this without the rum. Also, you can add the batter to your morning coffee for a treat. I use two tablespoons of batter (sometimes three) per 8 ounces of boiling water. Other than that, I wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this every year for Christmas gifts. People love it! The husband even loves it. We drink it & wrap presents....the only way I can talk him into helping!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is simply amazing! I had remembered having a hot buttered rum years ago when I was very sick and decided to give this a try and I just can't say enough good things about it. I made it just as directed. Used an 8oz cup so it wouldn't be too watered down. Put the cool whip on top and sipped it non stop. Needless to say since I am not a drinker I was in bed almost immediately hehe but everyone should give this a try. Fantastic holiday drink or just anytime you need something to make you rest comfortably. Thank you so much for sharing this awesome recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the first time last year for Thanksgiving. Everyone loved it so much they asked for it again this Thanksgiving. Thanks for the fabulous and easy recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummie!!! It's great even if you don't add rum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tried this for the first time last year; and all I can say is WOW!! Quickly became a little too popular for us -- we were addicted. Nothing like it on a cold night! We do add about 2 Tablespoons of batter to a cup, though. And as for it lasting in the freezer 3 months...no, it never made it even close- we polished it off much quicker than that! Just glad its that season again so I can make more!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very good but I think the recipe is off saying confectioners sugar, I think it should be granulated so that's what I used. I wasn't sure how it would work with the powdered sugar. I did like everyone said and used 2 T per cup of the batter and the spiced rum. YUM. It's not what my husband calls hot buttered rum but it's good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this after all the rave reviews! I thought it was easy but was not wowed by it! I did not like the fact that the mixture sat on the top and had to be stirred after every sip. I made it and put it in the freezer and have not been back to get any. I will not be making this again.. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to make this right before Thanksgiving and use it all winter. The first time I had it I used regular rum, it was good but the spiced rum is a lot better. This is also great topped with French Vanilla Cool Whip, I hope it is back in the stores this Holiday season.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Smooth and creamier than a standard Hot Buttered Rum, especially when topped with the whip cream that one reviewer suggested. Excellent with Capt Morgan Spiced rum. Gives it the extra spice it misses otherwise.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I LOVE this batter. I make sure to have it in the freezer during the fall and winter months. We use it with rum, apple cider, butterscotch schnapps (my personal favorite) and coffee. DELICIOUS!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was a huge hit served hot in cider for our Thanksgiving family "reunion". I cut the recipe in half and stored half in the freezer in "Ball" freezer-friendly containers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made the recipe as listed, but scaled it down by half. I also added a dash of cloves. It was wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this and gave it as gifts to any rum loving friends as well as keeping a lot for myself. I'm glad it makes so much because on cold winter days after work, this is a wonderful hot drink. I used to have a so-so recipe, but now I'll be making this every year!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful but I put in double the amount of the batter into my cup. This taste great when made with the european butter and if you mix milk or cream into the hot water, makes it richer. It is very good as is though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice and easy. I actually found a Dryer's brand icecream that was Pumpkin Pie flavored, and it was perfect for this application! But, the vanilla is wonderful, too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe DOES make a lot, but use good ingredients, and who cares? In a pretty freezer container with recipe attached, it's a great gift idea. I used HaagenDazs ice cream, and freshly ground nutmeg, and it was delicious even as a virgin hot drink for the holidays. Rum's optional, but the freshly grated nutmeg on top isn't.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe yields a LOT of batter! It would be great to give to neighbors and friends as a gift. Our guests only drank one mug each during our Christmas party, as it reportedly made everyone sleepy (even though we were careful about the amount of rum added to each serving). I'd love to try this with amaretto - what a great idea from a past reviewer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy and very tasty. It's nice to have a batch made up and in the freezer for the holiday season.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: My Dad used to make this every Christmas. I had never tried it with powdered sugar, also added ground cloves, and it's very good! I did use my Dad's method of simply softening the butter (not melting), and creaming it together with the sugars, then adding the ice cream. Less mess, easy to scoop after it's been in the freezer and everything still melts together perfectly when adding the hot water. I also use 2 big scoops of batter, depending on the size of the cup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a few slight changes to it. I used Cake Batter Ice Cream instead of Vanilla and I used DiSaronno instead of rum. Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this. Forgot the cinnamon and nutmeg and it was still great. Used 2 tablespoons and filled with water in a coffee mug (with a shot of rum). Also used 2 TBSP with a cup of coffee and tasted like a caramel coffee.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good. I don't like the store bought hot buttered rum batters I have tried in the past. This mix was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've now sampled my wares and think it was a fabulous decision! I made a 3x batch with the intent to give some away. I used an instant cider pack and a lot of hot water in a big mug with about a shot of spiced rum. I added a bit more rum because I couldn't taste it. I gave up the idea I would "taste" it after I'd added about 2 shots (total). Dangerous stuff! I had my husband whisk the sugars into the butter because the butter was floating and . . I'm a wimp. Once it was whipped it was smooth and almost fudge-ish. Taking an idea from comments in another HBRum recipe on here, I sprayed some ice cube trays with unflavored oil and am freezing pre-portioned amounts for serving to guests. I've never made this before, and only had it once. I'm trying to decide who are the people who *must* get these as gifts and how many I can keep! Update: Don't do the ice-cube tray idea! I've got a gloppy mess!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is wonderful! Easy to make ahead and serve the night of a party - delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really, really good! It seemed a little weak using only 1 tablespoon of batter per serving, so I doubled it. Perfect for a cold night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellant recipe! My original recipe was lost and thanks to this site, I have it again! Make it! You'll get great review at your next party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: There are no words great enough to describe how good this is. I cut this in half, as it's only my husband and I that will consume it. I also use two tablespoons of the rum batter and add a shot of spiced rum. It's liquid heaven.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never tried a recipe like this. It was easy to make, makes A LOT of servings, and is really yummy. We used fat-free ice cream and low-fat butter. Yummy! Great with spiced rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! This is the best Rum Batter, EVER. It looks like you are making a lot, but it is SOOO worth it. Share it with a friend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best holiday drink recipe! My famiily loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good for parties, great for unwinding and taking the chill off. Use apple cider if you have a sweet tooth, use hot water if you don't. Going to go have one more now...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wasn't sure what to expect of this but it was good, especially with 2 tablespoons of the mix per cup. I've noticed that on some of the Buttered Rum reviews people mentioned the "butter" floating on top. Because butter is dairy based it shouldn't do this, make sure you don't replace it with margarine- oil based. Also, I doubled the recipe and put it in a plastic gallon ice cream container, it fit perfectly. Make sure you don't put it in a chest type deep freeze while it hardens though. My kids tipped it and dumped half in the full freezer as the seal didn't hold and I didn't notice until 6 hours later, what a mess.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is SO GOOD! My husband says it tastes like something out of Narnia. :) It is good with butterscotch schnapps mixed in too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an awesome recipe! I make it every November. Its wonderful on a cold winter night in front of the fire. I don't change a thing in the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I cut the recipe in half since I knew I would be the only one eating/drinking it. I don't measure I just scoop in two or three big spoonfuls of batter into my mug, add boiling water and it is delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not a big hit. Made as stated, felt like I wasted a bunch of ice-cream. Maybe will try leftovers on something else?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: For a holiday dinner party, I cut the recipe in half and used lowfat ice cream. My guests tried it with Bacardi and with very dark rum as well as in coffee and loved it. I'll make it again next year.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good, pretty good. It freezes for a long time. I use milk in place of water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I took the advice of others and used spiced cider. It was a great drink for a gathering since is can be made with or without the rum. It tastes great both ways.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! This was my first time to have anything like this and I love it! I use way more than a tablespoon in each drink, more like 3! It's best with Capt. Morgan spiced rum, but I ran out and used whiskey in place, still good! Thanks for the great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is excellent. It's so good we are on batch #3.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! A hit even out here in Hawaii!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my gosh!!!!!! I made this and took it as a hostess gift to a party. She now hates me because it is soooo GOOD that she ate most of it herself with a spoon! I have used it as a topping on almost everything from hot BROWNIES to muffins- and as the drink mixer! Evil in your freezer! :-P

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh. My. Goodness. This is the best stuff EVER. Never having made hot buttered rum batter before, I wasn't sure what to expect. This was amazing! I gave it out to a few friends and family at Christmas. My mom ate it with a spoon out of the bowl. I didnt make any changes to it at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This just wasn't for me. It seemed I had to add a lot more than one tablespoon of batter to get any kind of flavor at all. I haven't been back in the freezer to have more since.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved it! The second time I added 1/2 tsp ground cloves, and that was even better (I love ground cloves!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This made a great batter without any changes, but it makes a TON of batter. Unless you are catering to some serious Hot Buttered Rum drinkers, consider cutting down the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did this, they were good, it makes a lot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty drink to serve on cold evenings and during the holidays. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I halved the recipe and it ran out. Everyone just kept coming back for more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Liked it best with hot apple cider/juice--kids liked it too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe- particularly with hot apple cider and a little of the Captain's rum! My guests enjoyed it as well!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was very disappointed with this recipe. For starters, the batter looked completely unappetizing. It was very lumpy and did not freeze completely. The lumps seemed to be the powdered sugar... not sure if it should have been sifted. Then, when we mixed it with the rum, there was a layer of melted butter on the top! Who wants to drink butter? I will not be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!!! this is heaven on earth, perfect and perfect. i had some in my coffee today and i have never ever had coffee so good. I did not make it all, i think i made 20 servings, I did however add extra nutmeg and cinnamon. PERFECT!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I once swapped this recipe to a bartender in Snowmass Colorado in exchange for free drinks in his bar for a week. This is the best! The batter will keep indefinitely if frozen.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it.Easy to make and all our guest loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was SO yummy. We made it in the middle of an ice storm and it simply hit the spot. Tastes great with or without the rum, too! Thanks for a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super!!! I halved the recipe to try it and loved it. The 2nd time around I added about 1/2 tsp. of coffee granules to each mug and topped it off with canned whipped topping. So smooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is fabulous! I emailed this recipe to every person I know. I could eat the batter by itself, it is so good. As for a hot buttered rum drink, I don't typically like rum at all, but I swoon over this drink. Highly recommend this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!! Made it exactly as the recipe called for and it turned out great. I put one big spoonful of the batter, one shot of Captain Moran's spiced rum, and then just topped off with boiling water. My friend who's pregnant had it without the rum and still had thirds!! Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is wonderful with Capt Morgan's spiced rum or Meyers rum. I also loved it in my coffee! Heck, it was even delicious with just a spoon! I guess I should mention that my husband wasn't a big fan though--ah well, I loved it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: When I read the recipe I wasn't sure what to expect. But I wanted to try something different to bring to a holiday lunch. I cut the recipe in half and then froze it in 2 small plastic containers - enough for 2 holiday parties. The drink was delicious! Very creamy but not too buttery, just the right amount of spice. My husband, who told me he hated hot buttered rums, even said they were good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this mix twice, the first time I did have the issues with the batter being messy and the drink looking slightly murky, but it still tasted wonderful. The second time I made it I used the whole 1.75 quarts of ice cream and I served it in a gravy boat. It was wonderful and the hit of my work holiday party. I had to convince my coworkers not to eat it straight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I scaled the recipe down to about 10 servings and, while it didn't cover 10 drinks, meant that I had no leftovers and had to make it AGAIN lol. Was wonderful, highly recommended.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: ADD A LITTLE X-TRA FLAVOR..WITH CAPT.MORGAN SPICED RUM AND OR BUTTERSCOTCH SCHNAPPS...YUMMMMMY

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooooooooo good in coffee.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mmmmm....never had Hot Buttered Rum before and this was outstanding. All the guests raved about it! (would be good batter for coffee too, I'm sure).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh yum. We made half the recipe. We used one large soup spoon worth of batter and one ounce of rum in our 8oz teacups and didn't quite fill it up all the way with hot water. That seemed about right. Definitely a hit at our dinner party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! I forgot the powdered sugar and it was still GREAT! We used three teaspoons per glass and added a dollop of cool whip with a pinch of nutmeg to the top. The other reviewers are RIGHT, this is great with or without the rum! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! I made it for Thanksgiving dinner but used it in my coffee this morning and it was delicious! I can't wait to use it with the rum and water! Happy Thanksgiving!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Holy moley. Where has this been all my life. I work in a restaurant and we made a double batch in the kitchen after closing last night with Blue Bell ice cream. I can think of so many things this would be amazing with. Over cinnamon roles, over ice cream, with apple cider, in hot water, in my coffee. I could go on and on. This will always be in my freezer. I was surprised to find that it doesn't freeze solid. Maybe because of all the sugar. Is that normal?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: While this batter tasted REALLY delicious on its own, it was really watery when made into a hot drink. I used 3 tbs. batter and added 1 tsp. instant coffee to ~8 oz of hot water and that was pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe before, but with regular sugar instead of confectioners. I used confectioners this time and it was just as good (if not better) than I remember it. I added a little extra spice to my taste. My spices were a bit old so that certainly could have contributed to the blandness that I experienced. Once I added it to water the spice really came out anyway. I made it in advance for Thanksgiving and don't have rum yet, so I used rum extract for flavoring. It's so amazing! I'm in heaven right now. I halved the recipe, but it's still not going to last long. I used way more batter for my cup than 1T.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great improvement on the recipe I had been using. I like a creamier drink so I use milk rather than water and just pop it in the microwave to heat. A perfect drink for a cold evening!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had never even tasted Hot Buttered Rum before I made this, let alone tried it. While it was really different than what I was expecting, I LOVED it!! This was a perfect drink to have on a cold autum night and I definitely will be sharing this recipe. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This batter is fantastic. I found adding 3 scoops of batter works best (maybe my mugs are really big). After reading the reviews, I cut the recipe in half and it has made plenty. My son really enjoyed it - without the rum, of course. Thanks for sharing this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I cut the recipe, and it came out good, but it needed a lot more than recommended to not be watery when mixed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an awesome recipe! Super easy and lasts in the freezer for months. I usually use a little more batter per drink than called for in the recipe, but I have a bit of a sweet tooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I first made this several years ago, and it makes a TON. We love it this way instead of the store bought.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great! Ive never had hot buttered rum before but this batter sounded delicious. It is so good you can eat the batter by itself with a spoon! I use about a tablespoon and a half per 6 ounces of water and it comes out nicely! Of course I did not make the whole recipe. I made probably about 2 cups of the batter all together because the recipe makes a BUNCH!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: We thought this was just wonderful! Perfect for a cold night. However, we ended up using double the amount listed in each mugful and added extra cinnamon and nutmeg. Next time I will add extra spices to the batter, and will continue to add extra batter per cup. Rich and wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so so good and a great 'gathering drink' with friends. It's very rich but OH -so -GOOD. It makes ALOT so maybe you could cut it in half easily.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a lot of the batter in my drinks because we like it sweet and creamy! Topped with whipped cream and ground cinnamon and nutmeg---this made it taste just like or even better than those seasonal drinks from Carribou Coffee or Starbucks! This is the best (with or without the rum in it)!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best and easiest hot buttered rum batter I've found. Toss out those canned mixes! It is a huge amount, though, so I halved it. Like others, when serving this I also use spiced rum and add a touch of whipped cream to the top. For those folks who complained it's too much work to make or for guests to put together, are you kidding me?! If that's the case you'd better stick to things that can be drunk right out of the bottle.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I scaled this down to 1/4 of the original recipe and followed it as written. We thought it tasted better with a couple of tablespoons of the batter, rather than just one. It is delicious and a wonderful treat on a very cold night! Thank you, Sheri!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our annual cookie exchange, and it was great. It made a lot, which was fortunate, since everyone loved it. Thanks for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG, this is yummy! Double the nutmeg and cinnamon. Add cider instead of water. Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very good. I do agree with other reviewers that you want to double the spices so there is still a strong cinnamon/nutmeg flavoring once the mix is added into the beverage.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this evey Christmas season and everyone loves it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This batter was very tasty "straight up", but thin and watery as a mixer. I even tried using only 4oz of water. Maybe it would be good with hot cider as others have suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooo yummy! I have never tried Hot Buttered Rum before, but this recipe has me hooked! I also ended up using about 2 tbsp. of batter per cup, and its not overly sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this batter last weekend for an outdoor party and it was awesome! Only suggestion is - note this recipe is for 100 servings. It makes alot!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: We found this far too sweet & watery. I can see its potential though & might try it again, but perhaps in coffee to make the flavour a little richer & hopefully cut some of the sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hi --this was just what I was looking for. A hot buttered rum recipe made with icecream. Thank You

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have a holiday party based on this drink every year. It's a hit with everyone. Delicious even without the rum as an alternative to hot cider or hot chocolate. Tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: made a big batch for Thanksgiving - the whole family loved it. I think I use more rum and more batter than they call for in a mug.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is not a pretty drink, but it sure is good! I cut the recipe in half and used a very high quality, natural ice cream. When I added the water I found I had to increase the amounts of batter and rum to get a rich tasting drink. I could eat this right out of the freezer with a spoon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great!! I always buy mine at a fancy grocery store and this was just as good...no better this was cheaper! I would make again and give as a gift, it is that good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband had this at a friend's house. He came home raving about the hot buttered rum he had and had his friend's wife give him the recipe. Well, lo and behold it was this recipe from my favorite website. I have never liked rum, and even I thought it was good. I will also be adding it to my hot tea. It is so sweet, my 5yr old licked the spoon and pot when I was done making it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This turned out delicious. The only thing I did differently was to use whipping cream instead of the ice cream because I didn't want all the strange ingredients, guar gum, etc. that come with store bought ice cream. The drink was very creamy, sweet and spicy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I added about 1/2 tsp of ground cloves and halved the recipe which still made plenty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made half a batch since I didn't have a full pound of butter on hand. It is gooey but to me that's good. This batter makes a very yummy drink. I used to not really like hot buttered rum but now I love it! This one is a keeper, thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! My prior efforts at making hot buttered rum always turned out disgusting, but this makes excellent drinks! I think I might possibly double the spices next time around, but otherwise this is wonderful. I think the people who complain about it being syrupy are letting it sit out at room temprature for too long. I keep the stuff in the freezer, and when I want some, I boil a mug of water and scoop a couple tablespoons of this into it, which cools it just enough to drink right away. Then I just throw in a little bit of rum. This is a great after-ski drink, and a nightcap as well!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hmmmm, not quite what I had in mind. I found the mixture to be too sweet and then when added to the water made this unappetizing tasting syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW...Amazing! This drink is so rich and such a treat! We've been trying it out mixed with other types of liquor...it is wonderful with coconut rum, amaretto, frangelico, or with no booze at all in coffee or cider. I think this batter is partially responsible for our winter weight gain! So Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is delicious! No other way to describe it. YUMMY. Goes well on many other things besides rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had this on Christmas with coffee and everyone loved it. Also tried it with Captain Morgan spiced rum added and it was delicious! Definitely will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: SOOOOO good and very addicting. We used it with Captain Morgans. I put in about 2 tbs of the batter, 1 1/2 oz of liquor and then a little hot water. Everyone loves it. And there is PLENTY of batter to last a while in the freezer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought that it was very very messy if you have company. We have a self serve bar and this stuff was very gooey. It tasted good, but not for everyone.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good, makes a lot! When I mix it up, I like my drink to be thick, so I use 3 TBS of batter. Also, try it w/Frangelico instead of rum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: A wonderful recipe for the holidays. I would recommend it to anyone planning to entertain. It is soooo good and easy to make. The batter keeps well in the freezer. I would suggest storing in several small containers (keeps it fresh).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I never had a hot buttered rum drink before this one, and now I am hooked. It was easy to make and delicious to drink. I did the 2 scoops and it was a bit sweet, so the next one might be just one scoop ( or maybe just more rum was needed!) Perfect for the holidays! Thanks Sheri

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my, this is amazing. I'd never had a hot buttered rum before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. The batter is incredible (yes, very rich, but just read the ingredients!) and makes an excellent addition to a vanilla milkshake. :) I had trouble mixing the sugars into the butter, but when I added the ice cream, everything blended decently. There are still a few little lumps of sugar in the batter but they dissolve in the hot water. An excellent recipe, thanks Sheri!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word....EXCELLENT

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Holy Cow - this stuff is awesome! I made this the day before Thanksgiving - drank it that night, and the next 2 days. My family loved it. Also tried it in coffee - very good. I didn't change a thing. We are having a Christmas party in a couple weeks - and we are making a doouble batch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Can't wait to try this!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: My mom uses this same recipe. When we were young we got to have it in coffee as a treat. She gave me a tub of it and my roommate ate it all with a spoon like ice cream! Good stuff!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this batter Christmas Eve and just finished the batter tonight, end of March ! An excellent recipe but you may want to cut it in half. I gave batter away to two different friends and still had tons left over. It is so darn good, we even warmed it in the microwave and poured it over vanilla ice cream as a sauce, yummy !

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the first time I have ever had anything like this, so I wasn't sure what to expect. It was good. Not the kind of drink I drink all night, its very rich, but what a treat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! Used Captain Morgan's spiced rum, topped with French Vanilla Cool Whip and sprinkled nutmeg on top. An addicting dessert in a mug.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simply delicious! I put 2 tbsp of batter as others have suggested with 1-2 oz spiced rum topped with cool whip. It was a hit on Christmas day and will definetly make it again :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooooo delicious. The hit of Christmas Eve. Thanks Sheri

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh so yummy. I cut the recipe in half thinking it seemed like alot. Wrong move. Make the whole recipe. Add double batter, rum and spices. Added whipped cream, sprinked w/ cinnamon. Used Captain Morgans spiced rum. My friends loved it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an awsome recipe! I like it alot better than the store bought kind. Glad I stumbled across it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: OUTSTANDING! If you're not giving some away as a gift, you may want to cut recipe in half -- it makes a lot. When you can't get into the rum, it's also really good in green tea.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a recipe my grandmother used to make often. It is a winter tradition in my family. Simple to make and the batter stores in the freezer all winter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum. A nice treat for the holidays.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't want to make up as much so I used 1/2 cup each butter, brown sugar and icing sugar, 1 cup of ice cream, 1/4 tbsp cinnamon and 1/4 tsp nutmeg. I used 2 heaping teaspoons of the mix in a mug with 1 oz of rum and 6 oz of water. It had a great taste but I didn't like the appearance. I couldn't get over the color, it was like dirty water. This is fantastic in hot chocolate though, especially with whipped cream on top!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nothing warms the insides like a nice cup of hot buttered rum! And this recipe works great. Like other readers suggested, I creamed the butter with the sugar instead of melting it. I also cut the recipe in half. Very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy! I followed the direction but used another recipes mixing directions. I used 1 -2 oz dark rum, 2 heaping Tbls of batter, and 6 oz of boiling water. This makes the drink much creamier and sweeter. I can't wait to serve this at my holiday party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a family favorite that I've made for the past 14 years. I always keep some in the freezer during the holidays. We usually use 2 TBSPs of the mixture per cup for a creamier drink. The adults add rum....and the children drink it without. Our older daughter often dips a spoon into the mix and eats it as is....it's THAT good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! I brought this to our extended family's Christmas Eve get together. My relatives were skeptical at first--they'd never even heard of hot buttered rum--not like this stuff, anyway! It was a very gloopy recipe, but man, was it worth it! One person decided to try it, and soon enough, I was busy making cup after cup of this stuff! A1 stuff. I chose this particular recipe out of the other buttered rum recipes because this included spices. The spices were wonderful, gave it an intoxicating aroma, and worked really well with the quality dark Jamaican rum I chose to use. All the rum and sugar gave me a whopper of a headache, but I'm not complaining! Well worth it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh boy! This is delicious! I made this and gave it as Christmas gifts to some close friends, it was the hit of the season!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: All I had was 3/4 a pound of butter (3 sticks) and it was still excellent. What I will do next time is soften the butter then cream in the brown sugar Then add the powdered sugar and ice cream, and spices. I also gave to my kids by heating up apple cider. They loved it. But I thought it was sweet and rich, so next drink I think I may mix some cider with hot water, then add the batter. YUMMY!!! Also good added to a cup of coffee.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really, REALLY good! I had wanted to give as gifts and got my Ziploc baggies all ready with instructions and everything, then realized that this batter doesn't freeze like ice cream, it's more like a thick, sticky panckake batter (presumably hence the name "Hot Buttered Rum BATTER)...I ended up keeping it for myself - poor me! Thanks for sharing Shari - will make another batch for an upcoming after Christmas party!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first taste of hot buttered rum and I have to say it wasn't what I expected. I thought it would be much sweeter. It was very good though and my guests drank it up even my husband who is usually a beer man. I will probably make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this recipe for a get-together after a day of skiing, and those 100 servings were barely enough for 20 people! This recipe makes the sweetest, warmest, creamiest drink... and with the smoothest, most beautiful cappuccino color - absolutely perfect to warm you up after a day in the snow. Toss in a cinnamon stick and top with a dollop of whipped cream and dash of cinnamon if you really want to look like a goddess.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the BEST hot buttered rum ever! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my! This is the best hot buttered rum I have ever tasted! I just made half the recipe tonight to try, hoping it would be good to serve at Thanksgiving but I will have to make another batch before then...it's almost gone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was THE best hot buttered rum batter ever! I made it for an outdoor fall tailgate party on a cold Sunday. I scaled the recipe down to 50 servings, thinking I could freeze the rest for another day. Wishful thinking... it was gone before we knew it. There were a few creative people who added a scoop of vanilla ice cream before drinking and loved it. Guess I have to make more for the next party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely fantastic! Even without the rum this is a very satisfying warm beverage. I served it at a Harvest Party and it received rave reviews. I added more than one spoonful of batter per cup. A lot of my guests said it tasted like gingerbread.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I put more then a tablespoon in each mug, but otherwise followed the recipe. Sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg and throw in a peppermint or cinnamon stick to stir. Thank You!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: My niece and nephews love this drink without the rum too! I doubled the spices and added some fresh ground ginger (not to mention whole nutmeg, ground fresh).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: OH MY GOD, this is delicious!!! I like using more of the batter per cup though. I used equal amounts of rum and batter, then filled the cup with the boiling water. YUMMY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Though that this mix was delicious. My family thought so too. Made it on Christmas day after sledding!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely DELICIOUS!!! I love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really yummy. Warms you right down to your toes. I plan on making a batch for Christmas presents.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: This hot buttered rum batter is rich and creamy - definitely not for calorie counters. As good or better than what you can buy in the store.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree, this is the best Hot Butter Rum recipe I've seen!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this for my holiday Party. I doubled to allow for 200 servings. It was a hit. I had over 30 requests for the recipe but it was so easy I hated to give away my secret!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had this recipe years ago and lost it. It tastes wonderful!! I'm so glad to have this recipe again. Rose

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: absolutely delicious and I served with roasted vegetables which I got from this app!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I went the Dole's route as well. Less hassle.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don’t add the ice so when I make it it’s not a frozen drink. I serve it over ice so it turns out to be a little stronger and then I throw in a dark rum floater right before serving. Everybody loves these!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: So simple. One shot if each ingredient, add the ice, blended in my NutriBullet, and perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was wonderful! I quadrupled the recipe and made us two giant boozy slushies out of it. My only complaint is that I didn't have enough ice to make another round!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! Easy to make & pretty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent drink! Just the right blend of fruits and rums.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I Will, love it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party just mixed a large batch in a pitcher, stirred and put in the fridge to chill. Used Blue Chair Bay Coconut and white rum. Served over ice instead of mixing in blender - this was just easier for a large group. Everyone loved it the drink was a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious made it with dole pineapple and garished it with strawberrys

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is pretty close to how you are suppose to make a Bahama Mama , But you are suppose to use 1 part light rum, 1 part coconut rum, 1/2 part grenadine, 2 parts orange juice , 2 parts pineapple juice and blend in a blender. You can pour over ice or add ice if you want a slushy type drink. This how they make it in the Bahamas. Substitute the word part with oz , cup ,pint or whatever.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I used the Dole - orange/pineapple mixed juice and I have also used the Dole - orange/banana/strawberry mixed juice. Also, use a little less syrup. Everyone that has tried these - has liked them. Even the 'boys'!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved these. Just added a bit more rum than called for (doubled) lol, but a great change from our usual Margaritas on the patio.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! Unfortunately I didn't have any coconut rum, so I just doubled the spiced rum and I thought it still had great flavor. I don't love slushy bahama mama's, so I just mixed it together in my cocktail shaker and then poured it over ice. I would definitely make this again! Excited to try it again with the coconut rum and the orange pineapple banana juice that some reviewers mentioned.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Such a FINE recipe!!!! I made it so much I put it in my phone last summer so I'd be sure to have it when I needed it. Very simple. Not too strong. Easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe to the T and it was bland... this recipe needs more sugar or something!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add a splash of 99bananas or banana liquor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish, I make it without the grenadine (or just a spash), and also with plain seltzer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is sooooo good. I used Trop50 orange juice and a little drip of grenadine to reduce sugar. Thanks for a great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I used Juicy Juice Tropical instead of the pineapple juice and it tastes great! Perfect summer drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked this! I add a good amount of mango juice as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink! Served it at a party and everyone enjoyed it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!! Summery and awesome. My new favorite!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've had this before but prefer a Malibu Bay Breeze - Malibu Rum, Pineapple juice, and cranberry juice. Delicious! The suggestion to make this with the Dole orange/pineapple/banana juice sounds yummy too. Gotta try that one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!!! Just like we had when we were in the Bahamas..Don't add any sugar, if you want is sweeter just put in a splash more of the grenadine. I have been looking for this recipe since we returned from our trip. Took a WHOLE bunch to a party, it was the a hit!!! Thank you so very much :) and my family and friends thank you too..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had to double all ingredients except ice and it looked nothing like the drink in the picture.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Flavourful Delicious knock my wife out. :-) Yes I will be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this drink. I didn't have coconut flavored rum so I used rum and cream of coconut. thanks for submitting it Thall.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the closest to Margaritaville I am ever going to get. This is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did, and it was excellent. Followed recipe to the letter. Summer drink for sure. These would be great at a BBQ or just a get together with friends. Easy to make and easy to drink. Gail

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good idea with frozen peach, mango and more.... Put in The freezer with Dole juice Banana, Orange, Mango and Pineapple. No blender ! Everybody, love these drink around The pool. Thanks for The poster advice. Delicious.....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's pretty good but I think next time I will use a little less pineapple juice. I had the juices here so that is what I used. Next time I will try the Dole Orange-Pineapple juice. But it's a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made one small adjustment: tripled the rum. It was still amazing and now I'm having a great time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! To save time, Skip the blender and ice and just throw these into a freezer-safe pitcher and freeze overnight. I make a similar bahama mama recipe for parties and freeze a huge cooler full of them. No blending, no ice and they come out perfect every time! Depending on the size of the batch I make, I always check on them in the morning to see if they need time to thaw a little, but it saves alot of time and aggrevation of dealing with a blender! I also add a bag of Dole frozen fruit(peaches/mango/pineapple) to them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this by the pitcher for our parties and it's always a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe!! I mix up a big batch of them and then pour it into the single serve plastic Ocean Spray bottles and put them in the freezer overnite before a beach/boat outing. Drop them down in the ice chest the next day and you have a slushy yummy drink with just the twist of a cap!! YUMMY!!! Making a big batch tonight for a beach trip with the gfs tomorrow!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked this, thought tasted like the ones I had in the Bahama's

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good! Next time though I will add a little more O.J. and less pineapple juice. I served over the rocks. Next time I will try it with the crushed ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: As written, this cocktail was pretty bland to me. Personally, I needed to increase the liquor quantities and add a little sugar. Then it came out pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not bad at all. It came out very pretty and frothy. My husband is always asking me to make these

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious flavor but not slushy at all following the recipe directions. Maybe because our ice is regular size and not crushed. Next time I will add more ice so it is thick and frozen.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Okay, but lacked flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: great taste! mixs well!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word: Delicious! I've been 21 years old for less than a year- so I can't say that I've had a lot of drink types since becoming legal- but I enjoyed a virgin Bahama Mama in the carribbean a few years ago and fell in love with it. It was the first legal drink I enjoyed as well, and I just decided to try my hand at making them myself. This recipe is top-notch, however I did substitute the plain rum for some pineapple rum. I will deffinitely be making these again... and soon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: im glad i dont have to go to applebees anymore since i now kno how to make it :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: As made (using coconut liqueur as I had no coconut rum), DH rated it a 3--too sweet. I loved it as it so reminded me of some of the cruises I've gone on. Omitting the grenadine syrup, DH rated it a 3.5. I liked it both ways. Beware, 2 drinks OK...3 maybe...but better slow down with the 4th!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a large batch for a party and it was a big hit. Will definately make again and again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is absolutely delicious and deserves five stars on any hot summer day! I lessened the amount of grenadine and placed it in a shaker to get the top really white and frothy, and then enjoyed it in a tall glass over ice. It was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is wonderful drink recipe. I have made it over and over and enjoy it each time. Thank you for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very light & fruity. Refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely perfect!!!!!! Makes me feel like I'm on a beach on St. Thomas!!!!!! Make a big batch because it will disappear fast!! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Reminded the Wife and I of our honeymoon to the Dominican Republic. Tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum Yum! I've been obsessed with getting my hands on a Bahama Mama, but just too lazy to make it :P I tried this recipe out and it was really good. I used Bacardi and Malibu for the rum and Dole's Orange and Pineapple Juice. :) I do like to add a little more Malibu and orange juice to mine. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: If I could give this 10 stars, I would! This has become the "it" drink at get togethers! The combination of fruity flavors screams summer! We love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: wonderful for a warm afternoon on the back porch hangin with friends

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great tasting recipe AS WRITTEN. I tried this at first using the Dole Orange Pineapple Banana juice that others suggested and it did not taste right. That banana threw the whole thing off for me...However I tried it again today following the ingredients as listed and it tastes great! Much better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was easy to make, refreshing, and tasted great. I used the dole pineapple, orange, banana juice to make it easier & save room in my fridge. I think that if you use pineapple juice & OJ it might have a stronger fruity taste than the dole juice. I will definetly be making this all summer long. thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: HUGE hit!!!! we make GIANT pitchers and take them out on our boat all the time! super drink...don't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for New Year's Eve. My husband and I LOVED them!!! So wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Greattttttttttttttttt

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice tropical drink. I will freeze the OJ for use next time to keep the drink from getting watered down.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome...at first I tried the orange/pineapple/banana juice combo that others had used but absolutley did not care for the banana in it so made it exactly as the recipe states but doubled the liquor (I like my drinks with some bite). I used cups instead of ouces and made a batch to put in the frig. Even good the next day. Definately a keeper, just will use the recommended amount of booze for a gathering....could scare people! Nice summery flavor :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great reviews from my Memorial Day gang. I made them by the pitcher so guests could easily serve themselves over cubed ice. I reduced the amount of grenadine by half because the "test" drinks were way too sweet. Also used Dole orange/pineapple juice. I always have a signature cocktail for Memorial Day and this is the best so far.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are very good, a little too good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these for a pool party using a margaritaville blender and everyone loved them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink. I make this every summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit strong, but tasted as good as a cocktail you would get at a bar. The real thing! You definately have to double the ingredients for a single drink, though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is simply a wonderful coctail recipe. We have been making it again and again during the last week and serving it to all friends who are really thrilled. Thank you for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very yummy and very dangerous! I added an additional ounce of vodka to give it more kick. Also, I used blended orange pineapple juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: We just got back from the bahamas and this was very close to ones we had on the beach. Very tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Double this recipe and you've got a winner! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used orange pineapple banana juice and added a little more grenadine. Great drink....loved it! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! I used a shot of both rums, a shot of grenadine two shot fulls of o.j. and dole pineapple-orange-banana and two cups of crushed ice. PERFECT size drink. I could see this being dangerous.....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! Yumm-y! I took another poster's advice and used the Dole orange-pineapple-banana juice and it was perfect. What a great way to enjoy a summer evening.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like this cocktail. Wonderful tropical flavor. Of course, it is necessary to use fresh pineapple and orange juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow, these are so great, I add a little bit more ice to combat the quick melting here, but yum:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Although I did double the liquor!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is SO good!!! I put 3 ice cubes in a shaker with the other ingredients and shook it up and served it over the ice instead of blending it together. I did double the recipe and I would call that one serving. It is also great with Dole's Orange Peach & Mango juice in place of the o.j. and pineapple juice. YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I switched out the plain rum for dark rum and sometimes spiced rum. Using regular pale rum, is not quite the way I like them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe is awsome and exactly as i remember from my recent cruise to the bahamas.thanks for sharing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe to a T but it was really foamy and did not taste good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful flavor. We added just a splash of amaretto liquer (just a splash, it's strong and too much will permeate the drink) to perfect this recipe. We didn't "slush" it (I only like that in daquaris), but rather, poured everything over a generous glass of crushed ice. Add the grenadine first and the alcohol last, and the color of the drink will look like a fading sunset. This is the perfect summer drink for relaxing after work or on weekends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe and they tasted a little snow cone-ish to me. Maybe I used too much ice or something.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: pretty good. i will make again for friends that perfer sweet drinks over strong ones.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! Great tasting for next to the pool. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
