cocktail_reviews.Review: Not much on 1/2 oz. went 1 1/2 oz. to 3oz. and it was great. Wife liked it and she really doesn't like a drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was good, but I didn't find it as good as many of the other reviews said. It seemed to be missing something, but I don't know what.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: OH MY!!!!!!! This is so good. My wife and I love these.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was a big hit during the summer....I used Dole Pineapple/Orange Juice in the refrigerated section because I do not like the taste of juice from a can....This is a definate keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Close your eyes and you can almost feel the cool ocean breezes!! Very tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so good! I made these for a bon voyage party and people loved them, beacuse it was for a party I didnt blend it with ice I just had guests poor it over ice cubes..it was still excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a wonderful summertime cocktail. It makes any occasion festive!! Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink! I used creme de banana instead of plain rum. Perfect drink for a party. Can't wait to make it for friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not like this drink. By the other reviews it sounded like a very flavorful tropical drink. It did not have much flavor at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great, can be a little sweet!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect.....tastes just like the ones in the islands.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: A great and very popular tropical drink. Traditionally, you add creme de banana to it but the banana rum would be a cheaper alternative (2 bottles vs. 3). That's the joy of tropical drinks...you can modify them to your own personal liking! And everyone likes an escape to the islands from time to time...even if it IS mentally with an umbrella drink in hand!~

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I used Dole - Orange Pineapple Banana juice and it was perfect. I will be making these again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very good and perfect for barbecues and parties with a tropical theme.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: DELICIOUS - you can not go wrong with this island drink. Tastes good with crushed ice or on the rocks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome drink! I used banana rum instead of plain, and it is fabulous :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these after a long day as a stay-at-home mom. They are refreshing and make you wish you were at a nice warm beach enjoying it. Not too alcohol tasting.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these over the holidays and my sister and I were crazy for them. They taste so nice and go down easy! LOL!! They reminded me of summertime!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: My favorite drink, with or without the coconut rum and with crushed ice or ice cubes, doesn't matter, It's Mmmmm Gooood!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Also drank this on the rocks. Used Capri Sun since I didn't have any orange juice and it was quite tasty. I can see making a huge pitcher of these for a party. Pretty color to boot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: These drinks were pretty good - recently came back from the Dominican and they tasted exactly like the way they made them there. Next time I'd probably increase the coconut rum and decrease the ice but overall, was a very good recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY good!! I served these at a "ladies night" party last week, everyone loved them! I added a bit more coconut rum to make them more tropical. They reminded me of Hawaiian Punch. WARNING: make sure you get the BIG bottles of rum!!! You won't want to stop with just one!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used to work at Applebee's and they also add banana liquer. Very tasty this way too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe. I like it a little stronger so I increased the rum by 1/2 ounce.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent, very tropical drink. I found this recipe a few weeks ago and have made it several times since. I originally made it using the blender, but now prefer it on the rocks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink on a hot day! Next time I am going to cut down on the ice. I might try 1/2 cup of ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like mine "on the rocks" so I don't blend it all together, but serve on ice, instead. Great mix/blend of ingredients, wonderful taste. Love it! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very yummy, I did these on the rocks since I am not into icee drinks anymore. They were yummy. I drank one and feeling it. I did 3 oz oj 3 oz pj. 1 Shot captains morgans , 1 shot malibu, 1/2 shot grenadine. Perfect!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent drink. I made if for the Survivor finale and now my wife wants a pitcher for a party she is having. Sweet and smooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Blend it up in the stockroom and top it with an umbrella for a girl drink drunk! Yum Yum Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add a shot of Dark Rum on top of the drink after it is in the glass just like red lobster wonderfull

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: We enjoyed these over rocks, with a tad less grenadine and a tad more coconut rum. Very nice and "islandy".

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used coconut flavored drink mix in a can instead of coconut rum. Didn't bother to double up on the regular rum either. Love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were the absolute perfect drink for our pool party! Everyone loved them and was asking for the recipe. We garnished the drink with pineapple & orange slices. I highly recommend this drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was great! The perfect beverage for a summer cookout.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasting this was like being back on my Bahana cruise again. Awesome, thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink. Easy,tasty and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Like being on vacation in my own backyard!!! Will make again and again and *hick-up* again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: great drink for when the girls come over for the evening!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: We are hooked!! Drink these every chance we get. Have served them for cookouts, and have taken them to pool parties. What a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: great drunk, I mean drink! I could drink these all night, you hardly taste the alcohol.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a good drink! Not overly sweet at all. Definitely will serve at my upcoming party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is definately a great drink, of all fruity drinks that I have ever tasted this one is the best.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very, very good. I am already on my second drink. Very fruity and refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Bahama Mama
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very very yummy!! I didn't blend mine, I served them "on the rocks." Everyone, young and old, enjoyed the drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Margarita
cocktail_reviews.Review: The full 2 oz of tequila was enjoyable as a strong drink! It was a breeze to make. I added a splash of agave as it need a little something extra. It did help brighten the flavor. Next time making this drink I'll substitute gold tequila for silver. I believe it would be a better pairing. Also, a bit of yellow sanding sugar added to the salt rim would be fun and yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Margarita
cocktail_reviews.Review: Unfortunately as I went to make this I realized we were out of the tequila the recipe called for so I substituted mezcal in. I love the smoky flavor with the sweet pineapple! This was a happy accident for my house and we will be making these on a regular basis. It was a very balanced cocktail and so fun with a side of chips and salsa.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Margarita
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a pretty yummy margarita! Perfectly refreshing for a hot day. I love that you don't have to but anything special, just ingredients that you probably have on hand and will use again. I will definitely be adding this to my cocktail rotation!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: No. It was perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was soooo good! Making for 3rd time tonight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a Luau and people raved. One person who had recently been to Hawaii said this Mai Tai was better than any he had there and thought he should give this recipe to the resort he went to for their use.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added a splash of Margarita mix, it needed a bit more acidity. 😋

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Taste of the Tropics..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: It’s important to note that this is not the original Trader Vic recipe which is made with lime, orgeat, orange curaçao, and simple syrup. I like mine with just a dollop of maraschino cherry juice and a big chunk of mint. This is considered the Hawaiian Mai Tai, which is the post-1953 version made popular by Elvis. Decent drink but not a real Mai Tai.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was easy and delicious! I like that it uses OJ instead of orange liquor as it isn't over the top strong for our group of older adults. Next time I would make my own grenadine (sugar, pom juice, lemon) to eliminate all the preservatives in store bought.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome!!! Reminded me and my husband of our honeymoon in Hawaii! I wouldn't change a thing. Bonus: We happened to have all the ingredients on hand, even the little drink umbrellas, so no trips to the store.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was really good! Simple to make although Grenadine wasn’t as easy to find as I thought it would be. I had better success just free pouring than following the exact recipe. You definitely have to watch how much Malibu you put in because the coconut overpowers the sweeetness and tartness of the drink. I’ll be making more for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: No changes made. Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Change: Did not have coconut rum, so just used all spice rum. Very good! Note: Measurement for 1/2 a jigger in ounces is wrong in the recipe. Should be 0.75 ounces.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, couldn't find the branded rum that was listed so I grabbed spiced Captain Morgan and Malibu. A lovely tropical drink that packs a punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband said he feels like he's drinking Hawaiian Tropic sunblock. That's his highest compliment! Thanks for making us feel like we are on vacation during COVID-19.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used 1 to 1 ratio for the Malibu and the Captain Morgan. Plus I added 3/4 ounce of lime juice. It was fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummyI! made it at a friend's house, minus the grenadine. (Cherry allergic) I will definitely make it again with the Pomegranate grenadine I have at home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious Mai Tai Recipe!! This is my go-to, so simple and good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm out of ice today but it still tastes darn good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I give it 5 stars. Cause I really liked it but tasted more like a Rum Punch, not Mai Tai

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super simple and super yummy! Great recipe to keep on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used one pack of Truvia per glass instead of simple syrup

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was awesome tropical greatness!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to mix the juice, spiced rum, and coconut rum in a pitcher. Then I add Grenadine after it is poured in a glass over ice. A splash of Dark rum on the top is a nice little addition as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well balanced & delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooo good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perhaps not as authentic as some might enjoy, but tasty, simple, and scaleable for varying desires. I have made this a few times now over the last couple weeks, the girls loved it. Poured over ice and into travel mugs or into the fridge in a glass jar its nice for emergency applications. I am using regular white rum instead of coconut, mostly because that is what I keep on hand here.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I couldn't care less if these are "authentic". They are boozy and tropical and delicious and DANGEROUS.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’m not a huge drinker or alcohol, but I do enjoy fruity tropical type drinks. I love pineapple juice and orange juice. I bought captain morgans coconut rum and had spiced rum from the country of Grenada. I wasn’t impressed with it. All I tasted was the alcohol and minimal juice flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was yummy my guests loved it .

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was yummy my guests loved it .

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good...easy to make an entire picture full.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wife loved it. Try adding 1 drop of pure almond extract. Adds a nice nutty earthiness to it. But only one drop.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Big hit at the pool party! These were so good!!! The coconut rum was so good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! My new fav mixed drink. I used good quality juices and rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would never add almeretto , not do I add much grenadine(too sweet and sugary). I do add Orgeat syrup which is the only way to make a real Mai Tai. This is not readily available most times so I get why people add other stuff. But if you ever can make it with the syrup you will taste a world of difference.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these just as the recipe says and adjust the amount of alcohol depending on my mood...I prefer this recipe over any that include sour mix or triple sec. It is so easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and tasty! Exactly as written, Ingredient list is simple, this is my Friday night treat

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe - tastes just like the ones at Don the Beachcomer's in Kona, Hawaii!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I Converted it into a virgin Mai-Tai, that is, non-alcoholic. Most of the kids liked it, and it was a little like a Shirley Temple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum-my!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: A big hit at our luau. Used regular Bacardi Rum and Malibu. Left out the grenadine. We had tried out the authentic recipe (with Jamaican rum, orgeat, etc) but it was not our thing (syrupy alcohol flavor). Dangerously delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: good and easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is very delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasted perfect! I added a lemon slice too...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did make equal parts reg rum and coco rum, but think i can cut back on the cocnut rum... or increase the regular rum. :P Next attempt i think im going to try Tattoo in place of the regular rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it, nice however added half on ounce of velvet fellernum. Ahhhhhhh heaven.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ooh la la!!! Definitely a keeper!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty! I made a kiddie cocktail substituting ginger ale for the alcohol. The kids loved those too! I will use equal parts of spiced rum and coconut rum next time like others have suggested for a slightly stronger coconut flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! Will continue to make these thanks!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and easy and delightful. Multiplied x8= perfection

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Came out great! Thank you for the recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Dangerously delicious! Made it exactly as listed. Definite keeper!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, almost as good as at the Outrigger in Waikiki!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: A hit with everybody we've shared it with. We also doubled the coconut rum. This is going to get a lot of use poolside.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I set out to buy Trader Vic's Mai Tai mixer, but my local market didn't have it. I didn't have the flavored, but I did have both Bacardi Gold and Bacardi Superior. I mixed the two. I'm very happy with this recipe and will never need a mixer again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes just like all the mai tai's I've had on vacations! And very easy to make. Agree with everyone else to add equal amounts of the rums... Very tasty! Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great for a girl's night in drink option!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very easy. I added triple sec and it was delicious. I put the drink into a pineapple to make it look Tiki style. A big hit and very potent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made exactly as stated and yummo!!! Have made this my go-to drink of choice. Very quick and easy to whip up. Lovely and fruity and not over powering with alcohol which I love.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yeah Baby!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm drinking this right now and I love it. I'm new to making cocktails (but not to drinking them! ) and this is my second time making this one. Delicious and easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe!!! 4 stars until I added my own touches. I added Amaretto for that almond flavor, equaled the spiced and coconut rum as some reviewers suggested and a hint of simple syrup. Was a hit at the family Luau. Went faster than the frozen pina colada daiquiris. Thanks for the recipe!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Favorite summertime drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not too bad, my wife said, but this version is nothing like the Original 1933 Mai Tai version.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious. It was a crowd-pleaser at my birthday party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: perfect!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: a very nice summer drink recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes like the ones in Hawaii

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple recipe, but didn't care for the taste which was very disappointing since I made a whole pitcher! Don't know if it was the coconut rum, but something gave it a funky taste ~ and everything was just purchased to make these. I will continue my quest for a good one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added splash of dark rum on top (very fruity if you don't) and my parents who LOVE mai tai's said this was the best they have ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't care that this is not an "authentic" Mai Tai - it is a pretty darn good drink - whatever it really is! I love the hint of spiciness from the spiced rum. I do want to try it again, this time adding the Amaretto & fresh lime as suggested by others. I do think that there's definitely enough coconut rum & would not add more. We were camping on the beach in the central California coast & as written, this refreshing cocktail fit right in!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous, easy... love the addition of coconut rum. Brings me back to sitting by pool in Hawaii.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink! Mai Tai's are one of our favorite drinks. I have made many many versions and this one is a great version. I do think it is a MUST to add amaretto in this as well to get the almond flavor that Mai Tai's have. Also half of a freshly squeezed lime is great in it as well! I like to add the lime and amaretto in it to make a more authentic tasting Mai Tai, but this recipe is for sure still great as written. Thanks for the recipe! This will be added to the list of favorites.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was looking for a drink to have out by the pool, on a warm summer day, this is it!! It not to sweet, and very refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: its ok nothing special

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent, makes a great Mai Tai. I added an extra ounce of coconut rum to balance the taste. Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is awesome...takes you right to the islands! I agree with other viewers to use equal parts of spiced rum and coconut rum. I made enough for 2 so I used 2 jiggers of each and a 6 oz can of pineapple juice, 1/2 cup of oj and only 1 t. of grenadine. Absolutely delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink! I made exactly as recipe stated. The two rums are what make this drink. I made for our memorial weekend BBQ - big hit! Not a poor man's drink though - to buy all the ingredients gets pretty costly - but worth it for something different!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect island drink! I added a bit more rum to boost it! Thanks for this great mai tai recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME! We did, however, increase the coconut rum to 1 full jigger. We will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fruity and refreshing. Takes me back to the Caribbean!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! We made a whole pitcher and they are all gone already :(

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mai Tai
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious and easy to try being 1 serving. I had everything on hand except spiced rum, so I used Myers dark rum. It was worth making another.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with Coyote Moons, NY Twisted Sister and cut the sugar in half and it was amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it. This packs quite a punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this as written 2 different times with 2 different red wines as written and one without sugar and it was disgusting. Would never recommend this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! I did tweak it to my liking tho. Who knew that this amount of rum would’ve worked so well? Anyways I’ve come to the realization that it does not matter what kind of wine you use!! Sweet, dry, red or white! Use whatever but just adjust the sugar content to your liking. I also added Cointreau, grenadine & 7up! Great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Exactly what I was hoping for on a humid afternoon. I did change it up just a tad, I was concerned about it being overly boozy because of other reviewers. I added a can of sparkling water just to try to thin it a touch. Seemed to help. Also added a little less sugar just because I ran out. This is fab and sweet and refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Sangria I ever had

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best sangria ever! It is the most requested recipe in my arsenal

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YesYesYes!!! I was so nervous about making a good sangria for the 1st time during our Covid lockdown Easter and it was AWESOME!! Not a large gathering for Easter, but my husband, and my 2 adult kids that are here and I were thrilled how delicious this turned out. • Used the Kraken Spiced Rum • made a 1/4C simple syrup bc some comments said sugar was a little hard to dissolve • Added all kinds of fruit, including frozen mixed fruit to soak over night • Next morning added fresh fruit • Topped each glass with a splash of ginger ale We tasted it right when I made it and ?? whew! A kick!! But by the next day this drink tasted like the BEST sangria, and I knew immediately I should have made more lol!! Will be remaking this recipe real soon!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this recipe since 2008 and it's always a hit! Over time, I've adjusted the recipe to use 3/4 cup of white rum (vice what the recipe calls for) and I use a red blend of wine (gives it a more balanced and smooth taste).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great for parties! I doubled the recipe and only used 1/4 cup sugar. Don't like it too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been wanting to make this recipe up as our local fav Mexican has a wicked Sangria which we often enjoy with our friends. So for a Friday easy dinner at their place I made this with tequila rather than brandy, all the citrus and apple. Then threw in strawberries, because I had 3 packs in the fridge. It only got an hour in the fridge so hadn't really developed fully. But sure went down well, the dogs loved the apple pieces, and even ate the orange peel. I need to make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: used pinot noir wine and only 1 cup of Malibu coconut rum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this! However, I let it marinate in the fridge for 12 hours and did not add the sugar. (I don't like overly sweet drinks). It was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was too much rum and way too much OJ. It tasted a little like medicine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the worst recipe for Sangria I ever made and I've made plenty. Think about it: 1 bottle of wine, 1-1/2 cups of rum tempered by only 1/2 cup of OJ. I've been to Spain and never encountered sangria like this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very strong, but very good drink! A few of my friends cut it with sprite, because they found it too strong. Would make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Favorite class sangria recipe, I can drink the whole pitcher on my front porch watching the corn grow.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit with my book club-not a drop left! The only change I made was to decrease the rum to one cup: we needed our senses because we still had to discuss the book! Muy delicioso!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was excellent! I used organic cane sugar and melted it with half of the orange juice first. Also used organic orange juice, and citrus fruits.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added some gingerale to mine to make it go a bit further. We all liked it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a very good recipe, very close to what you get in Spain. The only thing I would change is add more fruit and a little less rum, maybe a cup instead of a cup and a half.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everybody at the party love it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for an outdoor party; it was super-easy and everyone enjoyed it. I used blackberry merlot and spiced rum. I misread the recipe and thought it called for only 1/2 cup of rum … I actually used 3/4 cup and that was plenty, especially since I now see a lot of reviewers are complaining that the rum is overpowering. Also, in my opinion this doesn't need any sugar at all. So 4 stars because of too much rum and sugar, but after cutting back on those ingredients I would give it 5 stars. Also, I made ice cubes with fruit-flavored sparkling water to keep the mixture cold without diluting the flavor too much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has been by far the best Sangria I have ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of my guests said this was the best sangria she ever had which is not bad considering it was a gathering of people who had spent weeks hiking through Spain on the Camino de Santiago.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe and it's perfect. I've made it numerous times and have shared the recipe with a few friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was wonderful and very authentic. It was strong but didn't taste boozy. I used spiced rum and used some seltzer to cut it. As with many things it was better the next day and the few days after :) I will be using this again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it as is and have remade it every time I need Sangria for a umber

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last Fourth of July, and it was a huge hit. I ended up having to make three batches for just six people. I used Marques de Caceras Cranzia tempranillo with overproofed Wray and Nephew rum as the alcoholic bases, and they interacted quite well with each other. The thing is, it didn't even taste very alcoholic. It really snuck up on all of us. However, if you're going to go the tempranillo route, I do not recommend going the riserva or gran riserva route, or with any well-oaked wine for that matter. You're going to want a dry but fruity red. Oak is not going to add to this recipe, because it focuses heavily on fruit flavors.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very fun drink! As suggested, I cut the rum (3/4 cup) and even still it has a kick! Instead of sugar, I use one cup 7-Up. I often mix the liquids and let it sit overnight and then add the fruit slices a few hours before serving. My friends love it as well and we're all HAPPY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is delicious! You can't taste the alcohol at all so it's also super dangerous! I didn't have a lemon, I dumped a can of pineapple chunks in, juice and all. This will be a summer go-to pretty much *every* weekend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I looked long and hard for a recipe like this one. I remember the classic sangria from my college days when sangria was citrus fruits and red wine chilled. Today there are so many imposters with just about everything in them but the kitchen sink. This recipe brought back wonderful memories and a classic taste. It is on my go-to list forever.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled the recipe and put in a pretty glass spouted container. Huge hit, everyone loved the sangria I paired with Christmas tamales .

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe, I did reduce the rum to one cup as some comments said that 1.5 was too much. Aside from that, it was a delicious sangria. I'd make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for thanksgiving. I let the fruit and the sugar soak in the rum for about 6 hours. I used white rum and added an apple for little extra flavor. It was really good. Everyone enjoyed it. This is a very easy recipe that i will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a good hearty sangria. When I make this again I would cut the rum in half. Taste later and see if more rum is needed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe. Everyone at my party liked it. On a warm day it was great to have this chilled on the patio. Stood up to ice really well, too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME!! Made our camping Sangria Saturday Great I did use the Spiced rum and Raspberry Merlot ( Found in the desert wine section). Will use less sugar next time it didn't all dissolve. Definitely in my camping cookbook and my home cook book

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Adapt it however you like, using whatever fruit and wine you like. Add spritzer/soda water to dilute a bit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria exactly as the recipe called for, and I would not change a thing! I made this the night before and added the fruit two hours before serving. The results were outstanding!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice, refreshing summer drink. I will make this again, trying different variations.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I added strawberry's and cut the rum in half.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Made it as written with a very high quality, smooth, white rum. Served it at a Moroccan themed dinner party. The menu included Moroccan marinated olives, homemade hummus, toasted pita chips, zucchini patties with tatziki sauce, blood orange, beet and fennel salad, Moroccan Braised Beef from this site, and Israeli couscous. I have zero leftovers! Dessert was a beautiful lemon cheesecake from Anna Olson's cookbook.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times for our now infamous Sangria Sundays...very much in high demand! This is so smooth that you will never know what hit you! I recommend using a wine that you know you like because it makes all the difference. And just go ahead and double the recipe, you will not regret it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: wayaaaaa too strong. Is it possible the rum should be 1/2 cup and not 1 1/2??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I follow the suggestions below and add 1/2 cup grand mariner since I don't have triple sec. Always yummy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too much rum. I really like a strong drink, but the cup and a half is

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty but too much alcohol. I would make it again but would cut the rum in half.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Our first try with sangria, and we like it! I didn't have orange juice, so I used pineapple/orange juice. Reduced alcohol a little, just because we didn't want it too strong. Used ~ 3/4 cup spiced rum, and ~1/4 cup Triple Sec. Since I had them, we used frozen cotton candy grapes for ice cubes. ~~~ We enjoyed this very much! We don't drink often, but when we're in the mood, I'm sure we'll have this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this yesterday for a BBQ. My family are not big drinkers, so I used 1 cup of rum instead of 1 1/2 cups. I also made the sangria all at once & put it in the fridge for a few hours. I was a perfect amount of alcohol. I recommend adding ice to your glass. It was a refreshing drink on a hot Florida day. Ill definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my annual Kentucky Derby party because no one really cared for the mint juleps I had been making. This was a really big hit. I did use the blackberry merlot and cut the sugar in half as some suggested. I went through two pitchers of this in an afternoon and had requests for the recipe. I will definitely make this again next year...and I probably will make it even sooner.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this recipe for a few years now and every time it gets rave reviews from my guests! I typically substitute a double bottle of wine which yields more and the taste isn't compromised. Also, it tastes better if you let the fruit soak the rum overnight. Definitely make a double batch because it will be gone by the end of the night! That said, warn your guests that it packs a punch. I've had a few people stand up at the end of the night unaware of the affect. Great for patio parties - happy summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super useful! Really glad my cousin introduced me to this website. I did make a couple of changes in terms of the fruits used. 2 Limes 2 Plums 1 Apple 1 Lemon 1 Orange 1 Pear 6 Strawberries 20 Blueberries 12 Raspberries 10 Grapes I washed them all, cut them thinly, and placed them in the pitcher. Poured in 1 cup of Rum and 1/2 cup of Sugar, and left it to soak for 2 hours straight in the refrigerator. After 2 hours, I took them out and added half a bottle of wine followed by a cup of Orange Juice. The end product was just amazing with the Sangria looking blood-maroon in hue. Must try!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a dinner party I hosted, which was Latin themed, and the sangria was perfect. I actually made double the quantity so I had enough for the entire weekend! Would definitely recommend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really tasty. I used an inexpensive White Merlot (it's really red and not white) and dark rum. The fruit, sugar, and rum macerated for about 24 hours. This was purely unintentional but really enhanced the flavor profile. You definitely need to be mindful of your consumption of this delicious beverage. It will catch you off guard and pretty quick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Red Diamond "Temperamental" wine and half the rum and sugar. I also added about a cup of ginger ale. It was delicious and there was none left over!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh, wow. I made this for Thanksgiving tonight, assuming I would polish off the leftovers when my guests left. Not possible as they drank every last drop! I read reviews and used the recommended spiced rum and a big cheap bottle of blackberry merlot. I only had 3/4 cup of rum left, so I added a little cointreau to make a full cup of liquor. My fruit (lemon, lime, apple, strawberries, pineapple) soaked in the rum/cointreau/sugar/orange juice all day, and I added the merlot before bed last night. I also poured in some ginger ale before serving for fizz. Everyone loved it. My aunt said it was the best sangria she's ever had. Thanks for the recipe! Will use this again for parties for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit at my girls night and party last night. I used two oranges sliced in rounds, a lemon, a lime, three different types of apples, about 25 strawberries sliced, and a pair (I needed to make a huge batch). I put all of the fruit in a container, put about three quarters of a cup of sugar over the fruit, and then added 2 cups of very high-quality spiced rum. I let that soak in the fridge overnight, and then in the morning, I poured about a cup and a half of orange juice and three bottles of wine over the fruit and rum mixture. I let that sit in the fridge for another couple of hours before the party. I served it with ice on the side, and everyone loved it. Couldn't get enough of it!! Because of the high quality rum, no one has a headache today either. :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: After a week in Spain I decided to make my own Sangria instead of buying it in restaurants. I found this recipe online. It was so delicious, went down so smoothly & had a bit of a kick. When I went to put it back in the refrigerator I found the OJ sitting on the counter. Oh my, what a tipsy accident. I have repeated it with great pleasure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is a huge hit at parties. I've made it a few times now and everyone always asks if there's more when it's gone. Yummy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Got totally faced on this and took a dump on my friends lawn. Highly recommended!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a huge hit. A bit strong so we had to add more juice/water. This recipe is our new summertime favourite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Soooo good! Made it for girls night! There wasn't a drop left!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first attempt at making sangria and it was fantastic. I made minor changes to the recipe: reduced rum and sugar to 1 cup of spiced rum and 1/3 cup sugar. I cut up an apple and a pear and soaked them with the lemon and lime (I forgot to buy oranges so I did not use those). Next time, I might use more rum but would not add any more sugar. Fantastic recipe and everyone who tried it loved it as well. The apples and pears were a great treat to snack on after the sangria was gone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not a fan, honestly. Brandy is actually the best and most common hard alcohol to mix with the wine. Sorry, but I'll stick w/the Sangria! Sangria recipe here on AR. I use brandy & a splash of triple sec or OJ, maybe a splash of peach schnapps, allow it to blend/chill for several hours or overnight. I've also used blackberry brandy as well as ginger brandy for kicks - comes out great. I prefer to serve it with club soda - or ginger ale for those who prefer it sweeter. Again, sorry, but I'd skip this recipe and Google Sangria...you'll find brandy is much more authentic than rum. But hey, whatever works for ya! Also, add any citrus LAST ~ all fresh citrus turns bitter after a couple hours. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great recipe for a base. Next time I will do half a cup of oj as The flavor profile changed a little after a few days in the fridge.Too much orange juice gave it a slight grapefruit bitterness.Replaced the rum with a cup of single malt scotch and used blackberry merlot.You wouldn't think these too flavors would work but the scotch makes it smoother and easier to drink.My buddy and I made a batch and drank 1.5 liter mix in a matter of an hour.When it was gone we wanted another batch.Not drunk just relaxed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pure bona-fide AWESOMENESS!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous drink! I let the fruit and rum sit for about 5 hours. Very simple to make. Everyone at my party loved it....when it was all gone i made more but it doesn't taste the same when you don't let the fruit and rum sit a while. I will absolutely use this again and try to play up the fruits.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe was my first attempt at sangria. I just had some at scarlett oharas in st Augustine and it was great. I think she used pinapple juice and simple surup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a burgundy wine like suggested and the drink was beautiful but no one could stomach the strength! Won't be making this one again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe! I used Captain Morgan spiced rum and Arbor Mist Blackberry Merlot. I made one batch with the 1/2 cup of sugar and one batch without it and to be honest- it doesn't need the sugar at all! The wine and orange juice made it sweet enough, but not overboard. This is perfect for a romantic evening or a summer day! Loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was delicious! I used a blackberry merlot and spiced rum as others suggested. I also added a half cup of triple sec. This was the best sangria recipe that I have tried thus far. Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good recipe but has too much rum. We cut the rum in half. Some didn't like the tartness of the wine and could have used something a bit fruitier.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is so good although I put it in a glass bowl with the fruit floating but also had garnished my wine glasses with fruit as well and i let my friends pour their own everyone enjoyed this

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I found this recipe on here about 5 years ago, and with a couple tweaks for personal taste, I've made it my go to red sangria recipe. To me, sangria is a year round drink, but most like it as a summer beverage. I love it with rum, like this recipe calls for, but a neutral spirit like vodka works just as well. I'm from Texas, where we like things either really sweet, or really spicy, so I double the sugar. Aside from that, if you're in a hurry, you can really just throw all the ingredients together at once and serve it over ice (which you should do anyway). If you're having a party, go ahead and do yourself a favor and make double the amount. Some people like a splash of 7up to top off their glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this a few times for cookouts and get togethers with friends. It is delicious! It goes fast. I suggest to double the recipe for serving friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing! I used the dark rum and a dry (for me) red, "Red Fox" from Goose Watch. I did cut the rum down to 1 cup. It was great the first day, absolutely amazing the second! Though I have to admit there wasn't much left for day two. Letting the fruit soak really made a difference. Definitely keeping this recipe around. Great for parties, special occasions, just for fun

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: When I first read about rum in sangria, I thought no way! But I did it with CM Spiced Rum, strawberries, raspberries, oranges, pears, pineapple. Soaked it for about a day and a half. Added no sugar, and the wine and OJ. It was a big hit! I will definitely make it again. The only thing is you have to plan in advance. I used to make sangria with only red wine and OJ, plus the fruit and I thought THAT was good! LOL, thanks for a great simple recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I substitute 1c brandy for rum -and substitute chopped apples for the lemons and limes, I also cut back the sugar alot (apples make it sweeter) we sometimes skip the OJ too let the fruit soak & add a few cloves for a kick. Just my preference reminds me more of what we had in Spain

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is hands down the favorite at my parties. But.....it is STRONG! Make sure your friends have lots to eat. I use two-buck chuck from Trader Joes and Bacardi light rum. It is amazing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Tasty! Very strong. Pour it over some ice and enjoy! Thank you for this easy recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I used berries along with citrus fruits and it was very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this a lot of ways depending on what I have on hand. Always the fruit called for in the basic recipe but sometimes other fruit as well. Strawberries peaches nectarines apples pears ... A lot of times I haven't had the orange juice on hand. I have never used the full amount of sugar before and I usually use only 1 cup of rum. I have added frozen lime or lemon-aid instead of the orange juice. Today I, for the first time after a couple of years of messing with this recipe finally have made this recipe as listed above. Awesomeness ***** . My rating is for the recipe as listed. This could be called Smooth Heroin wine... One glass and your cheeks are warm... Take care and enjoy...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a family gathering at Christmas! Boy was it a hit!! I added Triple Sec and SPICED Rum. Decreased the sugar to 1/4 cup and added pineapple, orange, lemon, apple, cherries and pear. Oh and yes, I added the Misty Arbor Blackberry Merlot. You cannot go wrong with this recipe and I highly reccomend you add the spiced rum. It gives it a dimension you will love, if you really like sangria! Enjoy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is excellent, and allows for considerable variations to tastes and fruit availability. Highly recommended, and yes it is potent.....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this as written except I used only 1 and a quarter cups of rum, and I found even that to be too much rum. I used Bacardi and Trader Joe's merlot. It made a little too much for my pitcher but looked very pretty and was yummy chilled. This was the first sangria I've made and it was very easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Double batch, cheap red blend, spiced rum, same citrus fruits plus frozen pineapple and mango chunks - YUM! I've made it before, always a big hit. The one thing I do differently, because I didn't read it wrong the first time, I just put it all in a glass pitcher at once and let it mull 3-4 hours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used arbor mist blackberry merlot 1.5 liter and mostly doubled the ingredients. Used sailor jerry spiced rum but only about a cup and it was still pretty strong. Also added some triple sec and raspberries. Turned out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: way too alcoholic tasting

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and refreshing. Kool-Aid for grown ups. My cousins in Madrid taught us to add some orange liqueur (Cointreau or Triple Sec) for a little extra kick. And if you can, let this sangria sit for two days before serving--5x more delicious. Serve icy cold with slice of the marinated citrus--it will be a gorgeous purple color after a day or so in the wine. Great recipe! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this with spiced rum and it was amazing! What really made it a treat was having leftover drunken fruit, draining the dregs. Yes, it's very strong, but the citrus component really makes it nice and smooth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a back yard cook out and it was a huge hit. This will forever me my classic summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: GREAT SANGRIA - very easy to make and my friends loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never made Sangria before and thought it would be a nice addition to our summer bbq. I used the spiced rum and soaked the fruit overnight. When I went to purchase Blackberry Merlot - based on other recommendations, the clerk at the liquor store said it was a very sweet wine. So - being worried it would be too sweet - I bought a regular Merlot and it was perfect! This one is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a girls' night in and it was a big hit! I used spiced rum and a merlot. Be careful, the alcohol sneaks up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: UPDATE: SOME OF MY GAL PALS AND I VISITED A LOCAL WINERY RECNETLY (TOUR AND DRINKS!). I WAS FINALLY ABLE TO PURCHASE A BOTTLE OF BLACKBERRY WINE!!! I MADE A SECOND BATCH OF SANGRIA WITH SPICED RUM AND A MIXTURE OF RED / GREEN APPLES AND PEARS. WOW! ALTHOUGH MY HUBS PREFERS THIS WITH MERLOT, HE REALLY LIKED THE FRUIT. THAT'S SAYING A LOT SINCE HE PRETTY MUCH HATES ANY AND ALL FRUIT! :) Pretty good! I am not a wine drinker at ALL, but I really enjoyed this (especially with spiced rum)!!! Having said this, I do think this could use a touch more sugar. Had I been able to find the blackberry wine I wanted to use, this might have been sweet enough for my liking (I had to use Merlot instead). Next time I'll be sure to plan ahead so that I can stop at another grocery store to look for it. I will also substitute pears and apples for the citrus fruits since my hubby thinks they would soak up the booze better lol. Thanks for sharing your recipe, Lisa. I can't wait to make this again - and again! :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I only use a 1/2 cup rum to a liter of wine - this stuff is strong, but delicious. Already bought a case of wine just for sangria. These are just so good!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked the general plan for this, simple and quick. I like my drinks sweet, and even with 'sweet' red wine this was a bit too much for me. I added Sprite directly to my glass, and that made it perfect for me. It is quite potent, though. Not that I'm complaining . . . .

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't enjoy this very much. The spiced rum overpowered it in my opinion. Would not make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ugh. Bummer. Was looking forward to trying this recipe.... What a disappointment!!! Brought it to an afternoon cocktail party/ bbq. Way, way, way too sweet!? ( i even omitted some sugar). I bartend for a living and was so embarassed. Should have known better! Will not make this recipe again-- sorry.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with the blackberry merlot and spiced rum, oh my, I'm glad I planned to stay home! Very potent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really loved this Sangria although I made a couple changes to it. I only used 1 cup of rum and I added about 1-2 cups of Sprite as well. I also used more fruit including strawberries, peaches, oranges, maraschino cherries,apple, pear, lemon and extra lime. Also, it's tastes soooooo good with all that fruit, the sugar is just completely unnecessary, so I didn't use any at all. And I soaked the fruit in rum overnight as suggested by others. (And yes, the fruit tastes amazing after soaking, so don't let too many people taste-test it before adding to the sangria!) I also used orange juice ice cubes in the glasses as suggested by someone else. My guests raved about it and it was all gone in no time! As per the recommendation of the staff member at the liquor store I used Jackson Triggs Merlot red wine and it was delicious. I will definitely be making this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our dinner guest last night, had lots of fresh Florida oranges, lemons and strawberries. I used fresh squeezed orange juice. The best part about Sangria is when the drink is gone you can still eat the fruit. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very festive -- made for a small potluck dinner at my house. Ideal for a spring or summer event - so refreshing! Of course I modified it based on what I had on hand -- I added some sprite and club soda (almost an entire 2 litre bottle's worth) to make a larger amount -- the sugar is necessary at that point. Also added some apricot brandy (about 1/2 cup). I had some leftover limeade made up as well so I added that (about 2 cups -- note: this was NOT substitued for the OJ -- that was added as well.) Guests raved about it and said they wanted the recipe. It did look pretty with the citrus fruit slices in a large glass pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a Day of the Dead party. WOW...can't imagine a party without it now. Thank you!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best recipe for sangria. However, because I am a bit of a light weight, I cut down on the rum a bit. I also recommend using fresh squeezed orange juice, it really does make a difference in the flavor. It adds a freshness that orange juice concentrate does not offer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!!!! This is one kick Sangria. It sneaks up on you, be very careful! The first time I made it I used the Captain Morgan Spiced Rum and Triple Sec. It was so smooth. I used the Blackberry Merlot and it was wonderful. I used orange, lemon and lime slices. Definately a KEEPER!!! I made it the same way the next time and warned everyone to pace yourself. Look no further this is the one!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've served this at a couple of parties now and it's a huge hit - even with the guys! I use spiced rum and an inexpensive chillable red wine, and the flavor is wonderful. If you leave the rum-soaked fruit in the pitcher, you can keep adding red wine all evening without compromising the flavor. I like to serve it with ice and extra fruit in the glass. Watch out though - a couple of full glasses tend to knock your socks off!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Read some say that the rum was too strong for the flavor, so with that advice I put in half as much rum as called for, with the idea if it needed more I could always add more. Still with half the recommended amount of rum, it seems to strong. I think I am going to move onto another recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: There are many ways to make sangria, but I wanted a basic "jumping off" recipe for sangria I could customize. I doubled the recipe to take to a party where most of the attendees usually drink beer. The recipe worked very well and was completely gone by the end of the evening!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy! The only thing I changed was to add one pear, as the writer suggested. So much flavor for so little work and my friends raved! I used Cruzan rum and Rex Goliath Free Range Red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a tasty, easy-to-make sangria. I cut the rum in half and added cherries. My main qualm is that what makes the sangria taste good--the citrus fruit--is annoying once you go to drink it. Do you strain the slices? Do you eat them? Eating them makes a mess. Next time, I think I'll make this sangria the same way, but before serving it to guests I'll strain out the citrus slices and throw in only edible fruits, like pineapple, apple, or cherries. I don't know how that will affect the taste, but the experience might improve?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first sangria making experience, and I'm glad I followed this recipe. I used spiced rum and Cab Sav. I messed up and added the wine and OJ with the booze and fruit (which turned out fine), and I let everything soak for 24 hours. This was less popular at my party than the White Peach Sangria also found on this site.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. But, I got fruit loopy! Next time I will stick to basic recipe. Too much fruit soaked up the liquid. But it looked pretty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe for a summer party the last couple of years. I double the recipe, use blackberry merlot and then use berries for my fruit -- strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, raspberries. I also split up the 1 1/2 cups of rum -- usually 1/2 cup of Captain's Spiced, 1/2 Pineapple, 1/4 triple sec, 1/4 cointreau. Leave out the sugar. Powerful!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: instead of 1.5 cups of rum i only used 1/2 cup of brandy per batch. i also did half a lemon and half a lime instead of a full one. i let the orange, lemon and lime "cook" in the brandy/sugar mixture for a day then added a diced up apple and let that "cook" for 12 hours and then added the wine. that "cooked" for another 12 hours and then in the morning of the party i added the oj. enjoy !

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A great summer alternative to beer for poolside cocktails! I use blackberry wine and Captain Morgan's spiced rum. I've had several friends tell me it's the best sangria they've ever tasted :) You might want to double this recipe--use a 1.5 liter bottle of wine and the entire 5th of Captain Morgans.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've tried many of the sangria recipes on this site, and I have to say, this is by far the best red sangria recipe I've tried from ANY recipe site. So many of the reviews suggested reducing the rum by half and starting there (adding more if desired) so I did make that change, and I'm glad I did. I will also add a little less sugar next time (I think a quarter cup would be fine), but wow, this is fabulous!! Since the changes I made were purely my personal preference, I still feel this is a 5-star recipe, and I plan to use this as my go-to sangria recipe from now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The only change I made was since I did not have dry wine only semi-sweet I cut back a little on the surgar. It was very good and looked beautiful in the pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious! I only used about half the amount of rum, and for the wine I found a merlot/zinfandel blend which I thought worked out just fine. Will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best sangria recipe. Next time I'd add less lime, and maybe some bing cherries or other sweet fruit. I used a cheap shiraz, and it was fabulous. For those who think it's too strong, serve chilled over a full glass of ice. I also reduced the rum to 1/2 cup on occassion.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: drink with caution.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times, always with rave reviews and requests for the recipe. My favorite is using Parrot Bay Pineapple rum and Manischewitz Blackberry wine. Soooo good. In addition to a lemon, lime and orange, I add sliced pineapple and sometime strawberries. Making some this weekend. Can't wait to sit on my patio sipping a glass and enjoying the evening.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cheap wine redemption! I used white grape peach flavoring instead of citrus.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: we made this for the office staff party and forgot the orange juice (!) - noone noticed and everyone loved it...i wonder why... :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good flavor, but fairly strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this stuff!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Reduce rum to 1/2-3/4 cup per bottle of wine. Still strong but not over the top.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my girls night in party and it was a big hit! Everyone loved it. I followed the recipe with the exception of using another reviewers advice and added triple sec (1/2 cup) and adjusted the rum to one cup. VERY VERY GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had this over thanksgiving and just served it again recently... Made only one pitcher, but everyone loved it so much that I should have made 2!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love lemon, but this sangria is overwhelmingly citrus. IfI make it again. I will definitely tweak.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Since there was only 2 of us, I halved the recipe. Very, very good! Next time I will use Captain Morgan or omit the rum all together and use Triple Sec instead. I used a variety of fresh berries, oranges & apples! Amazing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used spice rum. Used regular Merlot because I could not find a decent black berry merlot. So I added some frozen black berries. Used 1 each of red apple, green apple, lime, orange, and a lemon. Many of us like it strong so we didn't need soda, but others felt the need to add soda. All were satisfied.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A good place to start, but could be improved.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: When they are in season, make this sangria with blood oranges and fresh squeezed blood orange juice. Incredible.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great sangria recipe it never disappoints and people are always raving about it. I like using a merlot for this and Barefoot Merlot really makes this pop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is an instant success! I used spiced rum and a cab/sav for wine. Outstanding!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy! Major hit at Girls Night In! I didnt have any rum on hand so I used brandy. Just as good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great, it was my first time making Sangria, I substituted brandy for the rum. Everyone loved it, including my friend who makes it all the time. I think the best thing is that it has very few ingredients so you taste the wine and brandy (it's also quick and easy to make) I mixed the fruit and wine together the night before, then mixed everything together in the morning so all the flavours melded.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used blackberry merlot (cheap but tastes sooo good!) and spiced rum along with all the other ingredients this calls for. I made 5 batches of it for my housewarming party and it was such a hit! Will DEFINITELY make this amazing Sangria again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! I used way too many fruits in my first batch, but the flavor was great and it is so easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used Merlot. Had every intention of using a spiced rum only to discover that I only had half the amount of it needed so I had to add regular rum to the rest. Needless to say the spiced flavor didn't come through. I also made a batch Sangria and it called for brandy. So I did a taste test and I like the rum better. The brandy made it too "boozy"

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe for Sangria. I used the spiced rum, but we didn't like the blackberry flavored wine (that was recommended by others) as much as regular wine (we used a cheap merlot the first time). I think the blackberry wine works great if you don't have time to let the flavors develop - or if you want a drink that is not as strong. Still, the great thing about this recipe is that you can experiment with the ingredients (both alcohol and fruit) and it'll still taste great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This turned out really tasty, even though I forgot to add the orange juice! I will definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have used this recipe multiple times! I live in Florida. Have had Cuban immigrants exclaim that: "Now THIS is like the Sangria at home." High praise indeed! Everyone, yes everyone LOVES this recipes. I save it and use it for all the spring, summer, fall parties I have! Good for drinking by the pool also! Now: January 2016: I make this for EVERY party I have: at least 3 times a year. This time I edited this way: and I must say: even more raves! I quadruple it: which is easy with allrecipes.com calculator on each recipe! Instead of orange juice use FRESH grapefruit juice (in the produce section). Instead of oranges: use red grapefruit slices. I use SPICED rum. Decrease the sugar by a 1/4. Two big pinches of salt (brings out the citrus flavor). For only 6 servings I would use a small pinch of salt. I always use a Cabernet wine. Okay to add an extra bottle of wine to stretch punch. Just keep tasting, as you add, before you add the slices of fruit. Keep muddling the fruit...the more the fruit is bruised in the punch: I think the better it tastes. I would say the punch today is the best yet. And I have made it at least 18 times!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: 4.5 Stars! I love this drink and can't wait to make it again. I doubled the original recipe for a party. I used blackberry wine as others suggested, but still added a bit of sugar. I didn't use quite as much rum (I used Cpt Morgan) since I had some older ladies who were worried about too much booze. I also had 7up on the side if anyone wanted to make a spritzer. For fruit, I used a whole lemon, 1 orange, half of an apple and a half of a can of pineapple with the juice. We actually ended up with leftover fruit, so next time I might not add as much. The drink would be great without it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: way too stong!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this for a party yesterday and love it. It tastes great--not too sweet but not too dry. Also, it is a lot easier than some of the other sangria recipes out there, which is great for when you're planning a party for a crowd. I will definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: So simple and so delicious. Everyone at our party asked for the recipe and it was almost embarrassing that it was so simple!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I used peach rum which added a nice flavor -- otherwise followed the recipe exactly. This will be my new go to sangria recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is some mighty fine stuff. I had bought a bottle of premixed Sangria as emergency backup but that's like comparing Dom Perignon to Mad Dog 20/20. I will definitely make this again and again :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe countless times and it never fails to win fans. I've shared it with friends on the east and west cost and what I always hear back from them is..."amazing sangria!". You simply cannot beat this recipe! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used spiced rum and blackberry wine as others suggested. Delicious! I hope to use this often for company

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe but be careful - it really packs a whollop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. I made this for a 4th of July cookout...and it was a hit. I only gave it 4 stars because I don't feel the sugar is necessary. I made it with Arbor Mist Blackberry Merlot and Parrot Bay Lime Rum...and followed the recipe exactly. It was a bit too sweet. But still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The original recipe is great! You can also improvise. I didn't have any red wine or brandy, so I used Zinfindel, mango rum, and plain rum. Had no fruit on hand so I used orange liquere. For a little carbonation I used a small bottle of sparkling tangerine juice. The point is, when in a pinch, you can use some subsitutions and still end up with a great drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go to basic sangria recipe. I took another reviewers advice and used Blackberry Merlot instead of dry red wine. This also eliminates the need for the 1/2 cup of sugar since the Blackberry Merlot is a sweetened wine. I like using spiced rum such as Captain Morgans. I soak the fruit (I usually add strawberries) in the rum several hours before putting the other ingredients. A bonus is getting to eat the rum/wine soaked fruit afterwards :) Very yummy, there are never any leftovers!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A little too sweet, but otherwise so tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: everyone enjoyed this alot, I should have doubled the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous sangria, but it will knock you for a loop. If you are going to have people driving home, you may want to reduce the rum just a little.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This must be an American version. I've had Sangria in almost very country that borders the Mediterranean and none of them had enough alcohol in them to even taste or feel it, irregardless of how much you drank.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe, make it every time we want sangria. I usually use Parrot Bay Passion Fruit Rum to make it more fruity tasting. SOOOOO good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! So delicious and perfectly fruity! I loved this and will make often! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really great recipe. Made it just as the recipe says with the minor substitution on sweet wine instead of dry. Used plain Bacardi rum and lemons, limes, and oranges. I mixed up the rum, fruit, and sugar the night before and added the wine a couple of hours before serving. The only issue I had was in trying to get the sugar dissolve. Awesome recipe, though. Will be making again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The first time I made this I used one of my favorite red wines and golden cachaca instead of rum and it was great! This time I used 1 cup golden cachaca since it's all I had and a new wine that wasn't nice on it's own and it was still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a very cheap bottle of Sangiovesse from Trader Joes and the cheapest white rum I could find. Following the recipe exactly....it's perfect. I think in the future I will put the sliced fruit, rum, sugar & OJ in a zipper bag and freeze, pop it into the ice chest along with a cheap bottle of wine and take camping.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This always pleases the crowd when ever I bring it to a shin dig! One time I used a wine that was 20% alcohol and whoa it was nothing to play with. Just make sure you take your time while drinking this it sneaks up on you. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add Spicey Capt Morgans rum for a great twist!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! So good! Beware it goes down VERY easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
