cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a jewelry party I was hosting and it was a HIT!! Every loved it and it looked very elegant and was very tasty! I added maraschino cherry's, and red and green apples and at the end of the party everyone fought over the fruit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a girls night fondue party and it was fantastic! I doubled the recipe and used Carlo Rossi Sangria wine, 2 small limes and 1 large lemon cut into thin rounds, I cut 1 orange into rounds and another I cut the orange wedges into bite size pieces, I cut up 2 apples into bite size pieces and before serving I added a jar of drained and rinsed maraschino cherries. It had a wonderful sweet-citrus flavor and I will make it again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used Blackberry Merlot. I have made this over and over again. Everyone LOVES it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I changes this around a bit, I added brandy and triple sec and cinnamon sticks to the recipe. I also took out the orange juice and added more sugar. I like my sangria sweet. I also let the fruit soak in just the liquor's with a little sugar and the cinnamon sticks. This recipe is a good start, but with my changes made it GREAT. If you do drink it the way I suggested, please drink it slow, it will sneak up on you later. Hope you enjoy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious! The only thing I might change was the amount of sugar. As I rounded glass number 2, I started to feel a bit sugar high and it was too sweet for me to finish the second glass. If you add just a bit less sugar, good to go!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very yummy recipe! I used arbor mist wine so it was a little more sweet and fruity and I used Sailor Jerry rum. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I've made this numerous times for dinner parties, and it's always a hit. I usually reduce the amount of rum down to 1 cup, and increase the orange juice by about 1/2 cup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVE LOVE LOVE this! I threw a couples bridal shower and made this as my cocktail drink and everyone could not get enough of it ( even the guys!). Its perfect and would not change a thing. Everyone went home with the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great base recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. As someone suggested, I soaked the fruit in rum for a while. I took this to a party so I combined all the ingredients in advance and it was really good. Next time, I'll add apples and maybe mangos.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Watch Out! This sneaks up on you! Try subbing the OJ for Peach Schnapps!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! Everyone RAVED about this drink! I used the blackberry merlot and spiced rum as other reviewers suggested and it turned out amazing! If it is too strong, you can top it off with a bit of diet or regular 7Up or Sprite...but we didn't do that and it was fantastic!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! Everyone RAVED about this drink! I used the blackberry merlot and spiced rum as other reviewers suggested and it turned out amazing! If it is too strong, you can top it off with a bit of diet or regular 7Up or Sprite...but we didn't do that and it was fantastic!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is fantastic, blending simplicity with awesomeness. I make it as often as possible, and sometimes I am reduce to inventing reasons. But, it's great for the holidays and any party you can think of. I always make double batches of this, and it fills a gallon pitcher. I lower the octane a bit by reducing the total the rum amount to just over 2 cups, and the OJ to about 1.5 cups. Otherwise, the (junk) wine flavor gets lost. I like it better when it's all balanced.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love love LOVE this recipe. It is my go-to sangra recipe. I find I like more sugar than what it calls for. Great summer and winter!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: everyone loved it! used coconut rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome sangria-the rum packs a nice punch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make, a little bit of a kick with the rum, and sweetness with the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for family and was delicious. I added one diced apple, one can of peaches (diced) and half a cup of ginger ale. I also placed a stick of cinnamon for flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My grown children requested I make this again and again. It's wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! I followed this recipe to a T and was it ever STOUT! Good but man it packed a punch. Oh and caution to those of you who make it, the lemon and lime seemed to be fine but eating the rum soaked orange will light you up! Not sure how it is any different than the other two fruits but my oh my did it ever absorb the alcohol. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Terrific!! I made this for my restaurant to rave reviews!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. If you scale up to 24 servings do NOT use 4 lemons, limes, and oranges. It is just too much fruit to waste. Everyone loved this recipe. Try to chill a few hours before serving if possible. If you can't, that's OK.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whenever I make this, people are in awe. I don't really know why, it is SO easy but totally worth it. I love making it in the summer to have around for those lovely, lazy afternoons... I add a little more rum, triple sec, a bunch of fruit and mix everything together in one pitcher, letting it all chill in the fridge. Adding a couple of pieces of fresh fruit to each glass is pretty but not necessary. And I never dilute it. Ever. If you are making this in advance (which I recommend), after a day the fruit takes on that red color. So, if you are going for pretty, changing out the fruit before presentation is a good idea.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is such a favorite with my friends. I follow the recipe, and occasionally add more rum (for an extra fun time!). I've used all sorts of red wines, but typically stick to a cheap merlot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was amazing..used grape juice didnt have orange juice..I mixed everything even the fruits & chilled for 3 hrs..I added Cherry liqueur..Used apple & pear tats the only fruit i had..will definitely make it again..was very excited to taste coz this was the 1st time i made sangria..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Such a simple recipe! It was a definate hit at my end of summer party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is some great but powerful Sangria. My best friend and I have turned a pitcher of this into a tradition whenever we get together, It is sooo tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making this recipe for 5 years for every party I host....Always a hit...Love it!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This came out great! I used merlot, less sugar, added strawberries, and a splash of Sprite when served.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very, very good Sangria! I used a Pinot Noir.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish!!! I used dark rum instead of spiced and added apples and oranges. Next time, I will use spiced rum and use mostly berries and lemons and limes. Will definitely make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times for dinner parties. It is a HUGE hit! Be careful though as it goes down very easy and packs a nice buzz in one glass. WE LOVE THIS RECIPE!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!! I did make a few changes. i didn't have any oranges so I justed used some orange juice concentrate to take the place of both the juice and oranges. I added lemon, strawberries and a little canned pineapple. I also added some of the juice from the pineapple which is sweet so I only added about a 1/4 cup of sugar. I also used about a 1/2 cup triple sec instead of all rum just because it adds to the citrus flavor. A great starting recipe you can use to add whatever your preferences are. Would be good with all sorts of different fruits!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this yesterday for the World Cup final and it was a huge hit - even the Spaniards here in Texas loved it! Being a Sunday I couldn't buy extra liquor so had to use what I had. I doubled the recipe so hence needed 3 cups of rum - I used 1.5 cups of Bajan Mount Gay and 1 cup of Dark Rum - the remaining half cup was made up with Peach Schnapps (some other Sangria recipes call for Peaches). I used Merlot and omitted the sugar - perhaps the Schnapps made the mixture more sweet as I didn't feel I needed the sugar. I added lots of thin slices of the fruit and chopped additional smaller pieces for use in the glass. I didn't have time to let the Sangria sit for two hours so served it within 30 minutes. It was a huge hit and marinating the flavors together overnight must make this a complete winner. Thank you Lisa.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We all loved this recipe! I tweeked it a bit and used a Lambrusco, and brandy (I used only 1/2 the amount for the brandy.) It was a major hit and went so fast I still can't believe it! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We quadrupled this recipe for my daughter's bridal shower. We should have made twice as much. We read the reviews and went with the Blackberry Merlot, and spiced rum that several people suggested. We added plums and apples along with the fruit listed. Yum!!! Big hit with everyone! I put a bottle of Sprite next to the Sangria just in case anyone wanted to lighten-up the rather potent concoction. I also had a big spoon there in case anyone wanted to dip in and get the rum-soaked fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Excellent drink! It IS strong but tastes soo good and is an amazing summer drink! I made mine with a dry Merlot, spiced rum and orange juice from concentrate. I added less sugar as well and it was great. As for the fruit, I added lemon, orange, blueberries strawberries and blackberries. I actually soaked the fruit overnight. It turned out wonderfully but watch out for the strawberries because they stood out above the rest for their ability to soak up the rum. Thanks for the great recipe! So simple and delicious. Will be making this all the time for summer entertaining!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did not like at all. Too strong!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty recipe. I used pineapple rum instead of regular and it gave it some good flavor. Should be noted that even without the pineapple rum, doesn't taste like traditional sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very delicious! Easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very delicious! Easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was amazing! Everyone agreed it was the best sangria they'd ever tasted. I used 1/2 cup of rum and added strawberries. I think it would even be delicious with a cinnamon stick. I will definitely be making this again, probably every Sunday! Thank you so much for posting it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: awesome..very smooth...will definitely make again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this all the time now! It is better than most Sangrias I've had in restaurants. The longer it is in the fridge the better. I'll add the run just before serving to ensure the fruit only takes up the wine. Your friends will be asking you for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! I used fruits & berries that I had on hand and spiced rum. Mmmmm, perfect for a hot summers day!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Solid recipe - I didn't have all of the fruit on hand b/c i made this at the last minute, so i only used strawberries (which i added at serving time) and orange slices which i added as the recipe stated. i also cut the sugar down just a tad and added only 1 cup of rum. Also, i added a splash of sprite to each glass to make up for the missing lemon/limes. Got a lot of compliments and will be making it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it this past weekend and it was a hit! I made it for 30 people. I used 2 huge bottles Arbor Mist in different berry flavors and Cpt Morgans Spiced Rum and added pears. I fermented it friday night and about an hr before serving added another 1/2 cup of sugar, then the oj and arbor mist. people were just drinking as much as they could before it ran out. Thank you so much!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for Mother's Day and it was wonderfl and refreshing! Next time I will double the recipe since it didn't make very much. I realized I only had 1/2 cup of orange juice on hand rather than the full cup so I used about 1/2 cup of triple sec to supplement the OJ. I also added about 1/2 cup of sour mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Using Captain Morgan's spiced rum and blackberry Merlot in the recipe makes a great combination. I made it twice, once following the recipe exactly, but it turned out better when I cut the sugar in half and only used one cup of rum. So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was alright. My guests seemed to like it well enough, but I felt it could have been a little better. I will keep looking for the perfect sangria recipe but might come back to this one and tweak it. Thanks so much for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this for friends all time. Everyone loves!! Thanks for the great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: FANTASTIC!!! I made this for a party I had this past weekend and it was gone within 10 minutes! I used Capt. Morgans 100 proof spiced rum and Berringer Merlot. Apples, strawberries, oranges, lemons, limes and blackberries. It was so good we added a 2nd bottle of wine and spash of rum and OJ to the leftover fruit. HIGHLY SUGGEST!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought it looked too simple to be as good as some of the other recipes- but I made it- added a few other things to taste and it tastes great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! Goes great with whatever fruit you have. I used one lime, one orange, one green apple, and about half a pineapple along with fresh squeezed orange juice. Lastly, I used a sweeter bottle of red wine. This drink will sneak up and kick you in the head, be careful out there!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I talked to my mom's neighbor who is from Spain and visits her family there 2 or 3 times a year. She said this is like the versions some of the newer restaurants have started serving the past few years. She said the traditional sangria is made with port(no rum) and lots of sliced citrus fruit and juice except for one small region where the locals use madeira and a splash of rum and lots of citrus. She also said your version is commonly found more towards France.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great! I added pineapple juice for extra flavor and it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING!!!! I used Blackberry Merlot by Arbor Mist and white rum. The best at home recipe for sangria I've ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best ever! Everyone loves when I make this! It's my staple now when entertaining big groups!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow this is really good, and I don't like wine at all. It's so yummy I can't stop drinking it (that's bad). I love that it doesn't have too many types of alcohol in it, so I don't have to buy tons of ingredients. I used spiced rum. Try this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this recipes. I added a ton of fruit to this apples, oranges, lemon, lime, pears to make it more fun. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is absolutely delicious. I add a few splashes sparkling water to the glass for guests who prefer something a little lighter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I lost my old Sangria recipe so I made this one in a pinch. It's ok but it needed major tweaking. I used less sugar than it called for and I had to add some extra wine, oj, triple sec and mineral water before it tasted right. For some reason it was terrible the next day. I think the traditional recipe with brandy is a better bet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked this but didn't love it. I just found it too strong for my taste but I am a lightweight when it comes to drinking. I do have to say that my brother loved it though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Had this at my holiday party and it was a hit! Everyone loved it even the beer lovers switched to this before the night was over. Thanks for a great, easy, delicious recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: pretty also

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was very popular at my Christmas party. Many of us were blitzed within 2 glasses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added more fruit and used Peach Brandy. Excellent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just tasted it - it comes off a bit sweet, but ice in my glass will help that. I think this is a very nice, simple version of sangria, and will use it again. I only used one cup of rum, but that was plenty for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've gotten so many compliments on this when I make it (usually for large groups) even from those who don't like "sweet" alcoholic drinks. I tried cutting the sugar in half, like other reviewers have said, but was told it wasn't sweet enough. I also add chopped apples (I chop the oranges, but leave the lemons and limes in slices so people don't bite into them thinking they are oranges!). I've used spiced and regular rum as well as blackberry and regular Merlot (at different times) and all are wonderful! For those who don't want such a "strong" taste, we add Sprite or 7-Up to the glasses afterward.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I have used this several times. Last time I used smoking loon cabernet with a blackberry flavor. This time MadHouse Wife Cabernet, but wished I had used there Merlot has more of a blackberry flavor. I also had to make a non-alcoholic batch so I used a 64oz bottle of Red Grape juice instead of the wine and rum, perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Strong and good! Easy to make too. I used Charles Shaw Shiraz red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a summer party and it was gone within 15 minutes!! It was so yummy! Watch out if you use soft fruit (strawberries, plums, etc.), they are lethal!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good, but I like "Sangria! Sangria!", better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Recipe! I doubled it and added plums, maraschino cherries, grapes, and it was fabulous! I also added a bag of frozen strawberries that chilled it and added flavor, too. Big hit!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a HUGE hit! Fantastic recipe. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: After following the directions...it was quite strong. But after adding another bottle of red wine...much better. Easy to make and tasted good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this drink! It looks pretty in the pitcher, it tastes wonderful, and it's fun to serve! I used Tortuga spiced rum and Barefoot Merlot (they support Surfrider Foundation!). This was pretty strong- much better for a night at home than taking somewhere and driving afterwards. Today I only let the fruit soak in the rum for about 3 hours, but next time I will let it soak overnight to get a stronger effect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! I used this recipe as a base and added the ingredients to my taste. The trick is letting the fruit and rum refrigerate together. Refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I added more fruit for flavor, and 1 liter of club soda to make it bubbly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too sweet!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was the hit of the party!! I did soak the fruit the night before in rum and OJ. The fruit I used were plums, orange, lemon, lime, apple, strawberries and blueberries!! I used a bottle of blackberry merlot, and 1 bottle of regular merlot!! It was gone in no time!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great; my mistake was too not print out the recipe and try to remember it! I added 1 cup sugar instead of 1/2 cup and it was a little too sweet! We still drank it. I let the fruit, wine and rum mellow in the fridge for about 4 hours! I'll try again and follow the directions better next time! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is such a great recipe! Delicioso!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added apples, strawberries, and pineapple. Doubled the recipe, but used 1/2 the rum (Capt Morgan spiced rum)called for. SO GOOD, we drank every last drop!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a cookout with friends. Major hit!!! We had some 7-UP handy for those who did not want a potent drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The rum is what makes this Sangria taste like REAL Spanish sangria. Be sure to use a really good dark rum to give it a yummy full taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Easy to make, and everyone at the party loved it!! I added extra sugar, about 1/3 cup! Will make over and over!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my housewarming party & everybody loved it. I ended up making 3 batches because it kept disappearing. Even the guests who said they hate wine were drinking it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic. I think it is a bit stronger than it tastes. For poolside, I might cut down on the ABV a bit next time, but very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great, but next time I will cut down on the rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and was a hit at our BBQ! I used 1 cup of rum as others suggested. Thanks Lisa for sharing this great recipe! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so easy to make! I did cut the rum to 1 cup and I only added 2-3 tbsp. of sugar as I like mine a little less sweet. I also added a few splashes of lemon-lime soda for some fizz. I used a basic table red that was inexpensive-this was a hit at our tappas party! Great summer entertaining drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used 1/2 spiced rum and 1/2 regular rum. Also cut the amount of rum in half and it was still strong. Added sprite as well. Really delicious and everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This didn't taste like the spanish sangria we drank in Spain. I added only 1 cup of rum and it still was too strong and not refreshing enough because of the sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious and a big hit at my last BBQ. I used a 1.5 liter bottle of Yago Sangria, increased the rum to 2 cups and kept the rest of the ingredient amounts the same. It went down great and was just as good as I've had at Mexican restaurants. Highly recommend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Sangria,and this recipe truly embellishes the wonderful use of fruit for those hot summer nights. I used a Merlot and it came put great. Buen Verano, everyone. Two hours was plenty of time to "meld" flavors.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome and simple, would add some fruit next time. Can't believe how easy this goes down, you can barely taste the alcohol! Doesn't seem to taste any better the morning after so perhaps leaving it overnight isn't necessary. Goes great with a paella!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is wonderful and only gets better with age. I use Arbor Mist blackberry merlot with whatever rum I have at the house. Everyone loves it and requests me to make it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We truly loved it. I used spiced rum as suggested and only 1 cup. We didn't want to get to snockered. I also added a little bit more OJ to match my husband's taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this over the summer, and it was perfect..... in addition to using lemon, lime, and orange slices, I also added white nectarines and strawberries to the fruit mix. The white nectarines were SO great - really gave it a nice flavor. I would not recommend cutting the sugar in half. Absolutely delightful! Guests just rave about it. I have been getting asked for the recipe all over the place. I put 7-up out for people who wanted to add a splash to their glass to water it down and give it some carbonation. But most everyone loved it the way it was. And the strawberries the next day after sitting in the alcohol mix all night???.....WOW! Look out! Strong, but delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I substitued blush but the rum and citrus was just too much, I couldn't drink it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of the easiest and best sangria recipes I have found. I used spiced rum and a merlot. I only used 1 cup of the rum, which was plenty. It was a little sour with the lemons- I will omit them next time and add more cherries and strawberries. It was a little heavy and sour, so I added a splash of lemon-lime seltzer water, which was perfect. It got great reviews, and I will definitely make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Appleton's rum and a $9 bottle of Merlot. It was such a hit, we made a 2nd batch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Phenomenal! Used spiced rum and blackberry merlot. I also cut up strawberries and put them in there. Sooooooo good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Insanely good....I made it last night when friends were over and I ended up making another as the night went on... the only thing I added was a chopped apple...DELICIOUS.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my daughter's wedding yesterday and it was a big hit. I actually forgot to add the OJ at the end and only added the wine and it was still great. I used spiced rum and blackberry merlot as others suggested. YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: All in all, I thought it was a great recipe...very classic with easy-to-find ingredients. The important step seems to be the 2-hour marinating time in which the fruit and the rum get "happy". I used a white merlot for the wine, and it was well balanced. (I don't care for really dry, woody wines.) Alcohol content is really personal preference, and for me, this recipe had twice as much rum as I'd like, so I will cut the rum in half next time. All the party goers enjoyed thje sangria as well, but most chose to cut it with Sprite or OJ. I will definitely make it again with less rum. Thanks for sharing this :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: So sorry but we just didn't like this recipe. There was too much rum. I was glad I had other drinks at the party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG this Sangria is just perfect! I did leave it on the fridge overnight and just before serving added 2 cups of Sprite! Apart from that I followed the recipe as it is written and it was a huge hit! I made it for a baby shower and everybody loved (except the pregnant lady who didn't drink it ;-) We are having friends over for a bbq and I am making it again! Thanks for sharing such a wonderful recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: went over EXTREMELY well! i made it about 24hrs in advance, (using a cabernet & white rum) then added 3 cups of 7-up right before serving to liven it up. my mother-in-law who rarely drinks had 4, that's right, FOUR glasses! made for a fun party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this in a 2 1/5 gallon jug Used 2 oranges, 2 lemon, 1 1/2 lime a package of Blackberries, and half a container of strawberries. I used 2 c. of rum, 1c of brandy, 1c. sugar, 1 c orange juice... i let all that mix for an hour or so then dumped in 1 liter & a half bottles of the cheapest merlot at wal-mart. will fill with ice to cut it down a bit (willbe sitting out allnight) and have club soda and ginger-ale for those who need to cut it down a bit but just taste tested it and WOW!!!!! that it a big ol' jug of trouble it is fabulous and i expect it to go quickly...since i made 2 containers showing up with 5 gallons of sangria may just make me the hit of the party!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful recipe, though we halfed the rum (still plenty) and added strawberries to the fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you have had authentic Sangria this does not measure up. I made this recipe because I had everything on hand however, there was too much rum for my taste and was lacking in flavor. With a little doctoring up, with sprite and a simple syrup it was pretty good but next time will try another recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe and so does everyone who tries it. I'm thinking of substituting peaches for the citrus fruit and using Capt Morgan spiced rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was fabulous! I hadn't made sangria before, and figured that this recipe wouldn't take too long to chill before my friends arrived. It was perfect. I used 2007 Turning Leaf Merlot for the wine, and Tortuga Bay spiced rum. The taste was very smooth and fruity. It was delicious, and it kicked us all in the butt, so be careful how much you drink. It will creep up on you! Thanks for the great recipe and tips from the other reviewers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! I made with Captain Morgan, as previous reviews suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely amazing! I did take the advice of others with the Blackberry Merlot, and lightened the intensity with a cup of lemon lime soda... and WOW! MY husband and I will be making this recipe once a week now when we sit out on our patio enjoying the sunny weather. Perfect summer evening drink! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is so refreshing! I used a little honey instead of sugar and used an orange flavored liqueur instead of rum. I can't wait to make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Lovely! A smashing success! I have not had many sangria drinks in my time, but this recipe might just change that. It was very potent but not boozy. I used a cheap shiraz and a combo of fresh orange and grapefruit juice becuase thats all I had on hand. I also used some pinapple juice left over from another punch I made that night. Not a big deal. I went used 2/3rds the rum called for in the first batch but went all in for the next round. The fruit looks lovely when it turns red.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and oh so good. Served this for "girls night" and it went over great! I did decrease the amount of run to 1 cup and substituted 1/2 cup Spenda for the white sugar. Will make again very soon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria is the biggest hit at BBQs! I follow the recipe except I specifically add Captain Morgan spiced rum (instead of just any rum).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times...everyone LOVES it. I have had SO many people ask me for this recipe. i cut back the rum and use blackberry merlot. MMMMMMMMM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was THE BEST!!! I made the Sangria for a party and received rave reviews all night long! Everyone kept asking for more and how to make it. I did follow some of the other suggestions and used a blackberry merlot and a little sprite. You can't go wrong...this was the best drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The rum is what did it. I went a little lighter on it just to be safe. I will use it all next time. My wine was sour, but everybody still raved. This recipe could save a bottle of vinegar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to follow recipe. I'd recommend soaking the fruit overnight. I added apples to the citrus fruits. I made it last year for a barbeque and there was very little left at the end.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice recipe! But classic spanish sangria is just Red Wine, Fruit (apple, orange, pear). only if wanted, a little bit of liquor (apple, for example), but never rum...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was pretty good. I have to admit I used spiced rum, as suggested in some reviews, and it was WAY too sweet for our tastes. Next time I'll either leave out the sugar or use plain rum as in the recipe. I diluted it a bit with Sprite to cut down the sweetness, and it was very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a fantastic recipe. I used Cabernet wine, spiced rum, pomegranite liquor, oranges, lime, lemon, cherries, orange juice, and apple juice. The sangria was a little stronger than I wanted, so I added 1/2 cup of apple juice and 1/2 more orange juice. I was a little short on the rum, so I made up the difference with pomegranite liquor. It's fantastic. It tastes just like the sangria at our favorite Spanish restaurant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! We had a can of mango juice on hand and added that as well along with some Contreau. It was a huge hit and this is easy to convert to a white sangaria as well with white wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of the best drinks I've ever had, though I've never had sangria before. Make sure you put in enough orange juice to ward off the flavor of liquor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used 1/2 the total amount of rum and sugar- added some club soda as I was pouring it into individual glasses. Great recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is awesome! I made exactly as recipe stated except I used only 1 cup of Captain Morgan instead of 1 1/2 cups and it was perfect. I have made it with letting it sit 4 hours or overnight and recommend the 4 hours. When I made it the night before it still tasted good but was slightly bitter from all the citrus rinds. I have also made it with a $3 bottle of Merlot or a much more expensive wine and there is no difference in the flavor so save your money. Be careful because you can hardly taste the liquor and it will knock your socks off.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a smash at every party that we have had! We usually mix with Sprite, it can be very potent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I added Triple Sec to add more kick. We loved it, and plan to make it again. When the summer months are here, I plan to add nectarines and pineapples.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last night in preparation for a dinner party tonight. I used a cheap OJ, and a cheap jug of Burgundy and Captain Morgan's. It came out just great. Had my brother, who went to Spain and loves Sangria, test it. He really liked it. Should be a big hit tonight! Thanks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: As I reside in Ponce Puerto Rico I have tasted some of the great Sangria's Puerto Rico has to offer which includes Cuban and Spanish recipes. This recipe by Lisa is simply dynamite and rivals the great Sangria served at El Patriota Restaurant located outide Ponce. I have been making this Sangria for the past two years and have been asked numerous times to make this recipe at gatherings, receptions, bridal & Baby showers and even tailgate parties. Two restauernater have even asked for this recipe for use in their bars. I know that experimentation with this recipe is expected, I find myself most reluctant to change it in any form. I find it great as it stands. Saludos to a great Sangia!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! Tastes just like the Sangria at my favorite tapas bar. I used only one cup of the rum and half the sugar, and would recommend that you adjust the sweetness and liquor according to your own taste - if you like a stiffer or a sweeter drink. You can also add any kind of fruit that you like, so it's a very forgiving recipe. For the wine I used a bottle of Concha y Toro merlot/cab sauv blend. 1.5 liters for $7, but you'd never know it was cheap wine with this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a hit wherever I serve it, although it is pretty strong. Depending on the crowd, I replace up to 1 cup of the rum with orange juice, and it's still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes, it is really strong. You should definitely use the spiced rum! I always add seasonal fruit when I make this. Also, try it with white wine too, it is really good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! I served this at my birthday dinner party 2 years ago and my friends are still talking about it. I'm dusting it off again to try for the adults at my son's birthday party...I will be omitting the rum this time as it really sneaks up on you in the recipe. This is a 5 star because it is unforgettable and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was excellent & everyone loved it! I did tweak the recipe a bit. I still used only one lemon, lime, & orange, but doubled everything else. After mixing everything, it tasted too much like rum/alcohol for my tastes, so I added more orange juice (prob. 1/2 to 1 cup extra), & more sugar (around 1/2 c. extra).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! Loved it! Loved it! It is strong; so be forewarned. My girlfriend fell asleep on the edge of my tub with her hiney in the air giraffe style after I served this at my baby shower.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: OH MY GOODNESS! I MADE IT WITH CAPTIAN MORGANS SPICE RUM AND A BOTTLE OF MURLO. I USE FRESH BLUEBERRIE, APPLES, LIME, LEMON, AND GRAPES. I HAD TO ADD A LITTLE EXTRA SUGAR THOUGH. I DID NOT LIKE WINE AT ALL, BUT MY DAUGHTER AND I JUST GOT HOME FROM ST.AUGISTINE, FLORIDA AND THEY HAVE THE BEST SANGRIA EVER AND OURS TURNED OUT EVEN BETTER. I CAN NOT WAIT TO MAKE THIS AND TAKE TO OUR THANKSGIVING PARTY, THIS IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ;0) ENJOY------ KAREN

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe because it is so easy and wonderful. I am sort of a light weight so I add some 7up or Ginger Ale to spritz it up and bring down some of the alcohol content.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this for plenty of parties and have been told this is better than the sangria in Spain. I took someone's advice and use Captain Morgan's spiced rum. I add a pear and an apple to the recipe and usually use at least two bottles of wine (usually a cabernet that is somewhat cheap or on sale). Have given the recipe to many others.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice and simple to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I get rave reviews everytime I make this. It is a good base recipe, I like to make it my own by adding apples along with the other fruits. I also use spiced rum and orange-pineapple juice. I have also added a dash of Fresca to each glass to make it zippy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Sangria I have EVER had! I used Captain Morgan Spiced Rum, fresh orange juice (not from concentrate), and instead of the citrus I used blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, and raspberries. Oh my God! Awesome. It was even better two days later when it had a chance to blend.. got a little thicker. This drink is not for a lightweight. Can't wait to make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends call this drink "Hangover Sangria" and demand I make it for every party/dinner/BBQ etc. I find it's best when really really cold, so I serve it over lots of ice. That way, its potency is lessened a little as well. I realize ice in sangria is "wrong" but it sure tastes good when it's cold, and I prefer that to watering it down with soda. I do cut down on the rum some as others have said. Still, it's a killer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not care for this recipe. All you can taste is the rum. We had to add an additional 2 cups of orange juice then mix it half and half with sprite to even drink some of it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish! I marinated the fruit, sugar, and rum (only 1/2 cup of it) overnight. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious but way too strong...I only put in a cup of rum already being wary of the alcohol. It was still a bit much. I'd go with 1/2 or 3/4 cup rum next time. I used cheap burgundy, lemon juice instead of a lemon, pineapple-orange juice (it's what I had), and added some maraschino cherries like some others did. Also, don't let it sit for longer than an evening with all the fruit in it or it gets real bitter (probably from the citrus rinds). But again, it was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Captain Morgan as others had recommended and thought the spice and rum was too strong in the mix. I would use Brandy next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this sangria recipe - very quick and easy and it tastes wonderful! I replace 1/2 cup of the rum with triple sec and lower the sugar to 1/4 of a cup. Also, I just mix it all up and let it sit in the fridge over night. Thanks for sharing this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: wow... just a tad too much rum. for those who like it strong, follow this to the letter. for those who like it reasonable, cut the rum in half. but i do like my bevy's with a bold taste so i enjoy this one overall, thus the 4 stars

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I put less rum and I could still get drunk out of this!! but I just LOVED it. It was gone in no time. I passed the recipe to my mom and we will both make it over and over. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: FABULOUS! Especially with a good Paella!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times. It is awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Look no further!!! This is it!!! The easiest to make and best tasting Sangria out there (and I know because I've tried plenty).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has WAY TOO much Rum for a Classic Sangria. True Sangria is just the wine, fruit and a classic syrup made with sugar and water. If you wanna get a buz on, this is the one for you though!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT recipe and EASY too! I added ginger ale and it gave it a little fizz and cut the strong taste for my lightweight friends (ha ha).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was awesome!I guess I never knew there was rum in sangria.I followed the directions exactly.I made a big punch bowl full of it and everyone at the party loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this at my summer party last year! It was so good, many guest compliments. I am making again for my upcoming party this week! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My entire family loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I actually followed the recipe when I made this and wasn't real sure about it when I started drinking it. Neither was my sister or a friend who tried it, but my sister and I persevered, and we agreed - the more you drink, the better it gets. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this sangria for a couple of years now . . . everyone always loves it and asks for the recipe. The only thing I changed after the first time was the quantity of rum. I only use one cup per batch instead of 1-1/2; it's plenty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I soaked 1 orange 1 lemon 1 lime in Orange flavored rum with sugar for a few hours...added a bottle of black swan merlot...awesome. I also made the orange juice ice cubes. Pour in the sangria...2 orange cubes...top it off with a splash lemon lime sparkling water...AWESOME! I cut up some extra oranges to garnish the glass...Fun to make...even more fun to drink! Great if you like citrus!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great sangria recipe, and very easy. My friends all loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: CLASSIC & Wonderful! I'll be making this again & again throughout this Summer! :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my hubby's birthday and it was amazing! I used a 1.5 Liter bottle of cheap merlot and added an apple, marachino cherries to the fruit. I also added the rum with the sugar and fruit the night before the party and let it sit All day to let the flavors develop. Yum!! I had to warn my guests about the rum because they didn't believe there was very much in this recipe. Boy were they wrong!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Took others advice and used 1 c Cap Morgan/Arbor Mist blackberry merlot combo. Used 1/2c of simple syrup instead of the granulated sugar and used a green apple, pear, peach, & lemon. Will have to up the Cap Morgan to the recommended 1.5c since I found it not that strong. Will be making double batches for my 4th of July party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! My first sangria made and it was an absolute HIT with a very large party. I did read all the reviews and made slight modifications. I went crazy with the fruit selection and skipped on the lemons. I added a lime, an orange, 2 kiwi's, cherries (sliced and pitted - fresh), raspberries (fresh), fresh apricots (sliced), 1 apple (sliced), 1 peach (sliced), and 2 pears (the red kind). I chose for my wine Sutter Home White Merlot. I was very nervous about the wine choice but White Merlot is not sweet like Arbor Mist yet not as "dry" as a red table wine/merlot/cab/pinot noir. I still added the sugar and the Orange Juice. Note: I went with a few reviews and used the Bacardi Razz Rum (raspberry rum) and used the full 1.5-2 cups. However, I used that amount with 2 1.5 L bottles of wine so I would agree that if I was making this recipe as originally stated I would use no more than 1 cup of rum. HUGE hit. Brought it to a friend's family party where people were being conservative in drinking alcohol and it was gone within 2 hours flat. The best part (and no-waste part)...we took the remains home (the fruit) and food processed it into a HUGE batch of smoothie for tomorrow night. VERY potent and super yummy. Stay Green!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used brandy (more traditional) instead of rum and added a splash of club soda to each glass. What a great way to drink a five dollar bottle of cab!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best I've ever tasted. This is a winner. I am making this for a neighborhood party and I made a test batch for me and the wife. Wow is this smooth and refreshing. Wife kept asking for more, but I had to cut her off for fear she would overdo it. I cut the rum back to 1/2 cup and it was still potent. I used dark rum as that is what I had in the cabinet. The great thing about sangria is you can use the cheapest dry red wine you can find and, once mixed, it tastes like a million bucks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used merlot, splenda, pears, peaches, and oranges. I loved the pears! I thought it was very good, but it did get some of my friends a little loopy, so i ended up diluting each glass with about 1/2 sangria, 1/2 diet lemon-lime soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this a number of times and everyone just loves it. I usually add other fruits like apples, plums, and pears. The fruit has quite a kick after it soaks up the alcohol!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely not a drink for lightweights - but it has become the signature drink that I bring to parties. The key to this is to soak the fruit, sugar, and rum overnight. This gives it a chance to bring out the flavors and make a much smoother drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great drink. I made it for our house warming and it disappeared so quickly. I had to make 3 other batches. I used apples and oranges, which worked really well. Used a box of cheap red wine and spiced rum. Perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Like others, I used Arbor Mist Blackberry Merlot and Captain Morgan. I added strawberries to the fruit and cut the sugar in half because the Arbor Mist is sweet. I made a double batch and it was gone in a flash. Wonderful recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a good base. We'd never had sangria with rum in it and we only used a cup. it really snuck up on you. We used two oranges, a lemon and two limes. It seemed a bit "winey" yet, so we added ginger ale to each glass. Not bad, but I've had better. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! That packs quite a punch and is NOT a Wed. night drink!! I am a regular drinker but that left me hurting the next morning. I will definately be cutting back on the rum next time. There's a lot of room to play with the recipe. I used sweeter fruits because the lemon and lime gave it a little too much tart-ness. I'll make it again but with modifications!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a hit every time. I omit Lemons/Limes and add raspberries and blackberries. Also I buy boxed sangria instead of the red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I brought this to a Sangaria party and it was not a hit. I only used one cup of Rum, added 2 cups of OJ and a cup of Ginger ale. They still found it stong. Four stars because My husband and I and one of my friends husband really liked it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a dinner party and it was fabulous! I did use the bigger bottle of wine (liter and half) but it was fine. I also added a granny smith apple and a couple strawberrys. I would suggest to add the rum by taste..some may think this is too strong, but we liked it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: All my friends (and me) love sangria and every time we meet at my house they ask me to make this sangria.It is our favorite!We have red homemade wine and it makes the sagria even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Strong, but wonderful. Most of my family loved it. I would suggest adding more lemon-lime soda or ginger ale to help cut the alcohol down some.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was easy and delicious. I added a granny smith apple and some diet ginger ale. It was a big hit with my friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whhoooooo!!! This was very nice. I made mine with grapes and peaches. Definitely a keeper. Thanks for sharing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great base recipe!!! I juiced up some mandarin oranges, soaked a lemon, some mandarines and a bottle of marachino cherries in one cup of Captain Morgans for a couple of hours. Then added a cheap bottle of Reisling and a cheap bottle of red. Totally sneaks up on you, I have the headache this morining to prove it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was ok. We generally like more alcohol in drinks, but found this tasted better with less (1 cup instead of 1.5 cups). We tried again the other night with 1 cup Bacardi Razz Rum and it was fantastic! I highly recommend this substitution!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The flavors mixed very well with eachother. The rum was hardly noticable which makes for empty glasses everywhere! People were drinking it right up! All of the citrus makes the Sangria just tart enough, not overwhelmingly sweet. Great drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not care for this at all. Some people liked it but I had a lot left over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! I made 2 pitchers w/ only 1 cup of rum each. My guests said this was great & really strong. I loved the Arbor mist blueberry merlot. I do not recommend drinking any leftovers the next day, I had half a glass & was getting a buzz, plus the flavors were too harsh, not as fruitty. I'll be making this for parties all the time now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome. It sneaks up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe for sangria is better than the $30 pitcher at Texas de Brazil. Actually it's better than 99% of the sangrias I've had in restuarants. The only thing I did differently was add a cup of Sprite and used fruit that was in season like strawberries, honeydew, pineapple, and tangerines. I also made one pitcher with a $3 bottle of Charles Shaw Shiraz and another pitcher with a $4 bottle of German red. Both were fabulous. You really have to be careful with this stuff because it tastes delicious and you don't realize how much it affects you until it's too late.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect Sangria! I love Sangria, but have never attempted to make it. I tried this recipe due to it's ease and great reviews. I completely agree. VERY easy and inexpensive. I was a little concerned about the "type" of wine to use. I ended up choosing a cheap shiraz in one and blackberry merlot (as suggested)in the other and light rum. Note: I did cut the rum to a cup and I shook the rum and sugar first before adding to the fruit. Huge hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A hit!! It was gone within minutes. We even became desperate after it was gone and dumped a bottle of (good) cabernet into the pitcher, hoping to recreate this awesome drink. No such luck :( Will make again (after my liver recooperates!!) LOL

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved this sangria, used others advice and added spiced rum and blackberry merlot instead!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: LOVED this!!!!! I had a party and this was such a hit. I took everyone's advice and cut the spiced rum in 1/2 and used the blackberry merlot. I used fresh cherries and apples instead of lemons. Wouldn't use apples next time. I thought the fruit was too strong and I made about 8 hours prior. In case you are trying to make mass quantities like I was I used a double batch (12 servings) for each punch bowl and it fit perfectly. I made 3 punch bowls (6 batches) for about 17 women. What a hit! They were all talking about me making this "next time". lol The orange juice ice cubes were loved. I made Cranberry Sierra Mist (it's new) ice cubes too for a festive look. I also added some pomegranite for a Christmasy look. Be prepared to giggle drinking this:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very good, although I prefer my sangria a little sweeter and upped the sugar to a cup. Very dangerous as it is extremely strong without tasting so! Proceed with caution!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good Sangria. Easy to make. But oh so strong! One cup will leave your head swimming. You may want to cut back on the rum or mix the sangria with ginger ale or Sprite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last night for the Pretty Boy Floyd Fight and everbody loved it.(TIPSY)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: packs ALOT of punch, without feeling like it at all -- a very dangerous combination! excellent taste and very simple to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing recipe and good year round. Hits you good and hits you fast! Oh, I use Captain Morgan's and Arbor Mist blackberry Merlot, thanks to the suggestion of others.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good, used spiced rum and followed the recipe to the letter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: the best sangria i ever made, i made it for my son's birthday party and it was a big hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was even better when I soaked different fruits in the rum and used different rums. Mmm, mmm! Tasty!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a halloween party a couple of weeks ago and within an hour all of this was gone! (I had made 2 pitchers) Using spiced rum and using plenty of oranges made this even better. Make sure you have plenty on hand!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: so i doubled the recipe (except for the sugar) and used sunny d instead of oj- this was so delicious, it was gone in no time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! I make this for pretty much every occasion. I have found that it can get a bit "dangerous" without the sprite, but if your friends will have only one glass, I think the full flavor is best without it. As other reviewers have suggested, I use spiced rum, and it's fun to mix up the fruit for different shapes and colors. Rum-soaked cherries are delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this in the past and it was enjoyed by all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe was outstanding the only thing I would change is the sugar amount.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was a huge hit! Everyone was complementing me on it. I used ginger ale instead of sugar and pineapples instead of lemons and limes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I found it a bit too strong for my taste the first time around and so I decreased the rum to a 3/4 cup and doubled the orange juice. I've been using Planter's Punch "Golden" to give me the best flavor. I also find that I have to increase the amount of fruit to prevent it from being "stolen" before the Sangria is finished.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good but I have had better for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Blackberry merlot and Captain Morgans spiced rum and follow the directions. Not too strong - EXCELLENT!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The BEST Sangria! We make this all the time for parties. The rum was too strong so we reduced it to 1 cup, and also served it with Sprite....2/3 Sangria, 1/3 Sprite. Make at least a double batch if you're having company, because this goes fast!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Dangerously good. Very stong. Best when served over ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect Sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very potent, but very good! I added a little grand marnier to it as well, but I did add about triple the amount of orange juice (if not more)to mellow it out a bit, as well as a dash of club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used only 3/4 cup of rum to have mercy on my guests and used a spanish red wine called "Sangre de Toro." It was quite delicious. The next time I make it, I think I will omit the lemon since that was the fruit that was least enjoyed. Thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good. made for Liz's house April 2006

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good sangria, just a bit strong!! I used the spiced rum and it was too much for everyone so I added 2 cans of sprite and it was perfect!! I also added a cup black cherries and a little extra sugar. Yummy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really good. Bad part I did not have time to wait 2 hours for it to set up. Instead of just adding the sugar, next time I will make a sugar water and add that since takes FOREVER for sugar to dissolve in cold liquids.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added Sprite Zero to mind. I also used Arbor Mist blackberry merlot and captatin morgan's spiced rum. I cut the sugar in half. Everyone loved it and was asking for the recipe. I make a double batch of this and had to make one more batch before the night was over. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best ever. I had so many people ask for the recipe. I followed other comments and used the Blackberry Merlot as well as Captain Morgan for the rum and it was a hit. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A 10 star recipe! I am known by my friends and family as making the best sangria ever....and this is the recipe I use. I add a cup of 7up. Otherwise it will knock everyone drinking it on their butt!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was kind of disappointed with the recipe. Based on all the reviews I thought it would be FANTASTIC...it was very good but it was incredibly strong. Not a drink you should have ore that 2 glasses of (which I learned the hard way:)). I'll make this again, but will add more orange juice and will top off with lemon-line soda as suggested by other reviews.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I brought this to a pool party this weekend, and it was soooo good. I used a bottle of Black Opal cab/merlot blend, tropicana orange juice, 1 1/4 cup spiced captain morgans rum, and added a small bottle of blackberry seltzer. I added lots of different fruit (orange, lemon, nectarine, fresh cherries (pit removed), and a drained can of fruit coctail!) Perfect for a summer afternoon party!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Sangria!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the BEST sangria I have ever made. It is requested at every gathering by friends and family!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! Fruity but with a real kick. I will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!! The only change I made was I cut the rum down to 1 cup. I didnt think this was too strong at all, if you load the glass with ice and the sliced fruit before adding the sangria. Perfect recipe, I will be making this again. Perfect summer drink while sitting outside on those warm summer nights.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a total HIT... If you don't like try wine,try Riunite Lambrusco and 1/2 the sugar. And because it DOES creep up on you, add Sprite to tone down. Even toned down, it left everyone SUPER “relaxed" ;) Let's just say 20 servings were made and left many asking for more. Enjoy responsibly!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! I made the pitcher as is, which my husband enjoyed, and I topped my glasses off with flavored seltzer, which was to my taste. I also cut the citrus fruit into wedges and squeezed the juice into the pitcher, which made the citrus flavors more pronounced.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perhaps I should have used spiced rum as some people have suggested, but I used white and found it to be a fairly harsh-drinking sangria. I'll probably try it again and switch a few things around.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious-- perfect amounts of wine, rum, and sugar. I always use the Burgundy wine and light rum for classic Sangria flavor. Goes fast.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy...I've never had Sangria before, but always thought it looked tasty, so I decided to give this a try. I used nectarines and plums since they were on sale, but I bet this would be great with pears as well!! I only used one cup of (spiced) rum and it was still strong so I believe the amountin the recipe to be a bit excessive. I followed other reviewer's advice and used blackberry merlot. This was delicious, I cannot comment on the authenticity of this recipe, but it sure does taste good!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe exactly, and I wouldn't change a thing. It tastes just like the Sangria that is served at my local Spanish restaurant. I even used Two Buck Chuck from Tader Joes. It got rave reviews from all of my guests, and as mentioned by other reviewers, this does sneek up on you so watch out!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I made it using a pineapple rum and a merlot. My husband and his friends really enjoyed it. Drink with caution because it will sneak up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent. I don't care for a super sweet sangria and this one hits the mark. I like to put a hearty splash of cold and just opened club soda to the pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! However when I made mine I used a grapefruit instead of an orange (there was a mix-up at the grocery). I also used Malibu Banana Rum with a Merlot. I will definitely make again and maybe reduce the amount of sugar. It doesn't need the total amount of suggested sugar (or at least the way I made it ;) )

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not add rum...I was just trying to use up some red wine that I had lying around. Maybe that was key to making it on the sweeter side...it just came out like cold tart red wine with fruit. It was cool and refreshing though on one of the first super warm nites. Will try again with rum or vodka.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was outstanding! I made it for a 'girl' party & everyone enjoyed it! It did sneak up on you, but that was what we were looking for! I added in strawberries & a little more sugar and also used Captain Morgan Spiced Rum... very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best I've ever tried. Fruity and STRONG! Followed the recipe exactly and wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy. I used a Australian Shiraz and cut the rum to 1 cup. Added a splash of lemon lime soda and served really chilled I mean ICY and it was so yummy! Perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the other user reviews and substitued the red wine with the Arbor Mist Blankberry Merlot - i make this whenever i have company and everyone raves!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turns out great everytime! This recipe never lasts long at my house

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely fantastic. Had 16 people over and everyone truely enjoyed the Sangria. Easy to make and wonderful taste!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this over the weekend as well. It was just "o.k." - nothing too spectacular. I let it sit overnight after reading some suggestions, but felt that it was too thick to drink. Maybe will use some sort of carbonated orange soda next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A little strong but delicious! I add sprite to my glass sometimes if I don't want to get too tipsy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for the adults at my daughter's 12th birthday party which we had on Cinco de Mayo. It was excellent and my first attempt to make Sangria. This is definitely a keeper. I used regular rum, and never thought to use spiced rum. I will try that next. I did add extra orange juice because it seemed a little strong at first. Maybe a little less rum would work too. I will be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We only used 1 cup of the rum, and the taste of it was still pretty strong. I think 1 and 1/2 cups would have been too much for us. I served it for Mother's Day, and everyone cut their drinks with Sprite. Made them really yummy and fizzy and little lighter and more refreshing. We'd make this one again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: had this for anna's shower----it was great, huge hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A hit---used a Spanish wine and a spicy rum---went over VERY well. Had none left at the end of the party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for any Mexican meal. Careful though it will sneak up on you. Works well with flavored rums and different types of fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really good sangria. I also added apples and strawberries, which were really good. I only used 1 cup of spiced rum. I also used a cheap blackberry merlot, and it was sooo tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I ended up leaving my fruit to soak overnight and woah it was strong!! Used the Spiced Rum and Blackberry Merlot as suggested but I didnt like the fruity taste. We also added some Sprite to the second batch and that was ok. Next time I'll use Red Wine though for a more authentic flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: After I figured out that 750ml is just a regular siza bottle of wine... I gave this a try and it was very good. We also tried it with a splash of club soda per glass. We liked that too! I did use only 1 cup of rum and it still can sneak up and get you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Amazing! I used only 1 cup rum (good enough!), blackberry merlot (yummy!), and instead of lime/lemon/orange, I used blackberries/raspberries/apple slices/strawberries. Delicious!!! I can't wait to get home from work and finish the rest off!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOO-HOO! Fantastic! Reminds me of Ybor City sangria... thanks for this one. Tastes great, exceptional stress-relieving qualities, too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!!! I used Blackberry Merlot for the red wine and Capt. Morgan's Spiced Rum. It was the best sangria I've ever had! Will definitely be looking for any good reason to make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I cut the rum to one pint for 12 servings; only used 1 cup of sugar and super-cheap merlot. I also made the gingerale ice cubes for my guests and these were a hit! Everyone raved this recipe. Very potent like everyone warned. WOW! Tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: wow this really sneaks up on you, we got tipsy right away... lol. great taste, will keep on file

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was wonderful for girls night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I let the fruit soak in the rum and an added 1/2 cup of Triple Sec. I made this with a Merlot (Little Penguin) and with a Blackberry Merlot. It was a lot sneakier when it was made with the Blackberry Merlot, i.e. we got drunk, but it hit us from out of no where. When it was made with the Little Penguin Merlot, it was a little too alcoholic. I solved this by having friends who are alcoholics and don't mind.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party and even though they said it was strong, they loved it. I used w=Woodbridge merlot and plain rum as I had forgot to pick up the spicd rum. I made a double batch and only used 1 cup of rum. I used orange-pinapple juice. I will make this again with the blackberry merlot and spiced rum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe quite a few times now, and it's always very popular. I never reviewed this recipe before because most of what I had to say has already been said by fifty other reviewers. However, I wanted to add that the last time I made this, it was in haste, and I accidentally used coconut rum. It was still delicious. Also, most of the reviewers have written that this recipe does not keep well, but we found that if there wasn't much fruit in the sangria (just liquid), it actually improves the longer it stays in the fridge.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
