cocktail_reviews.Review: I lived in Spain for several years and I have had all types of sangria. A lot of sangria in restaurants doesn't have any liquor added, but is just sweetened, fruity wine. Some restaurants add brandy, rum, and even vodka. My personal favorite is dark rum, but I scaled back the recipe so that there was only 1 oz. of rum per serving. A slightly less potent concoction, but it still packs a punch! I only gave the recipe four stars because I think that it needs a lot of tweaking for individual preferences and I did not care for the flavor that the lemons and limes added. Next time, I will use oranges and peaches, which is the "classic" Spanish fruit of choice in my experience.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I cut the recipe in half as it was just hubby & I, used a pinot noir, added maraschino cherries, used Bacardi Gold becasue I am out of white rum & cut it down to 1/2 cup (remember that I cut the recipe in hlaf), added more OJ to help tone down the alchohol flavor (Bacardi Gold has a stronger rum flavor than white) & I did need to add more sugar. The rum-soaked fruit was phenomenal...even the lemons. Thansk Lisa...this was wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My first time making Sangria. I served it at what was supposed to be a "snowman tea party". Who knew it would be 70 degree in mid Jan in NC! Too warm for the Spiced Cider. Nevertheless it was a huge hit. I took the advice of others and put some Sprite in it from the start as I was having some non-drinkers. I doubled the recipe and it was still all gone. I only used 1/2 cup rum for each recipe. I thought it was plenty. I also used a cheap Blackberry Merlot. All of my guests were driving so I did not want it pack the punch many people desribed. I plan to make it again for our Super Bowl Party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends always request this Sangria after I made some for my frind's baby shower. It packs quite the punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm not a wine drinker! But this sangria recipe is delicious!! Gets better as you drink it. Just the right amount of rum if you are a heavier drinker

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am not a wine-lover. I've tried wine and other mixed drinks and do not like the alcohol taste. Suprisingly enough though, the sangria was great! We followed recommendations and added sprite to individual drinks for the fizz. Very light and fruity. I know NOTHING about wine and just picked one from the grocery store - we used Luna di Luna Red wine and it turned out great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW, this is great but really packs a punch! I could easily drink too much, so found it was improved by mixing with ginger ale, either a third or half-- and it still tasted great! One final tip - don't crush the fruit too hard or you'll get a bitter taste from the rind.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Sangria is delicious! Our friends could not say enough great things about it. There are two steps to the recipe which does make it a bit involved but well worth the effort. We will always use this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria I have had since I was in Spain. I had pinot noir and spiced rum on hand and it turned out awesome. Love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good recipe, was a hit during my New Year's Eve party. It was a bit strong with the rum. Next time will try a little less amount. Very easy to prepare. Will definitely prepare it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this at my New Year's Eve party and it was a huge hit. People were taking the fruit home in baggies. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this for any party or large get togther we have. It gets rave reviews and I don't have to spend most of my time mixing cocktails. I have also subbed peach schnapps for the rum, peach nectar for the OJ, and white wine for the red, to make a white peach sangria. It also got raves.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did not like at all- very "rummy." We added another bottle of wine and that helped, but it was too late.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and authentic tasting! I used oranges, limes, lemons, strawberries and canned peaches (with 1/2 the can of syrup) as my fruit and let the fruit soak in the spiced rum and sugar overnight until the fruit was nice and drunk. Then I added Simply Orange OJ and Arbor Mist Blackberry Merlot. It was a HUGE hit at our Halloween party and now it will be a staple at every party! People especially loved the drunk strawberries! After a day in the fridge however, it gets really strong so we mixed the leftovers with Sprite the next day to cut down the alcohol. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was a huge hit w/ friends and family. I like to add whatever fruit is in season: apples, pears, plums, peaches. Marachino cherries are good too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good - but made some changes. Soaked with a cinnamon stick and used blackberry wine and a bottle of "sangria" wine. Pears were my favorite

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a way to start a party...I served this at Thanksgiving and it was a hit. The first sip is very strong, but after a couple of swigs, it's outstanding. I even had the men drinking this and enjoying it...It was definitely a crowd pleaser...Serving it over ice cuts down on the rum taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe should definately call for merlot and spiced rum - any other way is just not as good. But if you do use merlot and spiced rum it is a real winner. I like to use a wooden spoon to mash the sugar and the citrus fruits together a bit to get the juices going and to disolve the sugar a bit quicker.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful!!! I used Captain Morgan's silver, and blackberry merlot, and it's delicious. Sometimes we throw a cinammon stick in there while it's chilling.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is not a drink for "non-drinkers" I was hoping to make a punch for a party that would appeal to the masses, this was not it. Most people left their glasses half-full. It may have been the wine I chose, but I was disappointed

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good, Thank You

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a "fiesta" themed dinner party and this was hardly touched. One person had one glass, another person tried it and said it "burned her throat". I had two glasses just to get rid of it. I thought it was "OK". I bought a fifth of rum and a bottle of wine to make this...seemed like a waste of money.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used lemonade instead of orange juice because I wouldn't drink any leftover orange juice. I also used only 2 of the 3 fruits listed because my pitcher was already full with those two. I really liked the recommendations of using blackberry merlot, but I suppose a real wine drinker would prefer something less sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and easy and very good! We made this for some "particular" guests and they were complimentary also. I am making it again today for a dinner party! Definitely a keeper for us!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was sooo good. Just one thing though - I had to double the wine and orange juice because the rum was way too much. Will make this again and again with 1/2 amount of liquor. Thank you for my new favorite sangria recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This was very good and easy. I used a merlot and thought the flavor was very good. Next time I think I'll try spiced rum. The whole pitcher was gone....and there were only 2 of us! Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was delicious, and very strong- a deadly combination!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My family loved this. It's potent too!!Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this twice so far, and everytime it was well liked. I did use a blackberry merlot, also added strawberrys, black rasberrys, and red rasberrys. this was a hit with all my friend. Packs a punch!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it and so did the rest of the crowd including those that had never had Sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great Sangria! I had a girls night and had cut all the fruit the night before for two pitchers... It was simple to make and a complete hit! Will definately make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best party drink ever! It was a great success at a recent party and I am hooked for life! I follwed the recipe exactly and would would never change a thing. It is perfect as it is!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added apples, and cut back on the rum to just a cup. It was a huge hit at the party. Be warned, it packs a punch and a hangover! I will certainly make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Watch out cause this has quite a kick. Add the sliced fruit on top to garnish and it's really pretty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: wow, that's tasty! could do with maybe a smidge less rum, or maybe more food in my tummy...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Only flubbed once on this recipe.. It was either because it sat too long before mixing in the wine or because of the wine that was given for this (friend picked up sangria wine) I'll stick with a merlot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I took this to a bridal shower and everyone loved it. It's really tasty and easy to drink - but watch out! It really sneaks up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you add siera mist or other lemon lime sodas you dont need to add the sugar. They dont put sugar in it in Spain. And it should only have the wine as the alcohol, gives it a fresher taste. The aussie shiraz/cab is a great wine for Sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just didn't taste right with the rum to me. I like it with brandy better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Finally! A recipe that makes sangria exactly as was intended to be - delicious and deceptive. Careful now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really good! I used an Australian Shiraz/Cab blend. I didn't modify the recipe at all except to add a splash of lemon-lime soda in the glass. I will make this again, it would be great for a party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a get together this weekend and everyone seemed to like it. I followed the suggestions of others and cut the rum to 1 cup and went out to get the Blackberry Merlot---I had never heard of it before but found it with the wine drinks....think inexpensive screw tops. The amount of rum was perfect but next time I will use a bottle of merlot wine. This wine product is inexpensive but I'm sorry, I didn't care for it at all. I added a little more OJ and 1/2 bottle of merlot I had opened the night before to make it drinkable for us. I'm a merlot fan and next time I will use the wine that I normally buy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved the original recipe, but now I have played with it, and I like it even better. I use a fruit punch juice (whatever's on sale), strawberries, limes, bacardi limon with the wine and triple sec. I have also used a chardonay for a little variety. It has to chill all mixed together for at least 2-3 hours. If for some reason you have extra, pull out the lime slices and it usually keeps pretty well overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Haven't made this yet. I am making 90 servings which is 15 bottles of wine. should I use all blackberry merlot or half dry red. Any suggestions?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband made this for our 4th of July BBQ; he used the Blackberry Merlot as suggested. It turned out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! I used a cheap merlot for the wine and made it for a girls' retreat weekend. It was a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect the way it is! I am a lover of red wine and appreciate its strength and authenticity. I tried one batch with the blackberry wine and it tasted like cough syrup-- way too sweet- could have been any alcoholic punch recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! I have never had so many people ask me for a recipe before. Took a double batch to a summer party and it was gone in a moment. So many compliments! I used 1/2 the amount of rum and lemonade instead of OJ. Also added strawberries and blueberries with the citrus fruits. I will be making this often - thanks so much!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: 5 STARS! Better than most Sangria I've had in restaurants! I even messed it up a little bit... I read the recipe wrong and poured the rum, wine, & sugar all in at the same time. It was wonderful still!! Also, I used the blackberry wine as some suggested! I'm never letting this recipe go... DEFINATE KEEPER!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect just as it is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is worthy of TEN STARS! !! This was my first attempt at making homemade sangria and I sent the recipe home to a few of my guests. I followed all the great reviewers' advice and used Blackberry Merlot as well. Make sure you do not mash your fruit too much or you will get pulp in the sangria. Only make as much as is needed since I discovered it does not keep well overnight. One last note: It looked so pretty in a glass pitcher with all the fruit floating in it. Fabulous presentation too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was a huge hit and my husband drank all of it in one weekend! I followed the recommendations of using blackberry wine and 3/4 cup of rum so that it wasn't too strong. I am not a big drinker so I am always thrilled to find a drink that I truly enjoy. I have already made another batch for this weekend. It is best when prepared and allowed to refrigerate overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: this stuff is yummy!! has a great kick to it.....something you don't feel till the 2nd or 3rd glass. only thing i'll change next time is a wee bit less sugar. i added apples and they absorbed most of the rum i think...lol. but still much better than most of the stuff you get in restaurants.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my favorite Sangria recipe! I've made it a number of times and I always end up seding at least one person home with the recipe. Depending on the crowd, I either use less rum and more OJ or vice versa. I also like it with apples in addition to the citrus fruits.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good, I made it almost exactly as the recope said. I used fresh squeezed orange juice and I added about 1 cup of ginger ale. It was so cool and refresing, even though I made it as an experiment because I have never made Sangria before it was the first thing to go. I had to scamble and make another pitcher, wonderful drink to have at a pool party here in the desert(Vegas)...thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this for a party and it was a huge hit! I took the advice of using the blackberry merlot....it turned out great! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe for Sangria! I double the recipe and served it at a dinner party for 12. Use the blackberry wine, like everyone recommends. Turned out delicious. Even the people that usually don't like Sangria were drinking it and enjoyed every last drop! This is definitely a strong drink and socks a good punch. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, like all the others have said. Followed recommendations and used Arbor Mist's Blackberry Merlot, great flavor. But boy, it knocked me for a loop, so I would say to definitely cut the rum portion down if you want to enjoy the drink and remember enjoying it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. As per others' recommendations I cut the rum by 1/2. I made two batches, one with blackberry merlot and one with red burgandy and the general concensus was that the merlot one was a little better. I used lots of fruit. Just be sure everything is very cold. I didn't get the wine cold enough so I had to add ice. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe to a tee, used cabernet, might try again using a blackberry merlot, would not recomment cabernet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tripled the recipe, using 2 bottles of rioja and 1 of blackberry wine. Gone in minutes!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum Yum Yum. Very good - down to the last orange slice! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My wife is a big fan of Sangria. Whenever we go to a restaurant that offers Sangria she has to try it. I made this for her and my mother as art of their Mother Day dinner I was preparing. I took the suggestion of many other reviewers and used Blackberry Merlot and half the amount of rum. They absolutely loved it. I had a glass myself and it was tasty. Will certainly make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A great sangria. I serve it at almost all of my parties and it is always a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I made this Sangria for a party and it was a hit. I wanted to make sure that I didn't spend the entire party in the kitchen cutting up fruit so I actually put the fruit, rum and sugar together ahead of time and let it soak overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the most authentic Sangria I've tasted since a trip to Barcelona my freshman year of college. I LOVED it, but I must admit that my guests did not...I have tons leftover. I think it was too strong for people who are used to drinking an "americanized" version of the drink. A few of my friends mixed it w/ Sprite and enjoyed it that way. Personally, I thought it was wonderful...just be wary if you've got miller light drinking friends. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good and sweet. I used a lot more fruit and it was great! (used blackberry merlot)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe for authentic Sangria! We thoroughly enjoyed it and this is coming from someone who lived in Spain! I recommend using a Rioja wine to get the most authentic taste. I used Bacardi rum and I didn't have any orange juice on hand so I squeezed oranges. It tasted divine! Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is good. I enjoyed it very much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very tasty, I just married into a Spanish family and I LOVED my mother-in-laws Sangria but I wanted to try and impress her with "my own" so I used this recipie. She loved it! A little secret I stole from her recipe, add about 4 cinnamon sticks and 5 whole cloves and let it sit for about 2-3 days and it gives a nice kick of spice to it. I will be making this again for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is wonderful! I served it to a group of six women, and we went through 2 pitchers of this stuff. Just beware, it's pretty potent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This made a great drink for my boyfriend's birthday party. All the guests went for seconds and thirds. One guest mentioned it was better than his own version. I eventually ran out - way too early. For my version, I used a cheap burgundy, only 1/2 cup medium rum, no lime nor lemon (didn't have on hand), added diced apples, halved grapes, orange slices, 1/2 cup splenda (instead of sugar), and used iced cubes made with gingerale to prevent watering down the drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Do not serve this to someone that doesn't like red wine. I loved these sangrias. My husband doesn't like red wine but wanted to try it;not good. they still have a very distinct red wine flavor. Perfect for those of us who love a glass or 2 of red.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Went through 2 pitchers of this stuff for 4 drinkers! It was wonderful and refreshing. It is so important to let the fruit marinate in the rum and sugar for at least 2 hours. My second batch was much better. Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Don't know what I did wrong but this came out very strong and bitter tasting. It may have been that the red wine wasn't the best. I mixed it with 7up and poured it over ice and that helped some.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is awesome! I'm famous now with all of my family and friends! I'm the one with the "to die for Sangria"!! I cut the rum back to 3/4-1 cup and make the orange juice with about 1 1/4 cups.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Made this for the four women at our Super Bowl party, fully expecting the guys to drink beer. Five batches later, not one beer was consumed! Having lived in Spain, I can tell you this is very authentic and WONDERFUL!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I went through 4 pitchers for a party of about 6 drinkers. I used cabernet savignon and it worked very well. Used only 3/4 c. rum and that's plenty. When they want the recipe you know you have a keeper! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This one is great for parties. Looks pretty in a clear pitcher

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so delicious, even the non-drinkers and others who don't enjoy wine LOVED this and had seconds (and thirds and some even fourths)! The only change was, like many reviewers, I halved the amount of rum. I used the cheapest Burgundy I could find and white rum. It's fantastic, and I like it so much more than sangria made with brandy. Thanks so much for this recipe! If I'm using it so much in the winter time, I can only imagine how much I'll use it this summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was simply outstanding!! I doubled the recipe, used orange rum and Wild Vines Blackberry Merlot, but still only used 1/2 cup sugar as I put in a small container of frozen, sweetened strawberries. I also put in 1 each kiwi, mango, nectarine, all sliced, along with the orange and lime. My grocery store also carries fresh, already cored pineapple, so I also used that. Eating the fruit after the sangria was gone was a real treat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing. But be careful, this stuff is strong! I usually leave out the rum and my guests still rave!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Beautiful to look at and tastes great too. Careful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty! Unfortunately had many non-drinkers at party so I drank most! No more sangria for me for awhile!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe received rave reviews at a party that I recently had. I added fresh strawberries for an interesting twist. Absolutely delicious and it really packs a punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so, *so* good. As I was slicing the fruit I also decided it was probably too much, and ended up using only half of the lemon, lime and orange. I also added 2-3 sliced strawberries. I used Bacardi Limon, because that's what I had in the cabinet. (and a cheap Merlot) I think I used slightly less rum than the recipe called for; I didn't really measure it. For those who don't like to taste alcohol in their drinks, this will be too strong, but should be good if you cut it with some lemon-lime soda or ginger ale. (and if I make this for guests I will have some available for them, but I love this as is) I will definitely be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a Mexican themed dinner party & while it tasted okay, I thought there was too much fruit & not enough liquid.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Whoa! I love my drinks strong, and this fit the bill. I added extra lime and lemon juice, and mixed the rum between lemon and white. I used some cheap tempranillo I had lying around - I definitely wouldn't use "carbonated wine" like Arbor Mist.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yuck, maybe its my fault because I did not follow the recipe exactly instead I took the suggestions of many others and used blackberry merlot and spiced rum. I used tons of fruit and it still wasn't good. I personally think I went wrong by using spice rum instead of regular rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Less rum next time. Wow.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I LOVE sangria. This is a great recipe...however my rum was VERY strong. I would recommend putting a 1/4 cup at a time in until it is balanced. I had to make 2 recipes because my rum overpowered it. I know you all feel sorry for me. Some other great additions: peaches, apples, and concord grapes (my favorite addition). I would make it at least one day in advance--2 if you have the fridge space. It gets better with time. Thanks for a fabulous recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My guests couldn't get enough of this sangria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a casual wedding reception with a Mexican theme and it was a huge hit. I did cut the rum to 3/4 cup like everyone suggested. Along with lemons and limes, I used fruits that were more edible, like sliced oranges, white peaches, apples, and halved grapes. I left it in the fridge overnight at least 12 to 18 hours and it was excellent. The fruits had time to soak up the liquor and were absolutely wonderful. This is a real keeper!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a wonderful recipe that had everyone wishing there was more!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you Lisa for an awesome sangria recipe! We enjoyed many pitchers of this sangria this summer by the pool. It is the best I have tried and the only recipe I will use from now on!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good. I added a little bit of 7-up to cut it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never had sangria with rum, usually it's made with brandy. It was yummy! There was not a drop left - they were looking for more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. I did reduce the rum to 1 cup. I also addes white nectarines, pluots, apples, pears and grapes. Everyone loved it. They were so giggly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The Best! Used Captain Morgans Parrot Bay for the Rum. No adjustments needed! Outstanding recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a very tasty and very potent sangria. After two glasses, my guests were definitely feeling no pain. My only changes were I added another 1/4 cup of sugar and 5 strawberries (halved). I might try one more recipe to compare since this was my first time making this drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party of approximately 30 people, including a guest from Spain. It was such a success. I did halve the rum (spiced), as others had suggested, and I used pears, grapes, and limes. To make sure the red wine was not too dry, I used shiraz, which lended a light sweetness. My Spanish guest commented on how authentic the sangria was, and I overheard another guest telling someone that the sangria was his favorite drink at the party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: As a sangria novice with a sweet tooth, I found this recipe a perfect base to start from. I've made this recipe many times, and have had friends rave about it (and ask for the recipe!) However, I tend to throw in different types of fruit, whatever I have on hand (I find that strawberries, blueberries, and nectarines are fruits that work well!) and use only 3/4 cup to 1 cup of rum. I think the sugar is important to help draw out the flavor of the fruit, as well as crushing the fruit after it has chilled in the fridge. Also, I have found that a cheap blackberry merlot (as earlier posters suggested) works best, in my case, a $4 Arbor mist version! I'm the type of person that does not like to taste the alcohol so with these changes, the resulting sangria is sweet, fruity, and will be gone in minutes!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would omit the sugar add 1/2 cup of tripple sec and add a splash of peach schnapps. (just a splash) Also an apple is a good addition as well. The sugar is what gives you that terrible headache the next morning. You won't miss it in the flavor. If you want to make this without the 2 hour chill time just fill pitcher with ice, add fruit, then brandy & tripple sec, then wine, then oj splash the schnapps stir with a wooden spoon and you're all done.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe and used the red burgundy wine as it suggested but it was much too dry and tart for me. I thought the orange juice and fruit would flavor and mellow out the dryness of the wine but it didn't. I wasted almost half of the batch I made. Don't think I will make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good sangria, I served it at a dinner party and it was a big hit. Would make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is not really a classic Spanish Sangria, much too sweet. Spanish Sangria is made with brandy rather than rum and the fruit is muddled with small amounts of unrefined sugar and club soda(agua con gas. The wine should be on the sweet side rather than dry.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a great starting point, but it's way too strong even for folks who like liquor. I added more orange juice and some lemon-lime soda (like Sprite) to tone it down. It was a HUGE hit after that. I'll definitely be making this one again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my boyfriend's birthday party last month for about 100 people. This was a HUGE hit!!! It was gone before the evening ended, and everyone was disappointed. I used 1/2 less rum, and added pineapples. People are asking me to make it again; I definitely will!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect! I added some sliced berries and cherries for presentation, but it would have been fabulous without.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did I do something wrong? After reading all the rave reviews I choose this recipe to serve at a party. I was so excited about it and it BOMBED! Every one said how good it was when they first tried it but then I found full glasses of it all night just sitting around where people had abandoned it in favor of something else. And I still have practically a whole cooler full of the stuff left. I kept overhearing people say how strong it was, and this was a drinking crowd! Oh well, maybe better luck next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not my favorite - too much rum flavor, too sweetly sticky. I made it for a large crowd - a chili cookoff and not much was drank. I didn't have a large enough container for the fruit and rum and sugar, so I used a plastic bag. Maybe my proportions were off?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This stuff will knock you on your keester! We do "low carb" so I do not use the sugar or orange juice; instead, I add 1 can of Splenda-sweetened diet soda like Hansens's Tangerine Lime. I also reduced the rum to a cup or less. Try Gallo's Hearty Burgundy for the wine! Delicious and it improves over a couple days (if it lasts that long....)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was fabulous!! I made a double batch for a barbeque this weekend and there wasn't a drop left. This was one recipe where I did not totally agree with the suggestions of the reviewers. I purchased Blackberry Merlot for this recipe and found that it was just too sweet. I actually had to open a bottle of plain Merlot that I had in my wine rack and add it to the pitcher to cut the sweetness. Next time I will follow the recipe exactly. Oh, and I did use the Spiced Rum as suggested. Thank you for a great summertime drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Sangria EVER. The only changes I made was to use 1 cup of spiced rum and to add nectarine and champagne mango along with the citrus. I got many compliments and recipe requests. I'll definitely be making this again (and again, and again)! Thanks Lisa!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty after it sits overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: So delicious! Perfect for a summer afternoon on the deck with the grill fired up! I used a couple bottles of Merlot from Trader Joe's (inexpensive) as well as some apricots added to the citrus fruit. It was wonderful! And I have lots leftover (expected a bigger crowd than I got for dinner!) Thank you Lisa! This recipe is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has turned out to be a favorite among family and friends. I make the more potent variety and everyone loves it. The most difficult thing about the recipe is chopping the fruit. I use lemon, lime, orange, apple and black plums.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made a punch bowl of this sangria for a brunch party and it was a HUGE hit! Used about a third less rum (spiced) and cheap merlot. Put in strawberries, kiwi, and maraschino cherries, in addition to the citrus. Yum! Will definitely make this again!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best Sangria I have ever made! I used only 1 cup of rum to tame it down a bit, and it still tasted fabulous. The drunken fruit at the end was delicious. I also added 1/2 triple sec/Grand Marnier.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made several pitchers for a dinner party a few months ago... used Bacardi Gold in some and Christian Bros brandy in some. Forgot the orange juice (oops!) but it was awesome anyway! Got LOTS of compliments on it. Got complaints that I hadn't made enough...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best sangria recipe period! We make it almost every weekend. I make it just as stated and I have always gotten rave reviews.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not impressed. I used Columbia Crest Merlot/Cabernet blend and added peaches and apples like others suggested. I blended the sangria with 7-up and without that I don't think anyone would have drank it. I took this to a Memorial Day picnic so I made a double batch based on the reviewers comments and ended up throwing away over half of it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I got great reviews on this at our party... I added 1/2 cup of triple sec and only 1 cup of rum. Mangoes were also a great addition!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was good but not GREAT! Very strong on the rum if you follow the recipe given - next time I will cut back on the rum, and sweeten up a tad more to taste. I will say it was gone by the end of the party!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was easy and fun to prepare, i used arbor mist blackberry merlot and 1 cup spiced rum. it was a little bit too strong on the rum so next time less, otherwise very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is GREAT! I brewed 1 batch to share w/a friend for a BYO club event and realized a 2nd batch might come in handy -might have a friend or 2 that needs to be turned on to something different. I mixed up the first batch the night before the event and fortunately(?) I have to get up early otherwise I might have a couple more glasses. OH, I made this with 2 buck Chuck Merlot from Trader Joes to keep the cost down and not waste a "good" wine &Bacardi White (clear) rum -the recommended amount because this recipe doesn't need any added flavor, but any inexpensive white rum will probably do the trick. I added some fresh pink grapefruit to the mix and tomorrow for the party i'll be adding sliced nectarines and strawberries. Sangria is a great change from the norm and the fresh fruit makes for some tasty snacking. Just great to beat the AZ heat. ;) This is definitely a summertime favorite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I did reduce the rum, as others suggested, to 3/4 cup. I used a $3.00 bottle of merlot and threw in some strawberries. Will definitely be making this quite a bit this summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: mmmmmmmm.....I am sitting here as I type this drinking a glass. I used the Arbor Mist Blackberry Merlot, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Well,not exactly,cut back on the rum to 1 cup- and believe me~ it still has a kick! The only thing I would change in this recipe for "liquid heaven" is definitely add lots of interesting fruits. Although the lime, orange and lemon add great flavor....it would be nice to have another fruit besides the orange to eat and enjoy more of the Sangria:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was DELICIOUS and SO EASY!!! I am big on themes so I tried this on my boyfriend when we were having fajitas and we loved it! Finished it the next day and ate all the fruit too!! YUM!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this drink for a party, and got some mixed reviews. I'm not quite the rum drinker that I thought I was and the amount seemed a bit much. I suggest cutting back a little on the rum. It did however make the fruit quite tasty!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best sangria recipe I have found, however I put in half the rum to reduce the bite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this sangria with the blackberry merlot, only one cup of spiced rum, and I made each serving with three parts sangria, one part lemon lime soda. Excellent, and not too terribly strong this way. I plan to make this several times a year!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a party we had, and doubled the recipe. We also had a white sangria but THIS was the hit! Everyone loved it. Instead of using citrus, we used papaya, strawberry, mango which was amazing! You will love this recipe, 1 batch isn't enough!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good! I based my opinion on Cafe Sevila, this amazing Spanish Restaurant popular in California. I changed it a little based on other reviews, and to make it taste more like the Sangria at Cafe Sevila. Use apples!! If they suck up the rum, it's only wasted if you don't eat them! And instead of orange juice, add an orange flavored liquer like Cointreau, or if you really want to knock your socks off... Grand Marnier. This is what Cafe Sevila uses!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: the best sangria ever! always gets rave reviews at any party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed advice and used less rum - about a cup, I think. We loved it and got pretty tipsy. It's dangerous! I'll definitely make it again and again. I use a lot of fruit since that's the best part - peaches, strawberries, oranges, and limes...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was fantastic! I made a couple of batches for an Oscar party I had the other night and couldn't believe how tasty it was! I used less than 1 1/2 cups of rum (about 1 to 1 1/4 cups) and no one thought it was too strong. I used spiced rum and a $6 bottle of red and it turned out great. Added strawberries, an orange and lime, black plums, and some panned peaches- made for a nice variety of colours. Bottom line: this tastes like you spent a long time on it, but it's unbelievably easy to make! If you like sangria, you'll love this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice drink. A little on the potent side if you are having a few in the sun. You can cut it with club soda. Also try adding a sliced kiwi and two shots of Contreau. Mmmm.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a double batch using one bottle of merlot and one bottle of cabernet. I reduced the rum to 1 cup per batch (using 2 cups total for the double batch), and I used spiced rum as some reviewers suggested. WHAT A HIT?! It made for a wonderful evening with some good friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wicked Good Sangria. Ignore what they say about apples and pears. Add them both and then crush the fruit with potato masher or spoon afer the Sangria has sat overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was DELICIOUS!!!! I did reduce the rum to 1 cup and topped it with Meyers. served it with a cuban themed dinner and everyone thought it wonderful. I will be making this again soon....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: super yummy! Adjusted it to my taste- i added a little more O.J- some lime, lemon and orange slices. Went thru it quickly one summer night with the neighbors- had to make a double batch- what a night!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! We made a few batches of this and used different flavors of wine with different fruits each time. You can get creative with this recipe and it will still turn out great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: this recipe is excellent. It takes just like I remember from Spain. I reduced the amount of rum to 3/4 cup and used only 1/3 cup of freshly squeezed orange juice. That really made the recipe a lot better to me. I LOVE Sangria!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is fantastic!! I have made it many times and every time people have asked for the recipe. I used light bicardi rum and cheap burgundy red wine both times. I have had several sangrias and this is wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY!! Very cooling on a hot, summer day by the pool. My sister in-law and I drank 2 batches:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: By far this Sangria was the best I have ever had. It was restaurant quality. I have served this on several occassions and it always gets rave reviews. I used blackberry Merlot and Sangria wine along with Myers rum to soak the fruits in. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this on a couple of occasions to rave reviews. I sliced the orange, lemon, lime very thinly and placed them in a pitcher with the rum and sugar and let it sit overnight. Before I left for my party, I added the OJ and wine. It was amazingly good!! Also, I just used a Cab I had opened a few days before for marinara sauce and didn't like enough to drink on it's on. Great way to get rid of a red you don't love! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our New Year's Eve party and it was a hit! Everyone was sad when the pitcher was empty. I halved the amount of rum and used regular (not blackberry or any other flavor) inexpensive merlot - it turned out delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! Served this for New Years and it was a hit. I did end up reducing the amount of rum (made a quadruple recipie, and used 3 cups spiced rum instead of ~6) and I soaked the fruit in it overnight and all day. For fruit, I used 2 limes, 2 oranges, 1 lemon, strawberries, and canned peaches (and about 1/2 the juice from the can). I used Arbour Mist blackberrry merlot for the wine, and only added about 3 cups of orange juice to the whole thing. Turned out -excellently-, and was just about perfect for strength. Thanks for a great recipie!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Potent stuff!! It's sweet, so it goes down easily - too easily!! I decreased the rum to 1 cup (plenty of rum!) and served it over a glass full of ice. We made the second batch with a homemade raspberry merlot - good that way too - delicious recipe!! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hooo Mama! This was really good, but dangerous! Too easy to just suck down quicky . . . and then it hits you. Drink AFTER using the food processor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sure made the Cookie Exchange Party memorable (or not!). What a nice change from the usual drinks - my friends all LOVED it! Used $6 bottle of blackberry merlot ('not a wine, but a wine PRODUCT' I was informed by my local liquor store advisor:) and spiced rum. Deeeeeeeelishus!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this for my friends many times and it is ALWAYS a hit!!! I made it with the blackberry merlot and used only 1/2 the rum and added Sprite. VERY good, the alcohol sneaks up on you. The fruit gives it so much added flavor also. GREAT recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so yummy, my guests loved it. I accidentally forgot the OJ, but it was still delicious. I used Blackberry Merlot as suggested by some of the reviewers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am a huge Sangria fan and this is the best I've ever had. It is so easy to make!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I recently attended a dinner with a Spanish theme and made this recipe. I thought it sounded horrible (rum with wine? wine with OJ? Yuck) but I wanted to do something authentic. It was a huge, huge hit. Even the beer drinking guys wanted seconds of this. I did not cut it with any flavored sodas as some of the reviews said. I did use frozen cherries, blueberries, lemons and limes. I used merot wine and dark rum. I made two batches and everyone was dissapointed that it was all gone. I would highly recommend this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious - very strong

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WOW! I didn't think I would like this because I don't like sweet drinks but it really wasn't all that sweet. I did use 1 1/2 bottles of wine (because I had one open). My guests loved this and declared it the best sangria they ever had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a bridal shower and used the suggested Blackberry Merlot rather than just red wine. It was great! It tasted like sprite with a kick! The guests did not know that it had rum(spiced) in it. They soon found out after it hit them! It was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect just the way it is! I did add some halved strawberries and black cherries, but that's just me. Would make this again in a heartbeat.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great basic recipe. With these changes, I have never served it to anyone who doesn't like it. I use a bottle of blackberry merlot rather than dry red wine. I sometimes add half rum and half apricot brandy. I ALWAYS add peaches, strawberries, Kiwi, and sometime grapes to the citrus. Everyone loves scooping those up and eating them after they get to the bottom of the sangria. Don't skip on soaking the fruit in the rum and sugar for 2 hrs, and stir it up a couple of times during that 2 hrs.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Took this to a Sangria Tasting Party and it won. It's an awesome recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe i have been using for years and people pretty much lick the pitcher clean! I just made this for Labor Day weekend to take to the beach and my boyfriend drank more of it than I do and he hates wine!! I usually bring either 7-up or Sierra Mist to cut down on the strength because it is STRONG!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Incredible! I followed everyone else's advice and cut down on the rum a bit, and diluted it just a bit with club soda. I used Cabernet Sauvingon and it was fabulous. Great recipe, total hit with everyone!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had the girls over....WE LOVED it....ease up on the rhum though...it is powerful.... 1 cup is enough....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good recipe. Made it when a friend from out of town came. Plenty for 4 of us, we had it the next day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Unreal! I have made this several times making my own adjustments each time, and it's always a winner. Just about any fruit works well, and I buy the cheapest wine possible and it's still great. I always get compliments when I make it and if you use the amount of rum called for in the recipe, look out! It'll sneak up on you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely wonderful! Reminded me of when I was in Spain. I think next time, though, I might cut back a little on the rum. Either I'm a lightweight or that's pretty powerful stuff. The flavors were fantastic, though!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree with some of the reviewers about using spiced rum (Captain Morgan's) - it adds a unique flavor. I have served this at two parties and both times it was gone before all of the guests had even arrived.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe twice, and it is really great. It's much, much better than the sangria that restaurants serve. Blackberry merlot, as suggested, works well, as does 750 mL of 80-proof rum (gold or dark rum).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Keeper!!! Refreshing and addictive summer drink! I too followed advice of others and used blackberry merlot...delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A huge hit with my boyfriend! I used a little more Captin Morgan than what was called for (to make it a little stronger) and added more citrus fruits (orange, pineapple). A wonderful summertime drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Sangria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME RECIPE!! Use kiwis, strawberries, blueberries, and oranges for fruit. Used 3/4 cup of spiced rum which was the perfect amount.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!! This is such a good dish! I thought it sounded good just by reading the recipe and by reading the reviews from other users...but it was even better than I had expected. I am not much of a cooker and found this dish very easy to make. My husband went nuts about it and is already asking me to make it again! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a hit! To save time, I juiced the orange, lime and lemon, skipping the floating fruit and 2 hour "flavor development" phase entirely. To save my liver, I cut the rum content in half. Finally, we served the sangria in tall, ice filled glasses, continually refilling the ice. This makes for the perfect summer, out on the deck drink! Yum yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great summertime drink! I brought it over by a friend's and we sat outside in the sun, listening to the oldies, and sippin' on this Sangria. It was just perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great summertime drink! I brought it over by a friend's and we sat outside in the sun, listening to the oldies, and sippin' on this Sangria. It was just perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Next time I would add less sugar, but still really good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria was wonderful. I added a little more sugar just because I prefer added sweetness. But I will definitely file this recipe and use it often!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY VERY GOOD RECIPE!! Big hit here tonight. :) I will definitely be serving this alot. I used all the fruit this called for plus lots of strawberries. We used the blackberry wine. I only had 3/4 cup of rum in the house..but it was still very strong that way. SO we added some sprite to the pitcher as well. Very good combo!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this with Splenda instead of sugar. It's fantastic! I cut the rum to a splish more than half of the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good even though it was quite potent. I made it for a 4th of July barbecue and all the guests loved it. I typically don't serve Sangria over ice but found it worked well with this recipe since the ice made it a little less strong. I also added some Sprite for those that were overwhelmed by the rum. I tried one batch with inexpensive wine and another with mid-price and the cheaper stuff was better. Very festive and the chopped apple I added was mmm, mmm good! Good recipe! I highly recommend it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: wow - was this strong!! i took the advice of others and cut back on the rum just a bit...delicious just the same....i will make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Classic sangria at its best. I threw a big party and made 50 servings of this and it went fast. For the wine, I used the Charles Shaw Shiraz from Trader Joes - at $2 a bottle, it makes it an economically feasible party drink. I figured if you're going to add sugar and orange juice to wine, you shouldn't bother with the expensive stuff. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good. A nice treat in the summer time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it!! I followed the recipe exactly and it was great! Will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum - packs a punch though. Only change i made was 1 cup rum, and 1/2 cup orange liquer. Definately a keeper.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you, this was a great hit at a party I had to give. I used some of the the other reviews and used the spiced rum and blackberry wine. I also added apples, peaches, and strawberries. I made a double batch and there was none left over, everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good! You gotta try this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME! I served this at a dinner party and everyone loved it! I used Lambrusco wine and soaked pineapple, red grapes, limes, and oranges in the rum & sugar mix for a day and a half. Nummy!!! Will make again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is awesome. I've made it twice, with rave reviews both times. The first time I made a single recipe for a superbowl party. It finished in fifteen minutes. The second time I doubled the recipe for a baby shower, and it was gone in a few hours. Next time, I'll have to quadruple the recipe, and then we'll see.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! Made it for Christmas dinner and it was gone in a flash.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was expecting clear sangria. It wasn't. I used Chlien Merlot, vitamin OJ, and dri-light rum. OJ wasn't crystal clear. Wrong wine too??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and SO easy!!! My parents enjoyed it too. Not overly sweet either. I used Lambrusco. Will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My friends love this recipe and it's easy to make. My only caution is that you may want to reduce the rum as the drink is strong but deceptive. I always caution people against eating too much of the fruit also. It's only fun when you know how much you are drinking!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a bridal shower and it didn't go over too well. I think it was just way too strong. Next time I'll dilute the wine with a clear soda of some kind. I used burgundy wine and only 1 cup of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this recipe twice, and both times, I've been asked for the recipe! Some of the folks did add some ginger ale, and said it was great like that too. Easy - both in the making, and in the going down! Will make again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this exactly like the recipe said (ok- a little less rum) and it turned out fabulous. Since it packs quite the punch my dinner party got off to a roaring start and just continued going on that way!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, and such a beautiful presentation in a clear glass pitcher! I'm not much of a wine drinker, though, so I diluted it with giner ale. (And as a side note, it was not as good the next day; it seemed to have become bitter.) Thanks, Lisa!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! My favorite on cold winter nights! Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had to dilute it with 7-UP. Guests complained about the strength. I guess we're sissies...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Exceptionally good...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Incredible! I served this for Christmas brunch in a punch bowl and it was a hit! I am serving again tonight for New Years.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! I first tried this for July 4th and I haven't stopped getting requests to bring it to functions! I use blackberry wine and in addition to the citrus, I throw in sliced strawberries and peaches. Be careful...It's easy to drink a lot of this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just got back from Seville and this was so close to the real thing...Two glasses will have you GOOD for the rest of the night. Start out with less rum-- you can always add more later.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just got back from Seville and this was so close to the real thing...Two glasses will have you GOOD for the rest of the night. Start out with less rum-- you can always add more later.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a fantastic recipe! Easy and a big hit with everyone! But be careful... this sangria is so delicious your guests will have a very good time ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely the best Sangria I've ever had! Will make this every summer. Wherever I take it I'm asked for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a perfect sangria recipe. Without changing a thing, it tasted delicious (and it packs QUITE the punch). I mixed some with ginger ale and it was good, but everyone preferred the classic version. Also, the rum-soaked citrus fruits are perfect for cooking with chicken. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum, and really easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used the blackberry merlot and changed the fruits to rasperries, strawberries & grapes because I prefer berries in my sangria. It was a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Blackberry Merlot, Spiced Rum and added a little Triple Sec. I also added lots of fruit that I soaked in spiced rum and sugar for 24 hours. I made this in a punch bowl and used an "ice ring" made from sprite. It was a big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My guests dont appreciate the dry wines I like, so I decided to try this Sangria...everyone loved it! Next time will have to do a double-batch! Thanks, and... Salud!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I made this for a party and there was not a drop left. Everyone keeps calling for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Sangria!!! After reading the reviews I decreased the amount of rum to 1 cup, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I made this for my friends and they all loved it. They kept saying it was strong and downing one glass after another. When it was all gone they wanted more. I will definately make this again, but probably use a little more sugar or a different wine (I don't usually drink wine, so this was missing just a bit of sweetness for my taste).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! I made a triple-batch and took it to the lake in a huge rubber-maid sealed container. I only used strawberries and oranges - the fruits I knew most people liked. I also used a big bottle of Macaroni Grill Chianti wine - it's less than $6 but tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for my girlfriends surprise party, everyone loved it and had seconds. Made a double batch and left it overnight and it was gone in no time. I'm definitely going to make this again. Blackcurrant Merlot and Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum is the way to go! I only put a 1/4 cup of sugar and that was sweet enough.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Everyone LOVED it. Went through a double batch in no time. I wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made the recipe with 1/3 C of sugar, and it was still too sweet. If I follow this recipe again I will try less than 1/4 C sugar and 1/2 C orange juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: My first try at Sangria & everyone loves it!I have a friend that lived in Chile and she was insisting that the rum would ruin it,well she makes this Sangria now over the one she got from Chile.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A huge hit, although I lemons, limes, apples & pears, soaked in the sugar-rum mix overnight, and then added extra rum to taste when mixing. I use spiced rum, and it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe. I used the spiced rum and the suggested fruit. It's a very strong drink, so I had extra orange juice that my guest added themselves. Also, I should have doubled it since it went quickly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this at our 4th of July party, & it was a hit! I loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! Lots of requests for the recipe. Used the Blackberry Merlot, Capt. Morgan's Spiced Rum, and tons of fruit. I also cut out the Sprite. I soaked the fruit for two days. Huge hit at the 4th of July picnic. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Taking the advice of reviewers I cut the sugar down to 1/3 cup. I also added Honeydew melon balls and strawberries. This stuff was great and a big hit. I'll definately be making it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! I used white rum and will spiced next time.......I used only a cup of rum and was glad I didn't use the full dose! (this is a sneaky brew, all right!) I am also going to try cutting the sugar a bit but adding the lemon-lime pop. I think I would like the tickle of carbonation. Perfect addition to our 4th of July backyard picnic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! My boyfriend really loved it, he said it was the best Sangria he had ever tasted--better than his mom's! I will be making this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a HUGE hit at parties! It turned a little bit too sweet for me, so I use 1/4 cup of sugar. Thanks for the great Sangria recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first attempt at sangria and definitely not my last! The recipe was a big hit, but only after I had to add several cups of Sprite. Without the Sprite, this was just entirely too strong. Still, once the minor adjustment was made, I'd say this is a wonderful recipe (and my guests would say so, too!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We went to Portugal on our honeymoon and this sangria recipe comes pretty close! It brought back great memories. We put in some mint leaves and it was delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I read the reviews and went with the Blackberry Merlot and cut the white sugar in half. I made a triple batch, but only used a fifth of Bacardi white rum. I also soaked the fruit for 2 days, turning it twice a day to make sure it all got nice and soaked. Nectarines, Lemons, Limes, Apples, Oranges, Strawberries were what I used. Next time, much more strawberries and maybe 1 lemon and more oranges. I thougt of using Orange flavored rum and cut out all the white sugar, but thought I should just change one thing at a time. Wonderful, the fruit and drink was gone in no time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We loved this version of sangria. I followed the suggestions & used both the Capt. Morgan's spiced rum & the blackberry merlot. We didn't bother with the sprite, but would have if guests wanted it. I used lots of fruits (the suggested and peaches, grapes, strawberries, pears). The remaining "happy fruit" in the bottom of the empty pitcher was a bonus! Not a piece was left!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Used Captain Morgans with Roja wine. Was a little strong, but after the first glass I didn't notice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT! I ADDED STRAWBERRIES, PINEAPPLE, OJ, PINEAPPLE JUICE, AND A SPLASH OF SPRITE. I HAD TO MAKE 3 MORE BATCHES OF IT THROUGHOUT THE PARTY. IT'S GREAT, BUT IT WILL SNEAK UP ON YOU. THANKS FOR THE GREAT RECIPE.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe and very easy to make!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had to make another batch in the middle of the party!! Even the "beer drinking" guys loved it! Will defintely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first attempt at Sangria. I took the advice of others and used Blackberry Merlot, as well as spiced rum. I topped each serving with Sprite, and it was fantastic! When the Sangria was gone, I filled the pitcher with the remaining Sprite, so it could "soak up" the juices left in the fruit. It was a more "mellow" drink, which was needed after finishing the pitcher of Sangria. Thanks so much for this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good as well, but I changed the recipe a bit. I used a 1.5 liter bottle of wine, 2 cups of rum, 1 cup of sugar, and 2 cups of OJ. My grandma even went wild over it. I also soaked strawberrys, pineapple, and marschino cherries in equal amounts of OJ and Rum overnight and that was very, very good as well. I did not add the fruit to the sangria, I put it in a seperate bowl so people could pick out what they wanted. It worked out well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: A good use of homemade wine, I added a little more juice (1/4 c. apple juice) and a variety of cut up fruit in the mixture - strawbs, cut grapes, kiwis - once discovered at a huge family dinner...GONE.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best I've had since I sat at the cafe on La Calle Princesa in Madrid.. I plan on serving this all summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's perfect. It's simple. A party favorite. If you want to splurge use Captain Morgan Private Stock Spiced Rum with a tad bit more orange juice...you'll never know what hit you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not the best I've had but the neighbors enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This mixture was pretty potent! It had a really good flavor but I added some (about 3/4 cup to the pitcher) Sprite to cut the bite down a little bit. Great spring BBQ drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is now my staple for parties. I use Captain Morgans for the rum and lots of fruit, apples & pears. Yes they do soak up the rum but mmmmm are they delicious. People love my "happy apples".

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We've made this for a couple of parties, and it's always a big hit! very refreshing for summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent! A great way to use up a cheap bottle of red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!!!Used Wild Vines Blackberry Merlot,and no sugar,to make it a little less intoxicating.Strawberries were a great addition,you'll be tempted to eat all the fruit at the bottom!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY NICE- a nice alternative to all that citrus is to use rum-soaked halved strawberries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had to add a lot more orange juice, but I think it was my own fault...the rum I had on hand was 151 proof - I think I should have cut the amount in half! It tasted like pure alcohol!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome!! I decreased the sugar to 1/4 cup because I'm not fond of really sweet drinks. I was in a rush, so I didn't get to chill it, but adding an ice cube or two to a glass was just perfect. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: pretty good, though not the BEST. my friend has the BEST sangria recipe, but he won't share it with me!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a fabulous recipe!! I have shared with many friends. It was easy to make, and everyone enjoyed it. Careful though. It tastes like fruit juice, but you feel the effects of the alcohol later. Great to make for large parties.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: WAY GOOD!!! Apples worked just fine. Also works well with brandy instead of rum. I have made this several times with various fruits {the produce kind as well as my friends}and every time was awesome! Thanks! Erin

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: followed recipe to a T. Way too strong. Put in a cup of 7up and more sugar, still not well recieved

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipie is so easy and never fails to get compliments at our parties. A definite keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: watch out... this is strong stuff! maybe try less rum...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for a tapas themed party with friends from college. I thought this was a killer sangria and enjoyed it thoroughly. My friends were overwhelmed by the rum -- fortunately, you can add rum to taste for your guests. Buy smaller oranges and other fruits to fit in the pitcher. This is a great recipe! I'll make it again for sure; so easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: OH MY!! This was fabulous! I used the spiced rum and along with the citrus I added some plum slices. If you desire a less potent Sangria cut the rum in half. The flavor is still wonderful. Freeze orange juice in ice cube trays and add a cube to each individual serving. YUM

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: over labor day weekend i made 4 batchs, everybody raved about it, great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great!! Big hit at mexican-themed party we recently held. I think there were only about 6 of us drinking it, and we went through almost 3 batches! Went down nice and smooth, as long as it's cold!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good, but extremly strong. Will use less rum next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: a wonderful recipe. i added lots of different types of fruit. i loved it as is, but i made this for my family and they had to add lots of sprite because it was so strong and a little extra sugar too. i recommend trying it as the recipe says and adjust to your own taste once it's finished.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Deceptively intoxicating, but extraordinarily good. We used the white rum, and chilled the fruit mixture overnight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! I made this for a "girls gathering" and it was a big hit. A little goes a long way...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made 2 pitchers and brought to a pig roast! My brother drank 1 pitcher by himself!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous! I made a lot of this for a family party and everyone loved it. I served it out of a punch bowl and it looked very festive and tasted great. Next time I would like to cut the fruit into half slices and maybe add some different fruits - apples or cherries for color. Thanks for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Took this to the beach and served over ice. All of my friends loved it. We all will make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a double batch for my husband's 50th birthday party and didn't have a drop left. Used spiced rum and made ice rings from fruit and Sprite (so they wouldn't dilute it). Fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
