cocktail_reviews.Review: Thanks for this recipe! It was Yummy - very strong, though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Having made different versions of Sangria, I found this to be one of the very best recipes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe exactly for Cinco De Mayo and it was very good. My husband and I really enjoyed this and would definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sangria recipe is really really really good!!!!! Next time we'll use a little more rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: ABSOLUTELY MARVELOUS!!!!!!! I used spiced rum and followed the rest of the recipe to a 'T'. This is wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made this for a party - everyone loved it! Just beware that this beverage is very potent - or you might just be wearing the fruit slices as earrings!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a wonderful sangria recipe. I used Bacardi's spiced rum and decreased the fum amount to 1 cup. A glass punch bowl worked great for presentation. I also added a few large ice cubes to keep the sangria chilled. Your guests will love this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good fruity drink, next time I would like to add apples. Would be great with paella or mexican food.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This tasted great! I've never had Sangria but my "Sangria expert" guest said it was perfect. I doubled the recipe for a party of 12 and put it in a punch bowl and it made for a great presentation. Tasted very nice and looked good. Just make sure you stir it whenever you are walking by after mixing all the ingredients to dissolve all the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great taste. A little strong. I added less rum the second time, and a little more sugar, too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used the recommended ingredients and it came out yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow, thanks guys for all the great reviews (this is Lisa, I lost that old password). I submitted this recipe almost 2 years ago, and it'e evolved since then. I've cut back the rum, added a bit of Triple Sec, and substituted Splenda for the sugar, and I use fresh pineapple, some pineapple juice with the orange, and strawberries now, too. (I still don't like apples!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This was soo great! I used Bacardi White Spiced Rum and a spicy dry red wine. I served it in a glass pitcher and so it was not only yummy but beautiful on the table. This was the perfect touch to my dinner party and I am so glad I came across this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was such an easy recipe! I did add 1 cup sugar and used 1/2 brandy along with the 1 cup of rum. I also filled glasses 3/4 way and topped it off with 7-up. It was too strong without it for our tastes.....Love this drink!!!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: This worked perfectly with a Mexican themed meal I recently prepared. My guests really enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this with the Spanish paella recipe and they were both big hits at my dinner party. Plus I only had about 1/3 cup orange juice so I used 100% grape juice to make up the difference. The sangria was still very nice. Highly recommended.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: We did not have enough time to prepare this recipe as indicated and it still tasted great! We intend to try it again the right way as we are sure it will be even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Spanish Sangria
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super simple--any bottle of "cheap red wine" will work, and we loved it with Spiced Rum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: We let it stand overnight in the fridge without ice and Soda. This intensified the flavours. Added them both right before serving at the table. Absolutely delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quick, simple and delicious. We add a 1/4 cup of Coconut Rum to it as well, for a bit more of a tropical hint.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect. It was a big hit for a summer birthday party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made for a large group so we followed the recipe x 4 and kept the mix in a pitcher and added club soda to the glass. It definitely reminded us of our beach vacations by the pool

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too much sugar. I would recommend 1/4 to 1/3 cup. Other than that they are a hit. Paires with chicken fajitas... yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and wonderful

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe. A nice change from so-sweet margaritas. The only thing I'd did differently is use my KitchenAid mixer to do the muddling! You'll need to cover the mixer head with a cup towel while muddling the lines or juice will go everywhere. Pour the ice and run in and stir. Pour all into a pitcher and serve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed exactly, delicious & perfect amount! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Take your time muddling the mint and sugar, it’s worth it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! I only added 1/4 cup of white sugar though and it was still pretty sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good base but I’d do 1 1/2 to 2 cups rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a family lunch and it was AMAZING. I used sugar-free Strawberry soda instead of club soda and it was so good. The combination of Strawberry, Lime, and Mint was the key. Oh, and I also used Malibu Coconut Rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good. The only thing I would say is don't leave the limes in the pitcher too long or they will make your drink bitter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous as written, exactly what I was looking for! This recipe didn't specify what kind of rum to use but other mojito recipes used white rum so I did as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these yesterday, because I had a few girlfriends coming over for an afternoon get together. They were absolutely delicious! Not too sweet and very refreshing. A perfect summertime drink. We polished off the pitcher in a couple of hours, and I received many compliments. I followed the recipe exactly, except that the only white rum I had on hand was infused with lemon, but that seemed to work out just fine. This is now going to be my go-to make-ahead cocktail for casual summer gatherings.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and easy to prepare.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe—great proportion recommendations, especially in regards to the amount of mint. I must admit, however, that I doubled the amount of alcohol to two cups and did not find it overpowering. Some may think there is too much sugar, in which case they can just use a little less than recommended. However, considering it makes an entire pitcher, one 1/2 cup is not an overwhelming amount of sugar. Additionally, the steps could be a little revamped; I find the mint flavour (Canadian here) is absorbed better when it is ground up with the juice of the limes in addition to the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go-to recipe for mojitos, so easy and delicious! I always double the recipe and after pouring into glass I will top off with a little lemon-lime soda, not much. Everyone loves these, even anti-mojito drinkers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’ve been looking for a recipe to make a whole batch of mojitos and this was perfect! It was just like the traditional mojito recipe I’ve always made but so much easier to make a whole pitcher at once rather than one at a time. The only downfall is that I ended up having to make 3 1/2 batches because they were such a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great! I didn’t have club soda, so I substituted Sprite Zero. I had to cut the sugar back by 1/2 to accommodate the sub.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: We enjoyed the drink we need to use less mint

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: DELICIOUS!!!!!!Better with the raw sugar in my opinion

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! Everyone loved including me and I am not a mojito person!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used tonic water instead. wonderful refreshing drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I want to make this but need to buy the Rum. Do I buy the light or the dark rum?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy - the only problem is that it really doesn’t make enough. I’ve made them a few times now and I almost always omit the rum (my parents don’t drink) and add some extra club soda. I make two pitchers (at least) with fresh mint from my garden a few hours before company comes, and then let them chill in the fridge until serving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Saved for my son and he and everyone at his party sent cheers,he added a little more lime in the other pitchers he made.They were all very happy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I decided to juice most of the limes because I feared too much rind would make the drink bitter tasting.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe to a T, and it is fantastic! Thank you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and delicious. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought the proportions were perfect but the steps needed some tweaking. For me it worked better muddling the mint (I used 6 whole sprigs) with the sugar and the juice of 2 limes. I cut the third lime into wedges, and gave them a squeeze before tossing them in. Then added the rum and seltzer and stirred.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a group of friends at the cottage and it was a hit! I used sprite for a base, and added more rum, lime juice, and sprite just to polish off ingredients. It was still a bit too sweet for some. It would still be good with less sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is sooo good! We used 1/3 cup sugar since we don't like drinks too sweet and it was perfect! Wish I had one right now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was pretty good, a little too sweet for me. Next time I will do about half the sugar and a little more liquor. It was also better the next day. I recommend making it the day prior to drinking

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! I used McCracken dark spiced rum and muddled sweet mint, chocolate mint, peppermint and spearmint leaves from my mojito/tea mint pot. Next time I will make with. 5 to. 75 cup sugar because I like a little less sweet mojito. So much easier than asking by the glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful recipe, easy, refreshing and a lot easier to make for a crowd. We enjoyed these immensely and will make them again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super simple, very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as written first then made the second pitcher with raw demerara sugar, and added extra rum. Both were a delicious hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for my friends. Unsurprisingly, I nailed it. Surprisingly, however, my friends found the process laborious and the drink tasteless. If i were to go back, I would change everything. I will be recommending this to my friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this just as the recipe says, for our supper group, and everyone loved it! Wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was about to slam this because of how sweet it is, but realized my limes were still sitting on the counter. Its very tasty once the limes were added.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Refreshing and easy to make! I have used vodka when out of rum and it was good. I accidentally used oriental apple flavored vodka before and it was surprisingly very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: refreshing and delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Recipe was right on. The only changes i made were just a little less sugar and a little more rum. Cheers!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great easy recipe for 3 to 4 people. Everyone loves it. I added an extra 1/2 cup of rum -could probably add more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it. Delicious and refreshing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't drink mojitos but we hosted a party for my husbands boss and he requested mojitos. I followed the recipe and everone said it came out outstanding! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was way too sweet for my tastes. The sugar overwhelmed the lime and mint. Next time I will cut the sugar by 1/3 or 1/2.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did a 1/3 cup sugar to cut the sweet. Very tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito recipe. My husband did a big thumbs up

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito recipe. My husband did a big thumbs up

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simply delicious and easy recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Also my first attempt at making mojitos... I used the coconut Bacardi Rum instead and it was an instant hit!! Everyone loved it, definitely making this one again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had to modify it a bit to fit my pitcher and I don't usually keep club soda on hand. 36 mint leaves 3 limes 1 cup simple sugar 2 cups water Add water or alcohol as needed to taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes great. I followed the recipe but didn't use as much lime or mint as directed, although I did quarter 2 limes and halved and juiced 1 more and dropped it in the mix - used maybe 20-25 leaves. I recommend not muddling the mint in the sugar too hard because it shreds the mint into tiny bits that get stuck all over your mouth. I also used some rum in my sugar and mint to rinse out the bowl and then pour into the pitcher. Happy drinking all!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. Made it on two occasions and will definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this 3 times. Can always use more lime and mint. If you don't have a muddler, try a potato masher. Works wonderfully!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and delicious! I doubled the recipe for a neighborhood bbq and they were fantastic. If you make ahead add the club soda when pouring into glasses to keep it bubbly as club soda goes flat quickly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I bought some half gallon mason jars and made this recipe. I brought 3 jars to a Bbq and they were gone in a flash! Half gallon serves about 5-6 give or take (depending on cup size).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe. I added a little less sugar on the second pitcher.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good and easy recipe. Would not change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! For my diabetic bf I subbed Truvia for half the sugar and used Zaya rum, and it was delicious! Probably tastes even better with all sugar. Because I had to pack it to our outdoor activity in 100 degree weather, I made the mix minus the club soda the night before, then mixed it by the glass. That worked quite well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super Yummy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good stuff right here! I used Bacardi Limon Rum and doubled the recipe which made almost a gallon. Make ahead and take with you to an event for EASY Mojitos!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is soooo good. I doubled it and used mango Bacardi rum. Everyone raved about it and wanted the recipe. it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like club soda much better than lemon-lime soda, it cuts the sweetness. I also make simple syrup and keep in fridge but if you are making it 'by the glass' this recipe can't be beat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the BEST Mojito I've every made. A question though, can the club soda be replaced with champagne? Thank you for sharing your recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just right! Also good with a few added raspberries

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Every year when the weather warms up, we have a Cuban party. I made another recipe the first year (I had a by the glass recipe), and between making mojitos and the Cuban sandwiches, I spent all my time in the kitchen. I found this recipe last year, and I simplified my life. I doubled the recipe so to fit our 2 liter pitcher, and muddled the mint and sugar ahead of time, enough for four pitchers. I really do prefer the actual sugar as opposed to the simple syrup recipes, and this one is just perfect. Take my advice and make them ahead if you are serving a crowd. You won't regret it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Completely delicious and simple!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple easy recipe.The Mojitos came out great! Not too sweet, and very refreshing over ice on a hot summer evening. It's definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome mojito's! I'm one of those people who wasn't a huge fan of mojito's...the "squeeze", however, loves them! So happy I found this recipe as now we both enjoy when we make up a pitcher! I made the recipe exactly as posted.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Mojito recipe I've tried :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best mojito recipe I have tried. I like the club soda instead of lemon lime soda because they aren't too sweet and I can make it easily with my Soda Stream. I used raw sugar instead of white sugar. The perfect pitcher on a hot Florida day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe, easy and pretty consistent. It only fills 6 servings if using small glasses though. For tall glasses, you'll want to make a couple pitchers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome Recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first attempt on making a mojito and after all the sites I went to I finally gave up and just picked this one. It's amazing I haven't had a mojito this good in a while. It's easy quick and delicious. I used 1 1/2 cups of captain Morgan white rum. Good stuff :D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Big Batch Freezer Dirty Martini
cocktail_reviews.Review: This great for a party! Make ahead and be ahead of the game!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Needed more junk pickled stuff lol But very good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I add a 1/2 cup of pickle juice and 2 limes. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too much salt. Next time I try it I will start with a pinch of sea salt and go up from there until it has the right balance. Also, I like mine spicy so I added much more hot sauce.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not the best but very good. I always use Sacramento tomato juice and celery salt and a squeeze of lemon or lime.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these occasionally after a long day at work. They are very good and I really enjoy them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's really good. But I substituted a pickle for the olives since I am allergic

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just needed a basic Bloody Mary recipe... made this one exactly as written... perfect! Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good starter. Added my own Cajun seasoning (instead of salt), lime juice, horseradish, and a tiny bit of soy sauce.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Zing-Zang instead of tomato juice. And used Demitris bacon rim shot (its a spiced rim salt). Super simple, Super delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and you can switch up ingredients, I used regular v8 this last time,everyone enjoyed it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was exactly the type of Bloody Mary I wanted. Classic and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used original V8.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: My go to Bloody Mary recipe. I use just plain tomato juice instead of v8 (because I hate v8) but keep everything else the same.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a bit of Tajín for extra spice and lime juice. Came out grate.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: nice one

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were great. After sampling these, I'd made a pitcher, we doubled the vodka. I also served it with a slice of crisp bacon. I got rave reviews and they looked so great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: We liked this! It's a basic recipe, so don't expect anything more from it, but we like basic sometimes, so it worked for us!Thanks for sharing. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: 3.2.18 This is a good starting point, but doesn’t represent what I think is a really good Bloody Mary. For the most part, it just tasted like Spicy V-8 Juice, and it definitely needed more heat for me. I added a little horseradish, a little beef broth, more worcestershire, a healthy squeeze of lime juice, and additional Tabasco. I have a favorite Bloody Mary recipe on this site, and although this was OK, I think I’ll just stick with that one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: New to bloody marys but this just tasted like spicy V-8. I added more Worcester sauce and that helped but I won't do this recipe again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a bit more hot sauce and extra olives and it was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made the bloody mary mix but since I don't like vodka I used beer instead and made bloody bulls. They turned out excellent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband and I made him one of these. He threw in some oilves, peppercinis and horseradish. He thought it was pretty darn good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice, simple bloody mary recipe. Had to use what I had on hand, which meant regular V8 juice instead of spicy. I just added a couple extra dashes of hot sauce. Perfect cure for a hangover. Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum plus add pickled onions!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too salty

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Rim it with Celery Salt and use Clamato Juice instead of Tomato Juice, and you will have a Canadian Caesar!!! Give it a try! Eh?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used 1.5 oz vodka, 1 small can spicy v8, the Worcestershire and Tabasco sauces and topped it off with reduced sodium v8. Shaken with ice cubes and strained into a highball glass filled with ice. Much less sodium and easy to assemble.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY NICE! I always made pitchers of these and it was nice to just make one (or two) of these just for me. This will be my go to,recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tried it per the recipe, very good. Second pitcher added Sriracha in place of Tabasco, a dash of celery salt and 1/2 teaspoon of lime juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: A good basic start to a Bloody Mary, but for us it needed to be kicked up a notch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe for a classic drink. Obviously people have different takes on types of vegetable juice to use or what kind of vodka is best.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good Start, Missing Horseradish ;-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a Bloody Mary mix, and substituted black olives for the green olives.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This worked out very nice! I used a dash of celery salt and quite a bit more hot sauce but the taste was right on. Thanks for posting this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a very good recipe,though might I add the following ingredients.I add a Tbls.of juice from a jar of dill pickles, plus a dash of celery salt.Wonderful tasting Bloody Mary.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: not enough flavor...add to tweek a lot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good, reliable formula for a basic Bloody Mary, just waiting for your own personal spin and additions, whether it's horseradish, Clamato, steak seasoning, lemon pepper, Old Bay or beef broth, any number of which we've tried. On this occasion we merely substituted celery salt for the sea salt and threw in a couple of spears of pickled asparagus.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!! I just added a splash of lemon juice. It made all the flavors pop more. Definitely a keeper!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink - however I added some horseradish to mine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for brunch and it was very good. Only change I made was that I did not add the olives.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was my first time mixing a Bloody Mary, and it tastes just like the one I ordered @ a restaurant a few weeks ago...very tasty :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the same way we make it at work except we use celery salt around the rim of the glass and I like extra olives...it is delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Bloody Mary
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a pitcher of these. Used a 46oz. of vegetable juice, 1 cup; and a couple of splashes of Vodka, and celery seed. And the rest of the seasonings to taste. [I'd say close to a Tbls.] Very good recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: We added extra strawberries and it was delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought it was good,added whipped topping.And more rum of coarse.Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled the lime juice accidentally the first time, it was good either way!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this refreshing drink on a hot summer day. Did not have any lemon or lime juice but found it just as refreshing we're simply strawberries a little sugar and rum. Delicious and will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made exactly as directed (yes, even the 6 cups of ice) and these are fantastic! If you measure out the frozen strawberries as indicated (about 6 strawberries weighed), you need the ice because it’s not enough on it’s own. One could certainly double or triple the strawberry amount to reduce the sugar and ice amount, but I tried this recipe exactly as written and it’s wonderfully spot on. Tastes just like it would at a restaurant. I will be making these again. Thx for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it so delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added a little whip cream, extra strawberries and cut down the granulated sugar by 1/4 cup. Fantastic and delicious. Thank you for whoever made this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Kids and adults alike loved this - made without the rum for everyone.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used 1/3 cup sugar. Cooked down the strawberries a little while melting the sugar making a mixture. Then allow that to completely chill before mixing the rest. Make sure everything is cold as can be before blending. Add banana for extra flavor!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as directed but without the lemon/lime carbonated drink and it was excellent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! it feels like the number of servings is wrong though. They would be small servings. I scale down to 2 servings for one not very big drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used fresh strawberries instead and it was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Far too much rum. Had to add double everything else to make up for it. Other than that, the ingredients listed made a great daiquiri

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is indeed the best recipe I've ever found. I do, however make a couple of adjustments. 1. I use about 1 lb of strawberries (4 oz is way too little), and 2... I like to add about 1/4 cup of "silver" whiskey, which balances the sweetness very nicely (and adds little more of the booze kick).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used all lemon juice since we didn't have any limes and also doubled the strawberries and it was delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a couple changes. Way less ice, 1/4 cup of sugar, a little bit less lemon juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe but a little too tart for me. I melted the sugar with the lime juice on top of my stove in a small saucepan took about 5 minutes, let it cool, while I was loading the other ingredients in blender. I used frozen berries which I let thaw, no soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so yummy! I'm making it again tonight! I subbed the sugar for agave. Was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!! Not too sweet or overpowering. Refreshing and easy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: so good, better then the restaurants.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it!!! I felt it needed extra rum so added a full cup to it. That did the trick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made with fresh squeezed juice and strawberries - delicious! My husband and I enjoyed thesse on a hot summer night - We forgot to add the lemon-lime soda at first sip, took it to the next level when added.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Didn’t add lemon or the soda came out delish

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummylicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this exactly as stated by the recipe. The lemon juice and lime juice were overpowering. The strawberry seemed to only provide coloring. If you like a lemon lime daquiri then this is great. I didn't not like this at all. The consistency of the daquiri was perfect though. It wasn't too thick or too watery.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think the fault was in me and not the recipe. I only had frozen strawberries and quickly found that had to be defrosted before my blender would blend. Then the strawberries were the sourest I've ever tasted. Going to try this again but with fresh strawberries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is SO DELICIOUS!!! Hubby made a sour face, but I loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent but we added more rum and more strawberries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Most amazing recipe! It's so delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the recipe with the only change being use of coconut/pineapple seltzer water in place of the lemon/lime drink. The drink was fabulous. For the second batch I added a banana to the strawberry and it was also delicious. When I used the base recipe again I substituted the lemon with a freshly squeezed orange and still added the lime. This recipe is very versatile and all combinations I have made have been raved about by my party guests!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out great, I love the lime taste! I made 2 servings, about 16 oz. It was the perfect amount for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had company from the U.K. And a gallon bag of fresh/frozen strawberries. I made this cocktail for us in a flash. He was so impressed with how good the drink is, he can't wait to go home and share the recipe. I eye balled the measurements and it was fine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The strawberry daiquiris were a hit. Everyone loved them. I followed the recipe exactly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!!!!!! Big hit

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: So, the first time ever, I followed the recipe to the tee, and...not so good. Way too much citrus favor, and not sweet enough. I'm going to do it again, as I am on a quest to making the perfect daiquiri. I didn't read the reviews prior to making this, so I'll take some of the suggestions as well, and let you know hoe it comes out.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: It came out amazing!!! I made it without the alcohol for the family. Kids loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made the recipe as is (I always do before changes) and loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add 1/2 cup daiquiri mix (Daily's)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as written, I give this recipe 4 stars. Next time I make this, I am going to increase the amount of strawberries to at least 5 ounces and I'm going to make a simple syrup with the lime juice, lemon juice and sugar to make sure the sugar is completely dissolved. I blended it for quite a while last time and I still had sugar at the bottom of my glass. I also left out the lemon-lime soda - it didn't seem right to add it - unless you are leaving out the rum, then I would add it in. As far as taste, this was just as good as, if not better than any daiquiri I've ever ordered out... so good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Main thing is, reverse the amount of frozen strawberris with ice, so it will actually have a strawberry flavor. I used sweetened Roses Lime juice (and no lemon), and Agave syrup instead of sugar. Delicious, and actually tastes like strawberry. Oh, I used a whole cup of Rum! No soda...ugh!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect mix

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I also made some changes... Definitely reduced the sugar by half! Love the lemon in addition to the lime, it adds another layer of tropical flavors! Yum. ??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum!! Made these last night and everyone loved them. Used fresh strawberries right from the field as that's what I had on hand. Also didn't have lime juice but they were still terrific.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used fresh strawberries which were chilled but otherwise followed the recipe. Loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Swapped the rum for dissarano!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice sweet and tart balance. I was out of any sort of lemon-lime soda so I substituted Gran Marnier.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't like sour so I used half lemon juice and it was still too sour. But...still very yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used peaches instead of strawberries. No lime juice (out) but added spiced rum along with Bacardi. Yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Grabbed the first recipe that popped up in a search for 'strawberry daquiri.' I used a combination of sweetened key lime juice concentrate and fresh-squeezed lemon juice with frozen strawberries and a splash of diet 7-Up added to the blender at the last moment.. It was the perfect consistency and flavor.. Just enough tartness to stand up to the sweetness of the strawberries & sugar. I am saving this recipe for future use, it's amazing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just the right amount of liquor and tasted great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! Used agave instead of sugar and tropical frozen fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was REALLY hard to make. It didn't say to crush the ice, and I like it with much more soda and lemon juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: And who makes this without rum?! That's ludicrous! I wouldn't change a thing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this recipe was great! I've made it twice. The second time I only had about 2 cups of ice so I added more strawberry and it turned out great! I used lemon-lime seltzer water for the carbonated beverage and highly recommend it. My boyfriend thought that the sugar was too gritty the first time so we blended just the sugar and the liquids together first before adding the frozen ingredients

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a smaller batch of these, and ended up doubling the amount of strawberries and rum, and using superfine sugar instead of table sugar. Other than that, kept everything the same. Really delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good, but too much lemon/lime.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty base, although we altered it to a point where some might say I ought not review... Anyhow, we made virgin daiquiris using a total of 1 cup of lemon lime soda, 1/3 cup of standard granulated sugar, 1/4 c of lime juice, 8 ounces of frozen strawberries and 4 1/2 cups of ice/ Great change of pace to accompany dinner.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The whole family loves this recipe! We prepare it without alcohol so the kids can enjoy it as well, then add a little vodka (instead of rum) to our individual adult glasses. We've tried many other recipes lately, but keep coming back to this one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This gets rave reviews every time I make it! And it doesn't matter whether I use fresh-squeezed lemons/limes or use the pre-squeezed juice in bottles or whether I use fresh or frozen strawberries. The only thing that really makes a difference is using powdered sugar rather than regular, since the regular doesn't dissolve or distribute evenly. I'm also liberal with what 4 oz. of strawberries means to me. I've tried this with raspberries, too, and am looking forward to trying it with mangos. Mmmmm! Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is indeed the best strawberry daiquiri I've ever had! I used fresh strawberries, fresh lemon/lime juice and orange-flavored sparkling water ('cause I didn't have any lemon-lime soda) and a tiny bit of peppermint oil. Garnished with a spring of mint and a lime slice. OMG and don't drink it too fast...I got two or three brain freezes before I slowed down! LOL

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use 151 rum with my recipe, which really gives the daiquiri a nice kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: For those that want more of a strawberry flavor, omit lemon and lime juice and add some strawberry liqueur. (Don't use strawberry schnapps!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty delicious. This is the only daiquiri recipe I've ever made, so I don't have much to compare it too. I don't know if all of the ingredients are necessary, like both the lime and lemon juices. I've only ever made it with Captain Morgan, not Malibu. And I add significantly more rum than called for.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used 1/2 the recipe and replaced fresh strawberries for a whole banana. Amazing. Hint: Bananas are best over ripe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful daiquiri recipe! A perfect balance of berry, citrus, and rum. Usually I fiddle with recipes after the first try, but with this one, there's no need.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I will definitely make this again. I read the reviews and doubled the strawberries and reduced th lime/lemon juice - 1 tblspn. lime juice, 2 tblspn lemon juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!! I just made a "tester" of this, because I have a picky wife and wasn't sure how it was taste...but WOW!!!!! Absolutely amazing...only thing I changed was I added a little grenadine syrup, more because we like the flavour of it than anything else, lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: soo good, but I made some changes, 4 fresh strawberries, sprite, 2 spoon of sugar. it was just enough for one person.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: We loved this! Best homemade drink we've had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: We used 1/2 Stevia and 1/2 sugar, didn't put in the lemon-lime soda, and used fresh strawberries. Also we used less ice (mostly because our blender was maxed out). Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: it was okay. not really enough strawberry flavor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect recipe! Big hit at an all girls get together I had recently. I used frozen whole strawberries, I did make a simple syrup and used 1/2 c of that, sweet and sour mix (I had it so I used it), and but the blender on slushie. Everyone loved them and if too sweet, added a squeeze of lime into the individuals glass to suit their taste :-) Make some non-alcoholic ones tonight for our Sunday movie night! Thanks for this recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I opted out of the lime & lemon juice and just used a lime&lemon carbonated soda I had on hand. Decreased the ice to 4 cubes since my strawberries were already frozen solid through. Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quick simple and easy. It is a great recipe that works with other fruit as well. I tried it with peaches and it was awsome.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: it tastes more like a strawberry margarita than a daiquiri. too much lime flavoring. wasn't good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: verry lemony

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my friend's birthday party, another friend made Vodka crush, everyone thought the Vodka crush was great until they tried my Daiquiris. After that everyone put the crush down and never touched it again. My small party of 5 insisted I make 3 more batches and raved about it all over facebook. This cocktail is an epic win ;D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very delicious. I used a liberal amount of fresh strawberries - almost an entire carton as they are very cheap in-season. I also mistakenly bought frozen limeade concentrate instead of soda. When I made the limeade up, it worked fine. My friend who is not much of a drinker requested additional rum. We almost doubled the amount of rum (bottoms up!), and the drink still masked the flavor very well. I would HIGHLY recommend, but I would also highly recommend buying FRESH strawberries for this drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm giving this less than 5 stars, because I'm mildy and don't think I made it right. I 'eye-balled' the ice (how do you measure ice anyway?) and felt there was much too much ice. I also cracked my blender and half the ingredients came out and I re-did it. And my blender really sucks and is old. But despite all that, my frosty concoction turned out pretty good! It could use more strawberry taste, but if I didn't put in so much ice... :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty. I did cut down the amount of lemon and lime for my own personal preference. I also cut down the amount of alcohol. Do not let the cocktail fool you, even with a little less alcohol this packs a punch and it's so delicious you won't realize the amount of alcohol you're consuming!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: mmm

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: i followed the suggestion about fresh strawberries and i added alittle extra ice and some fruit concentrate that was made specially for daiquiri. It came out wonderfully. ^_^

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great little daiquiri recipe! I made 2 pitchers, one for the kids and one for the grown ups :) Didn't have to change anything so...bonus!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were really good and went down so easily! I didn't follow the measurements exactly, but it was probably close. I used Coconut Rum instead of regular and oh my goodness! I highly recommend you try it that way. It was the perfect amount of sweetness for me, without adding any sugar. Will definitely make them again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a great recipe! I was attracted to it for it's use of fresh lemon and lime juice. I doubled the amount of strawberries and made in 2 batches. This will is surely a recipe I will use again and again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been using this recipe for several years now and for the New Year we are turning to it again. I really love the simplicity of it and its comes out nice and smooth, not too fruity.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent taste and so fresh tasting. liked the fact that you really couldn't taste the rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good drink-followed direction exactly and was refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are great! I only had fresh strawberries, and I think I used more than the recipe called for...I also did not have lime juice. Instead of Sprite I used a strawberry flavored calorie free sparkling water, which I highly recommend! I wasn't going to add it at all but without the liquid my blender couldn't handle it. Excellent strawberry flavor :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Drink was okay. A little more hassle to make than other good rum drinks, due to having to use the blender.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: amazing just enought of everything!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful! I made it in 2 half batches (like others suggested.) I even made one using peaches instead of strawberries. It was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was delicious!!! I accidently added 1/2 cup of 7up but it was still great!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was a huge hit during ladies night....I used about 1/2 a cup of rum and a 1/4 cup of coconut rum...it was awesome...great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: very intriguing a little strong on the rum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked this recipe. I was looking for something to make with rum other than Mojitos, but I only had strawberries. Well, this was perfect! Changes: I tripled the strawberries (fresh) and next time I will decrease the sugar since the strawberries have their own natural sugar. All I had was club soda, which worked out great! But I LOVE club soda. I also used fresh lime juice and a little more rum than called for :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The absolute BEST Recipe for Strawberry Daquiri I have EVER had! FABUOUS!!! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best strawberry daiquiri I've ever had! I made it for me and my best friend and we couldn't get enough! LOVED IT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did this the recipe way , except I added sugar substitute and only made 2 servings ) via calculator) which filled a taller glass..Loved it!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was okay. I used fresh strawberries, def needs more strawberries, 4 oz was barely any. I liked the lemon/lime juice flavor. I might try this again w/ double the berries.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good recipe--I've made it several times. I always add a little extra lemon-lime soda for a bit more sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicous recipe, except do not use the soda, and use more strawberries and ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added more strawberries, but otherwise kept it the same. Delicious! In a normal size blender, you'll need to make it two batches.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: So good! My husband made as is for round one, but for round two doubled the amount of strawberries giving it an even better strawberry flavor!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used banana flavored rum...turned out awesome for anyone who likes strawberry banana flavored anything. I highly recommend it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so refreshing......with or without the rum

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quite tasty. We like a sour kick. I used 3 c. of fresh strawberries, Key West Lime juice and fresh lime juice, juice of two fresh lemons and zest from the lemon and the lime. Myers Rum gives a nice flavor. Must say I am enjoying it. Refreshing on this 90 degree day. I omitted the carbonated soda. It's not necessary. The soda would enhance a nonalcoholic version. Alas, we are lushes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a party this was a hit! Both men and women loved it. They commented that it wasn't that sweet and it didnt give them a stomach ache. I did try to save calories and used splenda instead of sugar and diet soda. I had to half the recipe because it didnt fit in my blender, but i used the same 4 oz of strawberries and 3/4 cup alcohol. I also put 4 fresh strawberries in each batch. The boys drank it with jack daniels, girls had canadian club.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent, wouldn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband made these for a demonstration speech he had to give for a class and everyone loved them, minus the alcohal of course.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my goodness; I made these for cinco de mayo and they were wonderful. Made exactly as directed. So much better than mix. I bought a bag of ice at the store for easier preparation and was glad. Thank you

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used fresh strawberries and left out the lemon lime soda since I didn't have any and these turned out pretty good. Next time I would use a little less ice and maybe more stawberries. I also saw another recipe that used triple sec... I think this is a fantastic basic recipe that you can tweak to your own liking.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is excellent. I agree with using fresh strawberries. I also added 1/4 cup of Peach Schnapps for a little change up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: There doesn't seem to be enough strawberries in this recipe. Okay recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good but not amazing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY GOOD!!! I did not use the lemon juice or the lime juice. I am going to use diet soda and splenda next time to cut some calories!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: this really is the best strawberry daiquiri! This was great. I only made half the recipe each time so it would fit in the blender. I probably used double the amount of strawberries and along with the sugar I added in some grenadine for extra sweetness. It really was great! I honestly couldnt taste any of the lemon lime soda in it, so if you dont have that ingredient it may be fine not to use it. This will be the way I make strawberry daiquiris from now on! No more of that nasty strawberry bottled mix. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: yum! used less sugar then recipe calls for and it was just as good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so good!! Me and my 5 year old mixed them up together. We scooped her out a glass before I added the rum. She loved it and so did I! They are wonderful!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good! we enjoyed these a lot. I poured the liquids in before the ice because we have an old crummy blender. It wouldnt take more than 4 cups of ice but they were delightful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! This is a great cocktail if you don't care for a strong alcohol taste. I subbed club soda for the lemon-lime soda. I rimmed the glass with granulated sugar. I recommend sweetening the drink with simple syrup or superfine sugar, as the regular granulated sugar can be a little gritty. Use extra soda instead of rum for a refreshing mocktail. My kids love to drink these (without the rum, of course) in a fancy glass rimmed with sugar and garnished with a lime wedge. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUUUMMMMMY, even my friend who doesn't like alcohol enjoyed this blend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good. I added a few extra strawberries to it (I only had fresh ones) to bump up the flavour. My husband loved them, he thought they were better than the canned version!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used fresh strawberries....and tried the recommendation to blend up my sugar since I could not find my superfine sugar....i ended up adding confectioner's sugar...yummm!!! Did not add the carbonated bev...the strawberries, rum and sugar were enough! (I think I would have overflowed the blender if I had done so...)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't like beer or wine so my husband makes these for me! We make them virgin for the kids, then add the rum at the end for the grown-ups. We always use some fresh and some frozen strawberries. I think he estimates the quantities according to taste, but does use this basic recipe every time. We need to come up with another name for them, though, because the kids have started telling people about how they love drinking strawberry daiquiris!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband wanted something with frozen strawberries and white rum so I told him to look up daiquiris. He ended up making this recipe scaled for 4. I know he didn't measure the strawberries so he needed to add more liquid. Instead of using lemon lime carbonated sode we used fresca and he ended up using the entire can. It was wonderful! We'll make it again, especially with the fresca.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy and super tasty. They could use a little more rum than what the recipe calls for, though. They almost tasted virgin.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used key lime juice instead of lime juice to give it tartness. Next time I'll cut back on the ice--it seemed to be too watery. Not bad as written; but needs to be tweaked. Even with my changes, something is till lacking, but I'm not exactly sure what...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Daiquiri! loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fruity, refreshing, delicious! What more could anybody ask for? We made it with rum, but I bet it would have been incredible even without it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fruity and tasty! I made this with Lemon Bacardi.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this for a couples dinner party and everyone said it was the best they have ever had. We added a bit more rum than called for, used fresh squeezed lemon and lime juice and superfine sugar. The sour taste was great compared to your typical super sweet daquiri mix from the store. We will certainly make this again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Was absolutely great! I do suggest doing the 20 second thing in the blender with the sugar. Just think how much money you save by making these yourself.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it. Added a banana the second time we made it, that was great, too! This is our boat drink of choice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these for a get together with the girls at work and we loved them. They are not too sweet, which I really liked. The only thing I didn't like was that you could easily drink a lot of these and not remember the rum!!! (Maybe that it is not so bad!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did w/o the rum and it was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was perfect! The only change I might recommend is to use crushed ice rather than cubes. This took our Osterizer out for a ride, but the drinks were well worth the hassle!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone agreed it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I enjoyed the daiquiris. Made them with fresh strawberries and they tasted wonderful.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good! I omitted the lemon and lime juice because I thought that would make it too sour. I used coconut flavored rum and that made it have a very "tropical" feel. I will make many more batches of it this summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe. Easy to prepare, I had to purchase a new blender, for a rookie like me. Can't wait for Summer and a big picture of Frozen Strawberry Daiquiris on the deck.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: made it without the rum and it tasted delicious! just like it would ordering at a resturant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome. We make it without the alcohol, and we love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I found this while looking for something else and I'm in love! I love this recipe. I thought it would be too much ice but it turned out perfect. I put a couple extra strawberries in but the lemon and lime contrast is perfect. Mine was a little thick to pour at first but I highly recommend this recipe. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perhaps due to our inferior blender or not, but either way, the ice was too much for the blending and I had to cut down on the amount. Also left out the soda, and put in a wee bit more strawberries. Loved the touch of lime and lemon, though! Would definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent - Even without the rum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the receipe and took the reviewer's advice to cut back just a little on the lemon and lime juice - these are the Best Strawberry Daiquiri's. I used Barcardi's Rum and won't change a thing for the next batch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really really good. My husband and daughter (she had a virgin one w/me, since I'm pregnant) want me to make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I find that a strawberry daiquiri will always turn out better using fresh strawberries and superfine sugar. Using superfine sugar will disolve instantly. If you have a good blender, blend granulated sugar (alone in the blender) for a good 20-30 seconds and you'll get your own superfine sugar. The rum quantity was great. I would leave out the carbonated beverage, though, because it takes away from the strawberry flavour.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these for a bunch of 40+ women at my little sister's 40th birthday party and they were a huge hit. I try to avoid sugar so I used fresh strawberries I cut up the night before and sweetened with Splenda and because I forgot to buy lemon juice I used a sugar free lemonade mix in place of the lemon juice. The girls loved them, thanks for a great drink recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: i followed the other reviews and i didnt use as much of the lemon and lime. but it was really good will definatly make this a permanant recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you make this recipe you will probably find that it is a little too sour. Needs to cut back on the lemon and lime juice. Overall a fun drink to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good, but quite tart. I added extra strawberries. MMMmm.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made some changes ... but who doesn't? 1/2 cup sugar sounded too much, so I decreased 1/4 cup. Used a combination of Roses lime juice and fresh lime juice. Instead of lemon juice, substituted prepared orange juice. Be sure to blend this long enough to give sugar time to dissolve. Fantastic cocktail. My husband and I enjoyed a pitcher of these, congratulating ourselves for the $$ we saved, rather than ordering one after another in a bar!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Made them for a girls' night and everyone wanted the recipe. Great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were awesome! I cut the recipe in half and finished these off all by myself! Sometimes I have a hard time making a blended drink taste as good as those I get at a restaurant. Not these, they were great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is a little strong with the rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe has some definite potential! It was tasty, but just too sour for my tastes. I'll make it again, but with less lemon and lime juice. The consistency was just right, and the pinky hue made it fun to drink .I made it without rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Strawberry Daiquiris!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Kids love it obviously without the alcohol. My husband and I love it with Citrus Bacardi and Citra soda. This is a terrific recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too much cream unless your the owner of the bar . Its too much remember cream coats your tongue and hides flavor thus why Gelato has more intense flavors than ice cream because very little cream flavors come through . Gelato uses way less of the flavorings yet still more intense for reason stated . Same recipe table spoon "splash" or personally I use to add 1/2 shot of baileys ... skip the cream except,.. I am doing Keto

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: The few I mixed were complimented

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mmm, smooth and delicious. I doubled the cream as I'm not much of an alcohol drinker. This classic certainly smooths out a rough day. One and done and very happy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: My new favorite drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this! Nice and smooth!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too strong!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had forgotten how good these are. My preference is for 1 part each of vodka, Kahlua, and milk over ice. One of my guests found that a bit strong and preferred to double the milk.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't care for this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Takes me to back in the day of my youth.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use 3 tsp. vodka, 3 tsp. kaluha, pour over ice in a tall glass and then add milk. Yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my favourite drink. Best vodka I've used for it is Russian Standard vodka. Smooth and refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use sweetened black coffee left over from my breakfast brew (made from fresh ground coffee of course) in place of the Kahlua with full fat or UHT milk rather than cream and good quality Vodka (Targovishte Special). Personally I go easy on the "Kahlua", heavy on the Vodka! The Dude would approve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really wanted to try this but didn't have the coffee liqueur. I used regular coffee with creamer in addition to the milk and it was the best!! Can't wait to try with the coffee liqueur!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: easy on the cream... the recipe should be two parts vodka, 1 part coffee liqueur, and a splash of heavy cream. The recipe as is, is pretty much just a glass of milk.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Try it with whipped cream vodka instead. It will blow your mind!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been drinking White Russian's for 20 years. This was too strong for me. I guess I am a weakling :) I prefer 2-3 times more Kahulua for more flavor. It cuts the the strong Vodka taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time ever to make a white russian. Creamy goodness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: A good standard recipe! This is also good if you replace the coffee liqueur with Irish cream.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for my husband tonight. Our version is a "Coked Out White Russian." We used cinnamon spice Kahlua and cola vodka (Three Olives). Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Tasty! Better with a little more kahlua in it though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quite tasty! Sipping this now over ice. I did make mine with a squirt of chocolate syrup, and light Silk coconut milk, as that's what I had in the fridge. Added a touch more Kahlua as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: VERY GOOD! I've never tried using milk until now! I love it! In my 2nd one I added alittle extra Kahlua ONLY because I love that extra flavor. Follow it exactly and it is GREAT! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: mmm very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Would not change a thing! Tried it out and it tastes great as is! (used half and half)

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Try with vanilla flavored vodka. Amazing! I was also a bartender for a few months and have put a splash of coke in it. It makes the flavors kind of pop. Its really unexplainable but very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for drinking while watching "The Big Lebowski." However, I prefer mine with 1 oz vodka to 1 1/2 oz kahlua. Very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: super good! This was my first time ever having a white russian and I likey!! I made them just a tad stronger and used cream. i think next time I'll try them with milk, because the cream was pretty heavy (but tasty!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is probably my favorite drink of all time. Although i love the original way to make it. i use vanilla vodka instead of just regular. it gives it a little bit of a sweeter taste but doesn't ruin the O.G. white russian.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is excellent. I remember in my day I would fix it with a little peppermint schnaps. It was my version of a Peppermint Patty. It was delicious and decadent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: The proportions are perfect in this recipe, provided you use GOOD vodka. If you are above the age of 40, you have probably found a premium vodka you can enjoy straight, or over ice. Use this one! However, if you are in your early 20's and it's more of a challenge just to see how much of the cheapest liquor available you CAN possibly drink and still get up the next day, , then you will definitely want to adjust up the measures of Coffee Liqueur and Cream. I was 20 once. I remember. I'm 45 now and I drink premium liquor at a much slower pace!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: The vodka helps cut the sweetness of the Kahlua. But I only put in a splash of fat free half and half. Half a cup seemed like alot. I like the Frozen Mudslide better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was ok.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I got a margarita machine for Christmas and we used it to make this drink for our New Years Eve guests. Talk about a coffee milk shake!! YUM! I had a bad experience with Black Russians many moons ago so I no drink the coffee flavored liquors, but I did have a taste and OMG was it ever delish! BTW, fat free half and half works really well with this. Thank you!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I adore a good White Russian..I like it with milk instead of cream and a splash (literally a splash) of Coke on top...makes it taste like chocolate milk. Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love love love these. So much better with cream and you have to use Kahlua. I could drink these everyday.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved every one of em!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I guess I will have to tell on myself here! I have gulped down more White Russians in my day than I probably should mention! I think they taste better with a double dose of the Kahlua, and are much tastier when half and half is used in place of milk. And just the other day when I discovered I had ran out of half and half, I topped one off with Irish Cream liqueur. It was the best one I had ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yumm! I'd definately use the Starbucks coffee liquer. A great drink that can double as a dessert.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always use skim milk with these, so that way I don't feel as bad about having a second one. Serve it super cold, and you don't miss the cream.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is absolutely delicious! skim milk was all i had on hand and it still came out wonderful

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hmm...not bad. I had a white Russian once in my time and that was about 4 or 5 years ago and it was the premixed stuff you can buy and I hated it. I thought I'd give it another try tonight and it tastes good. I used 1% milk.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: very tasty!! used half & half instead of cream. put in a shaker with ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe for White Russians. Not too strong. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great! Just like they serve in a restaurant or bar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good and really easy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
