cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, though a littel strong! I only had skim milk, and whipping cream in the fridge, so I used a oz of whipping cream, and topped up the glass with milk. Very tasty

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: You've gotta love something that tastes so good. I don't drink coffee but there something about a White Russian. Yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: White Russian is possibly the best drink in the world. After making about two dozen I decided that the best proportion is 2 Tbsps vodka, 3 Tbsp Coffee Liqueur, 3 Tbsp cream(lightly beaten, or you can use shaker if you have one), 3 Tbsp milk + lots of ice And don't forget the straw!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: HINT! SWITCH OUT THE KAHLUA FOR STARBUCKS COFFEE LIQUEUR! IT IS 40 PROOF AND MADE FROM 100% REAL STARBUCKS HOUSEBLEND COFFEE! IT MAKES KAHLUA TASTE REALLY BAD!!! TRY IT!!!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: Godd drink. Another one of my favorites. But be careful how much Kaluha you put in. It can be a doozy! All around pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: simple and easy good and fun great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: White Russian
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are good with a half shot more kahlua than vodka, rather than equal parts as this recipe calls for. Also, I always use milk, because I always have it on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe was great! I substituted the lemon lime soda for Hawaiian Punch this time and it was phenomenal

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: My daiquiri needed more ice because it was watery, but it tasted good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I absolutely love this! I made it for "happy hour" with my daughter. The first batch I made as the recipe said except I used lime flavored carbonated water and it was a little too sweet for me. So when I made again I only used an 1/8 cup of sugar and that was perfect. Thank you for sharing your recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: i added a bit more sugar and ginger ale soda , i also used more strawberries that were frozen fresh. The flavor was pretty nice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: really refreshing when its hot outside and good flavor

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think it was a little bit to sweet but other than that it's GREAT!??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is AMAZING!! I used a little extra lemon juice to add a little tang to it, but other than that it is perfect! Depending on your taste you may want to use a little less sugar. But this is my absolute favorite drink for summer time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious just needed a few more pieces of ice. other than that, amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: My Girl Scout troop made these for a Frozen Slumber Party and absolutely loved them!! The only adjustment I made was using frozen strawberries because I freeze my own and keep them on had.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made my first one according to the recipe and found it to be way too sweet for my tastes. I used very sweet strawberries and found that it needed way more strawiberries for my taste, as well. My second one I increased the strawberries to six and reduced the sugar to one tablespoon. I used Sprite Zero for the soda. Although my strawberries were very ripe, I did not get the nice red color like some of the photos depict. The second one suited my tastes much better,and I would probably rate my second one a four. Thanks for sharing this recipe, Helena W.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: fantastic. I do it almost every week now I love it so much. It is simple ad great when added whipped cream and a cherry ;) other recipes had too much fake flavoring but this was perfect. I made it for a group of five and everyone enjoyed it (it helps to add Bacardi).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't drink alcohol, and I've only had a virgin strawberry daiquiri once. With that said, I really liked this drink. I had a lot of strawberries to use and found this recipe. It's cool and refreshing. After making it according to the recipe and tasting it, I did throw in a few extra strawberries (mine were quite small) and 5 extra ice cubes to get a slushier consistency. *****The next time I made this, I used Splenda and Diet 7-Up. It's just as good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this one night in hopes of having a cold, refreshing drink outside, but instead I got this. It had the consistency and sweetness of powdered kool-aid. There is way too much sugar and way too little ice. If I were you I would disregard this recipe immediately, unless of course, you like feeling light-headed from a sugar overdose. Never try this drink, it is like drinking syrup!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best drink i have ever tasted. I omited the sugar so it was a little sour but delicious. I also used frozen strawberries. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Almost everyone who gave this recipe a good review changed stuff...so I don't think it should have been given such a good review. I had to add way more ice, at least 3 more strawberries, and more lemon. Partly I think that there was way too much sugar. But also, freeze this when you're done, no matter how cold your products are. If you freeze it partly for a couple hours then blend it, it is slushy. Also, I think lime would be a nice touch, and I will try that next time. This recipe was an okay template, but I definitely changed the proportions.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have not yet tasted this, but the picture looks yummy. I am however, going to pour this into a red solo cup and that's fancy for these here parts. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: this doesnt taste much like a daiquiri but i think it has good flavor. i replaced the lemon juice for lemonaid and it ws really good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!!!! Five stars!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe as a stating place, as I didn't have everything on the list. I used a fruit punch flavored soda, mixed frozen fruit (strawberries,peaches, and raspberries), lemon juice, and ice. No sugar. I didn't really measure it myself, but what I came up with was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this three times following the recipe exactly and each time the drink turned out a watery pale pink and it separated immediately

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I made it with the Magic Bullet©. It came out really well and I have enjoyed it many times with friends. The amount of sugar was too much for some of my friends so I varied it and it was still great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Instead of using lemonlime soda I just used lemon juice. It was good you should try it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Would get easily 5 stars but I made adjustments... I'm preggers & this was EXACTLY what I was craving. 1/4 c. of sugar makes it way too sweet, so just use 1/8 c. sugar & add more if you need to. 5 strawberries makes it more fruity. I went easy on the lemon juice too, more can be added at the end if needed. YAY for a recipe that makes 1 drink! I've been craving fruit so much and will probably go through my carton of strawberries just making these every night. Big plans for adding other fruits to it too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: The BEST drink I have ever made! I used 5 mediunm sized strawberries and half of a banana and it was amazing! Definitely will make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM! For a six-serving size, I used about 15 large frozen strawberries, the same sugar, ice, & lemon juice listed, and one, 12-ounce can of grapefruit soda/pop. My hubby and son loved it!!! It helps that I have a brand new mixer that makes very fine crushed ice! Who needs alcohol in their drink?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a large batch and I used frozen raspberrys and Lemon soda from my sodastream

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this exactly as written and I thought it was great! Slightly tart but plenty sweet. I love the bubbles on top. I left my drink for 1 hour while I dipped in the pool and when I got out it still had bubbles!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not the best recipe ever, but still good. I used frozen strawberries, and only put in about 1 T. sugar. Not "strawberry-ee" enough...so be sure to add MANY more...maybe like 6 or 7? Not bad for a refreshing beverage, but just needs to be added to.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: just o.k.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! We used frozen strawberries, left out the sugar altogether and used a limited edition specialty 7-UP that had Pomegranate in it. I'll make these again for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: i used this recipe as a "base" and adjusted it to fit our taste. i replaced the lemon-lime soda with pear juice (that was the only thing i had in the pantry..i imagine any mild-tasting juice would taste good too) and replaced the lemon juice with freshly-squeezed orange juice. with extra ice, my family said it was the best virgin strawberry daiquiri ever!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has an OK taste, but it is not really a daiquiri. You should replace the lemon lime soda with strawberry daiquiri mix and I would definitely add more fresh strawberries in the recipe. The sugar is not necessary for a daiquiri and should be left out completely and the lemon juice should be replaced with orange juice. You may also want a few more ice cubes to get a daiquiri like consistency. Also, this does not make a very large serving, so you may want to double all ingredients.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe . Amazing taste

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am sure this recipe is great with lime, unfortunately, I only had lemons! It was delicious substituting one lemon for the two limes. We also used diet 7-up instead of club soda. Refreshing & light. Perfect on a hot day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way to go, Jolene! This is excellent! The first time I made it, I followed the directions exactly, hubby said it was too sweet. So afterwards, I’ve modified it.....I’ve cut the sugar to half and added Patron lime liqueur. For our taste buds-perfection! Also a great way to use the mint running rampant in my garden! Thanks again for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: 5 stars for this.!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it. Didn’t make any changes

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Like most reviewers I halved the amount of sugar and skipped sugaring the rim of our glasses. I also sliced the strawberries, no need to puree them like some people suggested, and muddied them thoroughly with the lime juice, mint, and sugar. I also used 1 1/2 cups of rum and 3 cups of club soda but left the ratios of everything else the same and let the pitcher rest in the fridge for about 30 minutes. We still got great flavor and then when we made the second pitcher using the lime, mint and strawberry bits left while adding new mint, strawberry, and lime on top. Like other reviewers said, you can totally do this with other berries or cucumber.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe!!! Used only half the sugar and was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing!!! So so good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these and doubled the strawberries. Used 1/4 of the sugar. SOOOO GOOD!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe -made this with Malibu Rum and it didn't need the sugar -only added apprx 1 tbsp to recipe and rimmed glasses with lime and sugar. It was a hit :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these just as written except for half the sugar suggested for my girlfriend and I for cocktails before dinner. We both had two and they were wonderful. Not to sweet and very refreshing on a warm night. fyi don't forget that bruised mint :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will definitely halve the sugar next time as suggested! I didn't have club soda, but was able to substitute with San Pellegrino just fine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Needed a bit more sugar but fun. And a hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I substitued fresh rasberries for strawberry's and honey for sugar turned out fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome summer drink. Only change I make is to use half the sugar - otherwise it's too sweet. You can substitute other summer fruits for the strawberries - great with peaches too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great. I used 1 cup of 1:1 simple syrup instead of the sugar and everyone loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow -- Adding a juicy fresh strawberry to an already perfect fresh mint mojito is just the ticket for a summer cocktail. As a few others have done, I ditched the sugar and replaced with Splenda. Use 2 packs per glass. Upped the lime a bit, added more fresh mint leaves, and 1 large strawberry per glass. You really need to muddle the mint, limes & Splenda first, then muddle in the berry(ies). Totally yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this recipe several times and had to modify it after the first trial. Waaayy too much sugar according to the recipe. I cut the sugar down to half, as other reviewers suggested, and then it is perfect. I usually buy the strawberry Bacardi rum, but I've tried them with Coconut rum and lemon flavored Bacardi and it tastes good with any one of them. It really is a matter of personal preference.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great receipe. I used strawberry rum and lemon-lime (instead of club soda). Will use less sugar next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was an absolutely refreshing drink. A taste of sweet and sour all in one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! I subbed coconut rum instead of white, it turned out really good :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy & delicious! My guests loved this. Strawberries can be substituted with any other fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made recipe without the sugar-rimmed glasses. A nice change from traditional mojitos. Thanks, will be making again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe. We have made them twice for guest. The second time we cut the sugar in half as it was a little on the sweet side for our taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a few modifications: Less sugar since I used 7-up instead of club soda. I also used coconut flavored rum. Going to make this again for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wasn't as good as I hoped.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these for a summer bbq and they were fantastic! I like it sweet so I didn't mind the sugar. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! Sweet and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was excellent! Second time I make it I used truvia baking sugar mix, and it was just as Yummy! Making it for a Mother's day gathering.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are dangerously good!!! My sister and I love them and they're a hit at any party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe was very good! but only once I added 4 times the amount of club soda, hehe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect and refreshing for a hot summer day in the Florida sun. I added some guanbaba pulp (soursop), and it was a huge hit. Also, I took advantage of the key lime tree in my yard to add a little tartness to the mojitos.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG!! These were wonderful! I made them for a party and had to keep making pitchers of them because they were such a hit. I did put a few mint leaves, strawberrries and lime in the blender to speed up the processes and it turned out great! My dad - who hardly drinks - had 4 because they were so wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy, best mixed drink I've ever made, but I did follow the advice of other reviewers and used half the sugar. I also used raw sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe...but I kinda took a left turn with the directions though. :) I made a simple syrup out of 1/2 cup sugar, 1 1/2 cups lemon juice and 2 cups mashed strawberries - brought that to a boil, simmered for 3 minutes, removed from heat and strained through a cheesecloth and let cool. NOW...add 2 tbsp of the strawberry syrup to a glass, then add your mint and lime, muddle, add 1 shot of rum, top with Club Soda and ice cubes...and voila! Delish! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very delicious, and very much appreciated by friends at our backyard BBQ. I didn't measure out everything perfectly, but used this recipe as a guide for the ratios I should pour. I put the ingredients directly into a glass pitcher. I ripped apart the mint leaves so they were big enough that people wouldn't swallow, but not huge leaves floating around. I used lime juice instead of limes, although I if I make again, I'd prefer fresh limes. I also found that if I muddled the mint and sugar together first, then added strawberries and mashed them into the sugar and mint that the flavor was best. On one batch I forgot to mash the strawberries, I just threw them in with other ingredients and the loss of flavor was noticeable.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really yummy. Too much sugar in the original recipe. Made it with blueberries instead of strawberries. I think that you could experiment with many different summer berries. My friends loved the blueberry variant, but what can I say, they love anything sweet and alcoholic!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: New favorite way to tame the mint taking over my herb garden. Cut down on the sugar to half cup and added an extra strawberry. Yum........

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing and very refreshing! Only made one change and that was to decrease the sugar a lot. I used less than 1/2c ( maybe a little more than 1/4c.) for this recipe and used Ideal Sugar Substitiute instead of regular sugar. Fresh mint and fresh limes are key!!! Made this for our Memorial Day BBQ....delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe!! Perfect summer drink b/c it's light and fruity. I only added 1/2 a cup of white sugar and also added a 1/4 cup of simple syrup. Instead of white sugar to rim the glass with I used Williams-Sonoma's vanilla sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Brought this to a party and everyone loved it. I substituted Splenda Blend for the sugar. Should have used a little less - was still too sweet for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Its great I am drinking it Now 4 stars. However, I will strain it next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really good and I like the extra flavor the strawberries added but I still feel like this recipe was missing something... maybe I just like mojitos from a bar better for whatever reason.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Anything more than 1/2 cup of sugar is too much (for 8 servings). I also pureed the strawberries in a blender before adding. Good drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of my wife's favorites. Could use less sugar probably.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was awesome! I made these for a party and we all loved this. Based upon previous reviewers' comments, I only used 1/2 cup of sugar and it was perfect, not too sweet and just enough to allow the fruit and mint to macerate nicely to flavor the drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, I followed recipe adding one additional splash of rum. I guess you could omit the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good ingredients, just WAY too much sugar as written. If I make it again, I will cut the sugar in half. Also, I think it would be good to put the strawberries in a food processor so they aren't so chunky when drinking.

I substituted sugar for splenda and only put about 3 or 4 packets into the mixture and it still came out delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Strawberry Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use different ginger beers, but I’ve found that one of the cheaper ones - Citadelle - is one of the best and has a nice amount of carbonation. I tend to substitute bourbon (Kentucky Mule) or rye in place of the vodka. You can use any liquor, really. Mezcal mules are great, too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty darn tasty

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

It’s always better the next day and I can’t imagine it being any better than it already is. Be sure to make the roux dark as this is the secret to a good gumbo!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious! Made with Grey Goose, Gosling’s ginger beer, a squeeze of fresh lime and lots of ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! We had trouble finding ginger beer, so we made it with ginger ale instead. The colder the better! Goes down very easy! Best summer drink that doesn't require a blender!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so easy and go down too easy. For those who said they goofed and got hard ginger beer...the only one like that is Crabbies! That is good but, not for this drink. Haha!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use Crabby's alcoholic ginger beer, it adds just the right amount of ginger flavor. Very simple, very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy and very refreshing! Super easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: So. Good. I love lime juice and squeezed a whole lime into the drink (almost 2 oz), which is probably a horrible idea because now I'm going to continue gulping these down!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used raspberry ginger beer for a yummy change of taste

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a tad of maple syrup. My local bar makes a version using vanilla vodka, and maple liquor-I want to replicate if I can. Still very yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best recipe I have tried. Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it! Very refreshing! Great summer drink or anytime drink! Used a little less lime and put a slice of gringer in it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this as a "speciality" drink and gave them to guests as they arrived. All loved them and wanted the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: You don't have to chill the copper mugs, they'll get and keep cold when you fill them with ice cubes. I used the 1/2 cup (4 ounces) of Crabbie's Orginal Alcoholic Ginger Beer and all the other ingredients but added one more: 1 tsp of 'simple syrup' which I made by using a 1:1 ratio of water and sugar (1/4 cup water to 1/4 cup sugar or any equal amounts you choose) then microwaving in a glass bowl (NOT in the copper mugs!) and stirring it to dissolve the sugar. The left over simple syrup should be sealed tightly and refrigerated to be used for other recipes within a week. Adding the sugar makes this a 5-star recipe as it tempers the sour/acid of the lime a bit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect summertime cocktail!! It's refreshing and actually quenches your thirst. Just remember to drink in moderation and enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! What a difference in flavor depending on the brand of ginger beer, though!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: My new favorite drink! If you like a ginger beer with lots of bite try fever tree ginger beer. It has cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup. I also use the Tito's vodka.. it has a very smooth finish. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: To make the Teton Mule - that's higher in kick than a Moscow Mule, add 4 drops of bitters to the lime juice. High altitude kick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink. Even better out of a copper mug. Amazon has some nice ones.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful cocktail! I could only find Goya brand Jamaican style ginger beer, which is a bit spicy, but delightful. Rather than use fresh lime juice, I use Rose's Lime Juice, which is sweet, and float it on top. Served in my 30 year old roly poly copper tumblers! Awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I decided to make this after a friend introduced me to the drink last week. I used Seagrams Vodka and Reeds extra ginger brew. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used a great ginger beer, which think was most important to t he taste. Proportions of ingredients was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Warning! These are way, way too good. They go down so very smoothly. Use caution!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Diet Ginger Beer and it was still good. I bought a couple of cheap copper mugs just for this drink; which made it more fun.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: We used Smirnoff Vodka and Not Your Father's Ginger Ale. Wow, just wow. These were very tasty and VERY potent (probably due to the fact that I accidentally got hard ginger ale instead of ginger beer). The perfect recipe the new copper cups the hubs got for our 7th anniversary :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fresh and good

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added a little more lime and really enjoyed this cocktail served in copper mug

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I accidentally made it with rum...oops! But it was the clear kind, and it actually tastes pretty good. Can't wait to try it with vodka!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect icy cold summer drink! Probably pretty healthy too with the ginger, citrus lime, and no added sugar :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's good with blenheim ginger ale, if you don't have a ginger beer. I also enjoy it with Tito's vodka bc it has sweet finish and it's made in the US.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooo good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not QUITE as tasty in paper cups as in copper mugs, but still a pretty great way to end the work week and kick off a weekend. We used Bundaberg ginger beer. It's wodka (with a W, as my grandpa would say) with a kick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Favorite summer drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: The brand / quality of ginger beer makes a big difference. With a 'spicy' to balanced ginger beer, I like to add a splash of simple syrup. I really like Bundaberg, or Seattle's Rachel's Ginger Beer. You can skip the syrup if you pick a sweeter ginger brew. Fill your cocktail shaker with a handful of ice, pour in your favorite vodka, slice and squeeze the lime right in there, add the splash of simple syrup, and shake away. Pour the chilled / strained mix into your copper mug (but a glass timber can suffice), then top it with cold ginger beer and serve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Use premium Russian vodka, and there's your Moscow. Deliciously dangerous.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Moscow Mule Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good balance of sweet, sour, spicy (and boozy)! Watch out though...they go down too easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an amazing cocktail!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Review: I added more rum. My mint was picked fresh from my own plant . Added more mint. Used organic tonic water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Only change we made was to use 1 tsp of Splenda rather than 2 Tbsp sugar. Delish!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

I cut my lemons into four squeezable wedges, and squeezed two in per drink.
I also prefer adding the;
lime,
the syrup and the (not two tbsp, but 1 1/2 depending on preference
mint leaves first,
Club soda,
mix in shaker,
Than poured over ice

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Would add simple sugar to the two tbs white sugar as I think it could be sweeter

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty. Stuck close to recipe. No ice so I froze about 3 oz of club soda, still added more club soda. My twist was adding a few leaves of cilantro in addition to mint from my garden. Will definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this recipe for my wife who is a mojito snob and she was very happy with the taste. Good mint and lime flavor with the right amount of sweetness. This is a winner in our house.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I added blackberries for a nice little twist mmmmm

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty and easy to make. Refreshing summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I put two ounces of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good, but too sugary for me. Will use only 1tbsp next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

This is absolutely delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and wonderful. This is my favorite version of my favorite drink. This recipe is a definite keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a professional recipe that outperforms the great majority of Mojitos you’ll taste at establishments. Follow the recipe to a T. Great recipe to have in your repertoire.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe with simple syrup and with raw sugar granules and I actually loved the raw sugar taste better than simple syrup. Great recipe as is! Also recommend muddling some fresh berries or mango before adding the ice and club soda for variety!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simply superb

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I usually don't like mojitos but made this for a party because I had so much mint in the garden. It was delicious. I made simple syrup and used 2 TBSP instead of sugar, and the balance with the lime was excellent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like I remembered. Thanks

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time I have made Mojitos. Friends loved it. Made recipe as is...thank you Brandy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made these twice. The first time I poured the sugar straight in, but it pooled and barely dissolved no matter how slow i went or how much I stirred. Second time I added an extra step and made simple syrup which went a really long way and really made them perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. It tastes awesome.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe! Started making it and never look anywhere else.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: wonderful and simple recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely perfect. I only had tonic water at hand but it was still pretty delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooooo good! Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fresh tasting, crisp, delish

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is very yummy. I love peppermint, so I was drawn to try this drink, and I’m glad I did. I used 1oz rum because I don’t really like the taste of alcohol too much, since it’s a new taste for me. But after guzzling one drink and making another, well...we’ll see how I react, lol. It’s just so good! It’s sweet, but I like sweet. I also used a lemon for my 2nd drink due to no more lime, and it tastes good that way too. Also, I’ve learned to stir the mixture before adding ice, just so the sugar dissolves a little more. But there’s so much sugar that not all of it dissolving is okay.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I (accidentally) halved the sugar portion but thought the proportions on this recipe are perfect - it doesn't taste too much like rum, isn't overly sweet and has the perfect, balanced fragrance of mint and lime. Terrific.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very, very yummy. For me I switched out the sugar for trivia and cut amount in half, but my husband followed it exactly. Both were crazy good, his was a little sweeter. Our go to recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this drink exactly as the instructions stated and WOW!! I am not a big drinker, like a few times a year, so usually I find most alcoholic drinks tasting too strong for me. This however, was so delicious and hardly tasting like there was any alcohol in it. I can see how one could end up drinking the whole pitcher themselves!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very easy to make and it was so delicious. iuseCaptain Morgan’s White SPICED rum... I love this rum. It was the best Mojito I’ve ever had..Even better than in Ball and Chain in Little Havana, Miami.. And I love their Mojitos.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it with out ice cubes. Had to use vodka. Was good enough for my appreciation and taste. Used a quad shot glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: After trying several other recipes, this is the keeper. If any adjustments are needed, it could be the amount of mint, which would vary according to taste. But this recipe gives good balance of tartness, alcohol and sweetness.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really easy and tasty! I added a few thin slices of serrano peppers to the muddle for an extra kick. Even better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Its an absolutely refreshing and delicious I make it all the time. Its better when I make it a glass at a t ime..

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with a teaspoon of simple syrup instead of sugar. This recipe turned out great. I also used home grown mint, fresh limes, perrier and expensive rum. Im not sure how all of those things add up to a delicious mojito, but it did.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is by far my favorite Mojito. If you don’t have Bacardi, you can substitute with vodka and it’s also really good. Sometimes I use simple syrup instead of the sugar and it’s very sweet and addicting. Watch out! I want more and more

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my da

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my favorite mojito recipe :) the guys at Montana spirits and wine told me mojito is with vodka and looked at me strangely when I told them that’s not the recipe I am following but other people seem to say they like it better with this recipe. I went a little adventurous and rather than sugar I do stevia and I got an AHA lime+ watermelon seltzer rather than club soda. So good mom doesn’t drink and she said it was good. Little known fact you can substitute club soda for any seltzer so to make it really boozy one can simply add a Truly hard seltzer or a Bud Lifht seltzer I myself like the kiwi mango truly hard seltzer’s with this mojito :) thanks so much for the recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is greatly enhanced by using Squirt (grapefruit) soda. We add less than a teaspoon of sugar as the soda is already sweetened. Flor de Cana is also my preferred rum but they are all fine. Mojitos rock!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Superb! Very refreshing summer drink. We found we needed almost 3 T. of sugar to get it to our taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a Great Summer drink made with fresh mint from the yard and Lakanto Golden Monkfruit Sweetner! Zero Calories Zero Carbs and Zero Sugar it's an Awesome Summer Refresher!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect summer drink! I do use homemade simple syrup instead of just sugar as it mixes better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a delicious and very authentic mojito! I am personally not a fan of sweet cocktails, though, so I made mine with only 1 teaspoon of sugar. It came out perfectly, to my taste - but I can see how someone with more of a sweet tooth might prefer more. I also garnished mine with an extra sprig of mint. Love this, will be making it a lot this summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was great as written.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too much sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty and easy recipe. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very refreshing!!!! I used 3/4 sugar will try half next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I decided to make this for my hubby for Father's Day and he absolutely loved it. Like the other reviewers, I created a simple syrup first. IN the first batch, I put exactly 10 mint leaves per glass. In the 2nd batch, I upped the ante to 14 mint leaves per glass - and that is now my favorite version. Many thanks for this fantastic recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good but it doesn't specify what size glass. It needs a tall tea glass or less sugar. I might try lime flavored soda water next time. Goid on a hot day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tried this recipe as is and just takes a little extra stirring to get the sugar to dissolve. Sugar can also be substituted with regular or liquid stevia to taste for a “sugar free” choice. Liquid stevia goes a long way! New favorite summer time drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My go to recipe. Follow it very closely as the ratio is key. Use super fine/castor sugar - no need for simple syrup as it dissolves. I use this for all recipes that call for simple syrup - so much easier.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the steps exactly and it turned out perfectly. If you make this and don’t like it, check your mint variety. Use a spearmint variety NOT a peppermint variety which has a higher level of menthol. HINT: don’t have too many limes on hand or you’ll be tempted to make more and more and more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made enough for 4 servings; in a pitcher. Once I muddled the mint leaves, sugar and lime, I added to a pitcher. Added ice, then the 3\4 c Bacardi Light Rum and 1 liter of club soda. It was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and delicious with our fresh mint. We had lime sparkling water and used that. It was great! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: just slap the mint between your hands! more minty flavor that way

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make recipe with a whole lime (mine were small). Used only 1 tablespoon of sugar. This was so refreshing! I will make this again and again! Hello summer!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great, easy recipe. Will be enjoying these through the summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious mojito!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great easy recipe for a very tasty result. I fooled around with different types of rums and sugars and my favorite was white rum with turbinado sugar (reduced to 1.5 tbsp). Also great with a splash of black currant syrup. Looking forward to more experiments when my raspberries and blackberries come in.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was tremendous. Bright and refreshing! It was perfect for a sunny afternoon. For one of the drinks I made, I used 2 packs of Splenda rather than sugar. I preferred it because I do not like things to be quite so sweet. (Although I believe that 3 packs of Splenda would be equivalent to 2 tablespoons of sugar in sweetening power.) Lastly, I used a flavored rum (mine was Gator Bite satsuma rum) which added an extra dimension. I’m looking forward to trying it with the other flavor rums though it would be really amazing with just regular plain white rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super good. Drinking it right now. Added 1/2 teaspoon sugar extra bc I like it like thatttttttt babbbbyyyyy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Decided to upsize to a pitcher, all disappeared in a flash!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a test glass exactly as shown in the recipe and it was delicious and refreshing! Super easy and fun to make! I’m making a pitcher tomorrow. Salud!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow, this is an excellent recipe. Loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this but used tito's vodka and 3 tbs of sugar. So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great for my first time. I think though the next time I will make a simple syrup as others have recommended. Otherwise it was fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and refreshing. It’s a perfect summertime drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: More rum Malibu Passion fruit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy & Delicious!! Don’t forget to smack that mint before you drop it in the glass...helps to release that lovely mint aroma!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of the better mojitos we've had. Maybe not the absolute best (nothing a little tinkering won't fix), but for a DIY mojito, it definitely gets the job nicely done! The husman (too old for "boyfriend," but not married) and I are doing a weekly "cocktail night" and this was the featured cocktail we experimented with for Cocktail Night #2. Solid recipe for this drink. I've had way worse at actual restaurants. oh, we used: Puerto Angel white rum, 12 mint leaves per drink, and muddled the heck out of the first 3 ingredients! Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: So lovely. I've made this for three quarantine cocktail hours in a row. Great drink to cut the heat of a spicy meal. Last night it accompanied Korean Fried Chicken and was absolutely perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used sprit instead of soda water and sugar, works great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! I used mint from my garden. 3 tb of sugar was better for me!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used simple syrup that I made instead of sugar. I used 1.5 TBS and it was sweet enough!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Holy this is good! I’ve made many mojitos in my life but this was the best and easiest. Thank you for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe taste really good and refreshing. The only thing I changed was, instead of using white rum. I used flavored rum, I used coconut bacardi because the liquor store I go to didn't have white rum. Taste really really good, I def will be making this drink recipe again. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good.... needs a bit more sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had fresh picked blueberries so, added 1/4 cup blueberries and squeezed half of the lime juice and muddled with the mint leaves. Then added rum and sugar. Too with club soda Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added a scant pinch of salt to balance sweetness!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious but wayyyyy too sweet! I used 1 tbsp sugar and could have used less.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sprite instead of soda. Great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito I’ve made and tasted in a while! Thank you for sharing

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: If this post doesn't make sense it's because i just made mojitos and they were amazing!!!!!!! I recommend using a muddler so you don't squirt lime juice into your eye like I did. Ouch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used the sugar syrup suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these all the time, exactly as is, and its always a hit! Make sure you muddle the mint to release the flavour. Thanks for a great recipe :

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it. I added a splash of brandy liqueur. made it even better

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It turned out great

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was looking to make a good mojito recipe and found it here. I gave up real sugar so I substituted it with 2 tbsp of powdered Splenda that I use once in a while in a pinch or also you can you Swerve sweetener for those doing low carb or keto. Very easy to make and tastes great! I’m at a party right now and already on my second drink! It tastes so good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty and easy..I used simple syrup and a few more mint leaves.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Know what, Brandy? I did make it your way and it was GREAT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out great. Personally I went with only 1 tablespoon of sugar and I thought that was the perfect median between too sweet and bitter, also used tried and true bacaradi rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed recipe exactly and it was great. Added a touch more sugar, and it was perfect. Thank you, Brandy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these all the time, exactly as is, and its always a hit! Make sure you muddle the mint to release the flavour. Thanks for a great recipe :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is going in my favourites

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ran out of limes so I used the bottle of lime juice and came out just as good. Also used a little less sugar. Overall, it was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've had these in Havana, and in Mexico. But this one is right up there with the best. Easy to make and delicious. Five Stars! But TOO easy to drink. I need a nap.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The only thing I changed was the rum, parrot bay coconut. It was so good I had 3. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito recipe we’ve truly enjoyed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had a bunch of mint I needed to use so we made Mojitos. They were good, will definitely do it when my mint plant needs pruning again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: super delicious...refreshing and tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband is a mojito aficionado, and he loves this recipe! He likes his somewhat tart, so I cut down a little on the sugar for him. He likes his with sugar in the raw. I also squeezed the lime juice before muddling to make it a little easier. This gets an A+ in my book!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: 1.5 tablespoons sugar instead of 2

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The absolutely perfect mojito. I like it way better than with simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this twice. First time exactly as written. Second time I made a simple syrup instead of putting sugar directly into the glass. Simply syrup is much better. Sugar didn’t dissolve as well when stirred into beverage, obviously.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add more lime & rum

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: 2 tbs of sugar is way over the top. I used 1 tsp and that's plenty

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: bland & boring

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great simple mojito recipe! Turned out like ones I’ve had at restaurants/bars. I made them as the recipe called, just slightly less sugar. Don’t bother with making the simple syrup others have recommended. The granulated sugar helps grind up the mint. This is going to be a summer staple!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious Def be making a lot of these. Great recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out really well - I picked up the tip form a few of the readers to use syrup rather than sugar and it worked a treat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made no changes, and I will make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use this recipe but half the sugar. Otherwise, the measurements are perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Needs more alcohol!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make it exactly as is. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The key to using sugar vs simple syrup, is to use Caster Sugar or Baking Sugar, it is finer and dissolves much faster! Easy to make, just put 1 cup of regular sugar in food processor for 1 minute... If you are putting fresh lime wedges in, you need the grit of the sugar to assist the muddler to get the oils out of the limes!! Makes the drink even fresher... 2 Tablespoons of sugar is excessive, should be 2 full spoons using proper cocktail mixing spoon...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this mojito today and it was awesome! This will make a great cocktail on a hot day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe and I absolutely love it! We did this over the christmas holiday which is the Christmas Eve Christmas Day and the day after and I may have put a little bit more rum or what I said extra holiday cheer! But I really enjoyed making this recipe! It's a little hard at 1st and I can be a little time consuming. Then as if you want the right amount of mint oil to give it that perfect flavor. This year in July I was in kabo Mexico and we had mojitos and this recipe is the next best thing to how they make it in Mexico. This is now my go to drink for all parties!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I found it to be excellent! easy and yes tasted just like it does when you order the drink in a bar! was very happy because this drink is not as sweet as some and that is a nice change! love it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is very close to the mojitos we had in Cuba a few weeks ago. I never really follow recipes exactly, but the proportions on this one are right, and that's what I was looking for. Recommended!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added another tablespoon of sugar and a little more club soda to make it a little less bitter. Definitely will make again

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: No changes. Used hierba Buena which is just fresh spearmint, nothing special just a good drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Went lighter on the sugar but really delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have always gotten rave reviews from my guests. I adjusted the recipe to make it by the pitcher but I decreased the amount of sugar .

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Soooo good! This will be a go-to drink for sure! Did 1 tbsp of sugar instead of 2 - also used berry sugar as finer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: if you made the recipe just as its listed, you will have a very sweet drink that feels fresh, albeit very high in calories. so dont try to say its healthier than beer or wine. it's still a favorite drink of mine despite all that. the only change you should make is to make the presentation prettier. If you pour it from the serving glass to a mixer and back in, the mint leaves should be evenly dispersed throughout the glass. only worth it for guests, otherwise it doesn't affect the taste at all.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was sooo good! I was never that big a fan of mojitos but the farmer's market had some mint and my daughter talked me into buying some. I followed the directions exactly - using superfine sugar. I will definitely make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you!! And using granulated sugar is best because it pulls out the mint flavor from the leaves! This is the real way to make a Mohito for sure! Delish!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for the summer

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this as written. It was ok, not the best I've tasted. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! For my taste, I used a bit less than the sugar it called for. Next time I'll use even less.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My family and friends really like this recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! I tried one in Barcelona and loved it,this recipe is the same taste as that one! PERFECT. This will be my go to recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and delicious to drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It’s perfect! Refreshing! I would personally add a little less sugar and more mint.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great recipe for Mojitos! I recommend using fresh mint (I have a mint plant) and using a simple syrup instead of granulated sugar. Other than that I followed it exactly and they were GREAT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: First time making them ive had the kind from a mix bag that we got from Sam's club. This is much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. for a real mojito add a dash of angustura bitters

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hands down the best recipe and preparation method for the mojito. I personally use brown sugar instead of white sugar or simple syrup, I feel it gives it a much richer flavor. Also it's just the superior sugar to use in almost every single case. I also add a few dashes of angostura for flavor and color.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and delicious. Made it exactly as instructed and it came out perfectly. I noticed some reviews mentioned using simple syrup instead of the sugar so that it would dissolve. I had some extra fine sugar in my cabinet, so I used that instead and it worked wonderfully. No need to spend any extra time making simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great drink! Would definitely recommend, if you're using Calico Jack Coconut like I was (don't worry, it's cheap).

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Spot on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used 1oz simple sugar in place of white sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Liked it very much. Instead of 2 Tbsp of sugar I used simple sugar syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this exactly as written, and turned out great! I just wish there was a way to get a more intense mint flavour :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am sure this is perfect the way instructed, but as I am not a fan of undissolved sugar, I used one tablespoon sugar and 3/4 oz simple syrup (I like it sweet). I also added 2 oz run because that's how in remember my grandma making it. It is so yummy I'm trying not to down the glass like its plain limeade.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: easy and yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't generally like mojitos, but I suspected that it might just have just been that I had never had a good one. This no longer the case... this mojito is really good! I used fresh mint from my garden, fresh limes, and followed the directions. The only change I made was that I used spiced run, which is all I have on hand at the moment. Next time I will make this with white rum, since I don't think the spiced rum 'helped' the flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used simple syrup nstead of sugar. Great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy and sooo tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added some more lime juice - to make it more citrusy

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Why did I take so long to make this? It's fabulous. So I made it first with chocolate mint then with spearmint. I'm a mint lover but the chocolate mint was definitely better. And I used simple syrup as well My new Favorite drink to be sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This makes a great mojito! My only change is to make a simple syrup instead of the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: awesome! used lime seltzer and stevia simple syrup

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My wife was not impressed. Not sweet enough and couldn't taste the mint. I don't drink these but you know what they say - if the wife's not happy.... Won't be trying this again;

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! I made this exactly as written for my husband and we both loved it. I've also made this using various white rums; whipped rum, pure white rum & coconut --all are delicious my favorite being the whipped rum. I've even tried it with out sugar and 1 T both are pretty good to if your watching calories.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best one I've had. Doubled the rum!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous!! Instead of regular club soda, i made it with lime flavored sparkling water. Also used quick dissolve sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go-to summer drink. I have an entire garden of 3 types of mint (some generic type from the grocery store, spearmint, and peppermint) that is basically devoted to making mojitos. Sometimes I jazz it up and muddle blackberries, blueberries, or a strawberry in with the lime and mint, but it's exceptional as-is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really is the best Mojito recipe I've found. We just came back from Cuba again and my family thinks these are even better than those made there. Of course, I use Cuban rum. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty, I only used 1/2 the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed recipe and it turned out great. So refreshing on a hot day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed on of the reviews and made a simple syrup to add instead of sugar, and found it perfect. Before I made this recipe, I had also done some research on Mojito´s and found one great tip online, saying not to add lime wedges since the bitter flavor from the shell would come into the drink, so I juiced the lime instead. I made this in a mason jar, so I doubled the recipe, and because I juiced the lime, I used the juice from 1.5 lime, 3 tbs simple syrup and then followed the recipe for the mint, ice, rum and club soda. The mojito turned out a little to strong for my liking, so after drinking a little bit, I then added a little bit more club soda and then it was perfect for me. I would probably add 1 ounce of rum next time (in my case 2 ounces since I double it) so it wont become to strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved this recipe but I did have to adjust it a bit because I used simple syrup instead of the granulated sugar. Making them again this weekend!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love mojitos but also love caipirinhas, so what I did is mix the two. I followed the same recipe but used Brazilian rum instead. Brazilian rum (cachaça) is made from sugar cane so it's slightly sweeter. This came out great!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Phenomenal. Better than I have had in any bar. Can't recommend highly enough. I changed the recipe slightly to let the min leaves soak in pure rum for awhile.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. I added some crushed raspberries to the mix and a little bit more rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: it was really good. I didn't have any club soda at home so I used ginger ale and it still came out delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good! I used sugar cubes, because it was the only sugar I had in the bar, and had them mostly melt in the bottom of the glass (because sugar cubes are pretty hard). It was a great way to control the sweetness. I just lifted or lowered my straw a little. Since you can't really drink to the bottom anyway without sucking up mashed up mint and lime wedges, this worked perfectly for me. I used 4 sugar cubes, muddling 3 with the mint and lime. Perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Didn't have anything carbonated besides Sprite on hand for this but reduce the number of limes by one because the Sprite brings it all together and it was still amazing. Even adding two shots versus one shot of rum didn't bring out a strong rum taste and it was still enjoyable. Will make this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit too much mint, not enough rum. I do 5 mint leaves & 2 oz rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: A bit too much mint, not enough rum. I do 5 mint leaves & 2 oz rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love me a good mojito. Mirrors taste great and are so refreshing. I did like this recipe, but had to make quite a few tweaks to be up to my preference. First, I did make a simple syrup. 1 cup sugar to 1 cup water. If you make a big pitcher, you will need a lot of simple syrup. Second, I added more rum than mentioned. Third, I strained some of the pulp from the lime. Instead of the sugar, put some simple syrup and muddle the lime and mint. This makes it a bit tastier. Serve over ice, with lime and mint as a garnish.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: no changes. If your going to change someones recipe, then write your own!!!!! yes I will make it again!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Maybe it's because I used sugar in the raw... but this was waaay too sweet. In the name of science, I made a second using 1/2 the sugar. Still a bit too sweet. on my third (again, science) I used 3/4 teaspoon of sugar in the raw, which did the trick. I have mint growing in my garden, so I'm going to whip up a batch of simple syrup (equal parts water and sugar- heat, chill, sore in an airtight container)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We love this recipe and will definitely make again. I did cut back on the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it as stated, but used sprite in place of club soda, and a little less sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: used half of the sugar, still sweet enough!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: So so good. Perfect as is OR I muddled in some mango and that was divine too!! ?? yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The Real Mojito is REAL good! Exactly as written. I make one change in the process. I make a simple syrup instead of straight up sugar. Ensures that the sugar is dissolved.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: used half the sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a simple syrup because I was afraid the sugar wouldn't dissolve. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. They were delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you!!! This is a great recipe...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely love it! Made it just as written using fresh spearmint and Bacardi Silver. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made as directed, perfect! Will make again, in fact, right now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!!!!! I will definitely be making this again!!!!! Thank you!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe exactly and the cocktails turned out fantastic! Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Fresh and yummy. I only added 1.5 tbsp sugar, and could have added a bit less.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple great recipe. No changes to the recipe, but check your inventory of rum (only had enough for two....drats).

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! I used sparking water and agave necture in mine to make it even more authentic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Mojito's and was anxious to try this recipe on Memorial Day Weekend. The first one I made I skimped on the sugar for caloric reasons. It was good but the second one I made with all the sugar and 2oz rum and it was fantastic!! So excited to have a drink I love that I can make at home.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Best Mojito I ever made. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good as is, but I lowered this to 6 mint leaves and 1 1/2 tlbs sugar for my own taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed this recipe exactly as is, used bicardi white rum. I just doubled everything to fit in my 24 oz tumbler. I don't see the extra step to make the sugar into syrup unless that's your preference because if you follow the directions and muddle using the lime and mixing the suger it comes out perfect. Great refreshing drink on this hot Florida beach day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I will definitely make this again!! Better than the bar!! Made it just as the recipe called!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make & delicious. I've made it twice & added more mint the second time, which made it perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious, easy, and refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I haven't made this recipe, but I have a super short cut for those who don't have the time or inclination to source the exact right kind of mint. It's called New Age. You can find it already chilled at grocery stores, liquor stores, and not chilled at stores once known to be plus cost. get a lime wedge and ice, and go!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used superfine sugar and cruzan coconut rum. Very good, will make again! (Probably in 20 minutes)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Next time I will try to make a slurry w the sugar and the rum as it doesn't mix well in a full glass of ice

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out perfect! It is fun to change up the rum to give the flavor a little tweak. Like I made mine tonight with dragon berry Bacardi rum and my husband used Bacardi torched cherry and I muddled some maraschino cherries in with the mint, lime and sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delish! No modifications necessary .

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes just like the great ones I order at one of my favorite restaurants. I put mint and all lime and sugar and muddle once.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it EXACTLY as it said and it turned out amazing. I also added a few fresh cranberries on my second one.. and loved it! And, you don't need a sugar substitute when you mix with limes and mint first as directed. It mixes up perfectly. I will share and make for family and friends.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yumminess.... Made it for 6 and should have made double!! Big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a easy and wonderful recipe. I have tried others from this site, but this is the best one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very close to the recipe that I got from one of the local famous rum maker factories while on vacation. A simple sugar recipe is the way to go to ensure the sugar dissolves properly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you for the recipe nits a refreshing hot summer cocktail. I did however adjust to our taste preference. I muddled the 1 like wedge then added simple syrup and two more lime wedges and muddled again. I then poured that into a tall glass with ice. I used 2 ounces of white rum with 1 squished lime wedge and stirred. I added a little bit more ice then the club soda. For mine I used dried stevia leaves from my garden instead of simple syrup and it didn't change the taste at all. Then again I'm used to stevia. A solid drink for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Good! Mint and lime make for a perfect summer cocktail. If you are looking for a slightly sweeter/simpler version forgo the sugar v simple syrup debate and substitute Sprite/7up or other lemon-lime soda for the club soda and sugar. Also another *hint* can put together rum lime and mint earlier in the day and then strain for a flavor boost using fresh mint for garnish.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making subpar mojitos for a while and this recipes helped me out of that! The key is more lime and mint than you would think necessary. I agree with other reviewers in using simple syrup instead of sugar granules, and shaking the drink helps blend the flavours much better as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty bad.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Who knew that it was so easy to make a great mojito? Not me! This is a great recipe.,we used the end of a rolling pin in place of a muddler. It worked great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used simple syrup instead of sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love it. But if you want a low-carb version that tastes great, skip the simple syrup and soda and use cold Fresca instead. Delish! Pop in a half a hot chile (don't muddle much!) for a little kick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and fresh flavor! Was a crowd pleaser!! Although I used more mint than it called for. But the mint was almost too overpowering so next time I will use the exact amount the recipe calls for.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is closest to my favorite mojito during a trip to Puerto Rico. The granular sugar is essential.
