Substituting simple syrup as some other reviewers suggested saves little time and detracts from the drink. The granular sugar, with the muddled lime and mint, adds to the sweet and complex texture. Serve with one of those wide straws and you'll want to drink these faster on a hot summer day than you can make them (which are still good without the rum, by the way).

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it with blueberry lemonade seltzer (it was all I had) and turned out phenomenal.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: To truly make it a five star, use Agave nectar instead of sugar or simple syrup. A local bartender gave me that tip and all of his drinks have been awesome so that's how I made mine. Also...because I was making mojitos in bulk for a large party, I squeezed the lime juice ahead of time, no muddling, and used a blender for the mint mixed with some of the juice and rum. Let the mix set for several minutes and the mint "extract" will come out just as well as if I'd muddled the mint. About 1.5 gallons of mojitos lasted around 30 minutes...people loved them!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe turned out really great for me. I substituted a stevia-sugar blend and it worked perfectly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Trust me, you don't need to screw around with a good thing like some people suggesting here - using simple sirup, (2 cups of sugar to 1 cup of water, 2:1), unless you do this for a living and need to cut corners in order to be more productive. When it comes to making one for yourself or you friends, just use the real granulated sugar or sugar cube. Remember; muddling the ingredients together and especially the lime and mint leaves, require a good friction, grinding motion which you won't get from simple sirup!Whenever you'd be muddling sugar with citrus zests, granulated sugar is the "secret", it just requires a little extra effort which I think is well worth it especially when you perform in front of your buddies. Also don't worry about needing the "real" Cuban mint....any fresh bunch from your local store or your own yard will do. For a nice change you can even substitute fresh mint with fresh basil. Try it and let me know what you think.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe. I used Parrot bay rum and agave instead of sugar....holy cow it was good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this as the recipe states & it is delicious! The only thing I would do is add more lime but it is near perfect the way it is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: While I enjoy regular Mojitos....I love to substitute the club soda with 4 oz of champagne/bubbly for an out of this world Mojito.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: so good! i couldnt take a pic of a new one had to finish it... swinging lay woddy

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sounds delicious and I think just like what I had at a Bunko party years ago. I look forward to trying it come summertime. Only one question, if someone could answer? What kind of Mint to use? I am a complete duntz when it comes to knowing things like that.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice for a late afternoon relax.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Im a beer drinker, but this recipe and a hot summer had me intrigued. My wife, sisters and friends all liked your Mojito recipe. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and refreshing! Can't wait until I have fresh mint again to make these!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this recipe several times and was disappointed; then I varied it by first muddling the mint leaves (increased to 12), then squeezing the lime juice in, not crushing it. Now I can taste the mint without the lime overpowering it. And I used 2 T simple syrup which avoids sugar granules raining at the bottom of the glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely delicious and dangerous when you make a pitcher! I like to use Cuban rum. Lime or lemon Perrier water is a good substitute if you run out of club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mmm mmm. We don't eat white sugar so I used coconut sugar and it was a fine substitute. This is very refreshing. Can't wait to try it on a hot day. Thanks Brandy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: 4 1/2 stars. I made the simple syrup that other suggested, so I varied from the recipe a bit. After having 3 strong mojitos...I'm writing this review. Maybe it's the drink talking, but I liked it! :0)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Blows mojitos made at the bars out of the water! Make sure to stir well to get a consistent taste all the way through. Also, If you don't have a muddle, use the back of a spoon - Works just the same. Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go to Attitude Adjustment drink in the summer. Better than a Gin & Tonic. Another good reason to grow a mint plant.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes, that's perfect and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a very simple, and very good, recipe. So tasty! I had to really mix in the sugar with some liquid first, because the first time I tried it, at least a tablespoon of it settled in a blob at the bottom of the glass. For myself, this is fine. If I make this for guests, I'll use simple syrup instead of sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummy. When we have an abundance of mint, this is our go to summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG we had this drink last night. It was so refreshing so good and just plain perfect. If you are on a diet get diet club soda and since it is a cold drink you could use "Splenda". Gotta make this again for the gang!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made batches and batches of these for poker night. Everyone loved them. They were super simple and absolutely delicious. I did make a simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water) and just measured out the liquid in the same measurements as called for in the recipe for sugar. Worked like a dream!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love a great mojito! I agree with others that simple sugar is a far better bet than plain white sugar. I made my own with one part sugar, one part water, and used the same amount as called for. Just like Cuba!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! I didn't bother with the simple syrup, just made it according to recipe, and it was delicious! The mint flavor is subtle, not overwhelming like most bar mojitos.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Crisp and refreshing! Next time I will make the simple syrup since the sugar didn't dissolve in the glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so refreshing on a hot summer night. I started growing my own mint plants just so I could make this recipe all summer long for guests.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quick and easy recipe that's quite tasty. I made some modifications because I had to improvise. I only used one tablespoon of sugar and that was still a tad too sweet for my taste buds, but still good. I didn't have any club soda so I used lime tonic. It was a tasty treat for a Thursday evening. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was given fresh mint at our local growers market (score!) and needed something to do with it. Although without the muddler tool itself, I was able to muddle the mint in a glass with a rolling pin and then just squeeze the lime in with a small juicer. I also also used a whole lime instead of half and it tasted great to me. Excellent quick and tasty recipe that is easy to adjust.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really enjoyed this. Since I'm not a Mojito connoisseur I hope you won't hate on me but I used pure organic lime juice instead of fresh limes. And since I don't do sugar, or sugar substitutes like Splenda, I used a dash (bigger dash than I meant to) of coconut nectar. I muddled it with my potato masher in a bowl. Anyway, I really enjoyed it. I don't know if others would like it the way I made it, but I liked it better than the few I've had in bars. Thanks!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I skinnied it up -- substituted the sugar with Splenda. This lowers the carbs & cals, and Splenda melts instantly so its a win win. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy patio drink by the pool #SummerTime2014 #Summer2014 =)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe the other night. Delicious!! On the second one I only used 1 tablespoon of sugar. @ was a little to sweet for me. Just a tip for you Mojito lovers out there. I went to amazon.com and bought stainless steel mesh tea balls.(about $3.00 a piece) After I muttled the mint I put them in the mesh ball. The mesh ball comes with a chain and a hook. Just put in the glass put the hook on the rim and mint leaves don't float in you glass. I make big batch of these for our summer party and these keep the nozzle on our container from clogging up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This tastes fine

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious. Strongly recommend making and using sugar syrup; it blends perfectly. Also try this with over proof Jamaican rum---seriously awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect -- the only change I will make is to permanently change the recipe to make a pitcher :). absolutely delicious!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: When making simple syrup, add mint leaves to the mix to make mint simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I tried this recipe and not having a mortar and pestle I used my ice cream scoop. It worked great. I thought 2 tablespoons of sugar was too much. I ended up having to crush the 4th lime wedge, add a squirt of lime juice (the plastic one), add more seltzer water and a trickle more rum. In other words a taller drink to cut the sweetness. I bought my own mint plant today just to make Mojitos. I think tomorrow I am going to go buy another one - this time the variety with the fuzzy leaves. I think it will be better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Having sipped Mojito's on a couple visits to Havana, I'd say this was spot on!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Yummy and refreshing!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make these often but replace the rum with vodka as rum doesn't agree with me. Every time I serve them I get the same response. "so refreshing!"

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The ingredients are good but you'll really need to use a simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love the recipe brought memories of Cuba back! I also added a dash of Bitters to it! Brought out a whole other taste!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you ! This recipe is perfect. My husband had the exact recipe (I tried it) we both loved it. I made mine substituting agave nectar for the sugar( I'm type 1 diabetic) it was excellent as well ( i would use less agave nectar next time) I wouldn't change anything about this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely a good place to start. Once you're ready to step it up , replace the sugar with one ounce of simple syrup (heat 1 cup water & 1 cup sugar I'm saucepan and let cool) and use 2 ounces of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent !!! very refreshing I used lemons instead of limes because that is what I had I also used Sierra Mist instead of club soda and did not add any sugar not sweet - but not bitter next time I will use limes :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe gets a 4/4 for proportions and taste, but 2/4 for method. I find that muddle-ice-rum-soda does not infuse the whole drink with the minty, limey deliciousness that I want in a mojito. I HIGHLY recommend using this recipe's directions, but muddling your mint and limes (first mint and 1 lime, then 2 more limes) in a cocktail shaker, then adding sugar, rum, and ice and shaking until your hands freeze! Pour it ALL into a glass, fill up with more ice, and top with club soda. The result is frosty and flavorful. Seriously though, as far as ingredients and proportions, this is now my only mojito recipe. Perfect!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink came out perfect. Followed the recipe exactly. Made 6 batches with 3 limes and two packs of mint. Very tasty. It is on the sweet side so if you are not into sweet, don't add as much sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great taste, I replaced the sugar for splenda since I do not use sugar, and it was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thanks for the recipe. I liked it a lot. It was fine to me with just the granulated sugar but it did not dissolve like I would have liked, even shaking it like crazy. (if you are going to shake it, don't shake it with the club soda, add the club soda after shaking). Next time I will try to use the simple syrup like others suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I usually hate Mojito's but recently had a really good one at a local spot, so I decided that I would try making it myself. This is a really good recipe exactly how it is written! I will try the simple syrup trick next time and will update.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Didn't do the syrup but I will when I make a batch. But regardless OMG! The rum will sneak up on you be careful. Enjoy this is amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum!!! Followed recipe exactly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I fell in love with this recipe at once. I served it to the Poker group and they are requesting it as a regular beverage item now.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Haven't tried it yet but at my next function,it's gonna be a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito I've ever had. Best if made in a pitcher, stirred very well incorporating ingredients that settle on the bottom, and then pouring into glasses. A winner!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My daughter grew mint for a school project. When I saw this recipe I figured why not? Well this is so good and simple. Loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am sipping on one now. It's refreshing, looks nice and reminds me of the Bacardi rum factory in Puerto Rico.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: loved this. wanted to make a large quantity for a picnic at Ravinia. i adjusted the recipe to 25 servings and put 250 mint leaves and 3 cups sugar in a blender. used this as my base for the rest of the ingredients at the venue. delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I normally do not leave reviews but, this recipe is amazing! Love it! This recipe reminds of Mojitos we had in Miami. Thanks for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you add little bit of sprite in it you will find it much tastier

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We make these with Vodka though and for the 4th we make them with blueberries...spectacular and for Christmas cranberries. Outstanding! Very ones fav drink. The vodka everyone agrees makes them more refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The Carribean version of a mint julep ,as they say, When in Rum do as the Rummies do.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Mojitos are my favorite! I sometimes use icing sugar instead of simple syrup as it dissolves easily (1tbsp). Another favorite is to use a tbsp of real maple syrup!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy... So refreshing... Thank-you so very much!~

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: So easy... So refreshing... Thank-you so very much!~

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with Perrier and fresh mint that was in plastic from the supermaeket. I used Splenda instead of sugar and muddled it with a wooden spoon. It was fantastic !!!!!! I accidentally put in 8 ounces of Perrier instead of 4 ounces but still it was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and refreshing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: After muddling the mint and the lime the drink is full of tiny lime and mint parts. You kinda have to strain it unless you want to drink with "pulp".

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum, great recipe, very simple. I feel like I should be lounging in the Caribbean!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe as is. I didn't bother with the simple syrup - why make it harder on yourself when regular sugar works perfectly?? I just wanted a quick and easy recipe, and this was exactly that, plus it's delicious! It's just like any mojito I've had in bars, so I'm going to stick with this recipe (with the granulated sugar). One evening, I had Malibu coconut rum in the house, so I used that - serendipity! SOOO yummy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: DELICIOUS! Light, refreshing and a perfect blend of tart and sweet. After reading a considerable amount of reviews and the suggestions given in another review by the author, Brandy, I believe the key to getting this drink perfect is to be sure to use SUPERFINE SUGAR. I was going to try both simple syrup and the sugar to see which one worked best, but I decided at the store while picking up the mint leaves to check and see if they had the superfine sugar. They did and I bought it. This is definitely the key to adding the sugar easily. I used a mortar and pestle to muddle the ingredients and the superfine sugar just melted into the lime juice beautifully and completely with zero effort. The full dissolving of the sugar meant that it was going to mix into the drink evenly and give the proper amount of sweetness in every sip. I'll continue to use the superfine sugar because it's so easy and quick. I also splurged on a beautiful bottle of white rum called Oronoco and I believe that also made a big difference. My finished drink was smooth, perfectly sweet and tart and beautiful to look at. And I'm sure it's easy to overdo it - this cocktail went down way too easily!I used a swizzle stick and stirred it every now and then to keep mixing the flavors as I sipped it. I felt like I was on vacation. This is going to be my new special summer drink and I'm going to make another one this afternoon since it's so hot outside! Thank you, Brandy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I absolutely loved this recipe! We made it in a blender since we were making multiple drinks. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good, but a few tweaks make a better mojito. First, stay away from the simple sugar as the most helpful comment suggests. I have tried it and liken it to lemonade made in the same manner(I hate it!). I like having some undissolved sugar in my drink. I use a citrus reamer to juice half a lime and crush it into the the mint leaves. If I'm being lazy I use enough bottled Key West lime juice to dampen the 2TBS sugar. Also try using SPRITE (or even ginger ale) instead of club soda. MOST IMPORTANTLY MIX EVERYTHING BEFORE ADDING THE CLUB SODA/SPRITE. Then add your carbonation and give the drink a quick swirl or two. Unless you must know exactly how much alcohol you are consuming dont bother measuring out the rum. After filling my glass near to the top with ice, I simply pour the glass about 2/3-3/4 of the way full of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to use 151 proof Bacardi, and gold rum. I use a few drops of mint extract and a short squirt of agave nectar. Splendid!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like the real thing I had in San Juan. Mmmm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a pretty good recipe for a single drink but if I were going to make a full pitcher of mojitos, I'd make a mint-infused simple syrup instead of using granulated sugar. Granulated sugar just doesn't dissolve very well. I have plenty of spearmint in my back yard and this is a perfect treat after an afternoon of working on the pool and in the back yard. Thumbs up!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not bad, but I would start with half the sugar or even less and then add more to taste. I like to be able to taste the alcohol and fresh mint!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very easy to follow and the taste is perfect!!! Thanks for the share.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was nearly perfect. The only change I made was using home made simple syrup instead of sugar, and it tasted exactly like the ones I had in Mexico!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the only recipe we use when making mojitos. I have mint in my backyard in the summer so this is one of our favorite drinks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The problem with these is that they are so good we drank to many.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Omg! Been looking for the perfect mojito recipe and this is it! Thanks! Only change i made was to use brown sugar but overall, perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I dont measure the amount of club soda used but I think it is probably just under 1/2 cup. Otherwise I follow the recipe exactly. These are delicious. I made this recipe 3-4 times and the last time I wanted mojitos, I spent a good 5 min searching the internet for this recipe - It can't be beat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice Recipe! Thanks!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I saved this recipe a long time ago, but only tried it today for the first time. I bought a plant with fresh mint leaves growing. I made 2, both for my husband. He gave it 5 stars, said it was the best. He drank first one in 20 seconds. Thanks for a great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent...no need to fool around with the recipe. I made this with exactly the ingredients and methods described. I didn't have a muddler...so I used the fat round end of a rolling pin. It was surprisingly delicious. I had never had one before. Forget about the fancy stuff about simple syrup. Its not necessary. I found the drink easy and fast to make. There is something special about how the mint and lime combine. What a treat. I really enjoyed myself...so much that I had to take a nap afterward!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: the "simple sugar syrup" must be made from brown sugar... a bit richer flavor. Go this route and you are on your way to perfection. 4 stars.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this recipe! I just want to reiterate that the simple syrup is the KEY difference between an ok drink and an amazing one!!! Definitely take the time to make some! I'm boiling more up as I type! ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: As much as my wife didn't want it...you really need to put in the full amount of sugar. Once you do, you'll have a great drink! Better than then the one I bought for $7 last weekend.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a really great recipe! Just like the bartender makes it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!!! I don't have a muddler so I used the flat end of a wooden meat pounder. For round two, I took out the ice and left the other remnants in the bottom of the glass then repeated the recipe. Was even better than round one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best! nothing else to say, except there is now mint flavored seltzer out there!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe for a very refreshing mojito. Instead of sugar, I used simple syrup. Initially I made the simple syrup, but it kept recrystallizing, so I finally just purchased some (sooooo easy!). Also, my lime tree is not mature yet, and I had some key lime juice on hand from a pie that I made, so I used that. Delicious! Now I need to buy more club soda because I finished the whole bottle. Love to have these while floating in the pool!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was refreshing and delicious. I could totally see being tempted to drink a whole pitcher. The only modification I made was reducing the sugar to 1 TBS. I would use even less next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG my new favorite ! Served them at a 9 and Dine on the weekend and everyone thought they were great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! My favorite recipe for quick and easy mojitos. Not too sweet, not too bitter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was great. I dont like drinks too sweet so I replaced 1 tbl Splenda for the two tbl sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!! Try some mango flavored rum....amazing!! I muddle the lime, sugar, mint...then add the booze. Add ice...shake, shake, shake in a shaker then add the club soda. I agree with making a simple syrup. The best summer time drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've had mojitos at several restaurants/bars and some places make them better than others. This recipe was right on with the times that i've loved my mojitos. I love them on the sweeter side. i added half a teaspoon more sugar than the recipe called for, but making it with what it calls for is excellent also. I would not go through the trouble of making a simple syrup as when you muddle the leaves with sugar and lime it really does start to incorporate the sugar. Even when i've gotten this drink when we go out, you still have to stir as you continue to enjoy your drink....our new summer drink for 2012!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good recipe after reading many bad ones. I approached only slightly differently by making it the way a bartender would make it. I simply muddled the ingredients in a shaker, added ice, then poured the rum over it. I shook the drink, poured it straight into the glas then added a bit more ice and topped with club soda. There was no sense of granular sugar in it. I used all 4 limes in the muddling, but I rimmed the lime along the glass edge. I also added just a touch of roses lime. I think if you were making quantities, simple syrup would make it easier but it's not required for a couple of drinks if you shake it well. The only downside is that you do get a fair amount of floating mint, but I think that adds to it both in aroma and flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made with simple sugar and not too sweet, great balance!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it, drank it, loved it! Will make again and again this summer! Thanks for the recipe! *I added extra lime juice per my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Try using Malibu coconut rum instead of the traditional Bacardi! My brother in law is a bartender and he made one for me with Malibu and I have never gone back! I also made a simple syrup to use instead of the sugar, which is how they make it at his bar. Simple syrup is 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water. Let the syrup dissolve in the water over low heat and then allow to cool. These are so refreshing on a hot day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: You can also add 4-5 blueberries at the muddling stage to make a pretty blueberry mojito.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderfully Refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is exactly the way I make Mojitos except I use Mango Rum which gives it (I think) a better taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This mojito takes some extra work compared to the other better versions I've tried. There isn't really a big significance ofquartering the time and adding it to the glass to muddle. It takes up too much room in the glass that you cannot blend the ingredients together and doesn't add any extra flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a crowd pleaser! So light and refreshing! I made this with Splenda just to cut out the calories fom the sugar and EVERYBODY loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!! I made a couple of changes...I used coconut rum, only 1T sugar and 2 oz rum. So good!! And very light, as far as cocktails go.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this regularly in the summer. It's a great hit with friends. Very simple to make. Only a few ingredients so make sure you use good rum, fresh mint and ripe limes. Simple syrup works better than sugar. Overall, great mojito recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent flavor! I have been making these for a while now, and waited until I had fresh cut mint to use (instead of extracts, packaged leaves, etc) in order to give it a proper review. As with a lot of recipes, fresh ingredients make all the difference, and in this case take the drink from good to great! The only thing I insisted on doing different was to use simple syrup instead of sugar, to make sure it dissolved/blended well. Proper muddling is also key to bringing out the oils of the mint leaves (found that one out the hard way). Thanks for sharing a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe, but I take it a step further. No mint? No problem, try using basil leaves. Want to bring down the calories? Try agave syrup. I use a shaker for this so the agave syrup mixes in. I personally prefer to use a shaker anyway. I put about 4-6 large whole basil leaves and juice of one lime in a shaker and muddle. Then added agave syrup to taste and vodka, along with ice. Shake well. Strain into tall glasses filled with ice. I add a splash of mineral water and garnish with a basil leaf.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this drink following the recipe and I wasn't crazy about it. I've made it a couple of times using simple syrup and it tastes delicious! The sugar just doesn't dissolve and it leaves the drunk tasting really strong and the alcohol overpowers the drink. I made the simple syrup using one cup water and one cup sugar. I also add mango or strawberry.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hubby and I had these years ago down in Key West where Hemingway was said to have consumed these in mass quantities. I like to put a bit of sugar in the glass (tall pint type) with the mint leaves as it helps to pull the oil out of the mint when muddling. I then add mint simple syrup to taste. (easy to make, just add mint to the syrup at the end of your cooking time and let steep for 15 minutes) Also you can use plain water or seltzer or sprite or whatever tickles your palate. These are dangerous and super yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think the recipe is great but keep in mind that not all varieties of mint work well. The original recipe (that is, the one served in CUBA) calls for Yerba Buena, which is completely different from other species.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Best recipe I've found.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! The only change I made was to use simple syrup instead of the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these exactly as directed, using sugar and not simple syrup. An authentic, refreshing and beautiful drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My girlfriend and I love the recipe as is. We tried the simple syrup idea and found that the flavor wasn't as fresh. No need to tamper with this recipe if you know what you're doing...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe! THanks for sharing, Brandy! We were sure to use simple syrup and it was perfect. The key is to be sure to muddle very well to get all the flavors released. Just like what I order at a bar!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's worth it to make the simple syrup! Yum

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Basically the same as how I make mine except that I use about 1 1/2 teaspoon white sugar and I use 7UP instead of club soda. I like the idea of using simple syrup... I think I might try that next time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great mojito! I used diet seven up instead of club soda and 1 equal packet instead of the sugar. My husband loved it and said it tasted better than the $7 mojito he paid for at a restaurant the other day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I muddled the mint leaves with the sugar with a motar /pedstal and then added the lime as suggested and it turned out great no need to use simple syrup when you do this. I used 7 up instead of soda water and they were perfect! I also used crushed ice instead of cubes for a different flare!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: SO good!!! Easy to make and my first use of my mint in my garden! Be careful because these don't taste like alcohol at all so it will sneak up on you ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The great thing about this aptly named recipe is that it is so authentic. It tastes as it should--not too sweet, with some granulated sugar left at the end. Almost all the reviews that call for substituting this or that or making symple syrup may suit the American palate that has been weaned on industrialized food and gulps it down as fast as you can make it, but they will never be more than a faux-jito!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! I've also made this with Agave syrup instead of the sugar and also with vodka instead of the rum. It's great as written or with any of these substitutions. I LOVE my mint plant!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I added sprite for the club soda and only 1/2 T sugar and was awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good recipe. Nice and clean. I think I will reverse a step and muddle the mint with the sugar first. Then muddle the limes in there. The muddling the mint with the sugar should really get out a lot of the mint oil. Thanks for the great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: super good mojito!! my wife and i cant stop drinking them!! the only little thing i did is put sugar around the rim of the glass. excellent recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think this recipe is better with 2 oz of rum. :) Also, I use my homemade simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good.... a little too sweet for my taste, but tone the sugar down a little and after a couple you'll never know the difference. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I changed it just a bit to make strawberry mojito's and they were excellent! I used simple syrup instead of sugar and only used 1/4 of a lime and substituted a strawberry for the other 1/4. I also used Bacardi Dragon Bery rum instead of white rum and used 2 oz. My beer drinking husband always asks me to make these now!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I must have done something wrong, because it didn't taste quite like I expected.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thanks A LOT; I make these and now no place I go out to makes a Mojito that even COMPARES! Guess I need to cook at home more now and whip up one of these to go along with the meal! Only thing to keep in mind is the size of your mint leaves;some can be gigantor-so adjust amount accordingly-or go with the extra-minty version you'll have!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: seriously delicious! My boyfriend loves mojitos and we have a gazillion places in NY that have really great ones and he says this is pretty much the best he's had. I don't get this whole "syrup" talk - it's perfect the way it is. I just should have used more ice =P.. AND I used tonic water, because I wasn't able to find club soda for my life haha.. and it wasn't bitter at all - the sugar killed the bitterness. This is one perfect drink :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: a good solid recipe......used fresh mint from garden!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: SOOOOOOOO YUMMY & REFRESHING! Second batch we added a little more lime & sugar. Next time I'll go ahead and make the simple syrup with mint...just so I can make them faster! :) The only danger with these is that they are so easy to keep drinking!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: For my "skinny" mojito, I use splenda in place of the sugar. I also use bottled lime juice such as "Poe's" or "Rose's" for convenience.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I also used simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used simple sugar instead of table sugar because I was worried about it dissolving. Even using an equal amount of simple sugar it was a bit sweet, but still very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best Mojito recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple sugar tip: make ahead & make extra. Store in glass jar or Tupperware in fridge. Keeps for a week or so. Use in margaritas, iced tea, iced coffee etc. Perfect mojito recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it! I used the syrup version and it was amazing! Can't find one this good unless your in Miami! I will be making this for all of my friends ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Had my first Mohito. Made the mint simple syrup as someone suggested. Used lemon lime sparkling water for this one. For my 2nd I will use club soda to see which I prefer. Having my 2nd one now. I prefer the club soda. I also used the spiced white rum, careful now, it'll sneak up on you. I don't own a muddler so I used a wooden tart form, works pretty well!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made the simple syrup with lime as suggested by one other review and my hubby agreed it was one of the best mojito's. Now I have mastered his favorite summer drinks

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am a Mojito expert, I can tell you where to find the best Mojito in town. I just made the simple syrup and add the mint leaves and lime...DELISH AND CHEER... Now I can make it at home....Thank you for the recipe and the reviews....

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is soo good and so easy! you'll probably want some of those thin straws though so that you're not constantly drinking the mint leaves :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the closest I've found to a real Mojito like your favorite bartender will mix for you. It's essential that you use fresh spearmint and lime. If you don't like the flavor of club soda with the added sugar, replace the soda and sugar with 4oz of your favorite lemon/lime drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've had mojito's before but never have I tried making them myself. We really enjoyed this recipe, made as written. Very refreshing. I would though, recommend making the simple syrup as suggested by other reviewers. Also, use "ice for cocktails" from this site which really does make a difference.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good and easy to make! Nice for a hot, summer day!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was good. The suggestions of the others were good. Make sure the mint leaves are fresh.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great refreshing drink. I made simple syrup like suggested. I put everything in my shaker (except the club soda) and shook and shook. Then strained into a glass and poured the club soda on top. Then you can throw in some whole mint leaves to make this drink look super pretty. It took me three drinks to get this right! Not complaining. lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very good, but I think the perfect mojito needs a mint syrup (1:1 ratio of sugar or splenda to water, boil together for ~3mins, add fresh mint leaves to taste and allow to cool together before straining). I played all weekend and the mint flavor just translated better when I used the syrup. I muddled a few mint leaves with 1 lime wedge in the glass for effect, then added to taste the syrup, rum, and lime juice; ice cubes; and topped with club soda. This also cut down on the "dirty fish tank" effect of the drink, which never bothered me much but my husband complained about. Fun to make and very refreshing, thanks so much for sharing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made 6x serving for a 4th of july party. Took a while to make but the results were amazing. I also made the sugar into syrup, as some suggested. Friends said it was better than what they served at their bar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These mojitos rock. I like 10-15 leaves per glass, depending on size. I also use simple syrup and everyone loves these. Careful to not mix the lime too much or it will be ruin it because of being too sour. Thanks for a refreshing summer cocktail.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this last night, but we used Tonic Water instead of club soda (because it's not as bitter), & I'm so glad we did - it tasted soooooooo awesome!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This made excellent refreshing Mojitos...thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Made just as recipe says except... My mint leaves were large so I didn't put as many thinking it would be enough, nope the more the better. OKAY, I did change it up after having a few...so "my" recipe is made in a 16 oz Tevis glass (ha ha) 10 mint leaves, Kellie & Joes Key Lime Juice, 1 tbl splenda, (muddle) Add ice, 1 1/2 fluid ozs of Parrot Bay-Key Lime, then fill with club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was really good. I made exactly as is!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: really good recipe - delicious. next time I will make simple syrup though as some of the sugar settled to the bottom and it would have been nice to have it in the drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love mojitos, and they really don't sell them in bars here in Ohio..., only in restaurants. So I wanted to try to make my own, taste just as good as anywhere I've tried them! I tried the club soda, and I used sprite. I liked the sprite better, that's just me though. Thank you for the recipe, yummmm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty much the same as my recipe, although I make them a bit differently. I muddle the lime, mint and 3 tsp simple syrup in a cocktail shaker, then pour over ice and add a shot glass of Myers rum and fill with club soda. Perfect every time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this cocktail two years ago, but I've just realized I didn't reviewed it. I must say I am not a Mojito lover, I prefer fruity Mojito, but this recipe is a real deal. Better than any bars can do. I didn't change a thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fresh mint from the garden, a good rum. This is perfect (and dangerous)!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a refreashing summer drink. I like this drink because it isn't so acidic and it really cools you down on a hot night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! Don't use spiced rum- it has to be white! I use natural sugar, which doesn't dissolve well. I now use sweetened lemon-lime or citrus sodas instead of the club soda & sugar. I also add extra fresh squeezed lime and get rave reviews!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe, but replace the white sugar with a simple syrup flavored with mint. (It's easy enough to make.) Also, be sure to have a muddler on hand. We used 3/4 of a lime, 3 oz. of rum, and more like 15 mint leaves per glass -- less than that was wimpy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The ingredients are the same that I use and make the best authentic mojito. As mentioned though, I make a simple syyrup with equal parts sugar and water and I add a bunch of mint to the simple syrup, while on the stove, let simmer for about 20 minutes to infuse the mint flavor, then discard mint, add the lime juice and lightly muddle some mint leaves, for added flavor and effect. It make a mighty minty mojito, but that's how I like it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very authentic! Definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very nice, I added an extra splash of lime juice. I also used Splenda instead of regular sugar. Makes it low cal and dissolves easier as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: As is, yum! However, next time I will take the simple syrup advice as the sugar does not dissolve before the mojito is gone. Granted, that doesn't take much time...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love this recipe but have a new twist. Didn't have soda so used Pellegrino and the result was super refreshing. Will stick with this for now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a simple syrup with 15 mint leaves in it ahead of time...these were absolutely wonderful!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: A-maz-ing! We have oodles of mint in our garden and I love mojitos. This recipe is so good that my hubby and I are on our second glass. ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: As Dallas prepares for Game 6 in Miami, this may be "beverage of choice" . . . Go Mavs!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very simple yet tasty recipe. We use agave nectar instead of the sugar. For a little spice, try muddling some crushed red pepper and cayenne pepper in with the lime.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are awesome made with simple syrup and club soda.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are sooo good! Very addicting! I don't like my drinks very sweet, so I cut the sugar in half.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious & perfect!! Don't skimp on the ice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are so good and they are very addictive. I will be making these more often!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! I used agave nectar instead of sugar, and, although I didn't measure, I think a tiny bit more rum than 1.5 oz. Also used an ice-cream scoop since I don't own a muddler. Turned out DELICIOUS!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I definitely recommend making a simple syrup as others have recommended. It was not nearly sweet enough, because all of the sugar sank to the bottom and did not dissolve. I would add the sugar slowly to taste, as some may like it sweeter than others. I also used sweetened lime juice instead of plain lime juice which gave it a really good flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the best recipe! Here is a bit of advice though: Plan to make 2 or more pitchers if you have more than a couple of friends. These Mojitos go down easily and are gone in a flash!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfection!! I used a bit more sugar, probably should have made simple syrup because I prefer it sweeter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Esta bebida es muy bueno!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good. DEFINITELY needs all the sugar, plus a little more for my taste. These are a good base, with a little tweaking I think they can be perfect. Until them, I'll stick with the strawberry mojito mix from a local store.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe! Made for 20 using conversion with great results but a few logistic changes as couldn't muddle in each glass per original recipe. First, with all the cleaning, separating and muddling of the mint, it takes about an hour of hard work so start early! First, I combined most of sugar with rum and club soda in jug then used remaining sugar to separately muddle mint leaves in about 5 stages (~20 leaves at a time) with lime juice. The sugar and lime really helped with the muddling. Also, I used a juice squeezer rather than muddling for several lime because it just got to be too much work to muddle that many! I finished it about 30 minutes prior to serving and it still looked great. On serving, I added to a glass on ice and added leftover mint pieces for garnish. I got lots of positive feedback on this one. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My neighbors all loved it - me too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Great summer drink recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good but not sweet enough for me so I added more sugar and some sprite and yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe as is and easy to make subtle modifications to.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was my first attempt and my husband was very happy. Both of us loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This has been my official summer drink for several years and a tried and true authentic recipe. The only other ingredient I add is 3 to 4 few drops of Angostura bitters; it does make a difference. For those looking to cut calories and/or corners substituting Sprite Zero for the sugar and club soda works very well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Go to Cuba every year and this is my favourite drink. Fotrunate enough to have wild mint growing at my cabin in the bush so we enjoy the freshest mohito on the lake! Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Being the lush chef that I am, I recommend a 2:1 soda to rum ratio. Also use a quality rum like cruzan triple distilled light, not lighter fluid bacardi. This drink is intended to respect a high class rum. Stuck at work....wish I could pour one right now: )

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink. I added a bit more lime. I like it tart!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Mojito recipe! I used maybe a 1/2 T. of sugar (to help with emulsifying the mint & lime), and then used a simple syrup to sweeten the rest of it. This was our favorite drink this summer, and everyone loved them. Very refreshing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow. Best mojito ever! I followed the advice of a previous reviewer and made my own mint-infused simple syrup (so easy...just add 10 leaves of mint to the syrup and let it simmer for 10-20 minutes before cooling). I don't have a mortar, so used big spoon to mash lime wedges and mint leaves. I substituted syrup for sugar, adding more to taste. Fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: When making this I use one packet of Splenda for each drink. I also grow my own mint in my backyard. I've been making this drink for about 2 yrs. It's funny tho, not many places in my town can make them to correct way. I first drank one in another city and was determined to learn how to make them. I pretty much do it the way this recipe says.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a group tonight and it was very good. I multiplied all the ingredients to make one large batch instead of individual drinks. Used powdered sugar, and only put in half the amount called for by the recipe. Muddled the mint, but did not bother to muddle the limes - just squeezed in the juice and then threw in the wedges. Turned out great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: this was yummy but we had to modify the quantity of all the ingredients to our liking. very tasty though!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is so AWESOME!!! I made it exactly as is and it was so good. I made a second cup and used Fresca instead of club soda and it was equally good but you could add more liquor to it this way without it being overpowering. I could probably drink 10 cups but I won't.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love these things! Sugar syrup is a great idea, and you can make it a good while ahead since sugar is a natural preservative. The idea of less soda and more rum is one fine idea ;) @nance m - Splenda has the sweetness of sugar, but it doesn't have the physical characteristics of sugar, so you can't make a simple syrup using it. I know, I tried that making homemade liqueurs with Splenda, and it just doesn't do.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy and refreshing...I planted mint in my garden just for this drink. Its awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: When I say mojito, THIS is what I am talking about! Perfect in every way, this is an authentic version of a refreshing summertime drink. As an added bonus, muddling the mint and lime is a much better way to build up arm muscles than lifting weights!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great mojito

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Next time I will use this recipe but reduce the sugar. It was way too sweet (which is an unusual thing for me to say!). I made a simple sugar syrup in the microwave first-- it's the only way to get the sugar to dissolve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Light, refreshing, and easy. For my taste, I prefer 1 tablespoon of sugar. Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are perfect for a hot summer day! I made simple syrup and expanded the recipe to make a whole pitcher. Used the pineapple mint growing like mad in my front yard. And I loved them! In fact, I'm making another pitcher tonight!:)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've used this recipe several times - it makes a really great mojito! The last time, I used the servings calculator to make 6 servings, and mixed everything in a gallon-sized pitcher. It turned out really, really good - may have been easier to mix with a simple syrup rather than just the sugar, but it worked fine for my purposes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made good mojitos before, but this one isn't it. However, I think it could be improved. It's just way too sweet! I haven't modified it yet, but I'm guessing that about half the amount of sugar would be more realistic for this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The perfect summer beverage! So refreshing & not too sweet. I followed this basic recipe but used Molle888's variation and I couldn't make these fast enough! Do yourself a favor and just make these by the pitcher. Yes, they are a little more work, but your guests will really appreciate the effort....Enjoy!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just couldn't get this to turn out right. It's a labor intensive cocktail, for sure.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: reduce sugar - too sweet

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: These were good and probably the best I've ever made at home but I still think the ones I get at bars are better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect mojito. My friend does something similar, except he uses a simple syrup. I think I prefer this method, it's much simpler and you can really control the sweetness. I'll definitely never use a mix for a mojito. This recipe is crisp, clean and simple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best mojito recipe! Thank you so much for sharing! My husband made it according to the directions and it tasted so good! I will try the simple syrup version if I ever have the time to plan it ahead. :) I like the idea of the syrup and I think I'll enjoy the drink even more with slightly less amount of sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Ive made these three times quadrupling the recipe. Each time for the sugar I have used 1/2 real sugar and 1/2 splenda and the amount the recipe calls for is too sweet for my liking and not heavy enough on the rum. I have found they tast better using a third less sugar and a couple more ounces of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you prefer simple syrup like I do, try adding some mint to the pan when making the simple syrup and steep. Makes the simple syrup minty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Better than anything I've ever had in a restaurant! Used Parrot Bay Coconut Rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Utterly fabulous.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: awesome! tastes just like the restaurant/bar if you substitute simple sugar for the white sugar suggested here - I made it with the same amount run and simple sugar then followed the recipe exactly. YUM!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, but I changed club soda to ginger all and decreased the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good! I used a citrus rum with it and everybody loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: so easy and so yummy! I didn't have club soda, so I just use sprite and put less sugar. It came out great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really excellent recipe, everyone loved it! I did use natural sugar instead of white, but that's just because it was what I had on hand. Great stuff, and so much better than any other Mojito I've ever had!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. I let the lime, sugar and rum sit for a good hour before finishing the drink. I think that was part of the trick. Also, I used Bacardi light rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I planted mint plants just so I could make this drink! It was so good, I will make this again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Refreshing. It's important to muddle, because muddling releases the oils from the mint & the lime peel. Using sugar instead of a simple syrup is also important, because the crystals' grit releases even more of the flavorful oils. I only had lemon-lime soda & no club soda, so I did reduce the sugar. After making & tasting it with the recipe's proportions, I did add a little more lime, mint & rum (personal preference).

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the instructions to the letter and it was perfect for my taste. Delicious and refreshing, with the just the right combination of mint and lime. I'm cool as a cucumber as I write this on a searingly hot day thanks to that mojito.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very refreshing! The amount of rum was just right. Like many other reviewers, I used simple syrup instead of granulated sugar. I'm going to try making the simple syrup with turbinado sugar next time around. This drink is perfect by the pool on a hot summer day. Added: I just made this again with ultrafine sugar and it is heavenly. Two tablespoons of sugar may be too much for some, but it's just right for me. Adjust the amounts of sugar, lime, and mint according to taste. The second time around, I added extra lime and muddled the sugar, lime and mint with the back of an ice cream scoop.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Very good. I did take the time to make the simple syrup and add that instead. Really really good. Thank you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very refreshing and authentic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use brown sugar instead of white and it gives the drink an incredible taste!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Two Tablespoons was WAY too much sugar. I made these a second time with 2 tsp of powdered sugar and squeezed 1/2 of a lime into the glass, rather than muddling the lime wedge. In the future I may also try simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG! Yum!!! I used 1/2 lime, sliced fairly thin. 1/2 part Simple syrup (1 cup sugar & 1 cup water - warmed enough to help the sugar melt) 8 or so mint leaves; muddled together; then 1 part rum, 3 parts club soda. Then ice to fill the glass. These babies don't taste strong but watch out!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We just got back from Mexico, and were craving this delicious drink! This recipe was even BETTER than theirs! Absolutely make the simple sugar (1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water in a saucepan. Heat very slowly, stirring constantly, until the liquid is clear). We used pint glasses, so 2 large spoons of it was plenty. I followed the recipe step by step, and we all really enjoyed them!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am enjoying one right now and so glad that I tried this recipe....it is delicious and refreshing...I love fresh mint and lime. I did as some others and made a simple syrup instead of the straight sugar. Glad I did because it was smooth and not gritty. Thanks for this yummy and refreshing drink! Will definately be making again during the summer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty and easy to make. Healthier than buying a mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Almost as good as what we had in San Juan. Goes down quickly on a hot day, used simple syrup, may have to buy some lime juice to make in bulk next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nuff said- in Sacramento the summer gets to over 105- this is the perfect solution. Perfect while BBQ ing make in pitchers for crowds.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so good and really easy! We have spearmint, the best mint, and peppermint in our herb garden, so I used all of them! It came out really good, but my leaves were small so I added more than 10!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great starting point! As other reviewers I made a simple syrup instead of just the sugar. I also just made a huge pitcher used more rum and less soda. Delicious on a hot day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: First recipe I've tried for this drink; it was a success! Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added more lime wedges but excellent guide to amount of sugar

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent mojito. Recommend using Cruzan rum to any others. It's smoother and cheaper! If you don't believe me all you have to do is compare it side by side to bacardi or malibu. The others smell like gasoline compared to Cruzan. Doing your homework on liqour makes all the difference in the taste of a good cocktail~ YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best homemade Mojito I've ever had, definitely restaurant quality . . . made these on Cuban night and everyone enjoyed them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for my husband and his friend and they thought it was great!!! I made the first one exactly the way it said, then the second one I added alittle more mint and a tsp more of sugar.. It came out great!! Of course then my husband wanted a splash of pomegrate juice.. YUMMMMMMMMMM!!!! Definitely a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy drink. I used Vodka instead of rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cool sweet and sticky! I did add more sugar cause I like em sweet.....like my men.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM YUM. The only thing I did different was to use honey because I can't have disaccharides. If you don't have rum, you can use vodka!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my favorite mixed drink now! I loved it sooo much I went out and bought a mint plant and a bag of limes. I had sugar water on hand for my hummingbirds, they have to share it now.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good mojito! Like others, I used simple syrup.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome Mojito. It's really easy to adjust to make pitchers - I made it for a party of about forty people and I was making pitcher after pitcher. I followed the recipe exactly and everyone seemed to like it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: My wife's favorite summer drink...looking for a recipe to replicate the local bar where these are served during happy hour and this fit the bill to a "T"...very easy to make...great for afternoons by the pool

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought this was just okay. It needed WAY more mint leaves than the recipe called for. We added about 30 leaves all-told, and it was just about right, even with bruising them before adding. Not a bad "base" recipe, but I'll need to tweak it a bit so it suits my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these Mojitos for the first time yesterday, and it was phenomenal! Will make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We served these at a party and did not have enough, everyone loved them. Thanks for the great recipe :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good guidelines, but this tastes better with a few changes. I used simple syrup and added mint and lime to taste (a little extra). Also, a little more run and less soda ;)Overall, a good recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a real mojito drink like at the bar.Making the simple syrup is a must don't subsitute any of the ingredients. I made this for some people who don't drink mixed drinks and know they always request this when we have a gathering.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink, very refreshing. I put a sugar rim on the glass for presentation, and it looked as good as it tasted!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a "real" mojito. Very, very good and easy. Mint is very easy to grow in your own garden, so you can have fresh leaves whenever needed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! If you dont have a motar and pestal, smash the leaves on a plate with the sugar. Then pour all the leaves and sugar into the glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Refreshing and absolutely delicious! Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: We used vodka, which was really good - it's probably great with rum too. I strained ours though, because I don't like pulp.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: i thought this was excellent. i added 2 oz of rum per drink because i like them stronger. i used a wooden spoon to muddle and it worked great. i will definitely be making these again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Picked some mint from my neighbors yard and mashed it in a bowl with an ice cream scoop. Used the simple syrup technique. The only problem was I didn't make enough (and I increased the recipe to 6 servings!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Right on. I have mint growing wild in my yard so it's always available. I like how this recipe calls for sugar that you mix in when preparing the drink. I know some will argue simple sugar is a better way to go, but I thought the results were identical. When I made this, I didn't have club soda so I used carbonated spring water and it was a little less tart. I'm going to keep making it with carbonated water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think that the proportions are a bit off in this recipe -- my guests added quite a bit more limes and sugar to make the pitu palatable. A tip we discovered: if you're getting lazy crushing limes (and who doesn't after drinking a few?), add a tablespoon of lime juice and save some time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this recipe for a while now, but have found a low-carb version for all my "atkins-type" friends. I simply substitute splenda and diet sprite for the sugar and soda--not sure if you can make simple syrup w/splenda, but I don't see why not...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: UMMM! So good- gave 4 stars but would be 5 with my revisions. I took other suggestions and simmered equal amts of sugar and water and used that in place of the sugar. I probably didnt use the full amt of club soda- just topped it off. Very refreshing and yummy. Add more sugar to taste- I like mine sweet...

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: this drink was big hit! refreshing and easy to make. i did use simple syrup instead of regular sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is almost the same as the one we use at my bar. We use simple syrup (equal parts sugar in the raw and water, boiled down) instead of granulated sugar because it mixes with more ease. We also just muddle one half of a lime with the mint (exactly 11 leaves), add ice, measure your rum (we use 2 ounces) and simple syrup, then shake that bad boy to death. Pour into a glass, and top with a splash of soda water. These are crazy popular at my bar. We also garnish these with a stick of sugar cane, but that is strictly for aesthetics. Annoying to make, but so good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellant, highly recommended!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best drink ever! This recipe is simple and classic without any tricks srewing it up. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is great! I adusted the recipe to make 4 in one pitcher and it turned out great. Everyone loved them. Can't wait to make more. I did use a simple syrup insted of sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The Real Mojito
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my favorite cocktail ever!! I tend to use more mint-and lime- alot more-- also we like turbinado sugar (Sugar in the Raw)instead of white- it has a bit of a brown sugar edge to it that mixes great with the lime. Thanks so much for this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of my favorite cocktails

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never use a premixed bar mixture. Order a bourbon Manhattan to get a better grade whiskey and use a good grade vermouth. Both whiskey and wine need to be top quality, easy on bitters, generous with cherries and juice. A manhattan should always be smoooooth, velvety.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a tsp of cherry juice and a little more vermouth. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yep, liked it. Not sure if I prefer this or an old fashion...very similar

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe and this for someone who likes a strong drink. 1oz vermouth will soften it and slightly more than 1oz will be the perfect way your wife will like it. Luxardo cherries are a must. Don’t go too cheap on your rye choice either and a great drink this will be.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: A classic recipe! I like to use Rittenhouse or Bulleit Rye. Dolin sweet vermouth is very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Outstanding libation of the soul!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: You have to have a basic understanding of vermouth before diving into this recipe. This recipe is fabulous (5 Star) using a good sweet vermouth. Those preferring drinks on the sweeter side can even bump that up towards a fullThe alternate recipe from Martha is also fabulous, but using dry vermouth makes it something other than a true Manhattan. There are also other high quality red vermouth on the market now

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: My favorite drink. I do not care for it with Bourbon though. I usually use a Canadian whiskey. It's strong, so I avoid serving it to novice drinkers or those who like sweet drinks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Classic indeed! I prefer to use bourbon. While I don't typically enjoy sweet cocktails, this one straddles the fence between sweet and smoky....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was given many years ago the recipe for 'the perfect Manhattan' as follows: 2 oz. 100 proof bourbon (like Jeremiah Weed), 1 oz. extra dry Vermouth, 5 drops bitters, 1-2 Maraschino cherries plus 1 teaspoon cherry juice. Serve over ice or not. You won't order it 'out' as others will not be as good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Been a favorite for almost 30 years.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great classic! Thank you for saying STIR...never SHAKE....it ruins the whiskey! We love it with bourbon.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Manhattan Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a true classic- bracing for sure but yummy all the same.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is dangerously delicious! We used Gretzky Canadian Cream because we didn’t have creme de cacao. This one is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is DEa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This recipe was absolutely perfect! I was worried it would be too boozy but it was very sweet and mocha-like in flavor. Bought kahlua especial on accident, thought it was a better option but really it’s 70 proof, still worked great

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was great. I quadrupled the recipe and didn't add the full amount of creme de cacao as I wanted more of a coffee/espresso taste. I also used Starbucks double shot espresso with cream in place of the brewed espresso which comes in 4 pk cans. It was perfect and I won 2nd prize in a beach party contest! It was tasty! I also added a few brewed coffee ice cubes to keep the drink cold

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
