cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Pinnacle Whipped vodka and topped with whipped cream - delicious. Sometimes I add shaved chocolate to the rim of the glass. Delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Espresso Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Smirnoff Whipped Vodka in this recipe. I felt like making this "fizzy" so I topped it off with club soda which cut the sweetness a bit. VERY good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Boring tasting drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This one is awesome. I moistened my glass with a lime wedge and then rimmed it with pink sugar. (See my picture) Added in some fresh cranberries and it was like heaven! Definitely making this one again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this with a splash of "Fresca". Very refreshing summer drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful and especially nice with vanilla vodka.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's even better with mandarin orange vodka!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I squirted my lime wedge into my drink, then just tossed the wedge into my drink. Very good. I loved the tartness of this drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Cape Codder Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: You can't go wrong w/a classic! I prefer to use Ocean Spray's Diet Sparkling Cranberry for some bubbles. I rarely have limes, so I tend to forgo the garnish. This makes a great weekend breakfast drink (especially if you don't live in Seattle and can't drink Manny's for breakfast...).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: i have made these for years but have never used pineapple juice or orange juice i like it better without them

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe, upped the rum and added pineapple slices to the blender.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really refreshing and creamy. We liked the cream of coconut, even though my husband isn’t usually a coconut fan.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent. I added just a tiny bit of grenadine syrup because we like sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love coconut, so I Love this drink. I used coconut rum and doubled the rum for extra kick. Very delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good I made a few more servings. I added a little extra rum & curacao only because one person I made it for wanted a little stronger. Otherwise, this was perfect .....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this last summer. Perfect as is, I changed nothing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really great. I will definitely be making this again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great balance of flavors.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: So refreshing and sooooo good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Substituted sorbe coconut juice for the coconut cream. Skipped the pineapple ring and cherry garnish. I did not really care much for the curaçao liquor flavor. I was expecting more of a Kailua mudslide texture, but instead it was more foamy or frothy. Which could due to the sorbe coconut drink that I used.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just sweet enough and totally delicious. Flavors were well balanced and tasted just as good as the ones we used to enjoy so long ago!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not one change and from what I can remember, this drink was terrific! Loved it exactly the way it's called for in the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just mixed up a batch for Father's Day celebration in a ratio of 1:1:2 of Parrot Bay Coconut, blue Curacao and pineapple juice and it was delicious! Will be on to round 2 here soon so I thought I should write this review first. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Loved it. One of my favs

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty, after making a pitcher my husband and I both decided it needed more of a punch and doubled the rum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great summer drink. Very refreshing and my family and friends enjoy. We make it all the time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUM. So freaking awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made this. So refreshing. Though I think I might try a little less cream and maybe a tad more pineapple

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is really good. To make it slushier add 1.5 cups of crushed ice. Also really strong pineapple taste so I'd recommend using a little less creme of coconut.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic drink!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: AMAZING

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe for my sister's wedding shower and it was a hit! I've since made them a couple more times for my own personal use

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served these at a party

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really awesome taste sweet and yummy

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did not have coconut cream, or light rum, so I used coconut rum, and the drink was perfect. Just like the one I get at Moxies.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: We tweaked it a bit, because we are island girls. We added a shot of simple syrup, shot of sprite, 1 1/2 oz coconut milk non sugar, tsp vanilla, 1 shot of sweet and sour, 2 shots of rum rather then one. It took it up a notch, and wow-ser it was great, delicious!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink taste like vacation...it is very nice, has a subtle coconut flavor and is well-balanced. I can only drink one (and I like to drink).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This represents all things that are Hawaiian. From the beautiful color of the ocean to the magical tropical flavors. I used coconut flavored rum which gave it an added boost of coconut. No Hawaiian party should be without one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect, tropical,beachy feeling cocktail that my friends loved!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: YUMMY! I made these drinks for my BUNCO group. They were a hit! Didn't know where to purchase "Cream of Coconut" but found it in the liquor store. Used 1/2 ounce of cr. of coconut instead of full ounce (on advice from the sales lady at the liquor store). They were wonderful! Start with 1/2 ounce of cr. of coconut and work up if you want more coconut flavor. I love coconut and 1/2 was enough for me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one drink that will keep you Cool in the summer time and transport you to PARADISE! ! My Sugar Bear and I went to the Yard House after the movies. I asked the waitress for one of these and Man was it Yummy! ! The only way to make it taste better would be if I was sipping it IN Hawaii :):) Thanks AR, its a Keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of my all-time favorite mixed drinks! I usually don't add the pineapple slice or cherry, since it's just me and I don't need to impress, but it's yummy nonetheless!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: My Lady Absolutely loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is so good, but to make it even better, I like to add to add a tablespoon or 2 of sweetened condensed milk. YUMMY!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm going to make this drink right now!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooo delish!!!! Omg I can’t get enough!! Must try!! Used whipped vodka and extra cherry juice!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I absolutely love this drink. In the past I had used vanilla vodka, which worked fine, but the cake flavor really does make it better. It's a really great, easy-to-drink cocktail :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious and yes ill make it again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Bam! Nice drink. Smooth and delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cake flavored vodka is what makes this drink!! This recipe is 100% my favorite drink, ever. I swear you can *taste* the crust of the cake when you drink this. Pure heaven.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink tastes JUST like a piece of cake! I found the Three Olives cake vodka at my local Total Wine and More. It’s delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I don't drink, but I was supposed to have a date at my house today. I was gonna cook for her and make this. Her favorite desert is pineapple upside down cake and I stumbled upon this when searching for a unique recipe. She said she wouldn't turn it down so I was gonna make it. Sadly, she forgot about the date so I made it for myself just to taste it and it's pretty tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: You can substitute Whipped vodka for cake vodka too .

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was a touch too sweet for me. I used La Croix pina fraise in place of the pineapple juice and it gave it pineapple flavor without being overly sweet. Thanks for the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe and loved it!! I made my own cake vodka using karkov and white cake in a mason jar after letting it sit for two days... and straining it, the cake was still edible just tasty and potent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it as directed. Also made it with a splash (0.5oz?) of Amaretto. My wife preferred the original, while I preferred the Amaretto version. Either way, these are tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Exactly how it's described! Made this for the ladies and they loved it. Could easily lose track of how many of these you polish off. Definitely a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you want to make a pineapple upside down shot....

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy enough to make by the pitcher. Taste just like the real thing. Though my husband wouldnt know since he claims never to have had it in cake form. Made ahead of time and kept chilled in the fridge. Done more drinking this week along with this stuff then all of last year...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always use whipped or vanilla vodka but I'm sure the cake vodka is good too. The big thing you are missing is a splash of amaretto. But maybe you don't need it with the cake vodka?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of my favorite drinks! I make it when friends are over. My one addition is to add a splash of cream. Yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is great. My husband and I both love it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing! It truly tastes like pineapple upside down cake! Very very very good! First attemp my "splash" of grenadine was too much - turned it red and a little too sweet, second try- perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm drinking one one of these now, they are very tasty. I'm planning to serve this at our Memorial Day party tomorrow, I decided I needed to try it first. It's nice and tropical, the cake flavored vodka actually does have a "cake" flavor. I don't often use flavored vodka, but when I do, I use Pinnacle brand vodkas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: OMG this is amazing!!!!!! you got to try it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: If you like a sweet cocktail then this is a great choice!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I LOVE IT!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this recipe for a gathering with friends and we all really enjoyed it. When just the right amount of grenadine is added, it really does taste exactly like pineapple upside down cake! We used Pinnacle's cake vodka to create the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is by far my favorite drink. If they don't have cake vodka - the cotton candy vodka is also good in this drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazingly good. I used maraschino cherry juice instead of grenadine and added a maraschino cherry.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cake in a glass! What's better than that?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: My Father in Law loved it. I dribbled a drop of the cherry juice into the bottom after pouring the drink, it didn't "mix" as much which added to the look/presentation of the drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word, "YUM!"

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cake vodka! omg.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very pretty drink, and very tasty too.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful light cocktail. The only adjustment my husband made was to substitute the grenadine with maraschino cherry juice. Big thumbs up from our friends at the last cocktail party!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this recipe a couple weeks back when I saw it on Pinterest. It really does taste like a pineapple upside down cake! This also works with Whipped Vodka as well. NOTE: If you haven't had a chance to try cake vodka yet, DO. I was skeptical until I tried it. Now I'm hooked.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just when I thought it couldn't get any better, it did! I used Three Olives cake flavored vodka and it's so sweet you can drink it straight! If you can't find it, the older version of this recipe calls for "vanilla" flavored vodka. It's also very good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: this drink is delicious. and if you cant find cake flavored vodka, vanilla vodka tastes similar (but cake is better)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: At first I said I wasn't too crazy about this but the more I drink it the more I like it. ;o) Made it as a martini with vodka whipped cream (almost more potent than the vodka itself!) Still going to try some chocolate cake recipes with it...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious and very refreshing. Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass. YUM.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: This sounds like a good drink for this summer on the boat! I can't wait to try it, but I've never seen "cake-flavored Vodka". I'll look for it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXECELENT drink for the summer. @ Anne, if you can't find the cake vodka (I've never seen it before either), use a 1 oz. shot of each Buttershot Schnapps, Peach Schnapps, Almeretto, and 3 ozs. pineapple juice. Use a drop or 2 of the cherry juice for the grenadine. This is the way I make it and it taste just like a liquid PUSDC

cocktail_reviews.Name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes great - JUST like pineapple upside down cake!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added some fruit, lemons, limes and oranges. Everyone loved it! I will definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my new go to drink for parties! Te recipe is great, I just altered it slightly and converted it into percentages for when I am doing smaller crowds. I use 30% sunkist, 10% Hawaiian punch, 15% dollar store pink lemonade 15% Tropicana orange-pineapple 20%everclear (or vodka if you want a weaker drink) and 10%Malibu rum. DELICIOUS

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Improvised with the ingredients, but used about the same varieties. Was delicious. Added Ginger ale as it needed something bubbly in it. I also froze my orange drink as mini ice cubes and added those throughout the batch. Helped keep it cool and not dilluted.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe! Made this for a friendsgiving. I halved the recipe - made about 3 gallons. I used tang for the orange drink, V8 fruit medley for the fruit punch, simply pink lemonade and simply oj with pineapple juice. Also used Bacardi pineapple. It was so good! Not too strong just the right amount of yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink was really good. It is a little strong, so i suggest cutting it in half. I will definitely make it again, it was a big hit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome! Huge hit! I did the recipe for 15 people, made just over 2 gallons.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good. I omitted the Rum through and just stuck with Vodka

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would give this 7 stars out of 5 if that was at all possible. I am a junior in college, and using this recipe, we threw two INSANE parties that drew incredible numbers of people. This is what we used: 3 Gallons of Tampico Orange drink 3 1.8 qt. cartons of Minute Maid Berry Punch 6 qts. Newman's Own Pink Lemonade 3 1.8 qt. cartons of Dole Pineapple-Orange juice 5 handles of Rubinoff Vodka (we're college students, we're broke) We did away with the white rum altogether, seeing as how it's expensive and low in alcohol percentage. This recipe was enough to feed 50+ mouths with multiple cups, and everybody absolutely loved it and have been literally begging us to make it a weekly thing. Absolutely cannot stress enough how amazing this mixture is; 2 solo cups' worth will have any person with a normal alcohol tolerance pretty buzzed. Again, 7 stars. Awesome.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Waaay more affordable than the real Jungle Juice. We mixed the alcohol with some melon balls and sliced kiwi the night before and put it in the freezer to chill then added the juices and soda just in time for the party to start. You still may want to provide ice nearby as it was closer to warm later on in the evening. If the recipe is followed exactly you will have a punch that is very close to 8% ABV (or about the equivalent of two lite beers per 12oz cup). Add a 750mL bottle of Everclear to bring it up to 10.5% ABV. Very tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. There are so many variations of fruit punch and many different brands of orange drink and pink lemonade. I tried to stick with as basic of what is called for. Taste like an adult version of a fruity tropical punch. Very adaptable to tweeks. If in mixed company of adults and children mix up the juice in one container and mix the alcohol in another and let the adults add the alcohol mix to their drink to their taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: reeeeeally good. i made half of this recipe for a crowd of 15. i used sunkist, hawaiian punch, simply lemonade with raspberry and v8 mango peach. as for the alcohol, a half gallon of vladamir and fifth of malibu coconut rum. in total, it cost about 40 dollars for everything.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for our New Years Eve Party and everyone said it was way to strong. Perhaps it was the recipe in ml instead of ounces or gal. Anyways all we tasted was the alcohol. I wont make this again...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this on Saturday for a big party, everyone loved it!! Great Jungle juice and I'll be sure to make this again and again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. Just what I was looking for. Brings me back to my college days.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple enough and great for brunch time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Back off a little on the champagne 1 part champagne and 1 part OJ is just as good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never done more than equal parts of sparkling wine and OJ , except to add pineapple juice to soften the tartness sometimes. I'm not much of an alcoholic beverage drinker, and this is how I use up the champagne and proseco that I accumulate as holiday gifts and party leftovers. I serve it for brunch or luncheon get togethers. Mix your own --- go straight juice or wine (kept in ice bucket). Now the mixers can add a dash of triple sec to taste. What fun!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Make sure and use a champagne that you enjoy. The first time I tried this using brut champagne as suggested here and I didn't like it. Much better with pinot grigio champagne , my favorite.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Mimosa! This is the perfect proportion of champagne to orange juice. I saw someone had made this recently, and I asked my hubby to PLEASE bring home a bottle of champagne! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: A mimosa for Brunch hits the spot. I did use 1/2 orange juice and 1/2 champagne. I garnished the mimosas with blueberries and clementine oranges. Some of my guests wanted ice. So, have ice on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent Taste!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Traditional mimosa. I made a few "additions" and modifications due to personal taste: I made it in a punch bowl due to the amount of people serving, so be careful to watch the measurements when using the All Recipes serving totals. We have a diabetic in our family so I made a separate batch for him that included a low sugar orange juice and mixed in a minute maid diet mango drink. For the adults I added in the left over cranberry juice and pineapple juice I had from the cranberry whip recipe I made. For the children I made a separate version (with the cranberry/pineapple juices) but used a carbonated grape juice for the champagne. All were delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: How can you go wrong?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cheers!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa
cocktail_reviews.Review: We usually use half champagne (or sparkling cider for the kids) and half orange juice and add some raspberries to the glass. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Review: A perfect ratio between the champagne and the orange juice. I also made a non-alcoholic version for my kids using ginger ale and orange juice, which was just as delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Review: Drink was good as-is but like everybody on this site does, I tweaked the recipe a little. Instead of champagne I used whisky and instead of OJ I tried ice. Perfecto!!!

cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great refreshing way to enjoy brunch with my girl friends..or Sunday brunch with the family...Delicious..and you don't really have to worry about the alcohol content being too much.. 2 thumbs up!

cocktail_reviews.Review: Mimosa are usually 1/2 Champagne, 1/2 OJ and a Splash of triple Sec to soften the OJ. Serve with or without ice. But all are good !

cocktail_reviews.Review: I drank a glass of this on Christmas morning, as it only has 2 Tablespoons of wine per glass. I talked to some people on the recipe buzz about the best "sparkling wine" to use. I found that the mid priced ones worked the best. I got a bottle of Moscato D'asti, for about $11 at a whole sale club. It is a regular sweeter white wine I like anyway. It is slightly sparkling, unlike French champagne. And, it is much sweeter than the lower priced dry sparkling wines. I also used a favorite oj without the pulp. The proportions are perfect in this recipe, just follow it exactly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Mimosa

Not something we'll have routinely, but it was a nice treat for a more elegant breakfast/brunch.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: The measurements are perfect. Do need to add in proper order. I could drink these all night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for a friend last night (forgot to get a picture of it) and she said it was so good she was trying not to down it in one gulp!! So that’s why it got the full 5-star rating from me!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: I only add a splash of cola and add it at the very end. Then just stir with a straw. Basically a White Russian with a splash of cola. If using a glass as big as the one shown in the picture, definitely add more parts vodka and kahlua, after all it is called a “Paralyzer”! ??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: A diluted White Russian with added Coke. I liked the fizz the carbonation of the coke gave it. Will make again with less coke and in a smaller glass, like a tumbler.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: Works perfectly. No curdling if you make the recipe in order they are listed. I clicked on this recipe b/c of your awesome user name.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was surprisingly good, as in they go down too easy good. I think this is my new favorite drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well I made one exactly as the recipe read, then I made another one exactly as the recipe read, then my rade anothur robe, and arothurrun... all joking aside this is DELICIOUS! Reminds me of a Black Russian, very tasty. I have to admit I got curious after a few and decided to mix a pineapple/coconut carbonated water instead of soda, it was pretty good but stick to the recipe you'll be pleasantly surprised.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is critical to note that you DO NOT add the cola and milk in any order, you must add the cola prior to the milk or the carbonation will curdle the milk. It is best to use a generic brand cola or to leave your "coke" open to the point where it is slightly flat. Bar cola is rarely ever very fizzy and it is the reason it works well in the drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: nothing better then an original paralyzer!!! thanks for the post.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is suprisingly pretty good. I can only drink one becuase the consistency gets to me after that.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was okay. Isn't this called a Black Russian, too? I think I've had it before. Not my cup of tea, but drinkable. I used Diet Coke and fat free half-n-half to cut calories but still get my drink on. ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer
cocktail_reviews.Review: I thought there was a little too much coffee flavor, but my husband really liked it. Next time I will use some of the other suggestions.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Paralyzer

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. Added a lil extra coke and SS for my taste. But it takes a triple recipe to fill this bad boy!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nothing beats fresh simple syrup and lemon juice. Don’t use the sour mix if you’re making it for yourself.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never use tequila in a LIIT. The tequila overpowers the flavor. Use a splash of Roses lime juice in lieu of.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty good, here in Australia over the bar you will be served full shots rather than half so basically double the American recipe. I like my lit with a bit of real lemon juice as opposed to the sweet & sour mix, but to each their own 👍 also I always use Cointreau for the triple sec as it packs extra punch!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best recipe; hands down! I've searched and tried at least 4 others, this recipe is how a Long Island should taste!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Have been using this recipe for a while now. It's been my go to and it's spot on. Haven't changed a thing. Thanks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Actually….it’s not the original. I remember when this was first created in the late 70’s….and those are not the ingredients. But that is a nice recipe for a very “sweet” version.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: We really like this recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it! Drank it! Made some more! Can't say how authentic it is being born and raised in Texas but I can testify that it's quite tasty and affective. I don't consume sugar or carbs so I modified it to my diet so instead of simple syrup I used a squirt of lemon stevia drops and lime juice and Zevia cola. Only other modification was to double the serving. 2 of these and you're in good shape.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the recipe I follow to make Long Island iced tea. The only modification I make is double the sweet sour. I've served this to many guests (and it'sa regular drink I enjoy), and they love it. Just be careful, because it catches up quick!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Gary liked it. I used 1/2 oz honey sour syrup (instead of 1 oz), making all parts equal.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: you'd think as many nights as I can't remember because of this witches brew, I would have forgotten how it's made. That is the recipe, and I feel there may have been a few times I took it intravenously as well. Such a simple concoction if mixed in the right proportions tastes like the nectar of the Gods, but one spirit out of proportion can have disasterous results. Get the alcohol proportions right in the first two, and all is good. after that, you won't care. If the first tastes off balance, I usually have them add a shot of Roses Lime Juice as the most effective first aid(don't waste it), and watch the second being poured and accurately measured. A word of caution: DO NOT TREAT THESE AS SHOTS. Bad things will happen.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: One word, Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Superior Black Rum for its extra flavor and superbe color. 1 for 1 alcohol/coke ratio is just fine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used Margarita mix instead of sweet and sour mix.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome. The best recipe I have found for this drink. However you can’t have more than one.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just about the exact same way I make it. Though I usually do the cola by "taste" which ends up slightly less than called for herein. Still, you can't wrong w/this mix as stated and for the bartender that gives it 3 stars? Just remember, most bar prepared long island teas taste awful in comparison to this recipe. (Cheap sweet & sour mix? ) Not for certain why the bars usually aren't as good as I use well brands to make and so much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like it, i go a little lite on the gin.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Only thing is I would make my own sweet sour mix, 1 cup fresh lemon juice, 1 cup lime juice, 1/2 cup water and 1 cup sugar. Heat solution and mix. Chill before use. Stays good for about 2 weeks in refrigerator.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is AMAZING! Sooooo much better than what you get at a bar. I

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great flavor, smooth, best recipe I've found for long island iced tea

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I live on Long Island NY. From a native, a couple pro tips: Double all the volumes. Use simple syrup (sugar water) and juice of 1 lime instead of sweet and sour mix. Substitute a splash of Jaegermeister or Red Bull for cola.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Word of advice. if you buy triple sec that is liquor free, put 1 oz. Of each liquor in and it tastes great. I always made it 1oz of each liquor 1 oz of alcohol free triple sec 2 oz of sweet and sour and cola to taste. I bought triple sec today and it was 40 proof so it was very strong. made it as recommended above and its perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: One of the best LIIT I've had in a very long time, I was worried it would be over powering but it was very smooth going down!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I will definitely make this again

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: It was great!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you Sledge! I finally have a "go to" Long Island recipe that is oh so close to exactly how we like it. I will likely up the ratio of sweet and sour mix a little bit next time, but love it made exactly per the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've made this several times, and it is delicious! My husband loves liit and he loves this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: While bartending, I had always used sprite or 7up instead of sweet and sour mix. The newly 21 year olds loved them.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it with the sweet and sour mix. Eh. Read more on liit and made my own simple syrup. So I mixed the sweet and sour and used 1/2 oz simple syrup and 1/2 oz FRESH lemon juice. World of difference.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Strong, tastes sooo good! First real drink I made at my house :) I could get into this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made exactly as instructed; fantastic Long Island Recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Definitely not. Tequila is wayyyyy too overpowering. Does not taste like tea. I notice other recipes increase the sweet & sour and the coke. I will be trying that next time.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so delicious. It somehow seems to cancel out the alcohol taste and there-in is the rub...you could easily drink these in the same quantities as you would regular iced tea. Don’t.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love it. This thing is delicious. I would increase the serving to three when attempting. One serving is a very small glass.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will absolutely make again! Keep in mind this requires a tall large glass! Loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made a homemade, sugar free simple syrup and added elmons and lime juice to it to replace the sweet & sour mix. Other than that, followed the recipe to the T and it was great!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: A 'real' Long Island does not have tequila in it... That was added much later.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: It tastes just like I remember!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! This is so yummy but will kick your butt

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love it!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a little more sour mix and less soda and it was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made one of these at noon on my day off and let me tell you what a great way to spend an afternoon! Anyway this recipe tastes amazing as is but for me a good amount of coke and a bit less sweet and sour made it perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: He's right... This is exactly how one should be made and how it should taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added a little more of the sweet n sour, triple Sec ( orange flavor ), and the cola! YUMMY

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is very potent. I cant figure why there is no tea listed as an ingredient.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will surely make again!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not yet thinking about adding something to give it a unique taste. It is great so far but I'm looking for awesome

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I woulent change a thing this recipes is awesome. I want to try it with homemade sweet and sour, I think that would taste even better. Thanks for the recipe its now a favorite in our basement bar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe! I did a couple of things differently: 1. I abhor store bought sour mix, so I used simple syrup and lime juice; 2. I used Orange Caracao in place of Triple Sec. It turned out wonderfully and I've been using this recipe's ratios for years.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made one and I thought it was great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yep. This is the original, all right. Oh, yeah!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: It tastes good

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe even on a budget! I made this using pretty cheap alcohols and it turned out great. If you are going the cheap route, I would recommend adding a little extra cola. Great choice! I cannot taste the alcohol in it either.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect LIIT recipe. Absolutely perfect. Most places I go to make it too sweet and not strong enough. I feel like i'm getting cheated at those places.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a simple syrup instead of the sweet and sour mix and squeezed in some lemon juice. It's really good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Long Island outside of my favorite pub!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: As a bartender, I would add that instead of one fluid ounce of sweet and sour, fill your glass 2/3 of the way, then add a splash of Coke. Otherwise the ratio is off and it will be too strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was a bartender in the 80's and this is how I made LIT and I had a 3 limit I would severe per- person , but I worked in a restaurant bar ,, I'm from Arkansas I was having a hard time with all of the other peoples LIT's Thanks For Sharing The Real LIT,,,,,!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Did not change anything and just follow the original recipe and this is the simplest LIIT to make. Thanks Sledge for sharing this wonderful drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: EXCELLENT! I used extra sweet and sour though and extra diet coke otherwise it was too strong. Will keep this one as the only one I make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: When I read the ingredients after reading the hook line, "The REAL Long Island Ice Tea", this brought back memories of how my grandmother made this as my wedding punch about 40 years ago. Everyone talked about this slamming drink and wondered what were the ingredients. Yes this is the REAL thing! My grandmother wouldn't tell me the recipe except in excerpts; I finally got the recipe out of her over the years! I say enjoy but be careful because the smoothness can cause you to forget there is alcohol until you go to move of your seat. LOL!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Do not exceed four of these unless you like the spinning room effect. You forget how much alcohol is in there because it's so good. This recipe is by far the best of all I've tried. I'll definitely be keeping stocked for it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was plenty strong, and tasted WAY better than what you pick up in a normal bar. If you want it a little less "strong" you can double the cola. And I know it's not "authentic," but the first time I made this, we actually didn't have cola on hand, so I subbed with ginger ale, and it was pretty dang good that way too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a terrible recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I did not know that tequila was in a "real" Long Island. I made a couple of these for me & my husband while we prepped for thanksgiving dinner. If we were to have had more than one, we would not have finished. It was really tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is great. I usually mix a bit more sour mix with the drink but after two of these you are feeling pretty good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: The best ingredients!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just made one following directions as given & it turned out delicious!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This IS the Original and Famous LIIT recipe! You got it so right Sledge! and guess where I am from Long Island, NY! The only thing I do differently is put it all in the Tom Collins glass and then roll it into a shaker and back in the Tom Collins glass and then garnish with lemon!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Even better quadrupled and shared with three friends :D

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yess -Yess !! It is the real thing!! I had the recipe from ,of all people, my Father.But I lost it!! Thanx !! Tiggy

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yep! That's it. Pure and simple!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the way to make a LIIT-Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
cocktail_reviews.Review: I will gladly verify that this is the original PROPER recipe for long island iced tea.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: 2020 Christmas Day. Put in a crock pot to keep it warm. Smelled great and was delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: This one is too strong. Instead, use a ratio of four bottles of wine and one bottle of 80 proof. While delicious, the high alcohol content creaps up on you to the danger level. We love glug and had it for many many years. Just don't make it this strong.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: very nice flavors... easy to make ... Think it is going to be a tradition

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like the glogg I remember from my family way back. Lighting it on fire is always fun too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful stuff

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this every year. Wonderful recipe. I use two bottles of port and three Cabernet Sauvignon. I also cut back on the sugar. I prefer it less sweet. You can’t go wrong with this on a cold winter night sitting outside by a fire. Warms you to your toes. Thank you for sharing this awesome recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed commenter Cynthia Lerner's suggestion and made this in a percolator. I divided the wine and liquor by five -- 1 bottle of port and 1/5-bottle (5 oz.) each of bourbon and rum -- but used the same amount of spices as called for in the recipe. Put the spices in the percolator basket, turn it on and let it run its cycle. I made this on Christmas Eve. I measured out the ingredients ahead of time so it was quick and easy to make. People loved it, especially the way the alcoholic fumes go up your nose when you drink it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loves this and asks me to bring it to the yearly Christmas party. I make a crockpot full and never leave with leftovers. Skol!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been making this for years (decades, actually) and love this recipe. It's great to serve at a Holiday party instead of having to set up a bar. I use the same wine and spices, however, I cut the liquor to one 750 ml liter of brandy. The advice given is very good, use really cheap liquor and wine, the spices completely rule the flavor. I also cook this is a 30 cup percolator putting the sugar, spices and fruit in the basket. I also cut up and use a whole orange. By the time it perks thru its done. Serve from the coffee pot so it stays warm.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: your grandfather with using bourbon in Sweden before 1920 huh. That seems rare.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: This stuff is really good and really strong. It sneaks up on you! ;)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good. I couldn't find port wine so I used cabernet an d it wasn't to too sweet, which is great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: AWESOME!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is very good. I even make it Uganda. Everyone likes it. We use it as a sundowner. Georges from Kampala.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! For years we've used a recipe from some Swedish neighbors, but I thought I'd mix things up this year and try this recipe. It makes a LOT, so I cut it roughly in half but used about the same amount of spices. (And for a very non-Scandinavian touch, I used some watermelon-infused vodka I had on hand from a summer party and substituted dried cranberries since I was out of raisins.) It was a huge hit Christmas eve! Great idea about pouring back into the bottles for storage, BTW.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I grew up in Sweden and still have family there and visit on a regular basis. I have had and made my fair share of glögg, including my grandmother's recipe. This is by far the best one to date. I don't even drink bourbon, but enjoy including it in the glögg. I'm still trying to grasp how good this recipe works. It's simply the best! That said, I made one modification: I doubled the amount of cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves. I also don't put the spices in a cheese cloth...just strain after it has cooled down a bit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I grew up in Sweden and still have family there and visit on a regular basis. I have had and made my fair share of glögg, including my grandmother's recipe. This is by far the best one to date. I don't even drink bourbon, but enjoy including it in the glögg. I'm still trying to grasp how good this recipe works. It's simply the best! That said, I made one modification: I doubled the amount of cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves. I also don't put the spices in a cheese cloth...just strain after it has cooled down a bit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made a smaller version to try it out for a dinner party and it was gone halfway through the night. Delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Working on my 2nd batch. This will be a winter staple from now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: The volume of the chatter at mom's last Christmas increased five-fold as soon as a few of the ladies had a few sips. Absolutely delish and perfect a few weeks later when ice skating on the canal in Ottawa Canada in -15C weather.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Never tasted Glogg before and have always wanted to. Made this last week and it was a bsolutely fantastic! Will be making every year. Out of 6 bottles went through 5 of them last night at a holiday gathering. Was a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is a touch strong, but really tasty. Fantastic for a really cold night. May add a few more cloves and another cinnamon stick next time. Will definitely make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great Glögg Recipe! I love that Port is used in place of traditional Reds, which tends to make me really sleepy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like what my grandfather used to make. Warms the heart, and the blue flames make a spectacular show that will break the ice at even the stiffest of gatherings. Sometimes I use rum instead of whiskey. Can adapt this to non-alcholic, one liter apple juice, one liter cranberry juice, one lemon sliced. Add the same amount of spices and simmer.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made last Christmas...very good! Tack sa mychet!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a must during the winter holidays in our house. I have been to some large Danish parties where they use gallon jugs of Sangria with the addition of the other alcohol so I may try that. You can also serve raisins and dried cranberries soaked in dark rum on the side along with the slivered almonds. A truly wonderful drink that will get a lot of comments from those who may not be familiar with it. A definite party maker!!! Skoal!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Winter and freezing cold outside, but a glass of this Swedish Glogg made a whole lot of warmth inside.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
cocktail_reviews.Review: Growing up with a Swedish family this was a staple of Christmas, the smell is so sweet and wonderful. This is exactly how my father makes it. Be prepared though for the kick and don't expect to drink too much!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: At age 60..never had a martini.. so time to try. I'm not really an alcohol aficionado... Smirnoff vodka and martini and Rossi vermouth.. was ok.. frankly not my "drink" ..to heavy of "hard" spirits " taste.. Whiskey sour more my flavor...like a "sweeter" taste with less liquor taste. I can see that just 2 or 3 of these I wouldn't drive..and I'm 6'2' 260.. one was enough. I used 3 green olives with pimentos... And just regular ice cubes out of the tray.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used blue sapphire gin instead of vodka. Delish!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Classic. Classy. Refreshing. Adult.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Classic Beyond delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is perfect. A vermouth wash is not a vodka martini, it's just a glass of vodka with a vermouth wash. If you want a vodka martini with a wash, scotch is a popular choice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Don't forget ONE amazing addition: a drop of Worcestershire. It's what all of the fancy NYC bars do. I read it once in a magazine and I've had it with that little drop ever since.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added 0.5 oz of olive juice and it was perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too much vermouth. I had to add about 2 more cups of vodka to get this to a flavor level that I could drink. And distilled beverages really should be stirred.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it -- proportions are good (please don't tell me to rinse the glass with vermouth -- you need to be able to taste the botanicals). I added a dash of fee brothers orange bitters.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Woooo good if you like a strong drink. Would definitely make again. Went by the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Citron Vodka NO Vermouth -- very chilled & frosted Glass, a sixth of an inch of very frozen ice on the bottom of the?? Glass garnish with two hand stuffed blue cheese olives

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this drink after watching some classic movies. They always referred to drinking martinis! I do not drink alcoholic drinks very often, but I have had an apple martini. The vodka martini is a very strong drink. Not at all for occasional drinkers, if it doesn't grow hair on your chest, hair will grow somewhere!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Less vermouth! The first one I didn't care for, the second with about 2/3 of what the recipe calls for was much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I add a dash of orange bitters for a little additional flavor. Use Russian Standard or Tito's

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Both my husband and I have never had a martini before so we really do not know what if it compares to anything but we really like it. I am not a fan of green olives but in this drink they are the bomb. My husband like his dirty with a bit of olive juice and i like mine neat. either way this is a great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used Grey Goose and jalapeno stuffed olives for a little kick. Good & good for you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Okay for a fair or poor quality vodka. Vermouth take away the gasoline aftertaste. FIRST don't skimp on the quality of vermouth. Even the best vermouth is fairly cheap. The "Perfect Martini" = Chill a Martini glass AND store the vodka in a freezer or refrigerator. Fill a steel shaker with ice then pour in a good dose of QUALITY vermouth. Shake once or twice and then pour it out the bulk of the vermouth or until the shaker first just starts to drip (if you like a dry Martini) . Now you have the perfect amount of vermouth covering the ice in the shaker. Pour in 2-3 oz vodka, (If you have the means, Begluga Export or Gold line... or) Use a good quality Vodka (Belvedere, Kettle One, Grey Goose, Russian Standard Premiums, Stoli Gold) Shake slowly so as not to bruise the vodka (infuse with air and ice chips) until you feel the steel shaker frosting up. Dump the ice out of the glass and pour the shaker contents down the inside rim of the glass. I use a 1/4 inch thick lemon rind or if I want "Dirty" I go with two Queen olives freshly stuffed with Dutch BlueCheese. Skol!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the ratios to make two Martinis, no olives, added a 1/4 tsp of lime juice for the 2 x beverages. Makes for a great Friday night relax!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect vodka martini. There are lots of variations on the ratios of vermouth to vodka, but I've found I like this best. Especially with Grey Goose Citron vodka. Yum!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been using this recipe for many years. The secret to a good Matini is good Vermouth with any Vodka or Gin.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect, simple vodka martini recipe. First time martini drinker (my wife) liked it. Use a high quality vodka - I used Russian Standard Platinum. Easy, tastes great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect Martini! I also like to add a dash of the olive juice. YUM Be sure to use good quality vodka.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: You can't go wrong with this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: thank you for sharing a basic martini recipe! I had to wade through dozens of sweet or gin recipes to find the perfect one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Rum is much better than bourbon.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’m not too familiar with hot toddy. It was pretty strong but tasty. I did a touch more water

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe. I change the whiskey to dark rum…. Just because rum doesn’t treat me as badly as whiskey lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made with 8 oz of decaf black tea and added the whiskey last to preserve maximum alcohol content. It was fabulous!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent recipe, we used rye instead of bourbon or whisky. It balances is better to bring out the spices with the sweet.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great toddy to warm you up during a cold night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I simply used Celestial Seasonings Bengal Spice tea and added the honey.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect sundowner or cold remedy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious. I used brandy instead of whiskey because I like brandy better, but I will try it with whiskey some time as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: A comforting drink when fighting a cold to help me sleep.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Only change was ground cloves and ground cinnamon - delicious and soothing for my cold & sore throat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great drink. I used pecan flavored bourbon and orange blossom honey. It was excellent.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was the first time making this. Made it for a terrible cold . Followed the recipe but replaced bourbon for the whiskey. And a lemon zinger tea bag . Not to bad. Definitely will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: 1st drink was amazing!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was quite tasty and comforting. Just what I needed for my head cold.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good for a sore throat. I followed the recipe as written. Don't triple the recipe like I did; the whiskey adds up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I added another oz of boiling water, another teaspoon of honey, and an extra slice of lemon, juiced, so that that whiskey flavor was not so strong. I personally enjoyed it much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yes! I used Bengal Spice tea by Celestial Seasons. Lemon juice and honey...and of course the whiskey! Idk if I feel better, but I feel better! lol

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe for when you have a cold or cough. It helped more than cough syrup for my flu related coughing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always double the recipe and it’s my “go to” in the evening when I’m sick. I keep telling my kids, “Sharing isn’t always caring.”

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband has a terrible bronchitis, and his coughing is painful to listen to. Had Bushmill whiskey on hand, and made it for him. Said it helped better than any of his other cough meds. This is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband has a terrible bronchitis, and his coughing is painful to listen to. Had Bushmill whiskey on hand, and made it for him. Said it helped better than any of his other cough meds. This is a keeper!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am currently sick as a dog. My Dad used to make these when we were sick, though I used to think they were nasty back then. I followed the recipe almost exactly, but used Blackberry brandy instead of whiskey. It’s Delish! Hoping this “cures” what ailed me. Thank you!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for a cold or just a cold evening.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very strong but I liked it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: It turned out great but you have to be bit careful with the measurements of water and whiskey and honey, as a miscalculation in any three can lead very different tastes. I will definitely make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's a simple recipe and I followed it. I will make it again. Be careful, that hot whiskey gets into your bloodstream very quickly!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: A simple yet relaxing drink to comfort the body. Made this for my husband. The next morning he said he slept sound and woke up feeling much better and refreshed! He asked for another one the next night! Ut oh, I may have started something...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it. idk, I had boiled water in my tea kettle and when I mixed the ingredients, the toddy wasn't as hot as I would've preferred. Plus, I don't think I'm a bourbon girl.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Followed the recipe, except started with a Tazo lemon tea bag and used Evan Williams honey bourbon. Delicious. Save yourself some extra work. Just make a double to start with. Still have a cold, but I am feeling better ; )

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy, quick and nice flavor.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was feeling a warm drink on a cold night, no cold or flu at all. I had to quadruple the recipe. Wow this knocked me on my bootie! Delicious but took me awhile to drink

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: No changes and yes will make again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good recipe, made my sick husband sleep much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I normally put a tea bag in it ...I like it better with the tea bag

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very delicious and soothing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: As my grandfather was fond of saying, "It may not heal you, but somehow you won't care as much."

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a powerful drink! I used Good Scottish whisky, 12 year old Glenmorangie! I didn’t have a cinnamon stick so I used a tea bag with cinnamon in it and closed it up with a twist tie and hung it in the drink over the rim of the glass. It did help my sore throat and I slept pretty good too!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: We used Apple Crown instead of regular whiskey so it was more like a grown up apple cider. It was really good and cleared us both right up.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted a bigger drink to last longer so I used 4 oz water, 2 oz JD, 2 thin slices of lemon, 3 cloves and 1/2 of a cinnamon stick. Tasty tasty tasty

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My girlfriend doesn’t drink bourbon but loved this for a sore throat.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had a friend who used to make this for me. I never really knew how to make it but I had some whiskey around the house and somehow I seem to have caught a cold. Thanks to this recipe I was able to get a little bit of an old friend and a little bit of warmth back. I really hope this works is great as her recipe did, but I am sure that it is really good and it was definitely worth making.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used tea as recommended- definitely helped. Used an decaf Earl Grey tea.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it with Crown Royal Apple for a slightly different flavor. Very tasty!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Easy to make and I used 2 drops of doTerra's OnGuard essential oil instead of the cinnamon and cloves- amazing flavour and so much easier! I feel better already...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made this toddy to help me get rid of this sickness I've had all weekend, and I gotta say it feels nice going down my sore throat. I popped a tea kcup in my keurig and brewed the large size cup, which I believe is 8-9 oz. I added honey, 2 oz of jack Daniels, a few whole cloves, dash of cinnamon and nutmeg and had to use my bottled lemon juice since I had none on hand. Adjusted the honey and lemon to taste and it was perfection! Hoping I feel better in the morning.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: For those trying to combat a cold and sore throat I recommend 2 oz bourbon, 1 fresh, juiced lemon, 1.5 Tbs pure maple syrup, a pinch of cayenne pepper, and 4-6 oz boiling water. Cheers

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a decaf green tea with the water. I just realized I only used 1 oz of whiskey (Jameson) instead of 1 1/2, and it was still good. I was feeling a little under the weather, and this helped.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a vanilla Earl Grey tea and it's pretty good! Just hope it helps my headache and sore throat!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I can feel the wonderful numbing effect as it goes down my throat. It's not a mug-full but the tiny amount is powerful. Will make again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I put more honey, and no nutmeg. All in all, very good for my achey body and sore throat.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I would make it again. I used Stash brand Chai tea as the base, instead of plain water. 3 cloves, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 tablespoon honey, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 2.5 tablespoons bourbon (I don't have regular whiskey around). It's definitely potent, but good. I think I'm developing a cold, and I hear people drink thes for that. I can see why!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wow! Great Christmas drink for a cold night by the fireplace. Great proportions. One shot of water microwaved for 45 sec, then mix a shot of whiskey. Used sprinkles of the spices (2 light sprinkles for cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves). No cinnamon sticks on hand. The honey and lemon were great for the sinuses too, smooth going down. Highly recommend! Used with Crown Royal and Maker's Mark. Preferred with makers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made these by the recipe before and it's very good. Had a sore throat and was super tired on a very rainy day today so I kicked it up a notch and it was sooo good!! 1 peppermint tea bag 1 chamomile tea bag, 1/4 tsp pumpkin pie seasoning, 1 tsp honey, a long slice of tangerine rind, a dash of cayenne and two shot glasses of smoky scotch... Very strong an soothing and perfect

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I haven't made it yet, but the recipe says to add the cinnamon and cloves, but cloves are not on the list of ingredients...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious.... really opens up the sinuses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great just as the recipie suggested!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use Ginger Brandy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: No yes I will make it again. It's a good single shot recipe. Take it at bedtime and sleep sleep sleep.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I changed this up a little bit from the original recipe. I did 8oz of hot water, 1 1/2 oz of jack daniels honey, 2 tbl spoons of honey, a dash of cinnamon, and a lemon slice. I can't taste the jack which was the whole point for me. The honey and lemon together make the drink taste awesome. I will be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was perfect. I doubled the honey, water and whiskey (I used brandy), and just added a dash of cinnamon since I didn't have sticks. I also removed the lemon and cloves after five mins so it wouldn't be too strong when I got to the bottom. It turned out great and my throat feels much better. I recommend having one just before bed to help you sleep.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love it!!!! it Helps with my tooth ache I used jack Daniel's Tennessee honey and I don't care for cloves or nutmeg so I left them out

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: A cold is in progress, knew I needed something special. Altered the recipe a bit. Used bottled lemon juice, a couple of Tbsp. Did away with the Clove. Used Honey whiskey. And threw in a Celestial Seasoning Bengal Spice tea bag. Someone should patent this stuff. it is so good!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic!! My husband and I are both sick. We couldn't be more wiped out. This brightened our evening for the first time in days! Thank you for a great recipe! Cheers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best hot toddy recipe.....a huge hit! Definitely my go to recipe

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! I have a cough along with everyone else and this definitely opens the chest

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Best Hot Toddy I ever made! I love cinnamon and nutmeg. I didn't have sticks, so I just used regular cinnamon. I also didn't use honey but maple syrup instead! Oh...plus spiced rum for me a whiskey for my hubby. So good! My throat is warmed from all the spices and rum. I may have to make another.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for my cold. This helps me through. I pour the water over my favorite bag of tea for added relief to my sinuses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a very strong Hot Toddy recipe. I recommend if you drink this (especially if sick) to be ready to crawl into bed to drink this and stay in bed, do NOT go outside or try to do anything after you drink it if it's cold weather especially. Do not walk the dog after, just go to bed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: As an Irishwoman.... A little tweak. We use the same amount of whiskey (preferably Powers or Jameson) but use 1 teaspoon of white sugar Instead of the honey. One slice of lemon with the cloves pushed through the lemon, hot water, not boiling, and enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was so skeptical, but after having numerous sinus infections in the past 5 years, and annoying cough spells from my horrible environmental allergies, I had to try an alternative. Nothing OTC works for me and none of the prescription meds help either. I just made this for the first time and I can breathe out of both nostrils, my ears aren't clogged anymore, and I'm not coughing for once. It made my chest and sinuses feel so much better!I'm thrilled and can kick myself in the butt for not trying this sooner!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I Substituted the water for ginger ale.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Husband and I totally enjoyed this with a small slice of fruitcake. :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome recipe! I made it with Sleepytime Vanilla Herbal tea as the base, and used Jack Daniel's Winter Jack Tenessee Cider. Sooooo good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sublime recipe when you have that scratchy throat "think I'm coming down with something" feeling, or need a winter's night panacea. I add a little extra honey, and some extra hot water, but otherwise perfect as is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very Yummy! I made mine with a tea bag as others had suggested.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made me feel better, but that was probably the alcohol. Since I'm not a big fan of whiskey, I used Spiced Rum. It was really good! I did squeeze the juice from the lemon slice into the drink after letting it steep for five minutes. I think I may add a green tea bag next time just for the health benefit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just what the doctor ordered! Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this to help knock out a cold this winter and enjoyed it so much I'm continuing to use it - just in case. I think RAW honey is an important thing to try and get so you get all the enzymes. But, don't boil it and kill the good stuff. It's hard to find and sometimes costs more but see if it makes a difference for you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! And a great way to help my cough. :) I would double the recipe, though.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent (but potent) as written. Personal preference- I added 1 batch as written to 6ish ounces strong tea with a little extra honey.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty classic, although the cinnamon and nutmeg not so much. Honey, stud the lemon slice with the whole cloves (keeps them contained in the lemon so they're not floating where you might drink one), whiskey (bourbon is tasty), and hot water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh ya! Love me a hot toddy and this recipe is great! Warms the soul and so relaxing! Used pinches of spices in the recipe as did not have cinnamon sticks or whole cloves- tasted great!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really worked to soothe a nagging cough. Also good with brandy. I used more the second time I tried, may try the tea bag as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Since I don't like the smell or taste of cloves, I left it out; used a little more nutmeg instead. YUM!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Only thing I changed was to make it with rum instead of whiskey---rum's my favorite thing. Oh...and I doubled the recipe. ;) MMMMMMM GOOD!! ?

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: You might try it with apple cider instead of water or tea for an interesting change.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My mom used to make Hot Toddies with orange juice and gin or vodka - cured anyone's cold and made them go right to sleep!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
