cocktail_reviews.Review: Liked this, although I've always preferred to make my hot toddy's with tea, and brandy with a tablespoon or two of honey and a teaspoon of lemon juice. I usually do about 6 ounces of boiling water with the tea bag and 1 1/2 oz of brandy for my wife and 2 oz for me :) Very soothing and very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hit the spot. Made my cold more bearable. I made this with tea. Great stuff! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Jack Daniels is the cure all. I've always made this with a full cup of hot tea instead of 2 ounces of boiling water, in the past. However I like to follow a recipe as close as possible when rating it and I followed this one to the letter. It is awesome! I love the taste. (To be honest I probably wouldn't drink it without a sore throat, but it tastes great against my sore throat. I topped mine off with two moonshine cherries (cherries soaked in moonshine) and I feel great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This works really well with Apple Cider instead of water. Yummm-O ! and my cold symptoms are forgotten for the night.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: strong but my throat feels better

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Many years ago I had a nasty cold that wouldn't quit. Grandpa gave me this recipe and told me to drink it sitting in a hot tub of water. Then dry off quickly and get into a warm bed and cover up with a down comforter and not throw the covers off. Boy, did I sweat that night. By morning the sheets were soaked, but my cold was gone! Now my wife has a nasty cold so I'm off to start boiling water. Cheers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I think it made me feel a little bit better!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used this recipe for a really sore throat, and I used a spicy tea bag along with it. I didn't have a cinnamon stick, so used 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon and left out the lemon. Next time I think I'll use either apple cider or apple juice. I'm happy to report that my sore throat is gone! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a lemon zinger tea, lemon juice b/c it was all I had, and filled the cup with hot water. Perfect for the crude.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I know it sounds strange but my father used to give me a hot toddy for woman problems and it did the trick every time. It gets rid of a nasty cold quickly. It is great as a relaxing night cap or for self medicating though that is an every now and then thing.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've never had a hot toddy before but this had the nice warming punch that I was looking for. I have a toothache and this helped with it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Can't wait for a cold or sore throat.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Use this when I feel a cold/cough coming on. I brew a regular sized cup of decaf tea and leave a little room at the top. Then I add the juice of 1/2 a lemon, honey, and whiskey - I am not a big fan of the flavor of whiskey so go light on that, probably use a half of a shot glass. Very soothing and relaxing on a rainy night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Use this when I feel a cold/cough coming on. I brew a regular sized cup of decaf tea and leave a little room at the top. Then I add the juice of 1/2 a lemon, honey, and whiskey - I am not a big fan of the flavor of whiskey so go light on that, probably use a half of a shot glass. Very soothing and relaxing on a rainy night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I just made these for a friend and myself and they were fantastic. The only thing I added was some shaken whipping cream on top - but they tasted awesome either way.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well don't tell my boyfriend but he had the most horrible and annoying cough, he swears cough medicine doesn't help and refuses to make a dr. apt. Sooo, I made this drink for him about 45 mins ago and I have not heard a cough from him yet!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to make the water recipe but I also had juice from a fresh orange and 1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla. I also add brown sugar and a cinamon stick like another user suggested. It always helps me feel better and get some sleep!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made it with tea, like others suggested. It was nice to have a warm beverage, but it didn't have a lot of flavor. However, I will keep this in mind for when I get a cold.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: These are great for sore throats and the flu (or whatever else is ailing you). I leave out the cloves - personal preference. Bourbon works well in a pinch if you don't have whiskey. I got sick right after Thanksgiving and this was the only thing that gave me any relief. My husband thought these were gross, that is until he got sick shortly after and wanted me to make him one.......

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this with tea instead of just hot water, I'm not a fan of watered down whisky. Didn't have lemons so I used lemon tea instead. It was delicious. My throat feels great and I'm nice and toasty warm. I would definitely make this again

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My favorite drink recipe to have after shoveling the snow. Only change I made is that I can't wait the five minutes to drink it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: It did nothing for my stuffy nose but after drinking the hotty toddy (and no I'm not drunk and I do know how to spell the title of this drink), I sure didn't care about it. Goodnight ya'll! Oh wait. I did modify after tasting the final results, which tasted like watered down whiskey. I made hot tea and combined the 2 drinks. Served with "Fresh Pea Soup," "Italian Peas," "Fried Broccoli," "Pumpkin Seed Beer Brittle," and "Ham and Cheese Bowties."

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This drink is the silver lining of getting sick. It's soothing, great-tasting, and knocks me out within 20 minutes. Thanks for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: The spices are a great touch. It is so soothing on a sore throat. Thank you so much for the great recipe! I can't wait till the next time I have a sore throat.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Except for the lemon, I add a pad of butter with some brown sugar. AND I use Meyers Dark Jamaican Rum.. Best hot toddy, hot buttered rum ever.Used to bartend at a ski lodge, now there were some happy skiers after a day out in elements. No colds the next day. hahaha..

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the suggestion in an earlier comment and used tea instead of water. I happened to have 'gingerbread' herbal tea, and so I omitted the spices, which simplified the recipe for me. We enjoyed it and will make it again. Thanks for the inspiration!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: My late step dad used to make this for me (as a young adult of corse)and was just thinking about it the other day and went looking for the recipe, this is just the ticket, Thank you so much for posting.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good - but better with tea (Constant Comment a good match!!)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Didn't have whiskey so used vanilla rum and a hit of orange liqueur, on top of a constant comment green tea bag. Honestly I've been blowing my nose all day so after a few sips, not feeling tipsy, but the heat is helping to clear stuff out. I'm sure I'll sleep well tonight! thanks for the post

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This really helped to relax my cold-addled brain and soothe my raw throat. Thanks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I've been using this approximate recipe for several evenings now as I have a cold. It is definitely comforting.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I should get sick more often! how come this tasted so awful when my mom made it????????

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I also made it with a tea bag. Added more water. Didn't have the stick cinnamon or cloves so just used a bit of cinnamon sprinkled on top.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe, but I changed one very important thing- I added a tea bag in the first step. I used orange spice tea, but I hear earl grey is pretty good, too. This gives the Toddy a bit more flavor, so it doesn't taste like hot, watered down whiskey. I also used burbon, and it warmed me right up!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to put the cloves into the lemon slice. Maybe just for fun...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh My! Definitely cleared up my sinuses - works almost as well as NyQuil. I don't think I'd drink this for pleasure, but I'll give it two thumbs up for medicinal purposes.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for two flu-sick people, who are staying with me at the moment. It warmed them up and also it shut them up ;) Just the ticket!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: The spices are a great addition to my traditional honey, lemon, whiskey, and water hot toddy recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very good. Nice and strong and it helped my cold symptoms marvelously.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this one night after a blizzard. We were out all day building the abominable snowman and we rewarded our efforts to a hot tod. It definately hit the spot. I'm keeping this one on my favorites.Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Strong, but very soothing. Kinda made me sleepy *LoL*

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very nice. I'm really a light weight, so this relaxed me quite a bit. I don't think it cured my cold, but it made me not care so much about it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made mine with bourbon. MMMMMM!!!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I didn't like this much my first try, but being a whiskey fan I thought I'd give it a couple tweaks - mainly making it with hot tea rather than water, and a liberal douse of honey, and it was divine!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm feeling the first signs of a sore throat, so I wanted a hot drink. This was very tasty. I didn't have whiskey so I used Rum instead. This only fills up about 1/5th of a coffee mug though. If you want to fill the mug, you'll need to multiply the ingredients by five (that should knock you out for the night!) or else add a lot more water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a nice recipe. I would change one thing however, that is to use Whisky instead of Whiskey. Being Scottish myself, it just has to be... :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: very strong, but good in the winter when it's too cold to barhop.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really think there may be an error in this recioe. I was using an ordinary 8 oz drinking cup so I made this with water amount 6 oz. Otherwise, this is a decent recipe. I have the flu and made it tonight, it was very easy to make.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Hot Toddy
cocktail_reviews.Review: This tastes great and will knock your socks off, so don't have one too early in the evening!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple and easy, also must have is a dash of horseradish. DELISH!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: We Americans call it a Bloody Mary I like the clam juice. A lot of people don't think of that!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Nice

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm giving this recipe 3 stars because a ceasar is never made with tomato juice. The character of the drink is derived from clamato juice and tomato juice lacks those flavours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the closest recipe to my preference. I use tomato juice and clam juice. Instead of Worcester I use liquid smoke. Great recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am a serious Caesar lover like a lot of us Canucks [Canadians]. I was pleased to find a great one at the Royal Hawiian sp in Waikiki. Chili's there had no idea what I was talking about, but states close to Canada like Washington, do make a good one. Not to promote a product because I have no vested interest in the company, but Mott's Clamato rocks the Caesar. It comes in reg. , spicey, pickle juice, everything[has horseradish and spicy] and lime. When you visit Canada stock up and find your fav. I have tried the tomato and clam juice combo in a pinch. IT is pink, cloudy Not a substitute in flavor at all. Season with rim of celery salt or montreal steak spice or just salt and fresh pepper. Garnish with pickled hot green beans, celery, pepperoni, olives or pepperoncini [hot pickled peppers] my fave.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had this drink for the first time when I was on a fishing trip in Canada. I add some horse radish into the mix along with some black pepper. Its best with fresh home made tomato jucice and clam juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'll be honest you'll not find this pinkish looking drink called a Canadian Caesar at any bar, restaurant, or night club in Canada. They are all red in colour and don't look like you had a few too many coming back up and out colour. That is an improperly made drink the consistency is off the mark.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I was looking for a bloody mary recipe (can't stand bottled mixes) and found this. Yummie! From now on I am using this recipe to make my liquid treats.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like Bloody Mary's but the tomato juice is so thick. Had my first Dirty Caesar -- as it is called -- on a Princess Cruise in Alaska last week. Some very friendly Canadians told me about the Clamato juice. SO much better.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: The photo doesn't do any justice to this great Canadian Classic! If you use just tomato juice it isn't a Caesar! That's the difference between a Bloody Mary and the great Caesar - Tomato juice vs Clamato juice. You can make it with tomato juice and just add clam juice/liquor from a jar. If you're lucky and have fresh clams use their liquor. Using a lime wedge to rim the glass. Use a plate use Celery salt, Cayenne pepper, Chili powder dip into the mixture. A teaspoon of each would be enough for four glasses. Make a pitcher and rim each glass individually. There no straws involved here, you take a sip from the glass, hence the reason it is rimmed with all those goodies. I was in Louisville, KY recently and asked for a Caesar, they didn't have a clue what I was talking about. Their loss. Hail the Great Canadian Caesar!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: little bit of horse radish, even make it with a gin if you have it on hand, nice flavour pairing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I agree with the other comments. You can now find Clamato juice in Arizona. My friends were amazed when I introduced them them to a Caesar. They thought it was much better than a Bloody Mary. I am from Ontario and spend part of our winter in Phoenix. We were surprised to find a restaurant that made the drink. Yes, add more spice to it. This version is du

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I gave this 4 stars because it is a fantastic drink worth making. I am from Calgary, Canada (where the Caesar was born). This is popular in Canada, but know that tomato juice is NOT a substitute for Clamato. This drink is meant to be spicy as well, so beef up the hot pepper sauce (Tabasco is what it SHOULD be made with). As was said in previous reviews, there is no replacement for Lea and Perrins Worcestershire - don't try to substitute - it won't work. Try 2 tablespoons Dill pickle juice, but the clincher is to add a couple of shakes of Montreal Steak Spice. Takes this great drink over the top.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love my Caesars with a spicy pickled green bean and a squeeze of lime juice along with the other ingredients. Perhaps a couple extra shakes from the Tabasco bottle as well. I also add a pinch of salt and pepper before I pour in the Clamato juice.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Love my Caesars! They're awesome!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of my all time favorite drinks! Only, here in the states (namely Texas) it's called a Bloody Mary. The closer to the boarder you go, the spicier it gets! I start out with a tall glass rimmed with margarita salt and Add ice. Layer 1.5-2 oz. of vodka (or tequila if you want a "Mother Mary or you can leave out the alcohol for a refreshing "Virgin Mary"), 1/5 oz. Worcestershire sauce, 2 tablespoons green olive juice, a dash of Tabasco sauce, squeeze a little lime wedge in there, add some celery salt and fresh ground pepper to taste, then fill with Clamato. Stir and garnish with lime wedge, celery stalk, and green olives. All done! You can also make this by the pitcher! Did I mention I was a bartender? Enjoy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect starter recipe, eh? Double the vodka , Tabasco, Worcestershire , throw in a pickle and I'll take two ;) Cheers! The rim needs to be coated with a courser salt. (celery salt added in the salt is even nicer)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a good start, couple of things missing so wonder if this is an American version of a truly Canadian drink or not? Needs to be spiced up a lot more, see the others suggestions. I myself like it to be a bit more spicy. I use the Extra Spicy Clamato Juice, put about 10 shakes of celery salt into the drink, use no other brand of Worcestershire Sauce than Lee & Perrins, (others just don't imitate the original Worcestershire, and yes, I came to Canada from England, close to the county of Worcestershire so take my word for it on this one) .... it is a nice drink if you add a pickled green bean or pickled asparagus in it rather than the celery. The celery is a bit dull for such a nice spicy drink. The lime wedge is a nice garnish, but I add lime juice (about 1 tsp.) to the drink itself as well. Also, I add the ice last, not first, it's easier to stir with the pickle (or celery if you insist) as the stir stick.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! Best drink ever!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a great basic start to a Classic Caesar. It's always fun to add your own spin to this drink and I found a splash of the brine from this pickled egg recipe went very well in this Caesar. http://allrecipes.com/recipe/popas-pickled-eggs/detail.aspx. Thanks for sharing ambibambi.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: Add one tablespoon of pickle juice! Garnish with pickles, olives and hot peppers

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is good.I added a spicy bean and a little shaved horse radish. Also from Vancouver and you can find a number of variations up here.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Classic Canadian Caesar
cocktail_reviews.Review: I live in Vancouver, B.C. Canada and indeed this is often the drink of choice. I was dismayed when we were in Hawaii years ago and couldn't buy Clamato juice. This is a great recipe and I hope you all enjoy it as much as we do here.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: The Blueberry Tea cocktail has been a favorite of mine for many years and I usually ordered them out but rarely made them at home. I use a nice Earl Grey in mine instead of the Orange Pekoe and I think it's a very nice alteration. Favorite winter time soother!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I like to drink this when I’m sick with a cold too. I steep fresh ginger slices with the tea and add honey. Makes me feel better and helps me sleep.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this as described and it was lovely. It was so good that I finished that drink and immediately made another. My husband didn't like his, so I poured his over ice and drank that as well. Even better on ice. Is drank a real word? My only criticism is that it is potent and delicious and I am drunk. Next time i.will double the tea and halve my consumption. ACES!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this cocktail. I enjoy making it with an earl grey tea.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: The classic west coast version of this is slightly different. Add a muddled wedge of orange to the sniffer and a cinnamon stick. Also consider a good Earl Grey such as Mighty Leaf to accentuate the citrus flavours.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: And what makes it better is a tbl spoon of whip cream on top!! So good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Blueberry Tea Cocktail
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is a great tea to relax in the evening. It will send you to bed with a smile

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasted just like the Glühwein I had in the Christmas markets in Belgium and Germany! Perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Made this for the first time this year and loved it! Not overly sweet and just enough spice to warm you up on these chilly winter nights!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is my go to recipe! I have been making glühwein with this recipe for at least 10 yrs! Simple and excellent! Never fails

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband is picky and even he loved it. And so simple.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Merry Christmas to all! I made a double batch of the recipe but swapped the 1.5 cups of sugar with 36 packets of Stevia to reduce calories. It was easy and actually took less time to turn to syrup. Ausgezeichnet!! Vergelt’s Gott!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! I also added anise and a few pods of cardamom. Also, I used a shiraz and cut the sugar down to a little less than 1/2 cup. It was a good decision, 3/4 cup of sugar would have been too much.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! I added some star anise and a few cardamom pods, and reduced the sugar by half. This is a favorite for sure!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Me and the neighbors LOVED this sitting outside handing out Halloween candy. Will be making this again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is EXACTLY like the original you can buy in stores. Will definitely be saving this recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I always thought mulled wine to be a waste of red wine. So I made this with white wine. Still delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Added peppercorn!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was very easy to make but was far too sweet for our tastes. I used a Chilean carmenere for the wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was too sweet for my taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’ve never had mulled wine that I liked until I tried this. Fantastic! I added a bit of Cointreau and was careful not to let things boil. My suggestion: make more than you think you need if you want extra for later; you’ll likely not have leftovers.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’ve never made anything like this and it was delicious. Definitely in my favorites file. I added a handful of fresh cranberries it was really yummy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: We recommend cutting the sugar in half. We squeezed 4 mandarins instead of an orange. The outcome tasted like Glühwein in Bavaria. Proßt!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Reminds of the winter festival in Switzerland!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is a holiday tradition for me! It’s so simple to make yet amazingly authentic. After living in Germany for three years, I had to find a good recipe for Gluehwein and I found it with this. Thank you!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Seir gutt. very tasty version of my days in Austria

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is perfect, I've been making it for a couple years now. It's now a family tradition to make this on Thanksgiving and Christmas.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: So yummy, I wanted to drink all of it, but I shared it anyway. I will make it again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I’ve been making this for several years in the winter and my family loves it! It’s easy to make and makes a great gift!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used this recipe for this year’s Christmas party and it was loved by all! Doubled all the ingredients since there were about 12 guests. Keep the evaporation in mind and accordingly add a little bit more water and wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasty! I used the juice of 2 oranges, omitted boiling the orange halves in the syrup, substituted 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves for the whole cloves, and used 3 cinnamon sticks. Made this way the recipe tastes like the beverage sold in the Chicago Christkindlmarkt.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Growing up in Germany I drank gluhwein every Christmas, and this comes very very close to the real thing. I just remember it being a little stronger, maybe they added a bit more "umpf" in my hometown haha

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Used the water, not OJ. This was really good. Reminded me of my days in Austria.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a good cabernet sauvignon. Came out fantastic!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just got back from Germany and wanted Gluhwein like from the Christmas markets. This is very good. I didn't even have whole cinnamon or cloves so I used my regular powdered spices and I could not feel any gritty spice in my drink. I would use whole spices for company and nice glass cups but plan to keep using my giant economy size cinnamon for personal use this winter.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was just like the Traditional Gluhwein I had Wiesbaden Germany at a Christmas Market last week. I made a double batch and added some allspice berries. It was not quite sweet enough so I added a little cranberry juice and it was perfect!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As is, will most definitely make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: have made this several times, and love it! i tend to add spiced rum into my mug before i pour the recipe in, as i like the extra alcohol. delicious with and without!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As a German Immigrant I am very familiar with this drink. My family always drinks it on Christmas Eve as traditional festivities Very delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great easy recipe that tastes fantastic when done. Just like in Austria!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My mom is from Germany and she always made this for Christmas eve when we opened presents. Unfortunately, she had gotten to an age where she doesn't remember what the measurements were. This tasted just like how she made it. The only thing different was she didn't add the orange but I am sure it is a nice touch. Thanks for sharing and keeping our Christmas Eve tradition.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Good. Used a bottle of Merlot. Best when very warm.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the second time making this for entertaining friends. It's always a big hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Reminds me of Germany in the winter time!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Big hit at our Christmas party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use red velvet red wine. I followed are other recommendations to use orange juice in place of water. Some of our guests commented that the wine actually tasted better on ice. I noticed it got sweeter towards the bottom. A reminder to give it a stir while serving it. I will be making this over and over.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Came out perfect! I didn't have any whole cloves and substituted them for 1/2 teaspoon ground clove and it worked great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes like I remember it. Probably would've saved an hour if I knew to leave the lid off during the simmer/reduction.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Outstanding recipe. As SERVANTMARA suggested, I replaced the water with orange juice for more zest (same quantity) and I used 12 cloves (instead of 10). I used a Bordeaux wine called Louis Eschenauer. It was to die for. I will definitely make this again on Christmas Eve with the family.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super yummy! I first had Gluehwein at a German Christmas Market here in town and fell in love. This tastes super similar! I'm diabetic so I altered a little bit and doubled the recipe. For 1.5L of Chianti red wine, I used water and only half the sugar...however I used 2 oranges instead of 1 and half a grapefruit. I'm excited to keep experimenting with this base!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: So simple to make and soo soo good on a cold winter evening!!! This recipe is going in the box for later!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tastes exactly like the one we enjoyed in Germany. The quality of the wine matters though, so choose with care.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Simple & delicious... like Christmas in a glass. What's not to love??

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Outstanding recipe! My husband and I make our own wine, so. . . I decided I wanted to make a Christmas wine this year. We made a Beaujolais . After it went through its entire fermentation process and was ready for modeling, I then made this recipe to add to it. I multiplied the recipe, cut back a-bit on the oranges and added some of my own other spices! The taste was incredible. After simmering the entire pot we added it to our wine and then bottled two cases for friends and family for Christmas! Here’s hoping they love it as much as we do!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Making it for the second time. It is really good for the holiday season. Made as written with a cheap red table wine and it was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just like the Gluehwein we've enjoyed at European Christmas markets. A little extra spice does not go amiss. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I followed the rest of the reviewers suggestions and substituted orange juice for the water and it turned out so much better than I could have ever thought. My only complaint is there is no point in making a single batch, its just too good.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Always a huge hit at family gatherings. I use brown sugar instead of white and it never seems to get thick and syrupy but maybe I get too impatient to drink it, it's good nonetheless. I double it and put it in a crockpot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way to sweet! I would cut the sugar in half, maybe even more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled the recipe for a party. Everyone enjoyed it. There was a little left so I poured it back in a wine bottle. I reheated it later and it was still delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As the name indicates, it was a very easy recipe. I did not expect the gluhwein from Christmasmarkt in Germany, but the taste was in the right direction. It was delicious.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: We had a bunch of people come over and this was a hit!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is best done with merlot or pinot noir

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Really good! I used OJ instead of water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just back from the German Christmas markets and this Gluhwine beats them all. Next Christmas this will be the recipe of choice for all our guests.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I loved it! I also used orange juice instead of water. It was a bit on the sweet side, but the flavor was incredible. It made an excellent christmas drink!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I trippeled the amount for new years eve, fantastic, The pot was empty everybody loved it, great recipe easy to make. . We used Yellowtail, red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I've made it 4 times now and have even tripled the recipe. It takes me back to the Weinachtsmarkt in Deutschland and is a huge hit at parties, with family on Christmas and great for New Years too! I make it in a typical pot on the stove and once the wine is added and heated, I strain it into a crockpot to keep warm. I use a Merlot from Gnarly Head. It tastes great and makes you feel so warm and fuzzy.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was one of the best mulled wine recipes I have tried. Great flavor, I added a little brandy to it as well.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Awesome and easy recipe! Also did not use water, opting for orange juice instead. Overall amazing! Felt like being in Germany all over again! Next time I'll use less sugar and a less expensive bottle of wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is amazing! The only thing I did differently was use orange juice (no pulp) instead of water and I cut the amount sugar in half because I didn't want it too sweet. I also added 5 cardamom pods along with all the other spices. I made it with Cabernet Sauvignon. Everyone loved it and kept going back for more!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super easy, quick and delicious

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit at my party!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it as written, but I quadrupled the recipe for large group. After it was done I put it in a slow cooker on low . There wasn't a drop left at the end of the party. It was a great hit!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is the perfect balance of spices to compete with any Christmas market in Germany. I have made it for years and do not change anything. I make the syrup days in advance and mix it with the wine just before the party.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Reduced sugar to 1/2 cup; added a few peppercorns, 1 tsp grated fresh ginger, 2 anise stars and 1/4 tsp cardamom

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used raw can rather than white sugar otherwise followed the simple directions. Unfortunately the orange lacked really good flavor so I did add a splash of juice. It was wonderful.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Served 3 years in Germany and this IS what they sell in the Christmas Market :) Saved all our gluhwein mugs and this does them justice, love it! BTW, if you have a lower-sugar palet, don't make it with orange juice, stick to water :D

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Super good! I used a whole orange and a bottle of red wine, tastes amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: The flavor of this was great but it was slightly too sweet even though I love sweet wines and desserts....I suggest not replacing the water with orange juice as others suggest and cutting sugar back to 2/3 cup if squeezing the juice of the whole orange in. I used Merlot. Thank you for the recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Tasted exactly like German gluwhein. Really pleased with it. Id change very little but found two cinnamon sticks were nice, a little less sugar and a little more water or replace the extra water with orange juice and it'd be perfect. After cutting the orange in half, put the cloves in the orange halves before squeezing the orange as it becomes much harder to put the cloves in when it's already squeezed.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used brown sugar. And one more trick. You don't need to warm up a glass if you put a clean tea spoon in it while poring. Then just remove the spoon. Voila!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely the perfect winter drink! Delicious! The first time we made it with a very nice zin and WOW! The second time we used a cabernet and it was also fantastic! It seems that it doesn't really matter what kind of red you use, which is great. Makes it really versatile. We will definitely keep this recipe!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Things I changed: I used 7 cloves instead of 10. I added 1 cardamom pod. Of the 3/4 cup sugar; I split it 50:50 white sugar, brown sugar. For the red wine: I used a red blend (Llano signature red: Cab sav, merlot, malbec). I thought this was way too sweet. Also, I had mini mandarins, so I used 1.5 of those instead of 1 orange. In my tasting, I thought some almond would be a nice addition. I added a touch of amaretto to the mug, it tasted good. When I make again, I would use 6 tbsp brown sugar and almond slivers, or 4 tbsp brown sugar + 2 tbsp amaretto.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am from the Northern region of Germany and we serve ours with a shot of SoCo,Amaretto or any other

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I use this recipe every Christmas

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm giving the recipe 5 stars even though mine took extra work to be drinkable! They didn't have either of the red wines I had hoped to use, so I got cupcake merlot. It was not at all like the spiced wine I had at a German restaurant, but I added honey to make it taste okay. I want to make it again with wine I like, because it was the merlot itself that did not taste good. I hoped the spices would fix that, but it didn't.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious and cozy on a winter night. My hubby lived in Germany for a while and he says this is just like the stuff he had there.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great recipe on a nice cold snowy winter night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I liked this recipe! I added a little less sugar and I think If I were to make it again I would use maybe half the sugar.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Turned out really good. Though after reading reviews, had done some modifications. Added less water, and replaced it with orange juice. Also, added little bit of nutmeg, star anise and 1/2 inch piece of ginger while boiling the water (step 1). Thank you for sharing the reviews and this amazing recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: It is spelled glühwein, which means so much as wine which makes you glow with warmth

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent! Just made it for 2014 Christmas. I wanted to surprise my siblings who joined us at our house since we are of German descent. Everyone loved it! since I make my own homemade wine, I have tried it 3 different ways. But my first batch so far was the best, using Cabernet & Concord with the original recipe. I am definitely starting a new family tradition. WEEZ

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Pretty authentic, used orange juice in place of water and it gave a great flavor. Perfect for warming up on a cold winter day.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: fantastic!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thanks for the recipe! I added another cinnamon stick & a few more cloves. This was perfect! I was missing the spirited German Christmas Markets we experienced last year. Your recipe helped bring some of the cheer to my home this year.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As the recipe stands, I give it 4 stars because I think it's too sweet. But that can be easily rectified by making the sugar syrup as in step 1, setting half of it aside, then continue with the recipe as written. When finished, add more of the reserved sugar syrup (or not) to taste. Forget Christmas, this is wonderful all year long! Oh, and to give this a Swedish twist, serve with raisins and/or slivered almonds in the mug. Absolutely divine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Each time I visit Germany, I try to make sure it's at a time when I can hit a Weinachtsmarkt and drink glühwein. This is an excellent recipe! I didn't use sugar, but rather six packets of Splenda. I realized this was about 2/3 the sweetness that I would have gotten using the amount of sugar in the recipe, but I figured I could add more later, if need be. (6 packets were just right.) I did strain the glühwein before serving and then just put it back in the pot and set it on the kosher setting on the stove. After all, I didn't want the alcohol to cook off.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am German and have had lots of Gluehwein in my life, funny enough I never made it myself, since you can simply buy it anywhere in Germany. Since I've been in the US for many years, I looked for a recipe and I really enjoy this home made Gluehwein, it tastes great and authentic and I like that I can vary the ingredients if I want to, such as adding more orange joice, or adding spiced rum. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe, it brings a piece of home to me :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Just came back from Germany and the Christmas markets and we were craving some Gluewien. I also used orange juice instead of the water and added 2 more cinnamon sticks. It was exactly like the Gluewein in Germany this way

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent winter drink! Like others I used more OJ than the one orange, but otherwise made as directed. Our au pair from Austria says this is just like what they drink at home. Will be a holiday favorite at our house from now on.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I doubled this recipe using half orange juice and half water. I made this with a cabernet from Sam's. It was a hit! Just like I used to drink in Germany.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: The recipe, as is, is a bit too sweet for me. I had to add another half bottle of very dry red wine to get it to my liking.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Excellent!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: A great, tasty treat. Thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Too delicious! I'm not even a wine drinker but this has changed me into one!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect! Would not change anything!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is so good! We will be making more of this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I make this every year. I lived for 2 years in Germany and loved the Kristkindlemarkt gluehwein. The smell filling the house is WONDERFUL, and brings back memories of walking around the market with the sounds of the traditional oom-pah-pah band in the background. Fantastic.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful spiced wine! Very simple not a lot of expensive ingredients. I followed the recipe until the end when I added 2 more cinnamon sticks while heating the wine. Nice, spicy, and warming. I'm thinking about adding some black peppercorn next time to see if I can get a spiced wine with a kick

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I really liked this spiced wine - I think next time I will put a little less sugar in it (I think 1/2 cup would be fine). I'll definitely make it again - my friends and I enjoyed it today after our wreath making session - it's very festive!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband and father-in-law are born and bred in Germany. They said it tasted just like Gluehwein should! Yummy and makes the house smell wonderful!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This makes the best gluehwein! I've served it numerous times now, and I think it does taste better with the orange juice instead of the water, and reducing the sugar somewhat. I've also transferred it to my crockpot to keep warm, and used it while sitting around the firepit. Fabulous! Thanks for sharing this recipe, Else!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely fabulous. Compares with the ready made imports we get at Christmas time, only the orange gives it a fresher taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Hi from Turkey. This recipe is the best I tried so far, all family loved it so much. I added 2 orange, 1 I squezed in 2nd I added in slices and instead of removing I left all ingrediants in it. Even 6 days later the taste was amazing. Have a great Gluehwein. Thank you for this great recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Cheap wine is the best!!! Seriously! My husband and I fell in LOVE with this drink while on vacation in Bavaria, Germany. We made this drink with an expensive bottle of Merlot, then did a second batch with a cheaper brand (Barefoot Merlot...$5.99 a bottle). The cheaper brand DEFINITELY had the RIGHT taste and smell! Reminded us of being at the Christmas Market at Marienplatz in Munich -after the following changes. The things I did different was scale back the sugar to 1/2 cup and used orange juice instead of water (and still used the whole orange) per bottle. Done this way...it's like you're getting the drink straight from Germany!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very tasty! A little sweet for me the first time I tried it, so cut the sugar and water back to 1/2 cup each, and it suited my taste much more. Thanks to Else for sharing the recipe!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe was good with the orange juice instead of water, however the orange flavor was a bit over powering I recommend making a balance between water and orange juice to suit your taste. Still in general it was a great recipe, defiantly worth a try.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! Like other reviewers I used orange juice instead of water. I put the cloves into a tea ball to steep instead of shoving them into the orange skin (it was too tough and I broke a few cloves trying).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love this stuff!!! I've made this exactly as written for years and wouldn't change a thing. This is the best time of year to enjoy it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This a our new fall/winter staple!! I, too, used orange juice in lieu of water, cut back the sugar a bit and used a Shiraz. My boyfriend doesn't like wine at all, but absolutely loved this. What a great find. Thanks for sharing

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Sooooo good with a few changes. Instead of boiling the water with sugar, I boiled store bought orange juice. I did not push the cloves into an orange peel, I just threw them in at the same time as the cinnamon stick. After 30 minutes I added the wine and then I added more sugar, orange juice and water to taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved this recipe at our Thanksgiving dinner. Delicious, thanks!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: We love this! I am an Airforce wife currently living in Germany. And let me tell you, this is WAY better than the stuff they serve at the German Christmas markets. I made it for our Christmas party, but I used orange juice instead of water as the other reviewers suggested. I couldn't believe how easy it was to make either. Everyone loved it and asked for the recipe. This will be a tradition in our home every winter...Thank You ELSE!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a hit, although it was too sweet for me. But people came back for thirds! The smell was awesome too. I did NOT do the OJ, but rather followed the recipe and moved everything to a crock pot. If you have a crowd, I recommend doubling this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As many others have previously said, I too have fond memories of drinking Glühwein at many a Christkindlesmarkt when I was stationed in Germany. I recall being so surprised that I liked it because I typically drink Spätlese and find red wines such as Merlot too bitter. I made this with Shiraz, as a few reviewers suggested, to keep things on the sweeter side. I also used orange juice in place of water as many reviewers suggested. I think using a cinnamon stick and whole cloves are genius as ground versions would overwhelm it. I have tried many other Glühwein recipes and been sorely disappointed, however, this tastes just like the Glühwein I remember. Thank you, Else for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As many others have previously said, I too have fond memories of drinking Glühwein at many a Christkindlesmarkt when I was stationed in Germany. I recall being so surprised that I liked it because I typically drink Spätlese and find red wines such as Merlot too bitter. I made this with Shiraz, as a few reviewers suggested, to keep things on the sweeter side. I also used orange juice in place of water as many reviewers suggested. I think using a cinnamon stick and whole cloves are genius as ground versions would overwhelm it. I have tried many other Glühwein recipes and been sorely disappointed, however, this tastes just like the Glühwein I remember. Thank you, Else for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is really good! I did cut back the water and sugar to 1/2 cup each. Everything else the same. Since I am the only one in my family that drinks wine I had to put most of this back in the bottle after it cooled. I thought it tasted better after it sat in the fridge for a couple of days. I like this hot or cold. Thanks for sharing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was incredible! I left it on low heat for about an hour to keep it warm and it reduced down a bit to a sweet, spicy, rich nectar. So my mistake made it even better! I'm making it again tonight.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Absolutely delicious! I prefer white wines over reds but decided to try this after tasting a "Christmas Wine" at a local winery. This tasted better than what they served! My husband asked me to make sure that I double the recipe the next time and to please have some when his mom comes over for Christmas dinner! I'll be serving plenty of this... It's gonna be a very Merry Christmas! :-)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is simple and makes brilliant Gluehwein

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yum! We live in Belgium and have been going to all the Christmas markets here, Germany, and Holland. Our favorite part of the markets is drinking the different Gluehweins. I'm so happy you posted this recipe!! Used orange juice instead of the water and it was wonderful!! Will become a winter staple in our house now.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: very good...can't wait for real cold weather and make this and drink it while walking down the streets with nicely lit christmas docoration...get a bit of European atmoshere if drinking in the freezing cold in a christmas atmosphere...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummmmmy!!! I added a little apple cider.....unbelievably delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: No need to buy mulling spices with this recipe (seriously, I picked up some mulling spices at the store and realized that the ingredients on the package were the same as the ingredients for this recipe). This was soooo good! The only thing I changed was the amount of sugar, I used 1/2 a cup instead of 3/4. I also tried this with apple cider and it tastes great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fantastic! I used orange juice in place of water and reduced the sugar to about a 1/2 cup. I used 4 cinnamon sticks and even added a few dashes of ground cinnamon toward the end. Often, I like to add a few splashes of brandy. It makes it a bit more potent, which is especially nice if your wine got a little too warm and some alcohol evaporated. I've already made this so many times, I had to make sure I put my review in.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was a big hit! Very tasty.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this on a ski trip with friends. everyone loved it! Nice warm pick me up after a cold day on the slopes. I may try it next time with a little less sugar, seemed a little to sweet to me.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I even impressed my German friends. I used OJ instead of water and used a ton of cloves. Because of being crunched for time I made the 'sauce' several days before my christmas party, leaving in the orange, cloves and cinnamon. Reheated, strained the debris and served ... AMAZING!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Delicious! The only thing I would change next time is to cut the sugar down to half the amount. I used OJ as other reviewers suggested, for extra flavour. Looks pretty too in the Irish Coffee glasses.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Quite tasty. Try to pierce the orange with the cloves before you cut the orange. It is quite difficult to pierce the orange skins after the orange has been juiced. Do not worry if you are unable to pierce the orange skin with the cloves; just place the cloves and the orange flesh/peel in the sugar water. I strained the beverage as I poured it into the mugs.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used a big bottle of Cab/Merlot and used OJ instead of water like others suggested. I also cut back on the sugar. This was delicious and a big hit at my party. Will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I love Gluehwein my husband lived in germany for the last three years and it is truly a favorite when you go to the christmas markets i'm pregnant this christmas so none for me till next year. An it is a quick way to make you warm happy quickly.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I am an American living in Holland and I make this recipe every year during the holidays. I also add a splash of cherry liqueur (Kirsch) and place pitted cherries (NOT maraschino) in the bottom of the mug before serving. Everyone loves it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: very good. i have a thermos pitcher and it stayed nice and hot in there. brought to a halloween party and everyone loved it

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: PERFECT!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have been making the recipe since it first made it's appearance on this sight years ago. I make a double-batch, exactly as written, and it is always a hit. There is nothing like the way it makes your house smell. I am hosting Thanksgiving at my house and my guests have already checked to make sure we will have plenty of this around for those cold Michigan nights.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My husband made this exactly as stated. We used a cheap red table wine. It was delicious & tasted like what we've had in Europe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This recipe is now a Christmas/any chilly day favourite. Followed recipe as is and it turns out perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Well, if we had followed the recipe exactly maybe it would have been better. It was way too sweet for our taste. We used orange juice instead of water, as suggested by many people. If you are a wine drinker, especially a dry red wine drinker, don't use orange juice. It makes it too sweet! I will still be looking for another good mulled wine recipe. The search continues...

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Found this recipe after trying Gluehwein at the Chicago Chriskindlmarkt. Tastes just the same, delicious!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is an amazing recipe. It tastes just like what I drank while living in Germany. I made it for a bunch of friends for Thanksgiving and everyone really loved it. I kept getting compliments. That said, I used 2 bottles of cabernet sauvignon by Yellow Tail. I then doubled everything else but may have added a bit more sugar since I didn't measure exactly. The only thing I changed was I used mulling spices that I picked up from the store. I just put those in a large tea ball and let them steep. I also combined all the ingredients at once because I wanted a good portion of the alcohol to burn off. Everyone I know loves this and I give out the recipe pretty much every time I make it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Everyone loved this recipe at a party that we hosted.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Thank you for this recipe. We put in less sugar, some rum - wunderbar!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great - only a couple things I did different - substitute water w/ OJ, 1/2 cup sugar instead of 3/4, and 2 cinnamon sticks instead of 1. What made it great was how incredibly easy it was!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I can understand why a lot of people would enjoy this-- for me, though, it was just too sweet, even after DOUBLING the amount of wine. BUT-- it was easy to make! And I found that allspice was a suitable substitute for the cloves, which I didn't have on hand.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy and easy!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Fabulous recipe! I thought doubling the recipe to use two bottles of wine would be more than enough for my small Christmas party, but it went over so well I ended up making another "double batch." Merlot worked well, and as recommended, I kept it warm in the crock pot. I may try reducing the sugar next time as it is definitely very sweet, but in no way over the top.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This wasn't as good as I was hoping. I didn't really taste any of the spices, and I added extra. It was just warm wine for the most part. Took it to a Christmas Eve party and not many people drank it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great for a holiday party that I went to. I used OJ instead of water, and it gave it more of a warm sangria taste. Very good! I used merlot. This was easy and fast. I will make it again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I lived in Germany for several years and have missed gluehwein tremendously. I found this recipe this year and tried it using the recommended orange juice instead of water and a merlot for the wine. Amazing! Just as strong and fume-y as I remembered it (you'll see)! :) I will definitely be using this recipe again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Will be making this regularly during the holidays. Double this for sure - if you are having company. Kick it up with a shot of brandy when serving. Puts it over the top! I used an inexpensive red wine (zin) and it was perfect.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'd never heard of this, let alone had it before. I'm not a big fan of red wines, so I thought this was just okay. I drank the whole batch in two days, while it was snowing outside. Certainly, this is much better served hot; if you don't drink it quickly enough and it gets cold, it doesn't taste nearly as good. I made this exactly as written. However, the sugar/water mixture didn't get "thick and syrupy" within 30 minutes; maybe it's my elevation (6200 feet), or maybe I didn't have my "simmer" set high enough. I hope that wasn't a crucial part of the recipe. I also didn't get all the juice out of the orange halves (squeezed by hand), but they were pretty large, so I got a lot of juice anyway. But thanks for an introduction to this kind of drink; perhaps I'll find one that will "wow" me someday. Oh, and the wine I used was a 2006 California Shiraz (by Charles Shaw).

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is a bit sweet for me, but the spices are really great. I used a Zinfandel. Next time I may use something a little drier, just to offset the sweetness a bit.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: WUNDERBAR! We loved this recipe. I did cut the sugar down to 1/2 cup, added an extra cinnamon stick, the juice of 1 lemon, and then strained the whole thing before serving. Made it with a simple Burgandy wine...I bet a Pinot Noir or Beaujolias would be good too. It was even better the second day after the flavors had blended more.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Warms you to the bone! Very tasty. Doubled the recipe, but followed it exactly and it was a bit hit last Thanksgiving.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: PERFECT gluehwein/mulled wine recipe! Exactly the right amount of sugar and spice!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this many time already. I add more slices of oranges and lemons. Everybody loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Great old time German recipe. Try other juices also for a change. (O.J., cherry juice, etc.)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I lived in Germany for a long time and this recipe tastes perfectly authentic. Great for a cold winter night!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was so good! I took the advice of others and used orange juice instead of the water. It was a great drink for Christmas Eve.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: It's great, but I tried following one of the other reviews, and changed the water for OJ, and it made it much too sweet. It's perfect just the way it is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This was great! Everyone at our party loved it!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I had the pleasure of going to Germany several years ago, and this brought back some wonderful memories of that trip. This recipe is absolutely fantastic! My Husband is a diabetic, so I replaced the sugar with "Splenda Granular" and the recipe turned out great! Thanks for sharing your recipe Else!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I served this at a dinner party during the holidays and it was very well received. This is not a sophisticated drink - it's a good, flavorful somewhat sweet spiced wine that can be successfully made with an inexpensive bottle of red wine. I cut down on the sugar and used orange juice in place of the water. It was kind of like a winter-time Sangria. Yum.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This Gluehwein recipe was great, and so easy to make. My aunt from Germany makes this every year for the holidays, and this was my first time trying it for myself. It still wasn't quite as good as Aunt Helga's, but still very tasty and I would definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have never heard of gluehwein but was looking for a festive spiced wine something for Christmas. My mother-in-law loved it, sister-in-law hated it and I thought it was pretty good though not what I was looking for. I followed the advice of others and used orange juice which made it too bitter for me - for me the water would have been the better choice. I enjoyed the spicy taste and thought it was more like a dessert wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: this is my new favorite christmas tradition! not a drop survived!!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted something different this Christmas, so I gave this a try. I really enjoyed it. I used orange juice as others suggested, and was worried about it being too sweet, but it was lovely. I used an inexspensive French wine and sipped it while preparing Christmas dinner. Sehr gut! Danke, Else!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I used up a couple of bottles of partly finished reds(one Italian, one French) for this recipe. I used half brown/white sugar and orange juice as recommended by other reviewers. The kitchen smelt wonderful and everyone enjoyed it. I will be making this again for New Years to keep us warm whilst watching fireworks.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made it last night for a Gluehwien Party and it was gone in the first hour and I tripled the recipe!! Good Job!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for a Christmas party last weekend. I quadrupled the recipe and all if it was gone by the end. The only change I made was cutting the water in half and adding OJ for the other half. A very good German friend loved it.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My boyfriend is from a tiny village near Wasserberg in Bavaria. He was missing Gluehwein so I made this recipe for him and his boss, who is from Regensberg. They say that this recipe is actually what they call "Punsch", and that Gluehwein is heated wine too but a bit different. I dunno, maybe this is known as Gluehwein in other regions of Germany. Still, we enjoyed this recipe very much!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is fantastic!! I also substituted oj for water. I had this at our annual cocktail party and I didn't want to share! Many people wanted the recipe. This is a keeper!!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: The only reason I rated this a five is that there was no higher rating. I made it using burgundy wine and followed the suggestion of others and substituted the water with orange juice. Everyone loved it. I will definitely be making this often in the future. Thanks, Else.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This could be great. Unless you're a sugar addict, I'd cut the sugar down to 1/2c. Following some suggestions I used low sugar oj and still found this too sweet. For this I used Barefoot Merlot for the wine. Great start though :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I'm rating this from a POV of someone who hasn't had Gluehwein before but was looking for a good mulled wine for a holiday party. Overall it was good but the general concensus was that it was too sweet, so we added another half bottle of merlot. I would probably make it again with the initial 1 and a half bottles of merlot.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Orange juice instead of water and this is PERFECT. I am told by every German I know that this is the original recipe. Oh so good!!! Also yummy if Cherry juice is substituted for the water.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Always a party favorite, especially when it's cold outside. I also substitute water with orange juice, add green apple and orange slices and a little berry rum which adds a real flavor kick. Yumm!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very very good!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a nice blend of flavors! I ended up having to use ground cloves rather than whole ones and I felt that their flavor was far too strong...next time I will be sure to use whole cloves as the recipe calls for.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Almost exactly like what you can buy on the streets in central Europe. I used OJ and just a very cheap merlot--turned out great.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not very good. I made it for Christmas Eve, and I thought it tasted bad. Noone went back for seconds. I made it exactly to the recipe, but I did use cheap Merlot, maybe try to use a good, sweet red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is one of my favorite things to make for friends and family during the holidays! It is sooo yummy and spicy and sweet, it warms you to the bone. I use orange juice instead of water for added flavor. For parties, I get a cheap cask of red wine and quadruple the recipe. It never lasts long!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I made this for friends who were on a float in our town's Christmas Parade. I used brown sugar instead of white, and poured it into several insulated mugs with lids. Everyone wanted the recipe, and it helped them warm up after a night on a float. (I suspect it helped us all *float* home, too!) The only other change was that after the sugar/water/orange peel mixture boiled, I turned the stove off and let it sit while I did an errand. When I returned, the mixture had thickened. Since I used a small saucepan, I heated half of the wine in the microwave then added everything into a large thermos. My husband said he could smell it when the thermos was opened! Oh, since there was already orange juice in it, I also added about 1/2 cup of orange liquer for an extra shot of cheer. Will definitely serve again! Thanks for the recipe.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: As good as everyone says! I always strain this thoroughly before serving it. Careful...you could drink a lot of this!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Oh my word. Utterly fantastic. I made this for my husband and he was just as impressed, the smell in our house was great and the deep rich warming effect. Lovely!! Many thanks. :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: We made this on a whim one night after a recent blizzard in the northeast. I was hesitant to dedicating a bottle of wine to the effort since the last spiced wine we tried was so overspiced that it seemed like cough syrup. But this was a great balance of sweet and citrus and spicy, all without overpowering the wine. I didn't have an orange on hand so I used juice instead of the water and it came out great, I've already gotten requests to make it again and can't wait to try adjusting levels of cinnamon, clove and sugar for mild variations on the theme. A definite winner!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: My Mom is from Germany and hasn't been home in a while. It really made her holiday. She said it was just like home. Thank you.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: One guest asked if it was potpurri. It does smell wonderful, but too overpowering to drink - maybe less oranges/cloves would help. While I found it easy to prepare, I give it a low rating due to its unpopularity at parties. Sometimes simpler is better - i.e., red wine as is.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I took other people's suggestions and used orange juice instead of water. I also doubled the recipe and used 1/2 cup of regular sugar and 1/2 cup of brown sugar. It went fast! My guests were asking for more. I will be making this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: If I could give this recipe more stars, I would. We simmered the sugar, water, OJ, cinnamon and cloves on the stove and then transferred to the crockpot when it was time to add the wine. We started with 2 bottles of Kendall Jackson Pinot Noir, and it was gone within about 15 minutes. We actually had to go to the grocer for three more bottles of Pinot Noir! It was amazing!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Wonderful. I took the suggestions of many reviewers and substituted orange juice for the water, and think it's a great change. I'll definitely make this again.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: What a great recipe! I was skeptical at first about using 3/4 cup white sugar. I thought it would be way too much, but it wasn't. When I sipped the Gluehwein, the sweetness was perfect and all those memories from visiting Christmas markets in Germany came back. Wonderful recipe.....thank you Else!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: excellent recipe, very close to the authentic flavor as said by a visiting german friend

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Yummy... and the smell is wonderful. I always make this during the Holidays, and everybody loves it (even my husbands sister who thinks alcohol is yucky). This is a staple in our house during the winter months. I usually cut down on the sugar by 1/4 cup, and add and exra 1/4 cup of water. We always buy the cheap wine for this.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I actually haven't made this recipe, but it's so similar to what my Mom used to make that I will probably be using it for a crowd. I'm familiar with making individual servings, without the water/sugar/orange step. Put some red wine in a saucepan, add some sugar, cinnamon stick, half orange w/ juice and heat. It is soo yummy and warming. Definitely gives you a glow, inside and out! :)

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Perfect for parties or a cold day outside.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Maybe it was just me but there was something about this that I didn't care for. It could have been the brand of wine which I used (Black Opal) but the aroma of the warm wine made it very difficult to drink.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I have made this several times. I have substituted orange juice for water, an orange juice/pineapple juice mixture & an apple juice/orange juice mixture for the water. On all I used 2 cinnamon sticks instead of 1. Fabulous! I also substituted some of the white sugar with brown sugar. Equally yummy. I also tried it the original way, but added an extra cinnamon stick. It is really good when you get the mixture thick. I used local muscadine wine. No matter how it is fixed, it is hard to beat! A real crowd pleaser.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Not sure what I did wrong, but this didn't taste as great as I had hoped. A little too sweet and not enough clove/cinnamon taste.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: This is amazing! I made a triple recipie of this for a party, using Tropicana orange juice instead of the water, and I reduced the white sugar a bit and added just a little bit of brown sugar. It did not get syrupy, but with that much orange juice I didn't expect it would. I tripled the cinnamon sticks, but still only used 10 cloves, and only one orange. For wine, I used 1 and 1/2 bottles of Sawmill Creek shiraz. I added 2 bottles while it was on the stove, and then kept it warm in the crock pot, adding another 1/2 bottle directly to the crock pot (the full 3 bottles wouldn't fit). The porportions worked out perfectly though. Very yummy, and very cozy drink.... will definitely make again!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Very good, I would use less sugar next time, especially if you enjoy the subtleness/dryness of red wine.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: The perfect end to a long cold winters walk.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Some friends and I made this, and it came out absolutely superb!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: I wanted this "crockpot" style to stay nice and warm for the duration of the party. Well, just forget that! It was gone within 30 minutes, doubling the recipe just wasn't enough (for 16 people). Everyone raved as they downed this rosy-warm aromatic drink. Have back-ups pre-made. The trick I used with the crockpot was adding 2 inches of water, turning it on high with a lid while the oranges/cloves simmered in the oj mixture (not water) to get it nice & hot. So, instead of adding the wine to the stovetop pot, I dumped everything in the crockpot after the oranges were finished simmering. This worked great but I knew I was in trouble when it only filled it halfway. I used Yellowtail Shiraz/Cabernet as someone else suggested. Too good! Will make as often as I can.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: a tasty and spicy (and alcoholic) alternative to hot cider. i used orange juice instead of the water and reduced the sugar to 1/2 cup on a friend's recommendation--turned out great! as he said, it's pretty hard to screw this up!

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
cocktail_reviews.Review: Way too sweet for me, but yummy just the same.

cocktail_reviews.Name: Gluehwein
